module Network.AWS.Organizations.Types.Account

-- | Contains information about an AWS account that is a member of an
--   organization.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newAccount</a> smart constructor.
data Account
Account' :: Maybe AccountStatus -> Maybe AccountJoinedMethod -> Maybe (Sensitive Text) -> Maybe Text -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe (Sensitive Text) -> Maybe Text -> Account

-- | The status of the account in the organization.
[$sel:status:Account'] :: Account -> Maybe AccountStatus

-- | The method by which the account joined the organization.
[$sel:joinedMethod:Account'] :: Account -> Maybe AccountJoinedMethod

-- | The email address associated with the AWS account.
--   
--   The <a>regex pattern</a> for this parameter is a string of characters
--   that represents a standard internet email address.
[$sel:email:Account'] :: Account -> Maybe (Sensitive Text)

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the account.
--   
--   For more information about ARNs in Organizations, see <a>ARN Formats
--   Supported by Organizations</a> in the <i>AWS Service Authorization
--   Reference</i>.
[$sel:arn:Account'] :: Account -> Maybe Text

-- | The date the account became a part of the organization.
[$sel:joinedTimestamp:Account'] :: Account -> Maybe POSIX

-- | The friendly name of the account.
--   
--   The <a>regex pattern</a> that is used to validate this parameter is a
--   string of any of the characters in the ASCII character range.
[$sel:name:Account'] :: Account -> Maybe (Sensitive Text)

-- | The unique identifier (ID) of the account.
--   
--   The <a>regex pattern</a> for an account ID string requires exactly 12
--   digits.
[$sel:id:Account'] :: Account -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>Account</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--

--   method by which the account joined the organization.

--   Reference</i>.

--

--   (ID) of the account.
--   
--   The <a>regex pattern</a> for an account ID string requires exactly 12
--   digits.
newAccount :: Account

-- | The status of the account in the organization.
account_status :: Lens' Account (Maybe AccountStatus)

-- | The method by which the account joined the organization.
account_joinedMethod :: Lens' Account (Maybe AccountJoinedMethod)

-- | The email address associated with the AWS account.
--

--   that represents a standard internet email address.

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the account.

--   Supported by Organizations</a> in the <i>AWS Service Authorization
--   Reference</i>.

-- | The date the account became a part of the organization.

-- | The friendly name of the account.
--

--   string of any of the characters in the ASCII character range.
account_name :: Lens' Account (Maybe Text)

-- | The unique identifier (ID) of the account.
--   
--   The <a>regex pattern</a> for an account ID string requires exactly 12
--   digits.
account_id :: Lens' Account (Maybe Text)

module Network.AWS.Organizations.Types.Child

-- | Contains a list of child entities, either OUs or accounts.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newChild</a> smart constructor.
data Child
Child' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe ChildType -> Child

-- | The unique identifier (ID) of this child entity.
--   
--   The <a>regex pattern</a> for a child ID string requires one of the
--   following:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><b>Account</b> - A string that consists of exactly 12 digits.</li>
--   <li><b>Organizational unit (OU)</b> - A string that begins with "ou-"
--   followed by from 4 to 32 lowercase letters or digits (the ID of the
--   root that contains the OU). This string is followed by a second "-"
--   dash and from 8 to 32 additional lowercase letters or digits.</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:id:Child'] :: Child -> Maybe Text

-- | The type of this child entity.

--   fields.

--   </ul>

--   entity.

module Network.AWS.Organizations.Types.CreateAccountStatus

-- | Contains the status about a CreateAccount or CreateGovCloudAccount
--   request to create an AWS account or an AWS GovCloud (US) account in an
--   organization.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newCreateAccountStatus</a> smart constructor.
data CreateAccountStatus
CreateAccountStatus' :: Maybe CreateAccountFailureReason -> Maybe CreateAccountState -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe (Sensitive Text) -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe POSIX -> CreateAccountStatus

-- | If the request failed, a description of the reason for the failure.
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>ACCOUNT_LIMIT_EXCEEDED: The account couldn't be created because
--   you reached the limit on the number of accounts in your
--   organization.</li>
--   <li>CONCURRENT_ACCOUNT_MODIFICATION: You already submitted a request
--   with the same information.</li>
--   <li>EMAIL_ALREADY_EXISTS: The account could not be created because
--   another AWS account with that email address already exists.</li>
--   <li>FAILED_BUSINESS_VALIDATION: The AWS account that owns your
--   organization failed to receive business license validation.</li>
--   <li>GOVCLOUD_ACCOUNT_ALREADY_EXISTS: The account in the AWS GovCloud
--   (US) Region could not be created because this Region already includes
--   an account with that email address.</li>
--   <li>IDENTITY_INVALID_BUSINESS_VALIDATION: The AWS account that owns
--   your organization can't complete business license validation because
--   it doesn't have valid identity data.</li>
--   <li>INVALID_ADDRESS: The account could not be created because the
--   address you provided is not valid.</li>
--   <li>INVALID_EMAIL: The account could not be created because the email
--   address you provided is not valid.</li>
--   <li>INTERNAL_FAILURE: The account could not be created because of an
--   internal failure. Try again later. If the problem persists, contact
--   AWS Customer Support.</li>
--   <li>MISSING_BUSINESS_VALIDATION: The AWS account that owns your
--   organization has not received Business Validation.</li>
--   <li>MISSING_PAYMENT_INSTRUMENT: You must configure the management
--   account with a valid payment method, such as a credit card.</li>
--   <li>PENDING_BUSINESS_VALIDATION: The AWS account that owns your
--   organization is still in the process of completing business license
--   validation.</li>
--   <li>UNKNOWN_BUSINESS_VALIDATION: The AWS account that owns your
--   organization has an unknown issue with business license
--   validation.</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:failureReason:CreateAccountStatus'] :: CreateAccountStatus -> Maybe CreateAccountFailureReason

-- | The status of the asynchronous request to create an AWS account.
[$sel:state:CreateAccountStatus'] :: CreateAccountStatus -> Maybe CreateAccountState

-- | The date and time that the account was created and the request
--   completed.
[$sel:completedTimestamp:CreateAccountStatus'] :: CreateAccountStatus -> Maybe POSIX

-- | The account name given to the account when it was created.
[$sel:accountName:CreateAccountStatus'] :: CreateAccountStatus -> Maybe (Sensitive Text)

-- | If the account was created successfully, the unique identifier (ID) of
--   the new account.
--   
--   The <a>regex pattern</a> for an account ID string requires exactly 12
--   digits.
[$sel:accountId:CreateAccountStatus'] :: CreateAccountStatus -> Maybe Text

-- | The unique identifier (ID) that references this request. You get this
--   value from the response of the initial CreateAccount request to create
--   the account.
--   
--   The <a>regex pattern</a> for a create account request ID string
--   requires "car-" followed by from 8 to 32 lowercase letters or digits.
[$sel:id:CreateAccountStatus'] :: CreateAccountStatus -> Maybe Text

-- | If the account was created successfully, the unique identifier (ID) of
--   the new account in the AWS GovCloud (US) Region.
[$sel:govCloudAccountId:CreateAccountStatus'] :: CreateAccountStatus -> Maybe Text

-- | The date and time that the request was made for the account creation.
[$sel:requestedTimestamp:CreateAccountStatus'] :: CreateAccountStatus -> Maybe POSIX

-- | Create a value of <a>CreateAccountStatus</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:failureReason:CreateAccountStatus'</a>,
--   <a>createAccountStatus_failureReason</a> - If the request failed, a
--   description of the reason for the failure.
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>ACCOUNT_LIMIT_EXCEEDED: The account couldn't be created because
--   you reached the limit on the number of accounts in your
--   organization.</li>
--   <li>CONCURRENT_ACCOUNT_MODIFICATION: You already submitted a request
--   with the same information.</li>
--   <li>EMAIL_ALREADY_EXISTS: The account could not be created because
--   another AWS account with that email address already exists.</li>
--   <li>FAILED_BUSINESS_VALIDATION: The AWS account that owns your
--   organization failed to receive business license validation.</li>
--   <li>GOVCLOUD_ACCOUNT_ALREADY_EXISTS: The account in the AWS GovCloud
--   (US) Region could not be created because this Region already includes
--   an account with that email address.</li>
--   <li>IDENTITY_INVALID_BUSINESS_VALIDATION: The AWS account that owns
--   your organization can't complete business license validation because
--   it doesn't have valid identity data.</li>
--   <li>INVALID_ADDRESS: The account could not be created because the
--   address you provided is not valid.</li>
--   <li>INVALID_EMAIL: The account could not be created because the email
--   address you provided is not valid.</li>
--   <li>INTERNAL_FAILURE: The account could not be created because of an
--   internal failure. Try again later. If the problem persists, contact
--   AWS Customer Support.</li>
--   <li>MISSING_BUSINESS_VALIDATION: The AWS account that owns your
--   organization has not received Business Validation.</li>
--   <li>MISSING_PAYMENT_INSTRUMENT: You must configure the management
--   account with a valid payment method, such as a credit card.</li>
--   <li>PENDING_BUSINESS_VALIDATION: The AWS account that owns your
--   organization is still in the process of completing business license
--   validation.</li>
--   <li>UNKNOWN_BUSINESS_VALIDATION: The AWS account that owns your
--   organization has an unknown issue with business license
--   validation.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:state:CreateAccountStatus'</a>,
--   <a>createAccountStatus_state</a> - The status of the asynchronous
--   request to create an AWS account.
--   
--   <a>$sel:completedTimestamp:CreateAccountStatus'</a>,
--   <a>createAccountStatus_completedTimestamp</a> - The date and time that
--   the account was created and the request completed.
--   
--   <a>$sel:accountName:CreateAccountStatus'</a>,
--   <a>createAccountStatus_accountName</a> - The account name given to the
--   account when it was created.
--   
--   <a>$sel:accountId:CreateAccountStatus'</a>,
--   <a>createAccountStatus_accountId</a> - If the account was created
--   successfully, the unique identifier (ID) of the new account.
--   
--   The <a>regex pattern</a> for an account ID string requires exactly 12
--   digits.
--   
--   <a>$sel:id:CreateAccountStatus'</a>, <a>createAccountStatus_id</a> -
--   The unique identifier (ID) that references this request. You get this
--   value from the response of the initial CreateAccount request to create
--   the account.
--   
--   The <a>regex pattern</a> for a create account request ID string
--   requires "car-" followed by from 8 to 32 lowercase letters or digits.
--   
--   <a>$sel:govCloudAccountId:CreateAccountStatus'</a>,
--   <a>createAccountStatus_govCloudAccountId</a> - If the account was
--   created successfully, the unique identifier (ID) of the new account in
--   the AWS GovCloud (US) Region.
--   
--   <a>$sel:requestedTimestamp:CreateAccountStatus'</a>,
--   <a>createAccountStatus_requestedTimestamp</a> - The date and time that
--   the request was made for the account creation.
newCreateAccountStatus :: CreateAccountStatus

-- | If the request failed, a description of the reason for the failure.
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>ACCOUNT_LIMIT_EXCEEDED: The account couldn't be created because
--   you reached the limit on the number of accounts in your
--   organization.</li>
--   <li>CONCURRENT_ACCOUNT_MODIFICATION: You already submitted a request
--   with the same information.</li>
--   <li>EMAIL_ALREADY_EXISTS: The account could not be created because
--   another AWS account with that email address already exists.</li>
--   <li>FAILED_BUSINESS_VALIDATION: The AWS account that owns your
--   organization failed to receive business license validation.</li>
--   <li>GOVCLOUD_ACCOUNT_ALREADY_EXISTS: The account in the AWS GovCloud
--   (US) Region could not be created because this Region already includes
--   an account with that email address.</li>
--   <li>IDENTITY_INVALID_BUSINESS_VALIDATION: The AWS account that owns
--   your organization can't complete business license validation because
--   it doesn't have valid identity data.</li>
--   <li>INVALID_ADDRESS: The account could not be created because the
--   address you provided is not valid.</li>
--   <li>INVALID_EMAIL: The account could not be created because the email
--   address you provided is not valid.</li>
--   <li>INTERNAL_FAILURE: The account could not be created because of an
--   internal failure. Try again later. If the problem persists, contact
--   AWS Customer Support.</li>
--   <li>MISSING_BUSINESS_VALIDATION: The AWS account that owns your
--   organization has not received Business Validation.</li>
--   <li>MISSING_PAYMENT_INSTRUMENT: You must configure the management
--   account with a valid payment method, such as a credit card.</li>
--   <li>PENDING_BUSINESS_VALIDATION: The AWS account that owns your
--   organization is still in the process of completing business license
--   validation.</li>
--   <li>UNKNOWN_BUSINESS_VALIDATION: The AWS account that owns your
--   organization has an unknown issue with business license
--   validation.</li>
--   </ul>
createAccountStatus_failureReason :: Lens' CreateAccountStatus (Maybe CreateAccountFailureReason)

-- | The status of the asynchronous request to create an AWS account.
createAccountStatus_state :: Lens' CreateAccountStatus (Maybe CreateAccountState)

-- | The date and time that the account was created and the request
--   completed.
createAccountStatus_completedTimestamp :: Lens' CreateAccountStatus (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The account name given to the account when it was created.
createAccountStatus_accountName :: Lens' CreateAccountStatus (Maybe Text)

-- | If the account was created successfully, the unique identifier (ID) of
--   the new account.
--   
--   The <a>regex pattern</a> for an account ID string requires exactly 12
--   digits.
createAccountStatus_accountId :: Lens' CreateAccountStatus (Maybe Text)

-- | The unique identifier (ID) that references this request. You get this
--   value from the response of the initial CreateAccount request to create
--   the account.
--   
--   The <a>regex pattern</a> for a create account request ID string
--   requires "car-" followed by from 8 to 32 lowercase letters or digits.
createAccountStatus_id :: Lens' CreateAccountStatus (Maybe Text)

-- | If the account was created successfully, the unique identifier (ID) of
--   the new account in the AWS GovCloud (US) Region.
createAccountStatus_govCloudAccountId :: Lens' CreateAccountStatus (Maybe Text)

-- | The date and time that the request was made for the account creation.
createAccountStatus_requestedTimestamp :: Lens' CreateAccountStatus (Maybe UTCTime)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.Organizations.Types.CreateAccountStatus.CreateAccountStatus
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.Organizations.Types.CreateAccountStatus.CreateAccountStatus
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.Organizations.Types.CreateAccountStatus.CreateAccountStatus
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.Organizations.Types.CreateAccountStatus.CreateAccountStatus
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.Organizations.Types.CreateAccountStatus.CreateAccountStatus
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.Organizations.Types.CreateAccountStatus.CreateAccountStatus


module Network.AWS.Organizations.Types.DelegatedAdministrator

-- | Contains information about the delegated administrator.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newDelegatedAdministrator</a> smart constructor.
data DelegatedAdministrator
DelegatedAdministrator' :: Maybe AccountStatus -> Maybe AccountJoinedMethod -> Maybe (Sensitive Text) -> Maybe Text -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe (Sensitive Text) -> Maybe Text -> DelegatedAdministrator

-- | The status of the delegated administrator's account in the
--   organization.
[$sel:status:DelegatedAdministrator'] :: DelegatedAdministrator -> Maybe AccountStatus

-- | The method by which the delegated administrator's account joined the
--   organization.
[$sel:joinedMethod:DelegatedAdministrator'] :: DelegatedAdministrator -> Maybe AccountJoinedMethod

-- | The email address that is associated with the delegated
--   administrator's AWS account.
[$sel:email:DelegatedAdministrator'] :: DelegatedAdministrator -> Maybe (Sensitive Text)

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the delegated administrator's
--   account.
[$sel:arn:DelegatedAdministrator'] :: DelegatedAdministrator -> Maybe Text

-- | The date when the delegated administrator's account became a part of
--   the organization.
[$sel:joinedTimestamp:DelegatedAdministrator'] :: DelegatedAdministrator -> Maybe POSIX

-- | The date when the account was made a delegated administrator.
[$sel:delegationEnabledDate:DelegatedAdministrator'] :: DelegatedAdministrator -> Maybe POSIX

-- | The friendly name of the delegated administrator's account.
[$sel:name:DelegatedAdministrator'] :: DelegatedAdministrator -> Maybe (Sensitive Text)

-- | The unique identifier (ID) of the delegated administrator's account.
[$sel:id:DelegatedAdministrator'] :: DelegatedAdministrator -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>DelegatedAdministrator</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:status:DelegatedAdministrator'</a>,
--   <a>delegatedAdministrator_status</a> - The status of the delegated
--   administrator's account in the organization.
--   
--   <a>$sel:joinedMethod:DelegatedAdministrator'</a>,
--   <a>delegatedAdministrator_joinedMethod</a> - The method by which the
--   delegated administrator's account joined the organization.
--   
--   <a>$sel:email:DelegatedAdministrator'</a>,
--   <a>delegatedAdministrator_email</a> - The email address that is
--   associated with the delegated administrator's AWS account.
--   
--   <a>$sel:arn:DelegatedAdministrator'</a>,
--   <a>delegatedAdministrator_arn</a> - The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of
--   the delegated administrator's account.
--   
--   <a>$sel:joinedTimestamp:DelegatedAdministrator'</a>,
--   <a>delegatedAdministrator_joinedTimestamp</a> - The date when the
--   delegated administrator's account became a part of the organization.
--   
--   <a>$sel:delegationEnabledDate:DelegatedAdministrator'</a>,
--   <a>delegatedAdministrator_delegationEnabledDate</a> - The date when
--   the account was made a delegated administrator.
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:DelegatedAdministrator'</a>,
--   <a>delegatedAdministrator_name</a> - The friendly name of the
--   delegated administrator's account.
--   
--   <a>$sel:id:DelegatedAdministrator'</a>,
--   <a>delegatedAdministrator_id</a> - The unique identifier (ID) of the
--   delegated administrator's account.
newDelegatedAdministrator :: DelegatedAdministrator

-- | The status of the delegated administrator's account in the
--   organization.
delegatedAdministrator_status :: Lens' DelegatedAdministrator (Maybe AccountStatus)

-- | The method by which the delegated administrator's account joined the
--   organization.
delegatedAdministrator_joinedMethod :: Lens' DelegatedAdministrator (Maybe AccountJoinedMethod)

-- | The email address that is associated with the delegated
--   administrator's AWS account.
delegatedAdministrator_email :: Lens' DelegatedAdministrator (Maybe Text)

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the delegated administrator's
--   account.
delegatedAdministrator_arn :: Lens' DelegatedAdministrator (Maybe Text)

-- | The date when the delegated administrator's account became a part of
--   the organization.
delegatedAdministrator_joinedTimestamp :: Lens' DelegatedAdministrator (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The date when the account was made a delegated administrator.
delegatedAdministrator_delegationEnabledDate :: Lens' DelegatedAdministrator (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The friendly name of the delegated administrator's account.
delegatedAdministrator_name :: Lens' DelegatedAdministrator (Maybe Text)

-- | The unique identifier (ID) of the delegated administrator's account.
delegatedAdministrator_id :: Lens' DelegatedAdministrator (Maybe Text)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.Organizations.Types.DelegatedAdministrator.DelegatedAdministrator
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.Organizations.Types.DelegatedAdministrator.DelegatedAdministrator
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.Organizations.Types.DelegatedAdministrator.DelegatedAdministrator
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.Organizations.Types.DelegatedAdministrator.DelegatedAdministrator
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.Organizations.Types.DelegatedAdministrator.DelegatedAdministrator
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.Organizations.Types.DelegatedAdministrator.DelegatedAdministrator


module Network.AWS.Organizations.Types.DelegatedService

-- | Contains information about the AWS service for which the account is a
--   delegated administrator.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newDelegatedService</a> smart constructor.
data DelegatedService
DelegatedService' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe POSIX -> DelegatedService

-- | The name of an AWS service that can request an operation for the
--   specified service. This is typically in the form of a URL, such as:
--   <tt> servicename.amazonaws.com</tt>.
[$sel:servicePrincipal:DelegatedService'] :: DelegatedService -> Maybe Text

-- | The date that the account became a delegated administrator for this
--   service.
[$sel:delegationEnabledDate:DelegatedService'] :: DelegatedService -> Maybe POSIX

-- | Create a value of <a>DelegatedService</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:servicePrincipal:DelegatedService'</a>,
--   <a>delegatedService_servicePrincipal</a> - The name of an AWS service
--   that can request an operation for the specified service. This is
--   typically in the form of a URL, such as: <tt>
--   servicename.amazonaws.com</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:delegationEnabledDate:DelegatedService'</a>,
--   <a>delegatedService_delegationEnabledDate</a> - The date that the
--   account became a delegated administrator for this service.
newDelegatedService :: DelegatedService

-- | The name of an AWS service that can request an operation for the
--   specified service. This is typically in the form of a URL, such as:
--   <tt> servicename.amazonaws.com</tt>.
delegatedService_servicePrincipal :: Lens' DelegatedService (Maybe Text)

-- | The date that the account became a delegated administrator for this
--   service.
delegatedService_delegationEnabledDate :: Lens' DelegatedService (Maybe UTCTime)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.Organizations.Types.DelegatedService.DelegatedService
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.Organizations.Types.DelegatedService.DelegatedService
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.Organizations.Types.DelegatedService.DelegatedService
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.Organizations.Types.DelegatedService.DelegatedService
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.Organizations.Types.DelegatedService.DelegatedService
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.Organizations.Types.DelegatedService.DelegatedService
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.Organizations.Types.DelegatedService.DelegatedService


module Network.AWS.Organizations.Types.EffectivePolicyType

instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.Organizations.Types.EffectivePolicyType.EffectivePolicyType

instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.Organizations.Types.EffectivePolicyType.EffectivePolicyType
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.Organizations.Types.EffectivePolicyType.EffectivePolicyType
instance GHC.Classes.Ord Network.AWS.Organizations.Types.EffectivePolicyType.EffectivePolicyType
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.Organizations.Types.EffectivePolicyType.EffectivePolicyType
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.Organizations.Types.EffectivePolicyType.EffectivePolicyType
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.Organizations.Types.EffectivePolicyType.EffectivePolicyType


module Network.AWS.Organizations.Types.EffectivePolicy

-- | Contains rules to be applied to the affected accounts. The effective
--   policy is the aggregation of any policies the account inherits, plus
--   any policy directly attached to the account.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newEffectivePolicy</a> smart constructor.
data EffectivePolicy
EffectivePolicy' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe EffectivePolicyType -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe Text -> EffectivePolicy

-- | The account ID of the policy target.
[$sel:targetId:EffectivePolicy'] :: EffectivePolicy -> Maybe Text

-- | The policy type.
[$sel:policyType:EffectivePolicy'] :: EffectivePolicy -> Maybe EffectivePolicyType

-- | The time of the last update to this policy.
[$sel:lastUpdatedTimestamp:EffectivePolicy'] :: EffectivePolicy -> Maybe POSIX

-- | The text content of the policy.
[$sel:policyContent:EffectivePolicy'] :: EffectivePolicy -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>EffectivePolicy</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:targetId:EffectivePolicy'</a>, <a>effectivePolicy_targetId</a>
--   - The account ID of the policy target.
--   
--   <a>$sel:policyType:EffectivePolicy'</a>,
--   <a>effectivePolicy_policyType</a> - The policy type.
--   
--   <a>$sel:lastUpdatedTimestamp:EffectivePolicy'</a>,
--   <a>effectivePolicy_lastUpdatedTimestamp</a> - The time of the last
--   update to this policy.
--   
--   <a>$sel:policyContent:EffectivePolicy'</a>,
--   <a>effectivePolicy_policyContent</a> - The text content of the policy.
newEffectivePolicy :: EffectivePolicy

-- | The account ID of the policy target.
effectivePolicy_targetId :: Lens' EffectivePolicy (Maybe Text)

-- | The policy type.
effectivePolicy_policyType :: Lens' EffectivePolicy (Maybe EffectivePolicyType)

-- | The time of the last update to this policy.
effectivePolicy_lastUpdatedTimestamp :: Lens' EffectivePolicy (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The text content of the policy.
effectivePolicy_policyContent :: Lens' EffectivePolicy (Maybe Text)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.Organizations.Types.EffectivePolicy.EffectivePolicy
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.Organizations.Types.EffectivePolicy.EffectivePolicy
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.Organizations.Types.EffectivePolicy.EffectivePolicy
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.Organizations.Types.EffectivePolicy.EffectivePolicy
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.Organizations.Types.EffectivePolicy.EffectivePolicy
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.Organizations.Types.EffectivePolicy.EffectivePolicy
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.Organizations.Types.EffectivePolicy.EffectivePolicy


module Network.AWS.Organizations.Types.EnabledServicePrincipal

-- | A structure that contains details of a service principal that
--   represents an AWS service that is enabled to integrate with AWS
--   Organizations.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newEnabledServicePrincipal</a> smart constructor.
data EnabledServicePrincipal
EnabledServicePrincipal' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe POSIX -> EnabledServicePrincipal

-- | The name of the service principal. This is typically in the form of a
--   URL, such as: <tt> servicename.amazonaws.com</tt>.
[$sel:servicePrincipal:EnabledServicePrincipal'] :: EnabledServicePrincipal -> Maybe Text

-- | The date that the service principal was enabled for integration with
--   AWS Organizations.
[$sel:dateEnabled:EnabledServicePrincipal'] :: EnabledServicePrincipal -> Maybe POSIX

-- | Create a value of <a>EnabledServicePrincipal</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:servicePrincipal:EnabledServicePrincipal'</a>,
--   <a>enabledServicePrincipal_servicePrincipal</a> - The name of the
--   service principal. This is typically in the form of a URL, such as:
--   <tt> servicename.amazonaws.com</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:dateEnabled:EnabledServicePrincipal'</a>,
--   <a>enabledServicePrincipal_dateEnabled</a> - The date that the service
--   principal was enabled for integration with AWS Organizations.
newEnabledServicePrincipal :: EnabledServicePrincipal

-- | The name of the service principal. This is typically in the form of a
--   URL, such as: <tt> servicename.amazonaws.com</tt>.
enabledServicePrincipal_servicePrincipal :: Lens' EnabledServicePrincipal (Maybe Text)

-- | The date that the service principal was enabled for integration with
--   AWS Organizations.
enabledServicePrincipal_dateEnabled :: Lens' EnabledServicePrincipal (Maybe UTCTime)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.Organizations.Types.EnabledServicePrincipal.EnabledServicePrincipal
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.Organizations.Types.EnabledServicePrincipal.EnabledServicePrincipal
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.Organizations.Types.EnabledServicePrincipal.EnabledServicePrincipal
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.Organizations.Types.EnabledServicePrincipal.EnabledServicePrincipal
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.Organizations.Types.EnabledServicePrincipal.EnabledServicePrincipal
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.Organizations.Types.EnabledServicePrincipal.EnabledServicePrincipal
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.Organizations.Types.EnabledServicePrincipal.EnabledServicePrincipal


module Network.AWS.Organizations.Types.HandshakeFilter

-- | Specifies the criteria that are used to select the handshakes for the
--   operation.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newHandshakeFilter</a> smart constructor.
data HandshakeFilter
HandshakeFilter' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe ActionType -> HandshakeFilter

-- | Specifies the parent handshake. Only used for handshake types that are
--   a child of another type.
--   
--   If you specify <tt>ParentHandshakeId</tt>, you cannot also specify
--   <tt>ActionType</tt>.
--   
--   The <a>regex pattern</a> for handshake ID string requires "h-"
--   followed by from 8 to 32 lowercase letters or digits.
[$sel:parentHandshakeId:HandshakeFilter'] :: HandshakeFilter -> Maybe Text

-- | Specifies the type of handshake action.
--   
--   If you specify <tt>ActionType</tt>, you cannot also specify
--   <tt>ParentHandshakeId</tt>.
[$sel:actionType:HandshakeFilter'] :: HandshakeFilter -> Maybe ActionType

-- | Create a value of <a>HandshakeFilter</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:parentHandshakeId:HandshakeFilter'</a>,
--   <a>handshakeFilter_parentHandshakeId</a> - Specifies the parent
--   handshake. Only used for handshake types that are a child of another
--   type.
--   
--   If you specify <tt>ParentHandshakeId</tt>, you cannot also specify
--   <tt>ActionType</tt>.
--   
--   The <a>regex pattern</a> for handshake ID string requires "h-"
--   followed by from 8 to 32 lowercase letters or digits.
--   
--   <a>$sel:actionType:HandshakeFilter'</a>,
--   <a>handshakeFilter_actionType</a> - Specifies the type of handshake
--   action.
--   
--   If you specify <tt>ActionType</tt>, you cannot also specify
--   <tt>ParentHandshakeId</tt>.
newHandshakeFilter :: HandshakeFilter

-- | Specifies the parent handshake. Only used for handshake types that are
--   a child of another type.
--   
--   If you specify <tt>ParentHandshakeId</tt>, you cannot also specify
--   <tt>ActionType</tt>.
--   
--   The <a>regex pattern</a> for handshake ID string requires "h-"
--   followed by from 8 to 32 lowercase letters or digits.
handshakeFilter_parentHandshakeId :: Lens' HandshakeFilter (Maybe Text)

-- | Specifies the type of handshake action.
--   
--   If you specify <tt>ActionType</tt>, you cannot also specify
--   <tt>ParentHandshakeId</tt>.
handshakeFilter_actionType :: Lens' HandshakeFilter (Maybe ActionType)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.Organizations.Types.HandshakeFilter.HandshakeFilter
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.Organizations.Types.HandshakeFilter.HandshakeFilter
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.Organizations.Types.HandshakeFilter.HandshakeFilter
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.Organizations.Types.HandshakeFilter.HandshakeFilter
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.Organizations.Types.HandshakeFilter.HandshakeFilter
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.Organizations.Types.HandshakeFilter.HandshakeFilter
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.Organizations.Types.HandshakeFilter.HandshakeFilter


module Network.AWS.Organizations.Types.HandshakePartyType
newtype HandshakePartyType
HandshakePartyType' :: Text -> HandshakePartyType
[fromHandshakePartyType] :: HandshakePartyType -> Text
pattern HandshakePartyType_ACCOUNT :: HandshakePartyType
pattern HandshakePartyType_EMAIL :: HandshakePartyType
pattern HandshakePartyType_ORGANIZATION :: HandshakePartyType
instance Network.AWS.Data.XML.ToXML Network.AWS.Organizations.Types.HandshakePartyType.HandshakePartyType
instance Network.AWS.Data.XML.FromXML Network.AWS.Organizations.Types.HandshakePartyType.HandshakePartyType
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSONKey Network.AWS.Organizations.Types.HandshakePartyType.HandshakePartyType
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.Organizations.Types.HandshakePartyType.HandshakePartyType
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSONKey Network.AWS.Organizations.Types.HandshakePartyType.HandshakePartyType
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.Organizations.Types.HandshakePartyType.HandshakePartyType
instance Network.AWS.Data.Query.ToQuery Network.AWS.Organizations.Types.HandshakePartyType.HandshakePartyType
instance Network.AWS.Data.Headers.ToHeader Network.AWS.Organizations.Types.HandshakePartyType.HandshakePartyType
instance Network.AWS.Data.Log.ToLog Network.AWS.Organizations.Types.HandshakePartyType.HandshakePartyType
instance Network.AWS.Data.ByteString.ToByteString Network.AWS.Organizations.Types.HandshakePartyType.HandshakePartyType
instance Network.AWS.Data.Text.ToText Network.AWS.Organizations.Types.HandshakePartyType.HandshakePartyType
instance Network.AWS.Data.Text.FromText Network.AWS.Organizations.Types.HandshakePartyType.HandshakePartyType
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.Organizations.Types.HandshakePartyType.HandshakePartyType
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.Organizations.Types.HandshakePartyType.HandshakePartyType
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.Organizations.Types.HandshakePartyType.HandshakePartyType
instance GHC.Classes.Ord Network.AWS.Organizations.Types.HandshakePartyType.HandshakePartyType
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.Organizations.Types.HandshakePartyType.HandshakePartyType
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.Organizations.Types.HandshakePartyType.HandshakePartyType
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.Organizations.Types.HandshakePartyType.HandshakePartyType


module Network.AWS.Organizations.Types.HandshakeParty

-- | Identifies a participant in a handshake.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newHandshakeParty</a> smart constructor.
data HandshakeParty
HandshakeParty' :: Sensitive Text -> HandshakePartyType -> HandshakeParty

-- | The unique identifier (ID) for the party.
--   
--   The <a>regex pattern</a> for handshake ID string requires "h-"
--   followed by from 8 to 32 lowercase letters or digits.
[$sel:id:HandshakeParty'] :: HandshakeParty -> Sensitive Text

-- | The type of party.
[$sel:type':HandshakeParty'] :: HandshakeParty -> HandshakePartyType

-- | Create a value of <a>HandshakeParty</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:id:HandshakeParty'</a>, <a>handshakeParty_id</a> - The unique
--   identifier (ID) for the party.
--   
--   The <a>regex pattern</a> for handshake ID string requires "h-"
--   followed by from 8 to 32 lowercase letters or digits.
--   
--   <a>$sel:type':HandshakeParty'</a>, <a>handshakeParty_type</a> - The
--   type of party.
newHandshakeParty :: Text -> HandshakePartyType -> HandshakeParty

-- | The unique identifier (ID) for the party.
--   
--   The <a>regex pattern</a> for handshake ID string requires "h-"
--   followed by from 8 to 32 lowercase letters or digits.
handshakeParty_id :: Lens' HandshakeParty Text

-- | The type of party.
handshakeParty_type :: Lens' HandshakeParty HandshakePartyType
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.Organizations.Types.HandshakeParty.HandshakeParty
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.Organizations.Types.HandshakeParty.HandshakeParty
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.Organizations.Types.HandshakeParty.HandshakeParty
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.Organizations.Types.HandshakeParty.HandshakeParty
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.Organizations.Types.HandshakeParty.HandshakeParty
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.Organizations.Types.HandshakeParty.HandshakeParty
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.Organizations.Types.HandshakeParty.HandshakeParty


module Network.AWS.Organizations.Types.HandshakeResourceType
newtype HandshakeResourceType
HandshakeResourceType' :: Text -> HandshakeResourceType
[fromHandshakeResourceType] :: HandshakeResourceType -> Text
pattern HandshakeResourceType_ACCOUNT :: HandshakeResourceType
pattern HandshakeResourceType_EMAIL :: HandshakeResourceType
pattern HandshakeResourceType_MASTER_EMAIL :: HandshakeResourceType
pattern HandshakeResourceType_MASTER_NAME :: HandshakeResourceType
pattern HandshakeResourceType_NOTES :: HandshakeResourceType
pattern HandshakeResourceType_ORGANIZATION :: HandshakeResourceType
pattern HandshakeResourceType_ORGANIZATION_FEATURE_SET :: HandshakeResourceType
pattern HandshakeResourceType_PARENT_HANDSHAKE :: HandshakeResourceType
instance Network.AWS.Data.XML.ToXML Network.AWS.Organizations.Types.HandshakeResourceType.HandshakeResourceType
instance Network.AWS.Data.XML.FromXML Network.AWS.Organizations.Types.HandshakeResourceType.HandshakeResourceType
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSONKey Network.AWS.Organizations.Types.HandshakeResourceType.HandshakeResourceType
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.Organizations.Types.HandshakeResourceType.HandshakeResourceType
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSONKey Network.AWS.Organizations.Types.HandshakeResourceType.HandshakeResourceType
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.Organizations.Types.HandshakeResourceType.HandshakeResourceType
instance Network.AWS.Data.Query.ToQuery Network.AWS.Organizations.Types.HandshakeResourceType.HandshakeResourceType
instance Network.AWS.Data.Headers.ToHeader Network.AWS.Organizations.Types.HandshakeResourceType.HandshakeResourceType
instance Network.AWS.Data.Log.ToLog Network.AWS.Organizations.Types.HandshakeResourceType.HandshakeResourceType
instance Network.AWS.Data.ByteString.ToByteString Network.AWS.Organizations.Types.HandshakeResourceType.HandshakeResourceType
instance Network.AWS.Data.Text.ToText Network.AWS.Organizations.Types.HandshakeResourceType.HandshakeResourceType
instance Network.AWS.Data.Text.FromText Network.AWS.Organizations.Types.HandshakeResourceType.HandshakeResourceType
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.Organizations.Types.HandshakeResourceType.HandshakeResourceType
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.Organizations.Types.HandshakeResourceType.HandshakeResourceType
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.Organizations.Types.HandshakeResourceType.HandshakeResourceType
instance GHC.Classes.Ord Network.AWS.Organizations.Types.HandshakeResourceType.HandshakeResourceType
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.Organizations.Types.HandshakeResourceType.HandshakeResourceType
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.Organizations.Types.HandshakeResourceType.HandshakeResourceType
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.Organizations.Types.HandshakeResourceType.HandshakeResourceType


module Network.AWS.Organizations.Types.HandshakeResource

-- | Contains additional data that is needed to process a handshake.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newHandshakeResource</a> smart constructor.
data HandshakeResource
HandshakeResource' :: Maybe (Sensitive Text) -> Maybe [HandshakeResource] -> Maybe HandshakeResourceType -> HandshakeResource

-- | The information that is passed to the other party in the handshake.
--   The format of the value string must match the requirements of the
--   specified type.
[$sel:value:HandshakeResource'] :: HandshakeResource -> Maybe (Sensitive Text)

-- | When needed, contains an additional array of
--   <tt>HandshakeResource</tt> objects.
[$sel:resources:HandshakeResource'] :: HandshakeResource -> Maybe [HandshakeResource]

-- | The type of information being passed, specifying how the value is to
--   be interpreted by the other party:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>ACCOUNT</tt> - Specifies an AWS account ID number.</li>
--   <li><tt>ORGANIZATION</tt> - Specifies an organization ID number.</li>
--   <li><tt>EMAIL</tt> - Specifies the email address that is associated
--   with the account that receives the handshake.</li>
--   <li><tt>OWNER_EMAIL</tt> - Specifies the email address associated with
--   the management account. Included as information about an
--   organization.</li>
--   <li><tt>OWNER_NAME</tt> - Specifies the name associated with the
--   management account. Included as information about an
--   organization.</li>
--   <li><tt>NOTES</tt> - Additional text provided by the handshake
--   initiator and intended for the recipient to read.</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:type':HandshakeResource'] :: HandshakeResource -> Maybe HandshakeResourceType

-- | Create a value of <a>HandshakeResource</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:value:HandshakeResource'</a>, <a>handshakeResource_value</a> -
--   The information that is passed to the other party in the handshake.
--   The format of the value string must match the requirements of the
--   specified type.
--   
--   <a>$sel:resources:HandshakeResource'</a>,
--   <a>handshakeResource_resources</a> - When needed, contains an
--   additional array of <tt>HandshakeResource</tt> objects.
--   
--   <a>$sel:type':HandshakeResource'</a>, <a>handshakeResource_type</a> -
--   The type of information being passed, specifying how the value is to
--   be interpreted by the other party:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>ACCOUNT</tt> - Specifies an AWS account ID number.</li>
--   <li><tt>ORGANIZATION</tt> - Specifies an organization ID number.</li>
--   <li><tt>EMAIL</tt> - Specifies the email address that is associated
--   with the account that receives the handshake.</li>
--   <li><tt>OWNER_EMAIL</tt> - Specifies the email address associated with
--   the management account. Included as information about an
--   organization.</li>
--   <li><tt>OWNER_NAME</tt> - Specifies the name associated with the
--   management account. Included as information about an
--   organization.</li>
--   <li><tt>NOTES</tt> - Additional text provided by the handshake
--   initiator and intended for the recipient to read.</li>
--   </ul>
newHandshakeResource :: HandshakeResource

-- | The information that is passed to the other party in the handshake.
--   The format of the value string must match the requirements of the
--   specified type.
handshakeResource_value :: Lens' HandshakeResource (Maybe Text)

-- | When needed, contains an additional array of
--   <tt>HandshakeResource</tt> objects.
handshakeResource_resources :: Lens' HandshakeResource (Maybe [HandshakeResource])

-- | The type of information being passed, specifying how the value is to
--   be interpreted by the other party:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>ACCOUNT</tt> - Specifies an AWS account ID number.</li>
--   <li><tt>ORGANIZATION</tt> - Specifies an organization ID number.</li>
--   <li><tt>EMAIL</tt> - Specifies the email address that is associated
--   with the account that receives the handshake.</li>
--   <li><tt>OWNER_EMAIL</tt> - Specifies the email address associated with
--   the management account. Included as information about an
--   organization.</li>
--   <li><tt>OWNER_NAME</tt> - Specifies the name associated with the
--   management account. Included as information about an
--   organization.</li>
--   <li><tt>NOTES</tt> - Additional text provided by the handshake
--   initiator and intended for the recipient to read.</li>
--   </ul>
handshakeResource_type :: Lens' HandshakeResource (Maybe HandshakeResourceType)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.Organizations.Types.HandshakeResource.HandshakeResource
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.Organizations.Types.HandshakeResource.HandshakeResource
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.Organizations.Types.HandshakeResource.HandshakeResource
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.Organizations.Types.HandshakeResource.HandshakeResource
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.Organizations.Types.HandshakeResource.HandshakeResource
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.Organizations.Types.HandshakeResource.HandshakeResource


module Network.AWS.Organizations.Types.HandshakeState
newtype HandshakeState
HandshakeState' :: Text -> HandshakeState
[fromHandshakeState] :: HandshakeState -> Text
pattern HandshakeState_ACCEPTED :: HandshakeState
pattern HandshakeState_CANCELED :: HandshakeState
pattern HandshakeState_DECLINED :: HandshakeState
pattern HandshakeState_EXPIRED :: HandshakeState
pattern HandshakeState_OPEN :: HandshakeState
pattern HandshakeState_REQUESTED :: HandshakeState
instance Network.AWS.Data.XML.ToXML Network.AWS.Organizations.Types.HandshakeState.HandshakeState
instance Network.AWS.Data.XML.FromXML Network.AWS.Organizations.Types.HandshakeState.HandshakeState
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSONKey Network.AWS.Organizations.Types.HandshakeState.HandshakeState
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.Organizations.Types.HandshakeState.HandshakeState
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSONKey Network.AWS.Organizations.Types.HandshakeState.HandshakeState
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.Organizations.Types.HandshakeState.HandshakeState
instance Network.AWS.Data.Query.ToQuery Network.AWS.Organizations.Types.HandshakeState.HandshakeState
instance Network.AWS.Data.Headers.ToHeader Network.AWS.Organizations.Types.HandshakeState.HandshakeState
instance Network.AWS.Data.Log.ToLog Network.AWS.Organizations.Types.HandshakeState.HandshakeState
instance Network.AWS.Data.ByteString.ToByteString Network.AWS.Organizations.Types.HandshakeState.HandshakeState
instance Network.AWS.Data.Text.ToText Network.AWS.Organizations.Types.HandshakeState.HandshakeState
instance Network.AWS.Data.Text.FromText Network.AWS.Organizations.Types.HandshakeState.HandshakeState
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.Organizations.Types.HandshakeState.HandshakeState
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.Organizations.Types.HandshakeState.HandshakeState
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.Organizations.Types.HandshakeState.HandshakeState
instance GHC.Classes.Ord Network.AWS.Organizations.Types.HandshakeState.HandshakeState
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.Organizations.Types.HandshakeState.HandshakeState
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.Organizations.Types.HandshakeState.HandshakeState
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.Organizations.Types.HandshakeState.HandshakeState


module Network.AWS.Organizations.Types.Handshake

-- | Contains information that must be exchanged to securely establish a
--   relationship between two accounts (an <i>originator</i> and a
--   <i>recipient</i>). For example, when a management account (the
--   originator) invites another account (the recipient) to join its
--   organization, the two accounts exchange information as a series of
--   handshake requests and responses.
--   
--   <b>Note:</b> Handshakes that are <tt>CANCELED</tt>, <tt>ACCEPTED</tt>,
--   or <tt>DECLINED</tt> show up in lists for only 30 days after entering
--   that state After that they are deleted.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newHandshake</a> smart constructor.
data Handshake
Handshake' :: Maybe HandshakeState -> Maybe Text -> Maybe ActionType -> Maybe [HandshakeResource] -> Maybe Text -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe [HandshakeParty] -> Maybe POSIX -> Handshake

-- | The current state of the handshake. Use the state to trace the flow of
--   the handshake through the process from its creation to its acceptance.
--   The meaning of each of the valid values is as follows:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><b>REQUESTED</b>: This handshake was sent to multiple recipients
--   (applicable to only some handshake types) and not all recipients have
--   responded yet. The request stays in this state until all recipients
--   respond.</li>
--   <li><b>OPEN</b>: This handshake was sent to multiple recipients
--   (applicable to only some policy types) and all recipients have
--   responded, allowing the originator to complete the handshake
--   action.</li>
--   <li><b>CANCELED</b>: This handshake is no longer active because it was
--   canceled by the originating account.</li>
--   <li><b>ACCEPTED</b>: This handshake is complete because it has been
--   accepted by the recipient.</li>
--   <li><b>DECLINED</b>: This handshake is no longer active because it was
--   declined by the recipient account.</li>
--   <li><b>EXPIRED</b>: This handshake is no longer active because the
--   originator did not receive a response of any kind from the recipient
--   before the expiration time (15 days).</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:state:Handshake'] :: Handshake -> Maybe HandshakeState

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of a handshake.
--   
--   For more information about ARNs in Organizations, see <a>ARN Formats
--   Supported by Organizations</a> in the <i>AWS Service Authorization
--   Reference</i>.
[$sel:arn:Handshake'] :: Handshake -> Maybe Text

-- | The type of handshake, indicating what action occurs when the
--   recipient accepts the handshake. The following handshake types are
--   supported:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><b>INVITE</b>: This type of handshake represents a request to join
--   an organization. It is always sent from the management account to only
--   non-member accounts.</li>
--   <li><b>ENABLE_ALL_FEATURES</b>: This type of handshake represents a
--   request to enable all features in an organization. It is always sent
--   from the management account to only <i>invited</i> member accounts.
--   Created accounts do not receive this because those accounts were
--   created by the organization's management account and approval is
--   inferred.</li>
--   <li><b>APPROVE_ALL_FEATURES</b>: This type of handshake is sent from
--   the Organizations service when all member accounts have approved the
--   <tt>ENABLE_ALL_FEATURES</tt> invitation. It is sent only to the
--   management account and signals the master that it can finalize the
--   process to enable all features.</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:action:Handshake'] :: Handshake -> Maybe ActionType

-- | Additional information that is needed to process the handshake.
[$sel:resources:Handshake'] :: Handshake -> Maybe [HandshakeResource]

-- | The unique identifier (ID) of a handshake. The originating account
--   creates the ID when it initiates the handshake.
--   
--   The <a>regex pattern</a> for handshake ID string requires "h-"
--   followed by from 8 to 32 lowercase letters or digits.
[$sel:id:Handshake'] :: Handshake -> Maybe Text

-- | The date and time that the handshake expires. If the recipient of the
--   handshake request fails to respond before the specified date and time,
--   the handshake becomes inactive and is no longer valid.
[$sel:expirationTimestamp:Handshake'] :: Handshake -> Maybe POSIX

-- | Information about the two accounts that are participating in the
--   handshake.
[$sel:parties:Handshake'] :: Handshake -> Maybe [HandshakeParty]

-- | The date and time that the handshake request was made.
[$sel:requestedTimestamp:Handshake'] :: Handshake -> Maybe POSIX

-- | Create a value of <a>Handshake</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:state:Handshake'</a>, <a>handshake_state</a> - The current
--   state of the handshake. Use the state to trace the flow of the
--   handshake through the process from its creation to its acceptance. The
--   meaning of each of the valid values is as follows:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><b>REQUESTED</b>: This handshake was sent to multiple recipients
--   (applicable to only some handshake types) and not all recipients have
--   responded yet. The request stays in this state until all recipients
--   respond.</li>
--   <li><b>OPEN</b>: This handshake was sent to multiple recipients
--   (applicable to only some policy types) and all recipients have
--   responded, allowing the originator to complete the handshake
--   action.</li>
--   <li><b>CANCELED</b>: This handshake is no longer active because it was
--   canceled by the originating account.</li>
--   <li><b>ACCEPTED</b>: This handshake is complete because it has been
--   accepted by the recipient.</li>
--   <li><b>DECLINED</b>: This handshake is no longer active because it was
--   declined by the recipient account.</li>
--   <li><b>EXPIRED</b>: This handshake is no longer active because the
--   originator did not receive a response of any kind from the recipient
--   before the expiration time (15 days).</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:arn:Handshake'</a>, <a>handshake_arn</a> - The Amazon Resource
--   Name (ARN) of a handshake.
--   
--   For more information about ARNs in Organizations, see <a>ARN Formats
--   Supported by Organizations</a> in the <i>AWS Service Authorization
--   Reference</i>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:action:Handshake'</a>, <a>handshake_action</a> - The type of
--   handshake, indicating what action occurs when the recipient accepts
--   the handshake. The following handshake types are supported:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><b>INVITE</b>: This type of handshake represents a request to join
--   an organization. It is always sent from the management account to only
--   non-member accounts.</li>
--   <li><b>ENABLE_ALL_FEATURES</b>: This type of handshake represents a
--   request to enable all features in an organization. It is always sent
--   from the management account to only <i>invited</i> member accounts.
--   Created accounts do not receive this because those accounts were
--   created by the organization's management account and approval is
--   inferred.</li>
--   <li><b>APPROVE_ALL_FEATURES</b>: This type of handshake is sent from
--   the Organizations service when all member accounts have approved the
--   <tt>ENABLE_ALL_FEATURES</tt> invitation. It is sent only to the
--   management account and signals the master that it can finalize the
--   process to enable all features.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:resources:Handshake'</a>, <a>handshake_resources</a> -
--   Additional information that is needed to process the handshake.
--   
--   <a>$sel:id:Handshake'</a>, <a>handshake_id</a> - The unique identifier
--   (ID) of a handshake. The originating account creates the ID when it
--   initiates the handshake.
--   
--   The <a>regex pattern</a> for handshake ID string requires "h-"
--   followed by from 8 to 32 lowercase letters or digits.
--   
--   <a>$sel:expirationTimestamp:Handshake'</a>,
--   <a>handshake_expirationTimestamp</a> - The date and time that the
--   handshake expires. If the recipient of the handshake request fails to
--   respond before the specified date and time, the handshake becomes
--   inactive and is no longer valid.
--   
--   <a>$sel:parties:Handshake'</a>, <a>handshake_parties</a> - Information
--   about the two accounts that are participating in the handshake.
--   
--   <a>$sel:requestedTimestamp:Handshake'</a>,
--   <a>handshake_requestedTimestamp</a> - The date and time that the
--   handshake request was made.
newHandshake :: Handshake

-- | The current state of the handshake. Use the state to trace the flow of
--   the handshake through the process from its creation to its acceptance.
--   The meaning of each of the valid values is as follows:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><b>REQUESTED</b>: This handshake was sent to multiple recipients
--   (applicable to only some handshake types) and not all recipients have
--   responded yet. The request stays in this state until all recipients
--   respond.</li>
--   <li><b>OPEN</b>: This handshake was sent to multiple recipients
--   (applicable to only some policy types) and all recipients have
--   responded, allowing the originator to complete the handshake
--   action.</li>
--   <li><b>CANCELED</b>: This handshake is no longer active because it was
--   canceled by the originating account.</li>
--   <li><b>ACCEPTED</b>: This handshake is complete because it has been
--   accepted by the recipient.</li>
--   <li><b>DECLINED</b>: This handshake is no longer active because it was
--   declined by the recipient account.</li>
--   <li><b>EXPIRED</b>: This handshake is no longer active because the
--   originator did not receive a response of any kind from the recipient
--   before the expiration time (15 days).</li>
--   </ul>
handshake_state :: Lens' Handshake (Maybe HandshakeState)

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of a handshake.
--   
--   For more information about ARNs in Organizations, see <a>ARN Formats
--   Supported by Organizations</a> in the <i>AWS Service Authorization
--   Reference</i>.
handshake_arn :: Lens' Handshake (Maybe Text)

-- | The type of handshake, indicating what action occurs when the
--   recipient accepts the handshake. The following handshake types are
--   supported:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><b>INVITE</b>: This type of handshake represents a request to join
--   an organization. It is always sent from the management account to only
--   non-member accounts.</li>
--   <li><b>ENABLE_ALL_FEATURES</b>: This type of handshake represents a
--   request to enable all features in an organization. It is always sent
--   from the management account to only <i>invited</i> member accounts.
--   Created accounts do not receive this because those accounts were
--   created by the organization's management account and approval is
--   inferred.</li>
--   <li><b>APPROVE_ALL_FEATURES</b>: This type of handshake is sent from
--   the Organizations service when all member accounts have approved the
--   <tt>ENABLE_ALL_FEATURES</tt> invitation. It is sent only to the
--   management account and signals the master that it can finalize the
--   process to enable all features.</li>
--   </ul>
handshake_action :: Lens' Handshake (Maybe ActionType)

-- | Additional information that is needed to process the handshake.
handshake_resources :: Lens' Handshake (Maybe [HandshakeResource])

-- | The unique identifier (ID) of a handshake. The originating account
--   creates the ID when it initiates the handshake.
--   
--   The <a>regex pattern</a> for handshake ID string requires "h-"
--   followed by from 8 to 32 lowercase letters or digits.
handshake_id :: Lens' Handshake (Maybe Text)

-- | The date and time that the handshake expires. If the recipient of the
--   handshake request fails to respond before the specified date and time,
--   the handshake becomes inactive and is no longer valid.
handshake_expirationTimestamp :: Lens' Handshake (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | Information about the two accounts that are participating in the
--   handshake.
handshake_parties :: Lens' Handshake (Maybe [HandshakeParty])

-- | The date and time that the handshake request was made.
handshake_requestedTimestamp :: Lens' Handshake (Maybe UTCTime)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.Organizations.Types.Handshake.Handshake
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.Organizations.Types.Handshake.Handshake
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.Organizations.Types.Handshake.Handshake
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.Organizations.Types.Handshake.Handshake
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.Organizations.Types.Handshake.Handshake
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.Organizations.Types.Handshake.Handshake

instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.Organizations.Types.OrganizationFeatureSet.OrganizationFeatureSet


module Network.AWS.Organizations.Types.OrganizationalUnit

-- | Contains details about an organizational unit (OU). An OU is a
--   container of AWS accounts within a root of an organization. Policies
--   that are attached to an OU apply to all accounts contained in that OU
--   and in any child OUs.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newOrganizationalUnit</a> smart constructor.
data OrganizationalUnit
OrganizationalUnit' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> OrganizationalUnit

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of this OU.
--   
--   For more information about ARNs in Organizations, see <a>ARN Formats
--   Supported by Organizations</a> in the <i>AWS Service Authorization
--   Reference</i>.
[$sel:arn:OrganizationalUnit'] :: OrganizationalUnit -> Maybe Text

-- | The friendly name of this OU.
--   
--   The <a>regex pattern</a> that is used to validate this parameter is a
--   string of any of the characters in the ASCII character range.
[$sel:name:OrganizationalUnit'] :: OrganizationalUnit -> Maybe Text

-- | The unique identifier (ID) associated with this OU.
--   
--   The <a>regex pattern</a> for an organizational unit ID string requires
--   "ou-" followed by from 4 to 32 lowercase letters or digits (the ID of
--   the root that contains the OU). This string is followed by a second
--   "-" dash and from 8 to 32 additional lowercase letters or digits.
[$sel:id:OrganizationalUnit'] :: OrganizationalUnit -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>OrganizationalUnit</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:arn:OrganizationalUnit'</a>, <a>organizationalUnit_arn</a> -
--   The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of this OU.
--   
--   For more information about ARNs in Organizations, see <a>ARN Formats
--   Supported by Organizations</a> in the <i>AWS Service Authorization
--   Reference</i>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:OrganizationalUnit'</a>, <a>organizationalUnit_name</a> -
--   The friendly name of this OU.
--   
--   The <a>regex pattern</a> that is used to validate this parameter is a
--   string of any of the characters in the ASCII character range.
--   
--   <a>$sel:id:OrganizationalUnit'</a>, <a>organizationalUnit_id</a> - The
--   unique identifier (ID) associated with this OU.
--   
--   The <a>regex pattern</a> for an organizational unit ID string requires
--   "ou-" followed by from 4 to 32 lowercase letters or digits (the ID of
--   the root that contains the OU). This string is followed by a second
--   "-" dash and from 8 to 32 additional lowercase letters or digits.
newOrganizationalUnit :: OrganizationalUnit

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of this OU.
--   
--   For more information about ARNs in Organizations, see <a>ARN Formats
--   Supported by Organizations</a> in the <i>AWS Service Authorization
--   Reference</i>.
organizationalUnit_arn :: Lens' OrganizationalUnit (Maybe Text)

-- | The friendly name of this OU.
--   
--   The <a>regex pattern</a> that is used to validate this parameter is a
--   string of any of the characters in the ASCII character range.
organizationalUnit_name :: Lens' OrganizationalUnit (Maybe Text)

-- | The unique identifier (ID) associated with this OU.
--   
--   The <a>regex pattern</a> for an organizational unit ID string requires
--   "ou-" followed by from 4 to 32 lowercase letters or digits (the ID of
--   the root that contains the OU). This string is followed by a second
--   "-" dash and from 8 to 32 additional lowercase letters or digits.
organizationalUnit_id :: Lens' OrganizationalUnit (Maybe Text)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.Organizations.Types.OrganizationalUnit.OrganizationalUnit
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.Organizations.Types.OrganizationalUnit.OrganizationalUnit
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.Organizations.Types.OrganizationalUnit.OrganizationalUnit
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.Organizations.Types.OrganizationalUnit.OrganizationalUnit
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.Organizations.Types.OrganizationalUnit.OrganizationalUnit
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.Organizations.Types.OrganizationalUnit.OrganizationalUnit
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.Organizations.Types.OrganizationalUnit.OrganizationalUnit


module Network.AWS.Organizations.Types.ParentType

ParentType' :: Text -> ParentType
[fromParentType] :: ParentType -> Text
pattern ParentType_ORGANIZATIONAL_UNIT :: ParentType
pattern ParentType_ROOT :: ParentType
instance Network.AWS.Data.XML.ToXML Network.AWS.Organizations.Types.ParentType.ParentType
instance Network.AWS.Data.XML.FromXML Network.AWS.Organizations.Types.ParentType.ParentType
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSONKey Network.AWS.Organizations.Types.ParentType.ParentType
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.Organizations.Types.ParentType.ParentType
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSONKey Network.AWS.Organizations.Types.ParentType.ParentType
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.Organizations.Types.ParentType.ParentType
instance Network.AWS.Data.Query.ToQuery Network.AWS.Organizations.Types.ParentType.ParentType
instance Network.AWS.Data.Headers.ToHeader Network.AWS.Organizations.Types.ParentType.ParentType
instance Network.AWS.Data.Log.ToLog Network.AWS.Organizations.Types.ParentType.ParentType
instance Network.AWS.Data.ByteString.ToByteString Network.AWS.Organizations.Types.ParentType.ParentType
instance Network.AWS.Data.Text.ToText Network.AWS.Organizations.Types.ParentType.ParentType
instance Network.AWS.Data.Text.FromText Network.AWS.Organizations.Types.ParentType.ParentType
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.Organizations.Types.ParentType.ParentType
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.Organizations.Types.ParentType.ParentType
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.Organizations.Types.ParentType.ParentType
instance GHC.Classes.Ord Network.AWS.Organizations.Types.ParentType.ParentType
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.Organizations.Types.ParentType.ParentType
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.Organizations.Types.ParentType.ParentType
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.Organizations.Types.ParentType.ParentType


module Network.AWS.Organizations.Types.Parent

-- | Contains information about either a root or an organizational unit
--   (OU) that can contain OUs or accounts in an organization.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newParent</a> smart constructor.
data Parent
Parent' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe ParentType -> Parent

-- | The unique identifier (ID) of the parent entity.
--   
--   The <a>regex pattern</a> for a parent ID string requires one of the
--   following:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><b>Root</b> - A string that begins with "r-" followed by from 4 to
--   32 lowercase letters or digits.</li>
--   <li><b>Organizational unit (OU)</b> - A string that begins with "ou-"
--   followed by from 4 to 32 lowercase letters or digits (the ID of the
--   root that the OU is in). This string is followed by a second "-" dash
--   and from 8 to 32 additional lowercase letters or digits.</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:id:Parent'] :: Parent -> Maybe Text

-- | The type of the parent entity.
[$sel:type':Parent'] :: Parent -> Maybe ParentType

-- | Create a value of <a>Parent</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:id:Parent'</a>, <a>parent_id</a> - The unique identifier (ID)
--   of the parent entity.
--   
--   The <a>regex pattern</a> for a parent ID string requires one of the
--   following:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><b>Root</b> - A string that begins with "r-" followed by from 4 to
--   32 lowercase letters or digits.</li>
--   <li><b>Organizational unit (OU)</b> - A string that begins with "ou-"
--   followed by from 4 to 32 lowercase letters or digits (the ID of the
--   root that the OU is in). This string is followed by a second "-" dash
--   and from 8 to 32 additional lowercase letters or digits.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:type':Parent'</a>, <a>parent_type</a> - The type of the parent
--   entity.
newParent :: Parent

-- | The unique identifier (ID) of the parent entity.
--   
--   The <a>regex pattern</a> for a parent ID string requires one of the
--   following:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><b>Root</b> - A string that begins with "r-" followed by from 4 to
--   32 lowercase letters or digits.</li>
--   <li><b>Organizational unit (OU)</b> - A string that begins with "ou-"
--   followed by from 4 to 32 lowercase letters or digits (the ID of the
--   root that the OU is in). This string is followed by a second "-" dash
--   and from 8 to 32 additional lowercase letters or digits.</li>
--   </ul>
parent_id :: Lens' Parent (Maybe Text)

-- | The type of the parent entity.
parent_type :: Lens' Parent (Maybe ParentType)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.Organizations.Types.Parent.Parent
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.Organizations.Types.Parent.Parent
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.Organizations.Types.Parent.Parent
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.Organizations.Types.Parent.Parent
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.Organizations.Types.Parent.Parent
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.Organizations.Types.Parent.Parent
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.Organizations.Types.Parent.Parent

instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.Organizations.Types.PolicyType.PolicyType
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.Organizations.Types.PolicyType.PolicyType
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.Organizations.Types.PolicyType.PolicyType


module Network.AWS.Organizations.Types.PolicySummary

-- | Contains information about a policy, but does not include the content.
--   To see the content of a policy, see DescribePolicy.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newPolicySummary</a> smart constructor.
data PolicySummary
PolicySummary' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe PolicyType -> Maybe Text -> PolicySummary

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the policy.
--   
--   For more information about ARNs in Organizations, see <a>ARN Formats
--   Supported by Organizations</a> in the <i>AWS Service Authorization
--   Reference</i>.
[$sel:arn:PolicySummary'] :: PolicySummary -> Maybe Text

-- | The friendly name of the policy.
--   
--   The <a>regex pattern</a> that is used to validate this parameter is a
--   string of any of the characters in the ASCII character range.
[$sel:name:PolicySummary'] :: PolicySummary -> Maybe Text

-- | The unique identifier (ID) of the policy.
--   
--   The <a>regex pattern</a> for a policy ID string requires "p-" followed
--   by from 8 to 128 lowercase or uppercase letters, digits, or the
--   underscore character (_).
[$sel:id:PolicySummary'] :: PolicySummary -> Maybe Text

-- | A boolean value that indicates whether the specified policy is an AWS
--   managed policy. If true, then you can attach the policy to roots, OUs,
--   or accounts, but you cannot edit it.
[$sel:awsManaged:PolicySummary'] :: PolicySummary -> Maybe Bool

-- | The type of policy.
[$sel:type':PolicySummary'] :: PolicySummary -> Maybe PolicyType

-- | The description of the policy.
[$sel:description:PolicySummary'] :: PolicySummary -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>PolicySummary</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:arn:PolicySummary'</a>, <a>policySummary_arn</a> - The Amazon
--   Resource Name (ARN) of the policy.
--   
--   For more information about ARNs in Organizations, see <a>ARN Formats
--   Supported by Organizations</a> in the <i>AWS Service Authorization
--   Reference</i>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:PolicySummary'</a>, <a>policySummary_name</a> - The
--   friendly name of the policy.
--   
--   The <a>regex pattern</a> that is used to validate this parameter is a
--   string of any of the characters in the ASCII character range.
--   
--   <a>$sel:id:PolicySummary'</a>, <a>policySummary_id</a> - The unique
--   identifier (ID) of the policy.
--   
--   The <a>regex pattern</a> for a policy ID string requires "p-" followed
--   by from 8 to 128 lowercase or uppercase letters, digits, or the
--   underscore character (_).
--   
--   <a>$sel:awsManaged:PolicySummary'</a>, <a>policySummary_awsManaged</a>
--   - A boolean value that indicates whether the specified policy is an
--   AWS managed policy. If true, then you can attach the policy to roots,
--   OUs, or accounts, but you cannot edit it.
--   
--   <a>$sel:type':PolicySummary'</a>, <a>policySummary_type</a> - The type
--   of policy.
--   
--   <a>$sel:description:PolicySummary'</a>,
--   <a>policySummary_description</a> - The description of the policy.
newPolicySummary :: PolicySummary

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the policy.
--   
--   For more information about ARNs in Organizations, see <a>ARN Formats
--   Supported by Organizations</a> in the <i>AWS Service Authorization
--   Reference</i>.
policySummary_arn :: Lens' PolicySummary (Maybe Text)

-- | The friendly name of the policy.
--   
--   The <a>regex pattern</a> that is used to validate this parameter is a
--   string of any of the characters in the ASCII character range.
policySummary_name :: Lens' PolicySummary (Maybe Text)

-- | The unique identifier (ID) of the policy.
--   
--   The <a>regex pattern</a> for a policy ID string requires "p-" followed
--   by from 8 to 128 lowercase or uppercase letters, digits, or the
--   underscore character (_).
policySummary_id :: Lens' PolicySummary (Maybe Text)

-- | A boolean value that indicates whether the specified policy is an AWS
--   managed policy. If true, then you can attach the policy to roots, OUs,
--   or accounts, but you cannot edit it.
policySummary_awsManaged :: Lens' PolicySummary (Maybe Bool)

-- | The type of policy.
policySummary_type :: Lens' PolicySummary (Maybe PolicyType)

-- | The description of the policy.
policySummary_description :: Lens' PolicySummary (Maybe Text)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.Organizations.Types.PolicySummary.PolicySummary
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.Organizations.Types.PolicySummary.PolicySummary
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.Organizations.Types.PolicySummary.PolicySummary
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.Organizations.Types.PolicySummary.PolicySummary
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.Organizations.Types.PolicySummary.PolicySummary
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.Organizations.Types.PolicySummary.PolicySummary
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.Organizations.Types.PolicySummary.PolicySummary


module Network.AWS.Organizations.Types.Policy

-- | Contains rules to be applied to the affected accounts. Policies can be
--   attached directly to accounts, or to roots and OUs to affect all
--   accounts in those hierarchies.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newPolicy</a> smart constructor.
data Policy
Policy' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe PolicySummary -> Policy

-- | The text content of the policy.
[$sel:content:Policy'] :: Policy -> Maybe Text

-- | A structure that contains additional details about the policy.
[$sel:policySummary:Policy'] :: Policy -> Maybe PolicySummary

-- | Create a value of <a>Policy</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:content:Policy'</a>, <a>policy_content</a> - The text content
--   of the policy.
--   
--   <a>$sel:policySummary:Policy'</a>, <a>policy_policySummary</a> - A
--   structure that contains additional details about the policy.
newPolicy :: Policy

-- | The text content of the policy.
policy_content :: Lens' Policy (Maybe Text)

-- | A structure that contains additional details about the policy.
policy_policySummary :: Lens' Policy (Maybe PolicySummary)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.Organizations.Types.Policy.Policy
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.Organizations.Types.Policy.Policy
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.Organizations.Types.Policy.Policy
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.Organizations.Types.Policy.Policy
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.Organizations.Types.Policy.Policy
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.Organizations.Types.Policy.Policy
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.Organizations.Types.Policy.Policy


module Network.AWS.Organizations.Types.PolicyTypeStatus
newtype PolicyTypeStatus
PolicyTypeStatus' :: Text -> PolicyTypeStatus
