-- | Moves an account from its current source parent root or organizational
--   unit (OU) to the specified destination parent root or OU.
--   
--   This operation can be called only from the organization's management
--   account.
module Network.AWS.Organizations.MoveAccount

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newMoveAccount</a> smart constructor.
data MoveAccount
MoveAccount' :: Text -> Text -> Text -> MoveAccount

-- | The unique identifier (ID) of the account that you want to move.
--   
--   The <a>regex pattern</a> for an account ID string requires exactly 12
--   digits.
[$sel:accountId:MoveAccount'] :: MoveAccount -> Text

-- | The unique identifier (ID) of the root or organizational unit that you
--   want to move the account from.
--   
--   The <a>regex pattern</a> for a parent ID string requires one of the
--   following:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><b>Root</b> - A string that begins with "r-" followed by from 4 to
--   32 lowercase letters or digits.</li>
--   <li><b>Organizational unit (OU)</b> - A string that begins with "ou-"
--   followed by from 4 to 32 lowercase letters or digits (the ID of the
--   root that the OU is in). This string is followed by a second "-" dash
--   and from 8 to 32 additional lowercase letters or digits.</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:sourceParentId:MoveAccount'] :: MoveAccount -> Text

-- | The unique identifier (ID) of the root or organizational unit that you
--   want to move the account to.
--   
--   The <a>regex pattern</a> for a parent ID string requires one of the
--   following:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><b>Root</b> - A string that begins with "r-" followed by from 4 to
--   32 lowercase letters or digits.</li>
--   <li><b>Organizational unit (OU)</b> - A string that begins with "ou-"
--   followed by from 4 to 32 lowercase letters or digits (the ID of the
--   root that the OU is in). This string is followed by a second "-" dash
--   and from 8 to 32 additional lowercase letters or digits.</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:destinationParentId:MoveAccount'] :: MoveAccount -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>MoveAccount</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:accountId:MoveAccount'</a>, <a>moveAccount_accountId</a> - The
--   unique identifier (ID) of the account that you want to move.
--   
--   The <a>regex pattern</a> for an account ID string requires exactly 12
--   digits.
--   
--   <a>$sel:sourceParentId:MoveAccount'</a>,
--   <a>moveAccount_sourceParentId</a> - The unique identifier (ID) of the
--   root or organizational unit that you want to move the account from.
--   
--   The <a>regex pattern</a> for a parent ID string requires one of the
--   following:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><b>Root</b> - A string that begins with "r-" followed by from 4 to
--   32 lowercase letters or digits.</li>
--   <li><b>Organizational unit (OU)</b> - A string that begins with "ou-"
--   followed by from 4 to 32 lowercase letters or digits (the ID of the
--   root that the OU is in). This string is followed by a second "-" dash
--   and from 8 to 32 additional lowercase letters or digits.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:destinationParentId:MoveAccount'</a>,
--   <a>moveAccount_destinationParentId</a> - The unique identifier (ID) of
--   the root or organizational unit that you want to move the account to.
--   
--   The <a>regex pattern</a> for a parent ID string requires one of the
--   following:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><b>Root</b> - A string that begins with "r-" followed by from 4 to
--   32 lowercase letters or digits.</li>
--   <li><b>Organizational unit (OU)</b> - A string that begins with "ou-"
--   followed by from 4 to 32 lowercase letters or digits (the ID of the
--   root that the OU is in). This string is followed by a second "-" dash
--   and from 8 to 32 additional lowercase letters or digits.</li>
--   </ul>
newMoveAccount :: Text -> Text -> Text -> MoveAccount

-- | The unique identifier (ID) of the account that you want to move.
--   
--   The <a>regex pattern</a> for an account ID string requires exactly 12
--   digits.
moveAccount_accountId :: Lens' MoveAccount Text

-- | The unique identifier (ID) of the root or organizational unit that you
--   want to move the account from.
--   
--   The <a>regex pattern</a> for a parent ID string requires one of the
--   following:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><b>Root</b> - A string that begins with "r-" followed by from 4 to
--   32 lowercase letters or digits.</li>
--   <li><b>Organizational unit (OU)</b> - A string that begins with "ou-"
--   followed by from 4 to 32 lowercase letters or digits (the ID of the
--   root that the OU is in). This string is followed by a second "-" dash
--   and from 8 to 32 additional lowercase letters or digits.</li>
--   </ul>
moveAccount_sourceParentId :: Lens' MoveAccount Text

-- | The unique identifier (ID) of the root or organizational unit that you
--   want to move the account to.
--   
--   The <a>regex pattern</a> for a parent ID string requires one of the
--   following:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><b>Root</b> - A string that begins with "r-" followed by from 4 to
--   32 lowercase letters or digits.</li>
--   <li><b>Organizational unit (OU)</b> - A string that begins with "ou-"
--   followed by from 4 to 32 lowercase letters or digits (the ID of the
--   root that the OU is in). This string is followed by a second "-" dash
--   and from 8 to 32 additional lowercase letters or digits.</li>
--   </ul>
moveAccount_destinationParentId :: Lens' MoveAccount Text

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newMoveAccountResponse</a> smart constructor.
data MoveAccountResponse
MoveAccountResponse' :: MoveAccountResponse

-- | Create a value of <a>MoveAccountResponse</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
newMoveAccountResponse :: MoveAccountResponse

instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.Organizations.MoveAccount.MoveAccount
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.Organizations.MoveAccount.MoveAccount
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.Organizations.MoveAccount.MoveAccount
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.Organizations.MoveAccount.MoveAccountResponse
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.Organizations.MoveAccount.MoveAccountResponse
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.Organizations.MoveAccount.MoveAccountResponse
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.Organizations.MoveAccount.MoveAccountResponse

instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.Organizations.MoveAccount.MoveAccount
instance Network.AWS.Data.Headers.ToHeaders Network.AWS.Organizations.MoveAccount.MoveAccount
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.Organizations.MoveAccount.MoveAccount
instance Network.AWS.Data.Path.ToPath Network.AWS.Organizations.MoveAccount.MoveAccount
instance Network.AWS.Data.Query.ToQuery Network.AWS.Organizations.MoveAccount.MoveAccount


-- | Lists all the roots, organizational units (OUs), and accounts that the
--   specified policy is attached to.
--   
--   Always check the <tt>NextToken</tt> response parameter for a
--   <tt>null</tt> value when calling a <tt>List*</tt> operation. These
--   operations can occasionally return an empty set of results even when
--   there are more results available. The <tt>NextToken</tt> response
--   parameter value is <tt>null</tt> <i>only</i> when there are no more
--   results to display.
--   
--   This operation can be called only from the organization's management
--   account or by a member account that is a delegated administrator for
--   an AWS service.
--   
--   This operation returns paginated results.
module Network.AWS.Organizations.ListTargetsForPolicy

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newListTargetsForPolicy</a> smart constructor.
data ListTargetsForPolicy
ListTargetsForPolicy' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Natural -> Text -> ListTargetsForPolicy

-- | The parameter for receiving additional results if you receive a
--   <tt>NextToken</tt> response in a previous request. A
--   <tt>NextToken</tt> response indicates that more output is available.
--   Set this parameter to the value of the previous call's
--   <tt>NextToken</tt> response to indicate where the output should
--   continue from.
[$sel:nextToken:ListTargetsForPolicy'] :: ListTargetsForPolicy -> Maybe Text

-- | The total number of results that you want included on each page of the
--   response. If you do not include this parameter, it defaults to a value
--   that is specific to the operation. If additional items exist beyond
--   the maximum you specify, the <tt>NextToken</tt> response element is
--   present and has a value (is not null). Include that value as the
--   <tt>NextToken</tt> request parameter in the next call to the operation
--   to get the next part of the results. Note that Organizations might
--   return fewer results than the maximum even when there are more results
--   available. You should check <tt>NextToken</tt> after every operation
--   to ensure that you receive all of the results.
[$sel:maxResults:ListTargetsForPolicy'] :: ListTargetsForPolicy -> Maybe Natural

-- | The unique identifier (ID) of the policy whose attachments you want to
--   know.
--   
--   The <a>regex pattern</a> for a policy ID string requires "p-" followed
--   by from 8 to 128 lowercase or uppercase letters, digits, or the
--   underscore character (_).
[$sel:policyId:ListTargetsForPolicy'] :: ListTargetsForPolicy -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>ListTargetsForPolicy</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:nextToken:ListTargetsForPolicy'</a>,
--   <a>listTargetsForPolicy_nextToken</a> - The parameter for receiving
--   additional results if you receive a <tt>NextToken</tt> response in a
--   previous request. A <tt>NextToken</tt> response indicates that more
--   output is available. Set this parameter to the value of the previous
--   call's <tt>NextToken</tt> response to indicate where the output should
--   continue from.
--   
--   <a>$sel:maxResults:ListTargetsForPolicy'</a>,
--   <a>listTargetsForPolicy_maxResults</a> - The total number of results
--   that you want included on each page of the response. If you do not
--   include this parameter, it defaults to a value that is specific to the
--   operation. If additional items exist beyond the maximum you specify,
--   the <tt>NextToken</tt> response element is present and has a value (is
--   not null). Include that value as the <tt>NextToken</tt> request
--   parameter in the next call to the operation to get the next part of
--   the results. Note that Organizations might return fewer results than
--   the maximum even when there are more results available. You should
--   check <tt>NextToken</tt> after every operation to ensure that you
--   receive all of the results.
--   
--   <a>$sel:policyId:ListTargetsForPolicy'</a>,
--   <a>listTargetsForPolicy_policyId</a> - The unique identifier (ID) of
--   the policy whose attachments you want to know.
--   
--   The <a>regex pattern</a> for a policy ID string requires "p-" followed
--   by from 8 to 128 lowercase or uppercase letters, digits, or the
--   underscore character (_).
newListTargetsForPolicy :: Text -> ListTargetsForPolicy

-- | The parameter for receiving additional results if you receive a
--   <tt>NextToken</tt> response in a previous request. A
--   <tt>NextToken</tt> response indicates that more output is available.
--   Set this parameter to the value of the previous call's
--   <tt>NextToken</tt> response to indicate where the output should
--   continue from.
listTargetsForPolicy_nextToken :: Lens' ListTargetsForPolicy (Maybe Text)

-- | The total number of results that you want included on each page of the
--   response. If you do not include this parameter, it defaults to a value
--   that is specific to the operation. If additional items exist beyond
--   the maximum you specify, the <tt>NextToken</tt> response element is
--   present and has a value (is not null). Include that value as the
--   <tt>NextToken</tt> request parameter in the next call to the operation
--   to get the next part of the results. Note that Organizations might
--   return fewer results than the maximum even when there are more results
--   available. You should check <tt>NextToken</tt> after every operation
--   to ensure that you receive all of the results.
listTargetsForPolicy_maxResults :: Lens' ListTargetsForPolicy (Maybe Natural)

-- | The unique identifier (ID) of the policy whose attachments you want to
--   know.
--   
--   The <a>regex pattern</a> for a policy ID string requires "p-" followed
--   by from 8 to 128 lowercase or uppercase letters, digits, or the
--   underscore character (_).
listTargetsForPolicy_policyId :: Lens' ListTargetsForPolicy Text

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newListTargetsForPolicyResponse</a> smart constructor.

--   <tt>NextToken</tt> response element comes back as <tt>null</tt>.

-- | Lists tags that are attached to the specified resource.
--   
--   You can attach tags to the following resources in AWS Organizations.
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>AWS account</li>
--   <li>Organization root</li>
--   <li>Organizational unit (OU)</li>
--   <li>Policy (any type)</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   This operation can be called only from the organization's management
--   account or by a member account that is a delegated administrator for
--   an AWS service.
--   
--   This operation returns paginated results.
module Network.AWS.Organizations.ListTagsForResource

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newListTagsForResource</a> smart constructor.
data ListTagsForResource
ListTagsForResource' :: Maybe Text -> Text -> ListTagsForResource

-- | The parameter for receiving additional results if you receive a
--   <tt>NextToken</tt> response in a previous request. A
--   <tt>NextToken</tt> response indicates that more output is available.
--   Set this parameter to the value of the previous call's
--   <tt>NextToken</tt> response to indicate where the output should
--   continue from.
[$sel:nextToken:ListTagsForResource'] :: ListTagsForResource -> Maybe Text

-- | The ID of the resource with the tags to list.
--   
--   You can specify any of the following taggable resources.
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>AWS account – specify the account ID number.</li>
--   <li>Organizational unit – specify the OU ID that begins with
--   <tt>ou-</tt> and looks similar to: <tt>ou-1a2b-34uvwxyz </tt></li>
--   <li>Root – specify the root ID that begins with <tt>r-</tt> and looks
--   similar to: <tt>r-1a2b </tt></li>
--   <li>Policy – specify the policy ID that begins with <tt>p-</tt>
--   andlooks similar to: <tt>p-12abcdefg3 </tt></li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:resourceId:ListTagsForResource'] :: ListTagsForResource -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>ListTagsForResource</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:nextToken:ListTagsForResource'</a>,
--   <a>listTagsForResource_nextToken</a> - The parameter for receiving
--   additional results if you receive a <tt>NextToken</tt> response in a
--   previous request. A <tt>NextToken</tt> response indicates that more
--   output is available. Set this parameter to the value of the previous
--   call's <tt>NextToken</tt> response to indicate where the output should
--   continue from.
--   
--   <a>$sel:resourceId:ListTagsForResource'</a>,
--   <a>listTagsForResource_resourceId</a> - The ID of the resource with
--   the tags to list.
--   
--   You can specify any of the following taggable resources.
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>AWS account – specify the account ID number.</li>
--   <li>Organizational unit – specify the OU ID that begins with
--   <tt>ou-</tt> and looks similar to: <tt>ou-1a2b-34uvwxyz </tt></li>
--   <li>Root – specify the root ID that begins with <tt>r-</tt> and looks
--   similar to: <tt>r-1a2b </tt></li>
--   <li>Policy – specify the policy ID that begins with <tt>p-</tt>
--   andlooks similar to: <tt>p-12abcdefg3 </tt></li>
--   </ul>
newListTagsForResource :: Text -> ListTagsForResource

-- | The parameter for receiving additional results if you receive a
--   <tt>NextToken</tt> response in a previous request. A
--   <tt>NextToken</tt> response indicates that more output is available.
--   Set this parameter to the value of the previous call's
--   <tt>NextToken</tt> response to indicate where the output should
--   continue from.
listTagsForResource_nextToken :: Lens' ListTagsForResource (Maybe Text)

-- | The ID of the resource with the tags to list.
--   
--   You can specify any of the following taggable resources.
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>AWS account – specify the account ID number.</li>
--   <li>Organizational unit – specify the OU ID that begins with
--   <tt>ou-</tt> and looks similar to: <tt>ou-1a2b-34uvwxyz </tt></li>
--   <li>Root – specify the root ID that begins with <tt>r-</tt> and looks
--   similar to: <tt>r-1a2b </tt></li>
--   <li>Policy – specify the policy ID that begins with <tt>p-</tt>
--   andlooks similar to: <tt>p-12abcdefg3 </tt></li>
--   </ul>
listTagsForResource_resourceId :: Lens' ListTagsForResource Text

-- | Lists the roots that are defined in the current organization.
--   
--   Always check the <tt>NextToken</tt> response parameter for a
--   <tt>null</tt> value when calling a <tt>List*</tt> operation. These
--   operations can occasionally return an empty set of results even when
--   there are more results available. The <tt>NextToken</tt> response
--   parameter value is <tt>null</tt> <i>only</i> when there are no more
--   results to display.
--   
--   This operation can be called only from the organization's management
--   account or by a member account that is a delegated administrator for
--   an AWS service.
--   
--   Policy types can be enabled and disabled in roots. This is distinct
--   from whether they're available in the organization. When you enable
--   all features, you make policy types available for use in that
--   organization. Individual policy types can then be enabled and disabled
--   in a root. To see the availability of a policy type in an
--   organization, use DescribeOrganization.
--   
--   This operation returns paginated results.
module Network.AWS.Organizations.ListRoots

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newListRoots</a> smart constructor.
data ListRoots
ListRoots' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Natural -> ListRoots

-- | The parameter for receiving additional results if you receive a
--   <tt>NextToken</tt> response in a previous request. A
--   <tt>NextToken</tt> response indicates that more output is available.
--   Set this parameter to the value of the previous call's
--   <tt>NextToken</tt> response to indicate where the output should
--   continue from.
[$sel:nextToken:ListRoots'] :: ListRoots -> Maybe Text

-- | The total number of results that you want included on each page of the
--   response. If you do not include this parameter, it defaults to a value
--   that is specific to the operation. If additional items exist beyond
--   the maximum you specify, the <tt>NextToken</tt> response element is
--   present and has a value (is not null). Include that value as the
--   <tt>NextToken</tt> request parameter in the next call to the operation
--   to get the next part of the results. Note that Organizations might
--   return fewer results than the maximum even when there are more results
--   available. You should check <tt>NextToken</tt> after every operation
--   to ensure that you receive all of the results.
[$sel:maxResults:ListRoots'] :: ListRoots -> Maybe Natural

-- | Create a value of <a>ListRoots</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:nextToken:ListRoots'</a>, <a>listRoots_nextToken</a> - The
--   parameter for receiving additional results if you receive a
--   <tt>NextToken</tt> response in a previous request. A
--   <tt>NextToken</tt> response indicates that more output is available.
--   Set this parameter to the value of the previous call's
--   <tt>NextToken</tt> response to indicate where the output should
--   continue from.
--   
--   <a>$sel:maxResults:ListRoots'</a>, <a>listRoots_maxResults</a> - The
--   total number of results that you want included on each page of the
--   response. If you do not include this parameter, it defaults to a value
--   that is specific to the operation. If additional items exist beyond
--   the maximum you specify, the <tt>NextToken</tt> response element is
--   present and has a value (is not null). Include that value as the
--   <tt>NextToken</tt> request parameter in the next call to the operation
--   to get the next part of the results. Note that Organizations might
--   return fewer results than the maximum even when there are more results
--   available. You should check <tt>NextToken</tt> after every operation
--   to ensure that you receive all of the results.
newListRoots :: ListRoots

-- | The parameter for receiving additional results if you receive a
--   <tt>NextToken</tt> response in a previous request. A
--   <tt>NextToken</tt> response indicates that more output is available.
--   Set this parameter to the value of the previous call's
--   <tt>NextToken</tt> response to indicate where the output should
--   continue from.
listRoots_nextToken :: Lens' ListRoots (Maybe Text)

-- | The total number of results that you want included on each page of the
--   response. If you do not include this parameter, it defaults to a value
--   that is specific to the operation. If additional items exist beyond
--   the maximum you specify, the <tt>NextToken</tt> response element is
--   present and has a value (is not null). Include that value as the
--   <tt>NextToken</tt> request parameter in the next call to the operation
--   to get the next part of the results. Note that Organizations might
--   return fewer results than the maximum even when there are more results
--   available. You should check <tt>NextToken</tt> after every operation
--   to ensure that you receive all of the results.
listRoots_maxResults :: Lens' ListRoots (Maybe Natural)

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newListRootsResponse</a> smart constructor.
data ListRootsResponse
ListRootsResponse' :: Maybe [Root] -> Maybe Text -> Int -> ListRootsResponse

-- | A list of roots that are defined in an organization.

--   next part of the output. You should repeat this until the
--   <tt>NextToken</tt> response element comes back as <tt>null</tt>.

--   request parameter in a subsequent call to the operation to get the

-- | Lists the policies that are directly attached to the specified target
--   root, organizational unit (OU), or account. You must specify the
--   policy type that you want included in the returned list.
--   
--   Always check the <tt>NextToken</tt> response parameter for a
--   <tt>null</tt> value when calling a <tt>List*</tt> operation. These
--   operations can occasionally return an empty set of results even when
--   there are more results available. The <tt>NextToken</tt> response
--   parameter value is <tt>null</tt> <i>only</i> when there are no more
--   results to display.
--   
--   This operation can be called only from the organization's management
--   account or by a member account that is a delegated administrator for
--   an AWS service.
--   
--   This operation returns paginated results.
module Network.AWS.Organizations.ListPoliciesForTarget

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newListPoliciesForTarget</a> smart constructor.
data ListPoliciesForTarget
ListPoliciesForTarget' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Natural -> Text -> PolicyType -> ListPoliciesForTarget

-- | The parameter for receiving additional results if you receive a
--   <tt>NextToken</tt> response in a previous request. A
--   <tt>NextToken</tt> response indicates that more output is available.
--   Set this parameter to the value of the previous call's
--   <tt>NextToken</tt> response to indicate where the output should
--   continue from.
[$sel:nextToken:ListPoliciesForTarget'] :: ListPoliciesForTarget -> Maybe Text

-- | The total number of results that you want included on each page of the
--   response. If you do not include this parameter, it defaults to a value
--   that is specific to the operation. If additional items exist beyond
--   the maximum you specify, the <tt>NextToken</tt> response element is
--   present and has a value (is not null). Include that value as the
--   <tt>NextToken</tt> request parameter in the next call to the operation
--   to get the next part of the results. Note that Organizations might
--   return fewer results than the maximum even when there are more results
--   available. You should check <tt>NextToken</tt> after every operation
--   to ensure that you receive all of the results.
[$sel:maxResults:ListPoliciesForTarget'] :: ListPoliciesForTarget -> Maybe Natural

-- | The unique identifier (ID) of the root, organizational unit, or
--   account whose policies you want to list.
--   
--   The <a>regex pattern</a> for a target ID string requires one of the
--   following:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><b>Root</b> - A string that begins with "r-" followed by from 4 to
--   32 lowercase letters or digits.</li>
--   <li><b>Account</b> - A string that consists of exactly 12 digits.</li>
--   <li><b>Organizational unit (OU)</b> - A string that begins with "ou-"
--   followed by from 4 to 32 lowercase letters or digits (the ID of the
--   root that the OU is in). This string is followed by a second "-" dash
--   and from 8 to 32 additional lowercase letters or digits.</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:targetId:ListPoliciesForTarget'] :: ListPoliciesForTarget -> Text

-- | The type of policy that you want to include in the returned list. You
--   must specify one of the following values:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>AISERVICES_OPT_OUT_POLICY</a></li>
--   <li><a>BACKUP_POLICY</a></li>
--   <li><a>SERVICE_CONTROL_POLICY</a></li>
--   <li><a>TAG_POLICY</a></li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:filter':ListPoliciesForTarget'] :: ListPoliciesForTarget -> PolicyType

-- | Create a value of <a>ListPoliciesForTarget</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:nextToken:ListPoliciesForTarget'</a>,
--   <a>listPoliciesForTarget_nextToken</a> - The parameter for receiving
--   additional results if you receive a <tt>NextToken</tt> response in a
--   previous request. A <tt>NextToken</tt> response indicates that more
--   output is available. Set this parameter to the value of the previous
--   call's <tt>NextToken</tt> response to indicate where the output should
--   continue from.
--   
--   <a>$sel:maxResults:ListPoliciesForTarget'</a>,
--   <a>listPoliciesForTarget_maxResults</a> - The total number of results
--   that you want included on each page of the response. If you do not
--   include this parameter, it defaults to a value that is specific to the
--   operation. If additional items exist beyond the maximum you specify,
--   the <tt>NextToken</tt> response element is present and has a value (is
--   not null). Include that value as the <tt>NextToken</tt> request
--   parameter in the next call to the operation to get the next part of
--   the results. Note that Organizations might return fewer results than
--   the maximum even when there are more results available. You should
--   check <tt>NextToken</tt> after every operation to ensure that you
--   receive all of the results.
--   
--   <a>$sel:targetId:ListPoliciesForTarget'</a>,
--   <a>listPoliciesForTarget_targetId</a> - The unique identifier (ID) of
--   the root, organizational unit, or account whose policies you want to
--   list.
--   
--   The <a>regex pattern</a> for a target ID string requires one of the
--   following:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><b>Root</b> - A string that begins with "r-" followed by from 4 to
--   32 lowercase letters or digits.</li>
--   <li><b>Account</b> - A string that consists of exactly 12 digits.</li>
--   <li><b>Organizational unit (OU)</b> - A string that begins with "ou-"
--   followed by from 4 to 32 lowercase letters or digits (the ID of the
--   root that the OU is in). This string is followed by a second "-" dash
--   and from 8 to 32 additional lowercase letters or digits.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:filter':ListPoliciesForTarget'</a>,
--   <a>listPoliciesForTarget_filter</a> - The type of policy that you want
--   to include in the returned list. You must specify one of the following
--   values:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>AISERVICES_OPT_OUT_POLICY</a></li>
--   <li><a>BACKUP_POLICY</a></li>
--   <li><a>SERVICE_CONTROL_POLICY</a></li>
--   <li><a>TAG_POLICY</a></li>
--   </ul>
newListPoliciesForTarget :: Text -> PolicyType -> ListPoliciesForTarget

-- | The parameter for receiving additional results if you receive a
--   <tt>NextToken</tt> response in a previous request. A
--   <tt>NextToken</tt> response indicates that more output is available.
--   Set this parameter to the value of the previous call's
--   <tt>NextToken</tt> response to indicate where the output should
--   continue from.
listPoliciesForTarget_nextToken :: Lens' ListPoliciesForTarget (Maybe Text)

-- | The total number of results that you want included on each page of the
--   response. If you do not include this parameter, it defaults to a value
--   that is specific to the operation. If additional items exist beyond
--   the maximum you specify, the <tt>NextToken</tt> response element is
--   present and has a value (is not null). Include that value as the
--   <tt>NextToken</tt> request parameter in the next call to the operation
--   to get the next part of the results. Note that Organizations might
--   return fewer results than the maximum even when there are more results
--   available. You should check <tt>NextToken</tt> after every operation
--   to ensure that you receive all of the results.
listPoliciesForTarget_maxResults :: Lens' ListPoliciesForTarget (Maybe Natural)

--   account whose policies you want to list.
--

--   and from 8 to 32 additional lowercase letters or digits.</li>
--   </ul>

--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>AISERVICES_OPT_OUT_POLICY</a></li>
--   <li><a>BACKUP_POLICY</a></li>
--   <li><a>SERVICE_CONTROL_POLICY</a></li>
--   <li><a>TAG_POLICY</a></li>
--   </ul>
listPoliciesForTarget_filter :: Lens' ListPoliciesForTarget PolicyType

ListPoliciesForTargetResponse' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe [PolicySummary] -> Int -> ListPoliciesForTargetResponse

--   in the current response. Use this value in the <tt>NextToken</tt>
--   request parameter in a subsequent call to the operation to get the

--   <tt>NextToken</tt> response element comes back as <tt>null</tt>.

-- | Retrieves the list of all policies in an organization of a specified
--   type.
--   
--   Always check the <tt>NextToken</tt> response parameter for a
--   <tt>null</tt> value when calling a <tt>List*</tt> operation. These
--   operations can occasionally return an empty set of results even when
--   there are more results available. The <tt>NextToken</tt> response
--   parameter value is <tt>null</tt> <i>only</i> when there are no more
--   results to display.
--   
--   This operation can be called only from the organization's management
--   account or by a member account that is a delegated administrator for
--   an AWS service.
--   
--   This operation returns paginated results.
module Network.AWS.Organizations.ListPolicies

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newListPolicies</a> smart constructor.
data ListPolicies
ListPolicies' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Natural -> PolicyType -> ListPolicies

-- | The parameter for receiving additional results if you receive a
--   <tt>NextToken</tt> response in a previous request. A
--   <tt>NextToken</tt> response indicates that more output is available.
--   Set this parameter to the value of the previous call's
--   <tt>NextToken</tt> response to indicate where the output should
--   continue from.
[$sel:nextToken:ListPolicies'] :: ListPolicies -> Maybe Text

-- | The total number of results that you want included on each page of the
--   response. If you do not include this parameter, it defaults to a value
--   that is specific to the operation. If additional items exist beyond
--   the maximum you specify, the <tt>NextToken</tt> response element is
--   present and has a value (is not null). Include that value as the
--   <tt>NextToken</tt> request parameter in the next call to the operation
--   to get the next part of the results. Note that Organizations might
--   return fewer results than the maximum even when there are more results
--   available. You should check <tt>NextToken</tt> after every operation
--   to ensure that you receive all of the results.
[$sel:maxResults:ListPolicies'] :: ListPolicies -> Maybe Natural

-- | Specifies the type of policy that you want to include in the response.
--   You must specify one of the following values:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>AISERVICES_OPT_OUT_POLICY</a></li>
--   <li><a>BACKUP_POLICY</a></li>
--   <li><a>SERVICE_CONTROL_POLICY</a></li>
--   <li><a>TAG_POLICY</a></li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:filter':ListPolicies'] :: ListPolicies -> PolicyType

-- | Create a value of <a>ListPolicies</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:nextToken:ListPolicies'</a>, <a>listPolicies_nextToken</a> -
--   The parameter for receiving additional results if you receive a
--   <tt>NextToken</tt> response in a previous request. A
--   <tt>NextToken</tt> response indicates that more output is available.
--   Set this parameter to the value of the previous call's
--   <tt>NextToken</tt> response to indicate where the output should
--   continue from.
--   
--   <a>$sel:maxResults:ListPolicies'</a>, <a>listPolicies_maxResults</a> -
--   The total number of results that you want included on each page of the
--   response. If you do not include this parameter, it defaults to a value
--   that is specific to the operation. If additional items exist beyond
--   the maximum you specify, the <tt>NextToken</tt> response element is
--   present and has a value (is not null). Include that value as the
--   <tt>NextToken</tt> request parameter in the next call to the operation
--   to get the next part of the results. Note that Organizations might
--   return fewer results than the maximum even when there are more results
--   available. You should check <tt>NextToken</tt> after every operation
--   to ensure that you receive all of the results.
--   
--   <a>$sel:filter':ListPolicies'</a>, <a>listPolicies_filter</a> -
--   Specifies the type of policy that you want to include in the response.
--   You must specify one of the following values:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>AISERVICES_OPT_OUT_POLICY</a></li>
--   <li><a>BACKUP_POLICY</a></li>
--   <li><a>SERVICE_CONTROL_POLICY</a></li>
--   <li><a>TAG_POLICY</a></li>
--   </ul>
newListPolicies :: PolicyType -> ListPolicies

-- | The parameter for receiving additional results if you receive a
--   <tt>NextToken</tt> response in a previous request. A
--   <tt>NextToken</tt> response indicates that more output is available.
--   Set this parameter to the value of the previous call's
--   <tt>NextToken</tt> response to indicate where the output should
--   continue from.
listPolicies_nextToken :: Lens' ListPolicies (Maybe Text)

-- | The total number of results that you want included on each page of the
--   response. If you do not include this parameter, it defaults to a value
--   that is specific to the operation. If additional items exist beyond
--   the maximum you specify, the <tt>NextToken</tt> response element is
--   present and has a value (is not null). Include that value as the
--   <tt>NextToken</tt> request parameter in the next call to the operation
--   to get the next part of the results. Note that Organizations might
--   return fewer results than the maximum even when there are more results
--   available. You should check <tt>NextToken</tt> after every operation
--   to ensure that you receive all of the results.
listPolicies_maxResults :: Lens' ListPolicies (Maybe Natural)

-- | Specifies the type of policy that you want to include in the response.
--   You must specify one of the following values:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>AISERVICES_OPT_OUT_POLICY</a></li>
--   <li><a>BACKUP_POLICY</a></li>
--   <li><a>SERVICE_CONTROL_POLICY</a></li>
--   <li><a>TAG_POLICY</a></li>
--   </ul>
listPolicies_filter :: Lens' ListPolicies PolicyType

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newListPoliciesResponse</a> smart constructor.
data ListPoliciesResponse
ListPoliciesResponse' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe [PolicySummary] -> Int -> ListPoliciesResponse

-- | If present, indicates that more output is available than is included
--   in the current response. Use this value in the <tt>NextToken</tt>
--   request parameter in a subsequent call to the operation to get the
--   next part of the output. You should repeat this until the
--   <tt>NextToken</tt> response element comes back as <tt>null</tt>.
[$sel:nextToken:ListPoliciesResponse'] :: ListPoliciesResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | A list of policies that match the filter criteria in the request. The
--   output list doesn't include the policy contents. To see the content
--   for a policy, see DescribePolicy.
[$sel:policies:ListPoliciesResponse'] :: ListPoliciesResponse -> Maybe [PolicySummary]

-- | The response's http status code.
[$sel:httpStatus:ListPoliciesResponse'] :: ListPoliciesResponse -> Int

-- | Create a value of <a>ListPoliciesResponse</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:nextToken:ListPolicies'</a>,
--   <a>listPoliciesResponse_nextToken</a> - If present, indicates that
--   more output is available than is included in the current response. Use
--   this value in the <tt>NextToken</tt> request parameter in a subsequent
--   call to the operation to get the next part of the output. You should
--   repeat this until the <tt>NextToken</tt> response element comes back
--   as <tt>null</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:policies:ListPoliciesResponse'</a>,
--   <a>listPoliciesResponse_policies</a> - A list of policies that match
--   the filter criteria in the request. The output list doesn't include
--   the policy contents. To see the content for a policy, see
--   DescribePolicy.
--   
--   <a>$sel:httpStatus:ListPoliciesResponse'</a>,
--   <a>listPoliciesResponse_httpStatus</a> - The response's http status
--   code.
newListPoliciesResponse :: Int -> ListPoliciesResponse

-- | If present, indicates that more output is available than is included
--   in the current response. Use this value in the <tt>NextToken</tt>
--   request parameter in a subsequent call to the operation to get the
--   next part of the output. You should repeat this until the
--   <tt>NextToken</tt> response element comes back as <tt>null</tt>.
listPoliciesResponse_nextToken :: Lens' ListPoliciesResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | A list of policies that match the filter criteria in the request. The
--   output list doesn't include the policy contents. To see the content
--   for a policy, see DescribePolicy.
listPoliciesResponse_policies :: Lens' ListPoliciesResponse (Maybe [PolicySummary])

-- | The response's http status code.
listPoliciesResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' ListPoliciesResponse Int

-- | Lists the root or organizational units (OUs) that serve as the
--   immediate parent of the specified child OU or account. This operation,
--   along with ListChildren enables you to traverse the tree structure
--   that makes up this root.
--   
--   Always check the <tt>NextToken</tt> response parameter for a
--   <tt>null</tt> value when calling a <tt>List*</tt> operation. These
--   operations can occasionally return an empty set of results even when
--   there are more results available. The <tt>NextToken</tt> response
--   parameter value is <tt>null</tt> <i>only</i> when there are no more
--   results to display.
--   
--   This operation can be called only from the organization's management
--   account or by a member account that is a delegated administrator for
--   an AWS service.
--   
--   In the current release, a child can have only a single parent.
--   
--   This operation returns paginated results.
module Network.AWS.Organizations.ListParents

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newListParents</a> smart constructor.
data ListParents
ListParents' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Natural -> Text -> ListParents

-- | The parameter for receiving additional results if you receive a
--   <tt>NextToken</tt> response in a previous request. A
--   <tt>NextToken</tt> response indicates that more output is available.
--   Set this parameter to the value of the previous call's
--   <tt>NextToken</tt> response to indicate where the output should
--   continue from.
[$sel:nextToken:ListParents'] :: ListParents -> Maybe Text

-- | The total number of results that you want included on each page of the
--   response. If you do not include this parameter, it defaults to a value
--   that is specific to the operation. If additional items exist beyond
--   the maximum you specify, the <tt>NextToken</tt> response element is
--   present and has a value (is not null). Include that value as the
--   <tt>NextToken</tt> request parameter in the next call to the operation
--   to get the next part of the results. Note that Organizations might
--   return fewer results than the maximum even when there are more results
--   available. You should check <tt>NextToken</tt> after every operation
--   to ensure that you receive all of the results.
[$sel:maxResults:ListParents'] :: ListParents -> Maybe Natural

-- | The unique identifier (ID) of the OU or account whose parent
--   containers you want to list. Don't specify a root.
--   
--   The <a>regex pattern</a> for a child ID string requires one of the
--   following:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><b>Account</b> - A string that consists of exactly 12 digits.</li>
--   <li><b>Organizational unit (OU)</b> - A string that begins with "ou-"
--   followed by from 4 to 32 lowercase letters or digits (the ID of the
--   root that contains the OU). This string is followed by a second "-"
--   dash and from 8 to 32 additional lowercase letters or digits.</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:childId:ListParents'] :: ListParents -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>ListParents</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:nextToken:ListParents'</a>, <a>listParents_nextToken</a> - The
--   parameter for receiving additional results if you receive a
--   <tt>NextToken</tt> response in a previous request. A
--   <tt>NextToken</tt> response indicates that more output is available.
--   Set this parameter to the value of the previous call's
--   <tt>NextToken</tt> response to indicate where the output should
--   continue from.
--   
--   <a>$sel:maxResults:ListParents'</a>, <a>listParents_maxResults</a> -
--   The total number of results that you want included on each page of the
--   response. If you do not include this parameter, it defaults to a value
--   that is specific to the operation. If additional items exist beyond
--   the maximum you specify, the <tt>NextToken</tt> response element is
--   present and has a value (is not null). Include that value as the
--   <tt>NextToken</tt> request parameter in the next call to the operation
--   to get the next part of the results. Note that Organizations might
--   return fewer results than the maximum even when there are more results
--   available. You should check <tt>NextToken</tt> after every operation
--   to ensure that you receive all of the results.
--   
--   <a>$sel:childId:ListParents'</a>, <a>listParents_childId</a> - The
--   unique identifier (ID) of the OU or account whose parent containers
--   you want to list. Don't specify a root.
--   
--   The <a>regex pattern</a> for a child ID string requires one of the
--   following:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><b>Account</b> - A string that consists of exactly 12 digits.</li>
--   <li><b>Organizational unit (OU)</b> - A string that begins with "ou-"
--   followed by from 4 to 32 lowercase letters or digits (the ID of the
--   root that contains the OU). This string is followed by a second "-"
--   dash and from 8 to 32 additional lowercase letters or digits.</li>
--   </ul>
newListParents :: Text -> ListParents

-- | The parameter for receiving additional results if you receive a
--   <tt>NextToken</tt> response in a previous request. A
--   <tt>NextToken</tt> response indicates that more output is available.
--   Set this parameter to the value of the previous call's
--   <tt>NextToken</tt> response to indicate where the output should
--   continue from.
listParents_nextToken :: Lens' ListParents (Maybe Text)

-- | The total number of results that you want included on each page of the
--   response. If you do not include this parameter, it defaults to a value
--   that is specific to the operation. If additional items exist beyond
--   the maximum you specify, the <tt>NextToken</tt> response element is
--   present and has a value (is not null). Include that value as the
--   <tt>NextToken</tt> request parameter in the next call to the operation
--   to get the next part of the results. Note that Organizations might
--   return fewer results than the maximum even when there are more results
--   available. You should check <tt>NextToken</tt> after every operation
--   to ensure that you receive all of the results.
listParents_maxResults :: Lens' ListParents (Maybe Natural)

-- | The unique identifier (ID) of the OU or account whose parent
--   containers you want to list. Don't specify a root.
--   
--   The <a>regex pattern</a> for a child ID string requires one of the
--   following:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><b>Account</b> - A string that consists of exactly 12 digits.</li>
--   <li><b>Organizational unit (OU)</b> - A string that begins with "ou-"
--   followed by from 4 to 32 lowercase letters or digits (the ID of the
--   root that contains the OU). This string is followed by a second "-"
--   dash and from 8 to 32 additional lowercase letters or digits.</li>
--   </ul>
listParents_childId :: Lens' ListParents Text

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newListParentsResponse</a> smart constructor.
data ListParentsResponse
ListParentsResponse' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe [Parent] -> Int -> ListParentsResponse

-- | If present, indicates that more output is available than is included
--   in the current response. Use this value in the <tt>NextToken</tt>
--   request parameter in a subsequent call to the operation to get the
--   next part of the output. You should repeat this until the
--   <tt>NextToken</tt> response element comes back as <tt>null</tt>.

-- | A list of parents for the specified child account or OU.
[$sel:parents:ListParentsResponse'] :: ListParentsResponse -> Maybe [Parent]

-- | The response's http status code.
[$sel:httpStatus:ListParentsResponse'] :: ListParentsResponse -> Int

-- | Create a value of <a>ListParentsResponse</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:nextToken:ListParents'</a>,
--   <a>listParentsResponse_nextToken</a> - If present, indicates that more
--   output is available than is included in the current response. Use this
--   value in the <tt>NextToken</tt> request parameter in a subsequent call
--   to the operation to get the next part of the output. You should repeat
--   this until the <tt>NextToken</tt> response element comes back as
--   <tt>null</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:parents:ListParentsResponse'</a>,
--   <a>listParentsResponse_parents</a> - A list of parents for the
--   specified child account or OU.
--   
--   <a>$sel:httpStatus:ListParentsResponse'</a>,
--   <a>listParentsResponse_httpStatus</a> - The response's http status
--   code.
newListParentsResponse :: Int -> ListParentsResponse

-- | If present, indicates that more output is available than is included
--   in the current response. Use this value in the <tt>NextToken</tt>
--   request parameter in a subsequent call to the operation to get the
--   next part of the output. You should repeat this until the
--   <tt>NextToken</tt> response element comes back as <tt>null</tt>.
listParentsResponse_nextToken :: Lens' ListParentsResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | A list of parents for the specified child account or OU.
listParentsResponse_parents :: Lens' ListParentsResponse (Maybe [Parent])

-- | The response's http status code.

-- | Lists the organizational units (OUs) in a parent organizational unit
--   or root.
--   
--   Always check the <tt>NextToken</tt> response parameter for a
--   <tt>null</tt> value when calling a <tt>List*</tt> operation. These
--   operations can occasionally return an empty set of results even when
--   there are more results available. The <tt>NextToken</tt> response
--   parameter value is <tt>null</tt> <i>only</i> when there are no more
--   results to display.
--   
--   This operation can be called only from the organization's management
--   account or by a member account that is a delegated administrator for
--   an AWS service.
--   
--   This operation returns paginated results.
module Network.AWS.Organizations.ListOrganizationalUnitsForParent

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newListOrganizationalUnitsForParent</a> smart
--   constructor.
data ListOrganizationalUnitsForParent
ListOrganizationalUnitsForParent' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Natural -> Text -> ListOrganizationalUnitsForParent

-- | The parameter for receiving additional results if you receive a
--   <tt>NextToken</tt> response in a previous request. A
--   <tt>NextToken</tt> response indicates that more output is available.
--   Set this parameter to the value of the previous call's
--   <tt>NextToken</tt> response to indicate where the output should
--   continue from.
[$sel:nextToken:ListOrganizationalUnitsForParent'] :: ListOrganizationalUnitsForParent -> Maybe Text

-- | The total number of results that you want included on each page of the
--   response. If you do not include this parameter, it defaults to a value
--   that is specific to the operation. If additional items exist beyond
--   the maximum you specify, the <tt>NextToken</tt> response element is
--   present and has a value (is not null). Include that value as the
--   <tt>NextToken</tt> request parameter in the next call to the operation
--   to get the next part of the results. Note that Organizations might
--   return fewer results than the maximum even when there are more results
--   available. You should check <tt>NextToken</tt> after every operation
--   to ensure that you receive all of the results.
[$sel:maxResults:ListOrganizationalUnitsForParent'] :: ListOrganizationalUnitsForParent -> Maybe Natural

-- | The unique identifier (ID) of the root or OU whose child OUs you want
--   to list.
--   
--   The <a>regex pattern</a> for a parent ID string requires one of the
--   following:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><b>Root</b> - A string that begins with "r-" followed by from 4 to
--   32 lowercase letters or digits.</li>
--   <li><b>Organizational unit (OU)</b> - A string that begins with "ou-"
--   followed by from 4 to 32 lowercase letters or digits (the ID of the
--   root that the OU is in). This string is followed by a second "-" dash
--   and from 8 to 32 additional lowercase letters or digits.</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:parentId:ListOrganizationalUnitsForParent'] :: ListOrganizationalUnitsForParent -> Text

-- | Lists the handshakes that are associated with the organization that
--   the requesting user is part of. The
--   <tt>ListHandshakesForOrganization</tt> operation returns a list of
--   handshake structures. Each structure contains details and status about
--   a handshake.
--   
--   Handshakes that are <tt>ACCEPTED</tt>, <tt>DECLINED</tt>, or
--   <tt>CANCELED</tt> appear in the results of this API for only 30 days
--   after changing to that state. After that, they're deleted and no
--   longer accessible.
--   
--   Always check the <tt>NextToken</tt> response parameter for a
--   <tt>null</tt> value when calling a <tt>List*</tt> operation. These
--   operations can occasionally return an empty set of results even when
--   there are more results available. The <tt>NextToken</tt> response
--   parameter value is <tt>null</tt> <i>only</i> when there are no more
--   results to display.
--   
--   This operation can be called only from the organization's management
--   account or by a member account that is a delegated administrator for
--   an AWS service.
--   
--   This operation returns paginated results.
module Network.AWS.Organizations.ListHandshakesForOrganization

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newListHandshakesForOrganization</a> smart constructor.
data ListHandshakesForOrganization
ListHandshakesForOrganization' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe HandshakeFilter -> Maybe Natural -> ListHandshakesForOrganization

-- | The parameter for receiving additional results if you receive a
--   <tt>NextToken</tt> response in a previous request. A
--   <tt>NextToken</tt> response indicates that more output is available.
--   Set this parameter to the value of the previous call's
--   <tt>NextToken</tt> response to indicate where the output should
--   continue from.
[$sel:nextToken:ListHandshakesForOrganization'] :: ListHandshakesForOrganization -> Maybe Text

-- | A filter of the handshakes that you want included in the response. The
--   default is all types. Use the <tt>ActionType</tt> element to limit the
--   output to only a specified type, such as <tt>INVITE</tt>,
--   <tt>ENABLE-ALL-FEATURES</tt>, or <tt>APPROVE-ALL-FEATURES</tt>.
--   Alternatively, for the <tt>ENABLE-ALL-FEATURES</tt> handshake that
--   generates a separate child handshake for each member account, you can
--   specify the <tt>ParentHandshakeId</tt> to see only the handshakes that
--   were generated by that parent request.
[$sel:filter':ListHandshakesForOrganization'] :: ListHandshakesForOrganization -> Maybe HandshakeFilter

-- | The total number of results that you want included on each page of the
--   response. If you do not include this parameter, it defaults to a value
--   that is specific to the operation. If additional items exist beyond
--   the maximum you specify, the <tt>NextToken</tt> response element is
--   present and has a value (is not null). Include that value as the
--   <tt>NextToken</tt> request parameter in the next call to the operation
--   to get the next part of the results. Note that Organizations might
--   return fewer results than the maximum even when there are more results
--   available. You should check <tt>NextToken</tt> after every operation
--   to ensure that you receive all of the results.
[$sel:maxResults:ListHandshakesForOrganization'] :: ListHandshakesForOrganization -> Maybe Natural

-- | Create a value of <a>ListHandshakesForOrganization</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:nextToken:ListHandshakesForOrganization'</a>,
--   <a>listHandshakesForOrganization_nextToken</a> - The parameter for
--   receiving additional results if you receive a <tt>NextToken</tt>
--   response in a previous request. A <tt>NextToken</tt> response
--   indicates that more output is available. Set this parameter to the
--   value of the previous call's <tt>NextToken</tt> response to indicate
--   where the output should continue from.
--   
--   <a>$sel:filter':ListHandshakesForOrganization'</a>,
--   <a>listHandshakesForOrganization_filter</a> - A filter of the
--   handshakes that you want included in the response. The default is all
--   types. Use the <tt>ActionType</tt> element to limit the output to only
--   a specified type, such as <tt>INVITE</tt>,
--   <tt>ENABLE-ALL-FEATURES</tt>, or <tt>APPROVE-ALL-FEATURES</tt>.
--   Alternatively, for the <tt>ENABLE-ALL-FEATURES</tt> handshake that
--   generates a separate child handshake for each member account, you can
--   specify the <tt>ParentHandshakeId</tt> to see only the handshakes that
--   were generated by that parent request.
--   
--   <a>$sel:maxResults:ListHandshakesForOrganization'</a>,
--   <a>listHandshakesForOrganization_maxResults</a> - The total number of
--   results that you want included on each page of the response. If you do
--   not include this parameter, it defaults to a value that is specific to
--   the operation. If additional items exist beyond the maximum you
--   specify, the <tt>NextToken</tt> response element is present and has a
--   value (is not null). Include that value as the <tt>NextToken</tt>
--   request parameter in the next call to the operation to get the next
--   part of the results. Note that Organizations might return fewer
--   results than the maximum even when there are more results available.
--   You should check <tt>NextToken</tt> after every operation to ensure
--   that you receive all of the results.
newListHandshakesForOrganization :: ListHandshakesForOrganization

-- | The parameter for receiving additional results if you receive a
--   <tt>NextToken</tt> response in a previous request. A
--   <tt>NextToken</tt> response indicates that more output is available.
--   Set this parameter to the value of the previous call's
--   <tt>NextToken</tt> response to indicate where the output should
--   continue from.
listHandshakesForOrganization_nextToken :: Lens' ListHandshakesForOrganization (Maybe Text)

-- | A filter of the handshakes that you want included in the response. The
--   default is all types. Use the <tt>ActionType</tt> element to limit the
--   output to only a specified type, such as <tt>INVITE</tt>,
--   <tt>ENABLE-ALL-FEATURES</tt>, or <tt>APPROVE-ALL-FEATURES</tt>.
--   Alternatively, for the <tt>ENABLE-ALL-FEATURES</tt> handshake that
--   generates a separate child handshake for each member account, you can
--   specify the <tt>ParentHandshakeId</tt> to see only the handshakes that
--   were generated by that parent request.
listHandshakesForOrganization_filter :: Lens' ListHandshakesForOrganization (Maybe HandshakeFilter)

-- | The total number of results that you want included on each page of the
--   response. If you do not include this parameter, it defaults to a value
--   that is specific to the operation. If additional items exist beyond
--   the maximum you specify, the <tt>NextToken</tt> response element is
--   present and has a value (is not null). Include that value as the
--   <tt>NextToken</tt> request parameter in the next call to the operation
--   to get the next part of the results. Note that Organizations might
--   return fewer results than the maximum even when there are more results
--   available. You should check <tt>NextToken</tt> after every operation
--   to ensure that you receive all of the results.
listHandshakesForOrganization_maxResults :: Lens' ListHandshakesForOrganization (Maybe Natural)

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newListHandshakesForOrganizationResponse</a> smart
--   constructor.
data ListHandshakesForOrganizationResponse
ListHandshakesForOrganizationResponse' :: Maybe [Handshake] -> Maybe Text -> Int -> ListHandshakesForOrganizationResponse

-- | A list of Handshake objects with details about each of the handshakes
--   that are associated with an organization.
[$sel:handshakes:ListHandshakesForOrganizationResponse'] :: ListHandshakesForOrganizationResponse -> Maybe [Handshake]

-- | If present, indicates that more output is available than is included
--   in the current response. Use this value in the <tt>NextToken</tt>
--   request parameter in a subsequent call to the operation to get the
--   next part of the output. You should repeat this until the
--   <tt>NextToken</tt> response element comes back as <tt>null</tt>.
[$sel:nextToken:ListHandshakesForOrganizationResponse'] :: ListHandshakesForOrganizationResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | The response's http status code.

-- | Lists the current handshakes that are associated with the account of
--   the requesting user.
--   
--   Handshakes that are <tt>ACCEPTED</tt>, <tt>DECLINED</tt>, or
--   <tt>CANCELED</tt> appear in the results of this API for only 30 days
--   after changing to that state. After that, they're deleted and no
--   longer accessible.
--   
--   Always check the <tt>NextToken</tt> response parameter for a
--   <tt>null</tt> value when calling a <tt>List*</tt> operation. These
--   operations can occasionally return an empty set of results even when
--   there are more results available. The <tt>NextToken</tt> response
--   parameter value is <tt>null</tt> <i>only</i> when there are no more
--   results to display.
--   
--   This operation can be called from any account in the organization.
--   
--   This operation returns paginated results.
module Network.AWS.Organizations.ListHandshakesForAccount

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newListHandshakesForAccount</a> smart constructor.
data ListHandshakesForAccount
ListHandshakesForAccount' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe HandshakeFilter -> Maybe Natural -> ListHandshakesForAccount

-- | The parameter for receiving additional results if you receive a
--   <tt>NextToken</tt> response in a previous request. A
--   <tt>NextToken</tt> response indicates that more output is available.
--   Set this parameter to the value of the previous call's
--   <tt>NextToken</tt> response to indicate where the output should
--   continue from.
[$sel:nextToken:ListHandshakesForAccount'] :: ListHandshakesForAccount -> Maybe Text

-- | Filters the handshakes that you want included in the response. The
--   default is all types. Use the <tt>ActionType</tt> element to limit the
--   output to only a specified type, such as <tt>INVITE</tt>,
--   <tt>ENABLE_ALL_FEATURES</tt>, or <tt>APPROVE_ALL_FEATURES</tt>.
--   Alternatively, for the <tt>ENABLE_ALL_FEATURES</tt> handshake that
--   generates a separate child handshake for each member account, you can
--   specify <tt>ParentHandshakeId</tt> to see only the handshakes that
--   were generated by that parent request.
[$sel:filter':ListHandshakesForAccount'] :: ListHandshakesForAccount -> Maybe HandshakeFilter

-- | The total number of results that you want included on each page of the
--   response. If you do not include this parameter, it defaults to a value
--   that is specific to the operation. If additional items exist beyond
--   the maximum you specify, the <tt>NextToken</tt> response element is
--   present and has a value (is not null). Include that value as the
--   <tt>NextToken</tt> request parameter in the next call to the operation
--   to get the next part of the results. Note that Organizations might
--   return fewer results than the maximum even when there are more results
--   available. You should check <tt>NextToken</tt> after every operation
--   to ensure that you receive all of the results.
[$sel:maxResults:ListHandshakesForAccount'] :: ListHandshakesForAccount -> Maybe Natural

-- | Create a value of <a>ListHandshakesForAccount</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--

--   <a>listHandshakesForAccount_nextToken</a> - The parameter for
--   receiving additional results if you receive a <tt>NextToken</tt>
--   response in a previous request. A <tt>NextToken</tt> response
--   indicates that more output is available. Set this parameter to the
--   value of the previous call's <tt>NextToken</tt> response to indicate
--   where the output should continue from.
--   
--   <a>$sel:filter':ListHandshakesForAccount'</a>,
--   <a>listHandshakesForAccount_filter</a> - Filters the handshakes that
--   you want included in the response. The default is all types. Use the
--   <tt>ActionType</tt> element to limit the output to only a specified
--   type, such as <tt>INVITE</tt>, <tt>ENABLE_ALL_FEATURES</tt>, or
--   <tt>APPROVE_ALL_FEATURES</tt>. Alternatively, for the
--   <tt>ENABLE_ALL_FEATURES</tt> handshake that generates a separate child
--   handshake for each member account, you can specify
--   <tt>ParentHandshakeId</tt> to see only the handshakes that were
--   generated by that parent request.
--   
--   <a>$sel:maxResults:ListHandshakesForAccount'</a>,
--   <a>listHandshakesForAccount_maxResults</a> - The total number of
--   results that you want included on each page of the response. If you do
--   not include this parameter, it defaults to a value that is specific to
--   the operation. If additional items exist beyond the maximum you
--   specify, the <tt>NextToken</tt> response element is present and has a
--   value (is not null). Include that value as the <tt>NextToken</tt>
--   request parameter in the next call to the operation to get the next
--   part of the results. Note that Organizations might return fewer
--   results than the maximum even when there are more results available.
--   You should check <tt>NextToken</tt> after every operation to ensure
--   that you receive all of the results.
newListHandshakesForAccount :: ListHandshakesForAccount

--   output to only a specified type, such as <tt>INVITE</tt>,
--   <tt>ENABLE_ALL_FEATURES</tt>, or <tt>APPROVE_ALL_FEATURES</tt>.

-- | List the AWS services for which the specified account is a delegated
--   administrator.
--   
--   This operation can be called only from the organization's management
--   account or by a member account that is a delegated administrator for
--   an AWS service.
--   
--   This operation returns paginated results.

-- | Lists the AWS accounts that are designated as delegated administrators
--   in this organization.
--   
--   This operation can be called only from the organization's management
--   account or by a member account that is a delegated administrator for
--   an AWS service.
--   
--   This operation returns paginated results.
module Network.AWS.Organizations.ListDelegatedAdministrators

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newListDelegatedAdministrators</a> smart constructor.
data ListDelegatedAdministrators
ListDelegatedAdministrators' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Natural -> ListDelegatedAdministrators

-- | Specifies a service principal name. If specified, then the operation
--   lists the delegated administrators only for the specified service.
--   
--   If you don't specify a service principal, the operation lists all
--   delegated administrators for all services in your organization.
[$sel:servicePrincipal:ListDelegatedAdministrators'] :: ListDelegatedAdministrators -> Maybe Text

-- | The parameter for receiving additional results if you receive a
--   <tt>NextToken</tt> response in a previous request. A
--   <tt>NextToken</tt> response indicates that more output is available.
--   Set this parameter to the value of the previous call's
--   <tt>NextToken</tt> response to indicate where the output should
--   continue from.
[$sel:nextToken:ListDelegatedAdministrators'] :: ListDelegatedAdministrators -> Maybe Text

-- | The total number of results that you want included on each page of the

-- | Lists the account creation requests that match the specified status
--   that is currently being tracked for the organization.
--   
--   Always check the <tt>NextToken</tt> response parameter for a
--   <tt>null</tt> value when calling a <tt>List*</tt> operation. These
--   operations can occasionally return an empty set of results even when
--   there are more results available. The <tt>NextToken</tt> response
--   parameter value is <tt>null</tt> <i>only</i> when there are no more
--   results to display.
--   
--   This operation can be called only from the organization's management
--   account or by a member account that is a delegated administrator for
--   an AWS service.
--   
--   This operation returns paginated results.
module Network.AWS.Organizations.ListCreateAccountStatus

-- | Lists all of the organizational units (OUs) or accounts that are
--   contained in the specified parent OU or root. This operation, along
--   with ListParents enables you to traverse the tree structure that makes
--   up this root.
--   
--   Always check the <tt>NextToken</tt> response parameter for a
--   <tt>null</tt> value when calling a <tt>List*</tt> operation. These
--   operations can occasionally return an empty set of results even when
--   there are more results available. The <tt>NextToken</tt> response
--   parameter value is <tt>null</tt> <i>only</i> when there are no more
--   results to display.
--   
--   This operation can be called only from the organization's management
--   account or by a member account that is a delegated administrator for
--   an AWS service.
--   
--   This operation returns paginated results.
module Network.AWS.Organizations.ListChildren

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newListChildren</a> smart constructor.
data ListChildren
ListChildren' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Natural -> Text -> ChildType -> ListChildren

-- | The parameter for receiving additional results if you receive a
--   <tt>NextToken</tt> response in a previous request. A
--   <tt>NextToken</tt> response indicates that more output is available.
--   Set this parameter to the value of the previous call's
--   <tt>NextToken</tt> response to indicate where the output should
--   continue from.
[$sel:nextToken:ListChildren'] :: ListChildren -> Maybe Text

-- | The total number of results that you want included on each page of the
--   response. If you do not include this parameter, it defaults to a value
--   that is specific to the operation. If additional items exist beyond
--   the maximum you specify, the <tt>NextToken</tt> response element is
--   present and has a value (is not null). Include that value as the
--   <tt>NextToken</tt> request parameter in the next call to the operation
--   to get the next part of the results. Note that Organizations might
--   return fewer results than the maximum even when there are more results
--   available. You should check <tt>NextToken</tt> after every operation
--   to ensure that you receive all of the results.
[$sel:maxResults:ListChildren'] :: ListChildren -> Maybe Natural

-- | The unique identifier (ID) for the parent root or OU whose children
--   you want to list.
--   
--   The <a>regex pattern</a> for a parent ID string requires one of the
--   following:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><b>Root</b> - A string that begins with "r-" followed by from 4 to
--   32 lowercase letters or digits.</li>
--   <li><b>Organizational unit (OU)</b> - A string that begins with "ou-"
--   followed by from 4 to 32 lowercase letters or digits (the ID of the
--   root that the OU is in). This string is followed by a second "-" dash
--   and from 8 to 32 additional lowercase letters or digits.</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:parentId:ListChildren'] :: ListChildren -> Text

-- | Filters the output to include only the specified child type.
[$sel:childType:ListChildren'] :: ListChildren -> ChildType

-- | Create a value of <a>ListChildren</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:nextToken:ListChildren'</a>, <a>listChildren_nextToken</a> -
--   The parameter for receiving additional results if you receive a
--   <tt>NextToken</tt> response in a previous request. A
--   <tt>NextToken</tt> response indicates that more output is available.
--   Set this parameter to the value of the previous call's
--   <tt>NextToken</tt> response to indicate where the output should
--   continue from.
--   
--   <a>$sel:maxResults:ListChildren'</a>, <a>listChildren_maxResults</a> -
--   The total number of results that you want included on each page of the
--   response. If you do not include this parameter, it defaults to a value
--   that is specific to the operation. If additional items exist beyond
--   the maximum you specify, the <tt>NextToken</tt> response element is
--   present and has a value (is not null). Include that value as the
--   <tt>NextToken</tt> request parameter in the next call to the operation
--   to get the next part of the results. Note that Organizations might
--   return fewer results than the maximum even when there are more results
--   available. You should check <tt>NextToken</tt> after every operation
--   to ensure that you receive all of the results.
--   
--   <a>$sel:parentId:ListChildren'</a>, <a>listChildren_parentId</a> - The
--   unique identifier (ID) for the parent root or OU whose children you
--   want to list.
--   
--   The <a>regex pattern</a> for a parent ID string requires one of the
--   following:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><b>Root</b> - A string that begins with "r-" followed by from 4 to
--   32 lowercase letters or digits.</li>
--   <li><b>Organizational unit (OU)</b> - A string that begins with "ou-"
--   followed by from 4 to 32 lowercase letters or digits (the ID of the
--   root that the OU is in). This string is followed by a second "-" dash
--   and from 8 to 32 additional lowercase letters or digits.</li>
--   </ul>

--   Filters the output to include only the specified child type.

--   continue from.

-- | The total number of results that you want included on each page of the
--   response. If you do not include this parameter, it defaults to a value
--   that is specific to the operation. If additional items exist beyond
--   the maximum you specify, the <tt>NextToken</tt> response element is
--   present and has a value (is not null). Include that value as the
--   <tt>NextToken</tt> request parameter in the next call to the operation

--   return fewer results than the maximum even when there are more results
--   available. You should check <tt>NextToken</tt> after every operation
--   to ensure that you receive all of the results.
listChildren_maxResults :: Lens' ListChildren (Maybe Natural)

--   following:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><b>Root</b> - A string that begins with "r-" followed by from 4 to
--   32 lowercase letters or digits.</li>
--   <li><b>Organizational unit (OU)</b> - A string that begins with "ou-"
--   followed by from 4 to 32 lowercase letters or digits (the ID of the
--   root that the OU is in). This string is followed by a second "-" dash
--   and from 8 to 32 additional lowercase letters or digits.</li>
--   </ul>
listChildren_parentId :: Lens' ListChildren Text

listChildren_childType :: Lens' ListChildren ChildType

data ListChildrenResponse

--   
--   <a>$sel:nextToken:ListChildren'</a>,
--   <a>listChildrenResponse_nextToken</a> - If present, indicates that

--   this value in the <tt>NextToken</tt> request parameter in a subsequent
--   call to the operation to get the next part of the output. You should
--   repeat this until the <tt>NextToken</tt> response element comes back
--   as <tt>null</tt>.

--   code.

-- | Lists the accounts in an organization that are contained by the
--   specified target root or organizational unit (OU). If you specify the
--   root, you get a list of all the accounts that aren't in any OU. If you
--   specify an OU, you get a list of all the accounts in only that OU and
--   not in any child OUs. To get a list of all accounts in the
--   organization, use the ListAccounts operation.
--   
--   Always check the <tt>NextToken</tt> response parameter for a
--   <tt>null</tt> value when calling a <tt>List*</tt> operation. These
--   operations can occasionally return an empty set of results even when
--   there are more results available. The <tt>NextToken</tt> response
--   parameter value is <tt>null</tt> <i>only</i> when there are no more
--   results to display.
--   
--   This operation can be called only from the organization's management
--   account or by a member account that is a delegated administrator for
--   an AWS service.
--   
--   This operation returns paginated results.
module Network.AWS.Organizations.ListAccountsForParent

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newListAccountsForParent</a> smart constructor.
data ListAccountsForParent
ListAccountsForParent' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Natural -> Text -> ListAccountsForParent

-- | The parameter for receiving additional results if you receive a
--   <tt>NextToken</tt> response in a previous request. A
--   <tt>NextToken</tt> response indicates that more output is available.
--   Set this parameter to the value of the previous call's
--   <tt>NextToken</tt> response to indicate where the output should
--   continue from.
[$sel:nextToken:ListAccountsForParent'] :: ListAccountsForParent -> Maybe Text

-- | The total number of results that you want included on each page of the
--   response. If you do not include this parameter, it defaults to a value
--   that is specific to the operation. If additional items exist beyond
--   the maximum you specify, the <tt>NextToken</tt> response element is
--   present and has a value (is not null). Include that value as the
--   <tt>NextToken</tt> request parameter in the next call to the operation
--   to get the next part of the results. Note that Organizations might
--   return fewer results than the maximum even when there are more results
--   available. You should check <tt>NextToken</tt> after every operation
--   to ensure that you receive all of the results.

--   (OU) whose accounts you want to list.
