-- | Lists all the accounts in the organization. To request only the
--   accounts in a specified root or organizational unit (OU), use the
--   ListAccountsForParent operation instead.
--   
--   Always check the <tt>NextToken</tt> response parameter for a
--   <tt>null</tt> value when calling a <tt>List*</tt> operation. These
--   operations can occasionally return an empty set of results even when
--   there are more results available. The <tt>NextToken</tt> response
--   parameter value is <tt>null</tt> <i>only</i> when there are no more
--   results to display.
--   
--   This operation can be called only from the organization's management
--   account or by a member account that is a delegated administrator for
--   an AWS service.
--   
--   This operation returns paginated results.

-- | Returns a list of the AWS services that you enabled to integrate with
--   your organization. After a service on this list creates the resources
--   that it requires for the integration, it can perform operations on
--   your organization and its accounts.
--   
--   For more information about integrating other services with AWS
--   Organizations, including the list of services that currently work with
--   Organizations, see <a>Integrating AWS Organizations with Other AWS
--   Services</a> in the <i>AWS Organizations User Guide.</i>
--   
--   This operation can be called only from the organization's management
--   account or by a member account that is a delegated administrator for
--   an AWS service.
--   
--   This operation returns paginated results.
module Network.AWS.Organizations.ListAWSServiceAccessForOrganization

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newListAWSServiceAccessForOrganization</a> smart
--   constructor.

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newListAWSServiceAccessForOrganizationResponse</a>
--   smart constructor.
data ListAWSServiceAccessForOrganizationResponse
ListAWSServiceAccessForOrganizationResponse' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe [EnabledServicePrincipal] -> Int -> ListAWSServiceAccessForOrganizationResponse

-- | If present, indicates that more output is available than is included
--   in the current response. Use this value in the <tt>NextToken</tt>
--   request parameter in a subsequent call to the operation to get the
--   next part of the output. You should repeat this until the
--   <tt>NextToken</tt> response element comes back as <tt>null</tt>.
[$sel:nextToken:ListAWSServiceAccessForOrganizationResponse'] :: ListAWSServiceAccessForOrganizationResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | A list of the service principals for the services that are enabled to
--   integrate with your organization. Each principal is a structure that
--   includes the name and the date that it was enabled for integration
--   with AWS Organizations.
[$sel:enabledServicePrincipals:ListAWSServiceAccessForOrganizationResponse'] :: ListAWSServiceAccessForOrganizationResponse -> Maybe [EnabledServicePrincipal]

-- | The response's http status code.
[$sel:httpStatus:ListAWSServiceAccessForOrganizationResponse'] :: ListAWSServiceAccessForOrganizationResponse -> Int

-- | Create a value of <a>ListAWSServiceAccessForOrganizationResponse</a>
--   with all optional fields omitted.

--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:nextToken:ListAWSServiceAccessForOrganization'</a>,
--   <a>listAWSServiceAccessForOrganizationResponse_nextToken</a> - If
--   present, indicates that more output is available than is included in
--   the current response. Use this value in the <tt>NextToken</tt> request
--   parameter in a subsequent call to the operation to get the next part
--   of the output. You should repeat this until the <tt>NextToken</tt>
--   response element comes back as <tt>null</tt>.
--   
--   
--   <a>$sel:enabledServicePrincipals:ListAWSServiceAccessForOrganizationResponse'</a>,
--   <a>listAWSServiceAccessForOrganizationResponse_enabledServicePrincipals</a>
--   - A list of the service principals for the services that are enabled
--   to integrate with your organization. Each principal is a structure
--   that includes the name and the date that it was enabled for
--   integration with AWS Organizations.
--   
--   <a>$sel:httpStatus:ListAWSServiceAccessForOrganizationResponse'</a>,
--   <a>listAWSServiceAccessForOrganizationResponse_httpStatus</a> - The
--   response's http status code.
newListAWSServiceAccessForOrganizationResponse :: Int -> ListAWSServiceAccessForOrganizationResponse

-- | If present, indicates that more output is available than is included
--   in the current response. Use this value in the <tt>NextToken</tt>
--   request parameter in a subsequent call to the operation to get the
--   next part of the output. You should repeat this until the
--   <tt>NextToken</tt> response element comes back as <tt>null</tt>.
listAWSServiceAccessForOrganizationResponse_nextToken :: Lens' ListAWSServiceAccessForOrganizationResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | A list of the service principals for the services that are enabled to
--   integrate with your organization. Each principal is a structure that
--   includes the name and the date that it was enabled for integration
--   with AWS Organizations.
listAWSServiceAccessForOrganizationResponse_enabledServicePrincipals :: Lens' ListAWSServiceAccessForOrganizationResponse (Maybe [EnabledServicePrincipal])

-- | The response's http status code.
listAWSServiceAccessForOrganizationResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' ListAWSServiceAccessForOrganizationResponse Int
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.Organizations.ListAWSServiceAccessForOrganization.ListAWSServiceAccessForOrganization

instance Network.AWS.Data.Query.ToQuery Network.AWS.Organizations.ListAWSServiceAccessForOrganization.ListAWSServiceAccessForOrganization


-- | Removes a member account from its parent organization. This version of
--   the operation is performed by the account that wants to leave. To
--   remove a member account as a user in the management account, use
--   RemoveAccountFromOrganization instead.
--   
--   This operation can be called only from a member account in the
--   organization.
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>The management account in an organization with all features
--   enabled can set service control policies (SCPs) that can restrict what
--   administrators of member accounts can do. This includes preventing
--   them from successfully calling <tt>LeaveOrganization</tt> and leaving
--   the organization.</li>
--   <li>You can leave an organization as a member account only if the
--   account is configured with the information required to operate as a
--   standalone account. When you create an account in an organization
--   using the AWS Organizations console, API, or CLI commands, the
--   information required of standalone accounts is <i>not</i>
--   automatically collected. For each account that you want to make
--   standalone, you must perform the following steps. If any of the steps
--   are already completed for this account, that step doesn't
--   appear.<ul><li>Choose a support plan</li><li>Provide and verify the
--   required contact information</li><li>Provide a current payment
--   method</li></ul>AWS uses the payment method to charge for any billable
--   (not free tier) AWS activity that occurs while the account isn't
--   attached to an organization. Follow the steps at <a>To leave an
--   organization when all required account information has not yet been
--   provided</a> in the <i>AWS Organizations User Guide.</i></li>
--   <li>The account that you want to leave must not be a delegated
--   administrator account for any AWS service enabled for your
--   organization. If the account is a delegated administrator, you must
--   first change the delegated administrator account to another account
--   that is remaining in the organization.</li>
--   <li>You can leave an organization only after you enable IAM user
--   access to billing in your account. For more information, see
--   <a>Activating Access to the Billing and Cost Management Console</a> in
--   the <i>AWS Billing and Cost Management User Guide.</i></li>
--   <li>After the account leaves the organization, all tags that were
--   attached to the account object in the organization are deleted. AWS
--   accounts outside of an organization do not support tags.</li>
--   <li>A newly created account has a waiting period before it can be
--   removed from its organization. If you get an error that indicates that
--   a wait period is required, then try again in a few days.</li>
--   </ul>
module Network.AWS.Organizations.LeaveOrganization

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newLeaveOrganization</a> smart constructor.
data LeaveOrganization
LeaveOrganization' :: LeaveOrganization

-- | Create a value of <a>LeaveOrganization</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
newLeaveOrganization :: LeaveOrganization

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newLeaveOrganizationResponse</a> smart constructor.
data LeaveOrganizationResponse
LeaveOrganizationResponse' :: LeaveOrganizationResponse

-- | Create a value of <a>LeaveOrganizationResponse</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
newLeaveOrganizationResponse :: LeaveOrganizationResponse
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.Organizations.LeaveOrganization.LeaveOrganization
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.Organizations.LeaveOrganization.LeaveOrganization
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.Organizations.LeaveOrganization.LeaveOrganization
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.Organizations.LeaveOrganization.LeaveOrganization
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.Organizations.LeaveOrganization.LeaveOrganizationResponse
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.Organizations.LeaveOrganization.LeaveOrganizationResponse
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.Organizations.LeaveOrganization.LeaveOrganizationResponse
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.Organizations.LeaveOrganization.LeaveOrganizationResponse
instance Network.AWS.Types.AWSRequest Network.AWS.Organizations.LeaveOrganization.LeaveOrganization
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.Organizations.LeaveOrganization.LeaveOrganizationResponse
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.Organizations.LeaveOrganization.LeaveOrganization
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.Organizations.LeaveOrganization.LeaveOrganization
instance Network.AWS.Data.Headers.ToHeaders Network.AWS.Organizations.LeaveOrganization.LeaveOrganization
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.Organizations.LeaveOrganization.LeaveOrganization
instance Network.AWS.Data.Path.ToPath Network.AWS.Organizations.LeaveOrganization.LeaveOrganization
instance Network.AWS.Data.Query.ToQuery Network.AWS.Organizations.LeaveOrganization.LeaveOrganization


-- | Sends an invitation to another account to join your organization as a
--   member account. AWS Organizations sends email on your behalf to the
--   email address that is associated with the other account's owner. The
--   invitation is implemented as a Handshake whose details are in the
--   response.
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>You can invite AWS accounts only from the same seller as the
--   management account. For example, if your organization's management
--   account was created by Amazon Internet Services Pvt. Ltd (AISPL), an
--   AWS seller in India, you can invite only other AISPL accounts to your
--   organization. You can't combine accounts from AISPL and AWS or from
--   any other AWS seller. For more information, see <a>Consolidated
--   Billing in India</a>.</li>
--   <li>If you receive an exception that indicates that you exceeded your
--   account limits for the organization or that the operation failed
--   because your organization is still initializing, wait one hour and
--   then try again. If the error persists after an hour, contact <a>AWS
--   Support</a>.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   If the request includes tags, then the requester must have the
--   <tt>organizations:TagResource</tt> permission.
--   
--   This operation can be called only from the organization's management
--   account.
module Network.AWS.Organizations.InviteAccountToOrganization

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newInviteAccountToOrganization</a> smart constructor.
data InviteAccountToOrganization
InviteAccountToOrganization' :: Maybe (Sensitive Text) -> Maybe [Tag] -> HandshakeParty -> InviteAccountToOrganization

-- | Additional information that you want to include in the generated email
--   to the recipient account owner.
[$sel:notes:InviteAccountToOrganization'] :: InviteAccountToOrganization -> Maybe (Sensitive Text)

-- | A list of tags that you want to attach to the account when it becomes
--   a member of the organization. For each tag in the list, you must
--   specify both a tag key and a value. You can set the value to an empty
--   string, but you can't set it to <tt>null</tt>. For more information
--   about tagging, see <a>Tagging AWS Organizations resources</a> in the
--   AWS Organizations User Guide.
--   
--   Any tags in the request are checked for compliance with any applicable
--   tag policies when the request is made. The request is rejected if the
--   tags in the request don't match the requirements of the policy at that
--   time. Tag policy compliance is <i><b>not</b></i> checked again when
--   the invitation is accepted and the tags are actually attached to the
--   account. That means that if the tag policy changes between the
--   invitation and the acceptance, then that tags could potentially be
--   non-compliant.
--   
--   If any one of the tags is invalid or if you exceed the allowed number
--   of tags for an account, then the entire request fails and invitations
--   are not sent.
[$sel:tags:InviteAccountToOrganization'] :: InviteAccountToOrganization -> Maybe [Tag]

-- | The identifier (ID) of the AWS account that you want to invite to join
--   your organization. This is a JSON object that contains the following
--   elements:
--   
--   <pre>
--   { "Type": "ACCOUNT", "Id": "&lt; account id number &gt;" }
--   </pre>
--   
--   If you use the AWS CLI, you can submit this as a single string,
--   similar to the following example:
--   
--   <pre>
--   --target Id=123456789012,Type=ACCOUNT
--   </pre>
--   
--   If you specify <tt>"Type": "ACCOUNT"</tt>, you must provide the AWS
--   account ID number as the <tt>Id</tt>. If you specify <tt>"Type":
--   "EMAIL"</tt>, you must specify the email address that is associated
--   with the account.
--   
--   <pre>
--   --target Id=diego@example.com,Type=EMAIL
--   </pre>
[$sel:target:InviteAccountToOrganization'] :: InviteAccountToOrganization -> HandshakeParty

-- | Create a value of <a>InviteAccountToOrganization</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:notes:InviteAccountToOrganization'</a>,
--   <a>inviteAccountToOrganization_notes</a> - Additional information that
--   you want to include in the generated email to the recipient account
--   owner.
--   
--   <a>$sel:tags:InviteAccountToOrganization'</a>,
--   <a>inviteAccountToOrganization_tags</a> - A list of tags that you want
--   to attach to the account when it becomes a member of the organization.
--   For each tag in the list, you must specify both a tag key and a value.
--   You can set the value to an empty string, but you can't set it to
--   <tt>null</tt>. For more information about tagging, see <a>Tagging AWS
--   Organizations resources</a> in the AWS Organizations User Guide.
--   
--   Any tags in the request are checked for compliance with any applicable
--   tag policies when the request is made. The request is rejected if the
--   tags in the request don't match the requirements of the policy at that
--   time. Tag policy compliance is <i><b>not</b></i> checked again when
--   the invitation is accepted and the tags are actually attached to the
--   account. That means that if the tag policy changes between the
--   invitation and the acceptance, then that tags could potentially be
--   non-compliant.
--   
--   If any one of the tags is invalid or if you exceed the allowed number
--   of tags for an account, then the entire request fails and invitations
--   are not sent.
--   
--   <a>$sel:target:InviteAccountToOrganization'</a>,
--   <a>inviteAccountToOrganization_target</a> - The identifier (ID) of the
--   AWS account that you want to invite to join your organization. This is
--   a JSON object that contains the following elements:
--   
--   <pre>
--   { "Type": "ACCOUNT", "Id": "&lt; account id number &gt;" }
--   </pre>
--   
--   If you use the AWS CLI, you can submit this as a single string,
--   similar to the following example:
--   
--   <pre>
--   --target Id=123456789012,Type=ACCOUNT
--   </pre>
--   
--   If you specify <tt>"Type": "ACCOUNT"</tt>, you must provide the AWS
--   account ID number as the <tt>Id</tt>. If you specify <tt>"Type":
--   "EMAIL"</tt>, you must specify the email address that is associated
--   with the account.
--   
--   <pre>
--   --target Id=diego@example.com,Type=EMAIL
--   </pre>
newInviteAccountToOrganization :: HandshakeParty -> InviteAccountToOrganization

-- | Additional information that you want to include in the generated email
--   to the recipient account owner.
inviteAccountToOrganization_notes :: Lens' InviteAccountToOrganization (Maybe Text)

-- | A list of tags that you want to attach to the account when it becomes
--   a member of the organization. For each tag in the list, you must
--   specify both a tag key and a value. You can set the value to an empty
--   string, but you can't set it to <tt>null</tt>. For more information
--   about tagging, see <a>Tagging AWS Organizations resources</a> in the
--   AWS Organizations User Guide.
--   
--   Any tags in the request are checked for compliance with any applicable
--   tag policies when the request is made. The request is rejected if the
--   tags in the request don't match the requirements of the policy at that
--   time. Tag policy compliance is <i><b>not</b></i> checked again when
--   the invitation is accepted and the tags are actually attached to the
--   account. That means that if the tag policy changes between the
--   invitation and the acceptance, then that tags could potentially be
--   non-compliant.
--   
--   If any one of the tags is invalid or if you exceed the allowed number
--   of tags for an account, then the entire request fails and invitations
--   are not sent.
inviteAccountToOrganization_tags :: Lens' InviteAccountToOrganization (Maybe [Tag])

-- | The identifier (ID) of the AWS account that you want to invite to join
--   your organization. This is a JSON object that contains the following
--   elements:
--   
--   <pre>
--   { "Type": "ACCOUNT", "Id": "&lt; account id number &gt;" }
--   </pre>
--   
--   If you use the AWS CLI, you can submit this as a single string,
--   similar to the following example:
--   
--   <pre>
--   --target Id=123456789012,Type=ACCOUNT
--   </pre>
--   
--   If you specify <tt>"Type": "ACCOUNT"</tt>, you must provide the AWS
--   account ID number as the <tt>Id</tt>. If you specify <tt>"Type":
--   "EMAIL"</tt>, you must specify the email address that is associated
--   with the account.
--   
--   <pre>
--   --target Id=diego@example.com,Type=EMAIL
--   </pre>
inviteAccountToOrganization_target :: Lens' InviteAccountToOrganization HandshakeParty

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newInviteAccountToOrganizationResponse</a> smart
--   constructor.
data InviteAccountToOrganizationResponse
InviteAccountToOrganizationResponse' :: Maybe Handshake -> Int -> InviteAccountToOrganizationResponse

-- | A structure that contains details about the handshake that is created
--   to support this invitation request.
[$sel:handshake:InviteAccountToOrganizationResponse'] :: InviteAccountToOrganizationResponse -> Maybe Handshake

-- | The response's http status code.
[$sel:httpStatus:InviteAccountToOrganizationResponse'] :: InviteAccountToOrganizationResponse -> Int

-- | Create a value of <a>InviteAccountToOrganizationResponse</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:handshake:InviteAccountToOrganizationResponse'</a>,
--   <a>inviteAccountToOrganizationResponse_handshake</a> - A structure
--   that contains details about the handshake that is created to support
--   this invitation request.
--   
--   <a>$sel:httpStatus:InviteAccountToOrganizationResponse'</a>,
--   <a>inviteAccountToOrganizationResponse_httpStatus</a> - The response's
--   http status code.
newInviteAccountToOrganizationResponse :: Int -> InviteAccountToOrganizationResponse

-- | A structure that contains details about the handshake that is created
--   to support this invitation request.
inviteAccountToOrganizationResponse_handshake :: Lens' InviteAccountToOrganizationResponse (Maybe Handshake)

-- | The response's http status code.
inviteAccountToOrganizationResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' InviteAccountToOrganizationResponse Int

-- | Enables a policy type in a root. After you enable a policy type in a
--   root, you can attach policies of that type to the root, any
--   organizational unit (OU), or account in that root. You can undo this
--   by using the DisablePolicyType operation.
--   
--   This is an asynchronous request that AWS performs in the background.
--   AWS recommends that you first use ListRoots to see the status of
--   policy types for a specified root, and then use this operation.
--   
--   This operation can be called only from the organization's management
--   account.
--   
--   You can enable a policy type in a root only if that policy type is
--   available in the organization. To view the status of available policy
--   types in the organization, use DescribeOrganization.
module Network.AWS.Organizations.EnablePolicyType

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newEnablePolicyType</a> smart constructor.
data EnablePolicyType
EnablePolicyType' :: Text -> PolicyType -> EnablePolicyType

-- | The unique identifier (ID) of the root in which you want to enable a
--   policy type. You can get the ID from the ListRoots operation.
--   
--   The <a>regex pattern</a> for a root ID string requires "r-" followed
--   by from 4 to 32 lowercase letters or digits.
[$sel:rootId:EnablePolicyType'] :: EnablePolicyType -> Text

-- | The policy type that you want to enable. You can specify one of the
--   following values:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>AISERVICES_OPT_OUT_POLICY</a></li>
--   <li><a>BACKUP_POLICY</a></li>
--   <li><a>SERVICE_CONTROL_POLICY</a></li>
--   <li><a>TAG_POLICY</a></li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:policyType:EnablePolicyType'] :: EnablePolicyType -> PolicyType

-- | Create a value of <a>EnablePolicyType</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:rootId:EnablePolicyType'</a>, <a>enablePolicyType_rootId</a> -
--   The unique identifier (ID) of the root in which you want to enable a
--   policy type. You can get the ID from the ListRoots operation.
--   
--   The <a>regex pattern</a> for a root ID string requires "r-" followed
--   by from 4 to 32 lowercase letters or digits.
--   
--   <a>$sel:policyType:EnablePolicyType'</a>,
--   <a>enablePolicyType_policyType</a> - The policy type that you want to
--   enable. You can specify one of the following values:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>AISERVICES_OPT_OUT_POLICY</a></li>
--   <li><a>BACKUP_POLICY</a></li>
--   <li><a>SERVICE_CONTROL_POLICY</a></li>
--   <li><a>TAG_POLICY</a></li>
--   </ul>
newEnablePolicyType :: Text -> PolicyType -> EnablePolicyType

-- | The unique identifier (ID) of the root in which you want to enable a
--   policy type. You can get the ID from the ListRoots operation.
--   
--   The <a>regex pattern</a> for a root ID string requires "r-" followed
--   by from 4 to 32 lowercase letters or digits.
enablePolicyType_rootId :: Lens' EnablePolicyType Text

-- | The policy type that you want to enable. You can specify one of the
--   following values:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>AISERVICES_OPT_OUT_POLICY</a></li>
--   <li><a>BACKUP_POLICY</a></li>
--   <li><a>SERVICE_CONTROL_POLICY</a></li>
--   <li><a>TAG_POLICY</a></li>
--   </ul>
enablePolicyType_policyType :: Lens' EnablePolicyType PolicyType

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newEnablePolicyTypeResponse</a> smart constructor.
data EnablePolicyTypeResponse
EnablePolicyTypeResponse' :: Maybe Root -> Int -> EnablePolicyTypeResponse

-- | A structure that shows the root with the updated list of enabled
--   policy types.
[$sel:root:EnablePolicyTypeResponse'] :: EnablePolicyTypeResponse -> Maybe Root

-- | The response's http status code.
[$sel:httpStatus:EnablePolicyTypeResponse'] :: EnablePolicyTypeResponse -> Int

-- | Create a value of <a>EnablePolicyTypeResponse</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:root:EnablePolicyTypeResponse'</a>,
--   <a>enablePolicyTypeResponse_root</a> - A structure that shows the root
--   with the updated list of enabled policy types.
--   
--   <a>$sel:httpStatus:EnablePolicyTypeResponse'</a>,
--   <a>enablePolicyTypeResponse_httpStatus</a> - The response's http
--   status code.
newEnablePolicyTypeResponse :: Int -> EnablePolicyTypeResponse

-- | A structure that shows the root with the updated list of enabled
--   policy types.
enablePolicyTypeResponse_root :: Lens' EnablePolicyTypeResponse (Maybe Root)

-- | The response's http status code.
enablePolicyTypeResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' EnablePolicyTypeResponse Int
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.Organizations.EnablePolicyType.EnablePolicyType
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.Organizations.EnablePolicyType.EnablePolicyType
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.Organizations.EnablePolicyType.EnablePolicyType
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.Organizations.EnablePolicyType.EnablePolicyType
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.Organizations.EnablePolicyType.EnablePolicyTypeResponse

instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.Organizations.EnablePolicyType.EnablePolicyTypeResponse

instance Network.AWS.Data.Headers.ToHeaders Network.AWS.Organizations.EnablePolicyType.EnablePolicyType
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.Organizations.EnablePolicyType.EnablePolicyType
instance Network.AWS.Data.Path.ToPath Network.AWS.Organizations.EnablePolicyType.EnablePolicyType
instance Network.AWS.Data.Query.ToQuery Network.AWS.Organizations.EnablePolicyType.EnablePolicyType


-- | Enables all features in an organization. This enables the use of
--   organization policies that can restrict the services and actions that
--   can be called in each account. Until you enable all features, you have
--   access only to consolidated billing, and you can't use any of the
--   advanced account administration features that AWS Organizations
--   supports. For more information, see <a>Enabling All Features in Your
--   Organization</a> in the <i>AWS Organizations User Guide.</i>
--   
--   This operation is required only for organizations that were created
--   explicitly with only the consolidated billing features enabled.
--   Calling this operation sends a handshake to every invited account in
--   the organization. The feature set change can be finalized and the
--   additional features enabled only after all administrators in the
--   invited accounts approve the change by accepting the handshake.
--   
--   After you enable all features, you can separately enable or disable
--   individual policy types in a root using EnablePolicyType and
--   DisablePolicyType. To see the status of policy types in a root, use
--   ListRoots.
--   
--   After all invited member accounts accept the handshake, you finalize
--   the feature set change by accepting the handshake that contains
--   <tt>"Action": "ENABLE_ALL_FEATURES"</tt>. This completes the change.
--   
--   After you enable all features in your organization, the management
--   account in the organization can apply policies on all member accounts.
--   These policies can restrict what users and even administrators in
--   those accounts can do. The management account can apply policies that
--   prevent accounts from leaving the organization. Ensure that your
--   account administrators are aware of this.
--   
--   This operation can be called only from the organization's management
--   account.
module Network.AWS.Organizations.EnableAllFeatures

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newEnableAllFeatures</a> smart constructor.
data EnableAllFeatures
EnableAllFeatures' :: EnableAllFeatures

-- | Create a value of <a>EnableAllFeatures</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
newEnableAllFeatures :: EnableAllFeatures

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newEnableAllFeaturesResponse</a> smart constructor.
data EnableAllFeaturesResponse
EnableAllFeaturesResponse' :: Maybe Handshake -> Int -> EnableAllFeaturesResponse

-- | A structure that contains details about the handshake created to
--   support this request to enable all features in the organization.
[$sel:handshake:EnableAllFeaturesResponse'] :: EnableAllFeaturesResponse -> Maybe Handshake

-- | The response's http status code.
[$sel:httpStatus:EnableAllFeaturesResponse'] :: EnableAllFeaturesResponse -> Int

-- | Create a value of <a>EnableAllFeaturesResponse</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:handshake:EnableAllFeaturesResponse'</a>,
--   <a>enableAllFeaturesResponse_handshake</a> - A structure that contains
--   details about the handshake created to support this request to enable
--   all features in the organization.
--   
--   <a>$sel:httpStatus:EnableAllFeaturesResponse'</a>,
--   <a>enableAllFeaturesResponse_httpStatus</a> - The response's http
--   status code.
newEnableAllFeaturesResponse :: Int -> EnableAllFeaturesResponse

-- | A structure that contains details about the handshake created to
--   support this request to enable all features in the organization.
enableAllFeaturesResponse_handshake :: Lens' EnableAllFeaturesResponse (Maybe Handshake)

-- | The response's http status code.
enableAllFeaturesResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' EnableAllFeaturesResponse Int
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.Organizations.EnableAllFeatures.EnableAllFeatures
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.Organizations.EnableAllFeatures.EnableAllFeatures
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.Organizations.EnableAllFeatures.EnableAllFeatures
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.Organizations.EnableAllFeatures.EnableAllFeatures
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.Organizations.EnableAllFeatures.EnableAllFeaturesResponse
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.Organizations.EnableAllFeatures.EnableAllFeaturesResponse
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.Organizations.EnableAllFeatures.EnableAllFeaturesResponse
instance Network.AWS.Types.AWSRequest Network.AWS.Organizations.EnableAllFeatures.EnableAllFeatures
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.Organizations.EnableAllFeatures.EnableAllFeaturesResponse
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.Organizations.EnableAllFeatures.EnableAllFeatures
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.Organizations.EnableAllFeatures.EnableAllFeatures
instance Network.AWS.Data.Headers.ToHeaders Network.AWS.Organizations.EnableAllFeatures.EnableAllFeatures
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.Organizations.EnableAllFeatures.EnableAllFeatures
instance Network.AWS.Data.Path.ToPath Network.AWS.Organizations.EnableAllFeatures.EnableAllFeatures
instance Network.AWS.Data.Query.ToQuery Network.AWS.Organizations.EnableAllFeatures.EnableAllFeatures


-- | Enables the integration of an AWS service (the service that is
--   specified by <tt>ServicePrincipal</tt>) with AWS Organizations. When
--   you enable integration, you allow the specified service to create a
--   <a>service-linked role</a> in all the accounts in your organization.
--   This allows the service to perform operations on your behalf in your
--   organization and its accounts.
--   
--   We recommend that you enable integration between AWS Organizations and
--   the specified AWS service by using the console or commands that are
--   provided by the specified service. Doing so ensures that the service
--   is aware that it can create the resources that are required for the
--   integration. How the service creates those resources in the
--   organization's accounts depends on that service. For more information,
--   see the documentation for the other AWS service.
--   
--   For more information about enabling services to integrate with AWS
--   Organizations, see <a>Integrating AWS Organizations with Other AWS
--   Services</a> in the <i>AWS Organizations User Guide.</i>
--   
--   This operation can be called only from the organization's management
--   account and only if the organization has <a>enabled all features</a>.
module Network.AWS.Organizations.EnableAWSServiceAccess

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newEnableAWSServiceAccess</a> smart constructor.
data EnableAWSServiceAccess
EnableAWSServiceAccess' :: Text -> EnableAWSServiceAccess

-- | The service principal name of the AWS service for which you want to
--   enable integration with your organization. This is typically in the
--   form of a URL, such as <tt> service-abbreviation.amazonaws.com</tt>.
[$sel:servicePrincipal:EnableAWSServiceAccess'] :: EnableAWSServiceAccess -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>EnableAWSServiceAccess</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:servicePrincipal:EnableAWSServiceAccess'</a>,
--   <a>enableAWSServiceAccess_servicePrincipal</a> - The service principal
--   name of the AWS service for which you want to enable integration with
--   your organization. This is typically in the form of a URL, such as
--   <tt> service-abbreviation.amazonaws.com</tt>.
newEnableAWSServiceAccess :: Text -> EnableAWSServiceAccess

-- | The service principal name of the AWS service for which you want to
--   enable integration with your organization. This is typically in the
--   form of a URL, such as <tt> service-abbreviation.amazonaws.com</tt>.
enableAWSServiceAccess_servicePrincipal :: Lens' EnableAWSServiceAccess Text

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newEnableAWSServiceAccessResponse</a> smart
--   constructor.
data EnableAWSServiceAccessResponse
EnableAWSServiceAccessResponse' :: EnableAWSServiceAccessResponse

-- | Create a value of <a>EnableAWSServiceAccessResponse</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
newEnableAWSServiceAccessResponse :: EnableAWSServiceAccessResponse

instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.Organizations.EnableAWSServiceAccess.EnableAWSServiceAccess
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.Organizations.EnableAWSServiceAccess.EnableAWSServiceAccess

instance Network.AWS.Data.Path.ToPath Network.AWS.Organizations.EnableAWSServiceAccess.EnableAWSServiceAccess
instance Network.AWS.Data.Query.ToQuery Network.AWS.Organizations.EnableAWSServiceAccess.EnableAWSServiceAccess


-- | Disables an organizational policy type in a root. A policy of a
--   certain type can be attached to entities in a root only if that type
--   is enabled in the root. After you perform this operation, you no
--   longer can attach policies of the specified type to that root or to
--   any organizational unit (OU) or account in that root. You can undo
--   this by using the EnablePolicyType operation.
--   
--   This is an asynchronous request that AWS performs in the background.
--   If you disable a policy type for a root, it still appears enabled for
--   the organization if <a>all features</a> are enabled for the
--   organization. AWS recommends that you first use ListRoots to see the
--   status of policy types for a specified root, and then use this
--   operation.
--   
--   This operation can be called only from the organization's management
--   account.
--   
--   To view the status of available policy types in the organization, use
--   DescribeOrganization.
module Network.AWS.Organizations.DisablePolicyType

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newDisablePolicyType</a> smart constructor.
data DisablePolicyType
DisablePolicyType' :: Text -> PolicyType -> DisablePolicyType

-- | The unique identifier (ID) of the root in which you want to disable a
--   policy type. You can get the ID from the ListRoots operation.
--   
--   The <a>regex pattern</a> for a root ID string requires "r-" followed
--   by from 4 to 32 lowercase letters or digits.
[$sel:rootId:DisablePolicyType'] :: DisablePolicyType -> Text

-- | The policy type that you want to disable in this root. You can specify
--   one of the following values:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>AISERVICES_OPT_OUT_POLICY</a></li>
--   <li><a>BACKUP_POLICY</a></li>
--   <li><a>SERVICE_CONTROL_POLICY</a></li>
--   <li><a>TAG_POLICY</a></li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:policyType:DisablePolicyType'] :: DisablePolicyType -> PolicyType

-- | Create a value of <a>DisablePolicyType</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:rootId:DisablePolicyType'</a>, <a>disablePolicyType_rootId</a>
--   - The unique identifier (ID) of the root in which you want to disable
--   a policy type. You can get the ID from the ListRoots operation.
--   
--   The <a>regex pattern</a> for a root ID string requires "r-" followed
--   by from 4 to 32 lowercase letters or digits.
--   
--   <a>$sel:policyType:DisablePolicyType'</a>,
--   <a>disablePolicyType_policyType</a> - The policy type that you want to
--   disable in this root. You can specify one of the following values:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>AISERVICES_OPT_OUT_POLICY</a></li>
--   <li><a>BACKUP_POLICY</a></li>
--   <li><a>SERVICE_CONTROL_POLICY</a></li>
--   <li><a>TAG_POLICY</a></li>
--   </ul>
newDisablePolicyType :: Text -> PolicyType -> DisablePolicyType

-- | The unique identifier (ID) of the root in which you want to disable a
--   policy type. You can get the ID from the ListRoots operation.
--   
--   The <a>regex pattern</a> for a root ID string requires "r-" followed
--   by from 4 to 32 lowercase letters or digits.
disablePolicyType_rootId :: Lens' DisablePolicyType Text

-- | The policy type that you want to disable in this root. You can specify
--   one of the following values:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>AISERVICES_OPT_OUT_POLICY</a></li>
--   <li><a>BACKUP_POLICY</a></li>
--   <li><a>SERVICE_CONTROL_POLICY</a></li>
--   <li><a>TAG_POLICY</a></li>
--   </ul>
disablePolicyType_policyType :: Lens' DisablePolicyType PolicyType

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newDisablePolicyTypeResponse</a> smart constructor.
data DisablePolicyTypeResponse
DisablePolicyTypeResponse' :: Maybe Root -> Int -> DisablePolicyTypeResponse

-- | A structure that shows the root with the updated list of enabled
--   policy types.
[$sel:root:DisablePolicyTypeResponse'] :: DisablePolicyTypeResponse -> Maybe Root

-- | The response's http status code.
[$sel:httpStatus:DisablePolicyTypeResponse'] :: DisablePolicyTypeResponse -> Int

-- | Create a value of <a>DisablePolicyTypeResponse</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:root:DisablePolicyTypeResponse'</a>,
--   <a>disablePolicyTypeResponse_root</a> - A structure that shows the
--   root with the updated list of enabled policy types.
--   
--   <a>$sel:httpStatus:DisablePolicyTypeResponse'</a>,
--   <a>disablePolicyTypeResponse_httpStatus</a> - The response's http
--   status code.
newDisablePolicyTypeResponse :: Int -> DisablePolicyTypeResponse

-- | A structure that shows the root with the updated list of enabled
--   policy types.
disablePolicyTypeResponse_root :: Lens' DisablePolicyTypeResponse (Maybe Root)

-- | The response's http status code.
disablePolicyTypeResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' DisablePolicyTypeResponse Int

instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.Organizations.DisablePolicyType.DisablePolicyType
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.Organizations.DisablePolicyType.DisablePolicyType
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.Organizations.DisablePolicyType.DisablePolicyType
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.Organizations.DisablePolicyType.DisablePolicyTypeResponse

instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.Organizations.DisablePolicyType.DisablePolicyTypeResponse
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.Organizations.DisablePolicyType.DisablePolicyTypeResponse
instance Network.AWS.Types.AWSRequest Network.AWS.Organizations.DisablePolicyType.DisablePolicyType
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.Organizations.DisablePolicyType.DisablePolicyTypeResponse
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.Organizations.DisablePolicyType.DisablePolicyType
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.Organizations.DisablePolicyType.DisablePolicyType
instance Network.AWS.Data.Headers.ToHeaders Network.AWS.Organizations.DisablePolicyType.DisablePolicyType
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.Organizations.DisablePolicyType.DisablePolicyType
instance Network.AWS.Data.Path.ToPath Network.AWS.Organizations.DisablePolicyType.DisablePolicyType
instance Network.AWS.Data.Query.ToQuery Network.AWS.Organizations.DisablePolicyType.DisablePolicyType


-- | Disables the integration of an AWS service (the service that is
--   specified by <tt>ServicePrincipal</tt>) with AWS Organizations. When
--   you disable integration, the specified service no longer can create a
--   <a>service-linked role</a> in <i>new</i> accounts in your
--   organization. This means the service can't perform operations on your
--   behalf on any new accounts in your organization. The service can still
--   perform operations in older accounts until the service completes its
--   clean-up from AWS Organizations.
--   
--   We <b><i>strongly recommend</i></b> that you don't use this command to
--   disable integration between AWS Organizations and the specified AWS
--   service. Instead, use the console or commands that are provided by the
--   specified service. This lets the trusted service perform any required
--   initialization when enabling trusted access, such as creating any
--   required resources and any required clean up of resources when
--   disabling trusted access.
--   
--   For information about how to disable trusted service access to your
--   organization using the trusted service, see the <b>Learn more</b> link
--   under the <b>Supports Trusted Access</b> column at <a>AWS services
--   that you can use with AWS Organizations</a>. on this page.
--   
--   If you disable access by using this command, it causes the following
--   actions to occur:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>The service can no longer create a service-linked role in the
--   accounts in your organization. This means that the service can't
--   perform operations on your behalf on any new accounts in your
--   organization. The service can still perform operations in older
--   accounts until the service completes its clean-up from AWS
--   Organizations.</li>
--   <li>The service can no longer perform tasks in the member accounts in
--   the organization, unless those operations are explicitly permitted by
--   the IAM policies that are attached to your roles. This includes any
--   data aggregation from the member accounts to the management account,
--   or to a delegated administrator account, where relevant.</li>
--   <li>Some services detect this and clean up any remaining data or
--   resources related to the integration, while other services stop
--   accessing the organization but leave any historical data and
--   configuration in place to support a possible re-enabling of the
--   integration.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   Using the other service's console or commands to disable the
--   integration ensures that the other service is aware that it can clean
--   up any resources that are required only for the integration. How the
--   service cleans up its resources in the organization's accounts depends
--   on that service. For more information, see the documentation for the
--   other AWS service.
--   
--   After you perform the <tt>DisableAWSServiceAccess</tt> operation, the
--   specified service can no longer perform operations in your
--   organization's accounts
--   
--   For more information about integrating other services with AWS
--   Organizations, including the list of services that work with
--   Organizations, see <a>Integrating AWS Organizations with Other AWS
--   Services</a> in the <i>AWS Organizations User Guide.</i>
--   
--   This operation can be called only from the organization's management
--   account.
module Network.AWS.Organizations.DisableAWSServiceAccess

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newDisableAWSServiceAccess</a> smart constructor.
data DisableAWSServiceAccess
DisableAWSServiceAccess' :: Text -> DisableAWSServiceAccess

-- | The service principal name of the AWS service for which you want to
--   disable integration with your organization. This is typically in the
--   form of a URL, such as <tt> service-abbreviation.amazonaws.com</tt>.
[$sel:servicePrincipal:DisableAWSServiceAccess'] :: DisableAWSServiceAccess -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>DisableAWSServiceAccess</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:servicePrincipal:DisableAWSServiceAccess'</a>,
--   <a>disableAWSServiceAccess_servicePrincipal</a> - The service
--   principal name of the AWS service for which you want to disable
--   integration with your organization. This is typically in the form of a
--   URL, such as <tt> service-abbreviation.amazonaws.com</tt>.
newDisableAWSServiceAccess :: Text -> DisableAWSServiceAccess

-- | The service principal name of the AWS service for which you want to
--   disable integration with your organization. This is typically in the
--   form of a URL, such as <tt> service-abbreviation.amazonaws.com</tt>.
disableAWSServiceAccess_servicePrincipal :: Lens' DisableAWSServiceAccess Text

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newDisableAWSServiceAccessResponse</a> smart
--   constructor.
data DisableAWSServiceAccessResponse
DisableAWSServiceAccessResponse' :: DisableAWSServiceAccessResponse

-- | Create a value of <a>DisableAWSServiceAccessResponse</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
newDisableAWSServiceAccessResponse :: DisableAWSServiceAccessResponse
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.Organizations.DisableAWSServiceAccess.DisableAWSServiceAccess
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.Organizations.DisableAWSServiceAccess.DisableAWSServiceAccess
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.Organizations.DisableAWSServiceAccess.DisableAWSServiceAccess
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.Organizations.DisableAWSServiceAccess.DisableAWSServiceAccess

instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.Organizations.DisableAWSServiceAccess.DisableAWSServiceAccessResponse
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.Organizations.DisableAWSServiceAccess.DisableAWSServiceAccessResponse
instance Network.AWS.Types.AWSRequest Network.AWS.Organizations.DisableAWSServiceAccess.DisableAWSServiceAccess
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.Organizations.DisableAWSServiceAccess.DisableAWSServiceAccessResponse
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.Organizations.DisableAWSServiceAccess.DisableAWSServiceAccess
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.Organizations.DisableAWSServiceAccess.DisableAWSServiceAccess
instance Network.AWS.Data.Headers.ToHeaders Network.AWS.Organizations.DisableAWSServiceAccess.DisableAWSServiceAccess
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.Organizations.DisableAWSServiceAccess.DisableAWSServiceAccess
instance Network.AWS.Data.Path.ToPath Network.AWS.Organizations.DisableAWSServiceAccess.DisableAWSServiceAccess
instance Network.AWS.Data.Query.ToQuery Network.AWS.Organizations.DisableAWSServiceAccess.DisableAWSServiceAccess


-- | Detaches a policy from a target root, organizational unit (OU), or
--   account.
--   
--   If the policy being detached is a service control policy (SCP), the
--   changes to permissions for AWS Identity and Access Management (IAM)
--   users and roles in affected accounts are immediate.
--   
--   Every root, OU, and account must have at least one SCP attached. If
--   you want to replace the default <tt>FullAWSAccess</tt> policy with an
--   SCP that limits the permissions that can be delegated, you must attach
--   the replacement SCP before you can remove the default SCP. This is the
--   authorization strategy of an "<a>allow list</a>". If you instead
--   attach a second SCP and leave the <tt>FullAWSAccess</tt> SCP still
--   attached, and specify <tt>"Effect": "Deny"</tt> in the second SCP to
--   override the <tt>"Effect": "Allow"</tt> in the <tt>FullAWSAccess</tt>
--   policy (or any other attached SCP), you're using the authorization
--   strategy of a "<a>deny list</a>".
--   
--   This operation can be called only from the organization's management
--   account.
module Network.AWS.Organizations.DetachPolicy

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newDetachPolicy</a> smart constructor.
data DetachPolicy
DetachPolicy' :: Text -> Text -> DetachPolicy

-- | The unique identifier (ID) of the policy you want to detach. You can
--   get the ID from the ListPolicies or ListPoliciesForTarget operations.
--   
--   The <a>regex pattern</a> for a policy ID string requires "p-" followed
--   by from 8 to 128 lowercase or uppercase letters, digits, or the
--   underscore character (_).
[$sel:policyId:DetachPolicy'] :: DetachPolicy -> Text

-- | The unique identifier (ID) of the root, OU, or account that you want
--   to detach the policy from. You can get the ID from the ListRoots,
--   ListOrganizationalUnitsForParent, or ListAccounts operations.
--   
--   The <a>regex pattern</a> for a target ID string requires one of the
--   following:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><b>Root</b> - A string that begins with "r-" followed by from 4 to
--   32 lowercase letters or digits.</li>
--   <li><b>Account</b> - A string that consists of exactly 12 digits.</li>
--   <li><b>Organizational unit (OU)</b> - A string that begins with "ou-"
--   followed by from 4 to 32 lowercase letters or digits (the ID of the
--   root that the OU is in). This string is followed by a second "-" dash
--   and from 8 to 32 additional lowercase letters or digits.</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:targetId:DetachPolicy'] :: DetachPolicy -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>DetachPolicy</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:policyId:DetachPolicy'</a>, <a>detachPolicy_policyId</a> - The
--   unique identifier (ID) of the policy you want to detach. You can get
--   the ID from the ListPolicies or ListPoliciesForTarget operations.
--   
--   The <a>regex pattern</a> for a policy ID string requires "p-" followed
--   by from 8 to 128 lowercase or uppercase letters, digits, or the
--   underscore character (_).
--   
--   <a>$sel:targetId:DetachPolicy'</a>, <a>detachPolicy_targetId</a> - The
--   unique identifier (ID) of the root, OU, or account that you want to
--   detach the policy from. You can get the ID from the ListRoots,
--   ListOrganizationalUnitsForParent, or ListAccounts operations.
--   
--   The <a>regex pattern</a> for a target ID string requires one of the
--   following:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><b>Root</b> - A string that begins with "r-" followed by from 4 to
--   32 lowercase letters or digits.</li>
--   <li><b>Account</b> - A string that consists of exactly 12 digits.</li>
--   <li><b>Organizational unit (OU)</b> - A string that begins with "ou-"
--   followed by from 4 to 32 lowercase letters or digits (the ID of the
--   root that the OU is in). This string is followed by a second "-" dash
--   and from 8 to 32 additional lowercase letters or digits.</li>
--   </ul>
newDetachPolicy :: Text -> Text -> DetachPolicy

-- | The unique identifier (ID) of the policy you want to detach. You can
--   get the ID from the ListPolicies or ListPoliciesForTarget operations.
--   
--   The <a>regex pattern</a> for a policy ID string requires "p-" followed
--   by from 8 to 128 lowercase or uppercase letters, digits, or the
--   underscore character (_).
detachPolicy_policyId :: Lens' DetachPolicy Text

-- | The unique identifier (ID) of the root, OU, or account that you want
--   to detach the policy from. You can get the ID from the ListRoots,
--   ListOrganizationalUnitsForParent, or ListAccounts operations.
--   
--   The <a>regex pattern</a> for a target ID string requires one of the
--   following:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><b>Root</b> - A string that begins with "r-" followed by from 4 to
--   32 lowercase letters or digits.</li>
--   <li><b>Account</b> - A string that consists of exactly 12 digits.</li>
--   <li><b>Organizational unit (OU)</b> - A string that begins with "ou-"
--   followed by from 4 to 32 lowercase letters or digits (the ID of the
--   root that the OU is in). This string is followed by a second "-" dash
--   and from 8 to 32 additional lowercase letters or digits.</li>
--   </ul>
detachPolicy_targetId :: Lens' DetachPolicy Text

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newDetachPolicyResponse</a> smart constructor.
data DetachPolicyResponse
DetachPolicyResponse' :: DetachPolicyResponse

-- | Create a value of <a>DetachPolicyResponse</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
newDetachPolicyResponse :: DetachPolicyResponse
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.Organizations.DetachPolicy.DetachPolicy
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.Organizations.DetachPolicy.DetachPolicy
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.Organizations.DetachPolicy.DetachPolicy
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.Organizations.DetachPolicy.DetachPolicy
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.Organizations.DetachPolicy.DetachPolicyResponse
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.Organizations.DetachPolicy.DetachPolicyResponse
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.Organizations.DetachPolicy.DetachPolicyResponse
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.Organizations.DetachPolicy.DetachPolicyResponse
instance Network.AWS.Types.AWSRequest Network.AWS.Organizations.DetachPolicy.DetachPolicy
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.Organizations.DetachPolicy.DetachPolicyResponse
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.Organizations.DetachPolicy.DetachPolicy
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.Organizations.DetachPolicy.DetachPolicy
instance Network.AWS.Data.Headers.ToHeaders Network.AWS.Organizations.DetachPolicy.DetachPolicy
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.Organizations.DetachPolicy.DetachPolicy
instance Network.AWS.Data.Path.ToPath Network.AWS.Organizations.DetachPolicy.DetachPolicy
instance Network.AWS.Data.Query.ToQuery Network.AWS.Organizations.DetachPolicy.DetachPolicy


-- | Retrieves information about a policy.
--   
--   This operation can be called only from the organization's management
--   account or by a member account that is a delegated administrator for
--   an AWS service.
module Network.AWS.Organizations.DescribePolicy

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newDescribePolicy</a> smart constructor.
data DescribePolicy
DescribePolicy' :: Text -> DescribePolicy

-- | The unique identifier (ID) of the policy that you want details about.
--   You can get the ID from the ListPolicies or ListPoliciesForTarget
--   operations.
--   
--   The <a>regex pattern</a> for a policy ID string requires "p-" followed
--   by from 8 to 128 lowercase or uppercase letters, digits, or the
--   underscore character (_).
[$sel:policyId:DescribePolicy'] :: DescribePolicy -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>DescribePolicy</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:policyId:DescribePolicy'</a>, <a>describePolicy_policyId</a> -
--   The unique identifier (ID) of the policy that you want details about.
--   You can get the ID from the ListPolicies or ListPoliciesForTarget
--   operations.
--   
--   The <a>regex pattern</a> for a policy ID string requires "p-" followed
--   by from 8 to 128 lowercase or uppercase letters, digits, or the
--   underscore character (_).
newDescribePolicy :: Text -> DescribePolicy

-- | The unique identifier (ID) of the policy that you want details about.
--   You can get the ID from the ListPolicies or ListPoliciesForTarget
--   operations.
--   
--   The <a>regex pattern</a> for a policy ID string requires "p-" followed
--   by from 8 to 128 lowercase or uppercase letters, digits, or the
--   underscore character (_).
describePolicy_policyId :: Lens' DescribePolicy Text

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newDescribePolicyResponse</a> smart constructor.
data DescribePolicyResponse
DescribePolicyResponse' :: Maybe Policy -> Int -> DescribePolicyResponse

-- | A structure that contains details about the specified policy.
[$sel:policy:DescribePolicyResponse'] :: DescribePolicyResponse -> Maybe Policy

-- | The response's http status code.
[$sel:httpStatus:DescribePolicyResponse'] :: DescribePolicyResponse -> Int

-- | Create a value of <a>DescribePolicyResponse</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:policy:DescribePolicyResponse'</a>,

--   details about the specified policy.
--   
--   <a>$sel:httpStatus:DescribePolicyResponse'</a>,
--   <a>describePolicyResponse_httpStatus</a> - The response's http status
--   code.

describePolicyResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' DescribePolicyResponse Int

-- | Retrieves information about an organizational unit (OU).
--   
--   This operation can be called only from the organization's management
--   account or by a member account that is a delegated administrator for
--   an AWS service.
module Network.AWS.Organizations.DescribeOrganizationalUnit

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newDescribeOrganizationalUnit</a> smart constructor.
data DescribeOrganizationalUnit
DescribeOrganizationalUnit' :: Text -> DescribeOrganizationalUnit

-- | The unique identifier (ID) of the organizational unit that you want
--   details about. You can get the ID from the
--   ListOrganizationalUnitsForParent operation.
--   
--   The <a>regex pattern</a> for an organizational unit ID string requires
--   "ou-" followed by from 4 to 32 lowercase letters or digits (the ID of
--   the root that contains the OU). This string is followed by a second
--   "-" dash and from 8 to 32 additional lowercase letters or digits.
[$sel:organizationalUnitId:DescribeOrganizationalUnit'] :: DescribeOrganizationalUnit -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>DescribeOrganizationalUnit</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:organizationalUnitId:DescribeOrganizationalUnit'</a>,
--   <a>describeOrganizationalUnit_organizationalUnitId</a> - The unique
--   identifier (ID) of the organizational unit that you want details
--   about. You can get the ID from the ListOrganizationalUnitsForParent
--   operation.
--   
--   The <a>regex pattern</a> for an organizational unit ID string requires
--   "ou-" followed by from 4 to 32 lowercase letters or digits (the ID of
--   the root that contains the OU). This string is followed by a second
--   "-" dash and from 8 to 32 additional lowercase letters or digits.
newDescribeOrganizationalUnit :: Text -> DescribeOrganizationalUnit

-- | The unique identifier (ID) of the organizational unit that you want
--   details about. You can get the ID from the
--   ListOrganizationalUnitsForParent operation.
--   
--   The <a>regex pattern</a> for an organizational unit ID string requires
--   "ou-" followed by from 4 to 32 lowercase letters or digits (the ID of
--   the root that contains the OU). This string is followed by a second
--   "-" dash and from 8 to 32 additional lowercase letters or digits.
describeOrganizationalUnit_organizationalUnitId :: Lens' DescribeOrganizationalUnit Text

--   constructor.

-- | Retrieves information about the organization that the user's account
--   belongs to.
--   
--   This operation can be called from any account in the organization.
--   
--   Even if a policy type is shown as available in the organization, you
--   can disable it separately at the root level with DisablePolicyType.
--   Use ListRoots to see the status of policy types for a specified root.
module Network.AWS.Organizations.DescribeOrganization

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newDescribeOrganization</a> smart constructor.
data DescribeOrganization
DescribeOrganization' :: DescribeOrganization

-- | Create a value of <a>DescribeOrganization</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
newDescribeOrganization :: DescribeOrganization

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newDescribeOrganizationResponse</a> smart constructor.
data DescribeOrganizationResponse
DescribeOrganizationResponse' :: Maybe Organization -> Int -> DescribeOrganizationResponse

-- | A structure that contains information about the organization.
--   
--   The <tt>AvailablePolicyTypes</tt> part of the response is deprecated,
--   and you shouldn't use it in your apps. It doesn't include any policy
--   type supported by Organizations other than SCPs. To determine which
--   policy types are enabled in your organization, use the <tt> ListRoots
--   </tt> operation.
[$sel:organization:DescribeOrganizationResponse'] :: DescribeOrganizationResponse -> Maybe Organization

-- | The response's http status code.
[$sel:httpStatus:DescribeOrganizationResponse'] :: DescribeOrganizationResponse -> Int

-- | Create a value of <a>DescribeOrganizationResponse</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:organization:DescribeOrganizationResponse'</a>,
--   <a>describeOrganizationResponse_organization</a> - A structure that
--   contains information about the organization.
--   
--   The <tt>AvailablePolicyTypes</tt> part of the response is deprecated,
--   and you shouldn't use it in your apps. It doesn't include any policy
--   type supported by Organizations other than SCPs. To determine which
--   policy types are enabled in your organization, use the <tt> ListRoots
--   </tt> operation.
--   
--   <a>$sel:httpStatus:DescribeOrganizationResponse'</a>,
--   <a>describeOrganizationResponse_httpStatus</a> - The response's http
--   status code.
newDescribeOrganizationResponse :: Int -> DescribeOrganizationResponse

-- | A structure that contains information about the organization.
--   
--   The <tt>AvailablePolicyTypes</tt> part of the response is deprecated,
--   and you shouldn't use it in your apps. It doesn't include any policy
--   type supported by Organizations other than SCPs. To determine which
--   policy types are enabled in your organization, use the <tt> ListRoots
--   </tt> operation.
describeOrganizationResponse_organization :: Lens' DescribeOrganizationResponse (Maybe Organization)

-- | The response's http status code.
describeOrganizationResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' DescribeOrganizationResponse Int
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.Organizations.DescribeOrganization.DescribeOrganization
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.Organizations.DescribeOrganization.DescribeOrganization
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.Organizations.DescribeOrganization.DescribeOrganization
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.Organizations.DescribeOrganization.DescribeOrganization
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.Organizations.DescribeOrganization.DescribeOrganizationResponse
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.Organizations.DescribeOrganization.DescribeOrganizationResponse
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.Organizations.DescribeOrganization.DescribeOrganizationResponse

instance Network.AWS.Data.Query.ToQuery Network.AWS.Organizations.DescribeOrganization.DescribeOrganization


-- | Retrieves information about a previously requested handshake. The
--   handshake ID comes from the response to the original
--   InviteAccountToOrganization operation that generated the handshake.
--   
--   You can access handshakes that are <tt>ACCEPTED</tt>,
--   <tt>DECLINED</tt>, or <tt>CANCELED</tt> for only 30 days after they
--   change to that state. They're then deleted and no longer accessible.
--   
--   This operation can be called from any account in the organization.
module Network.AWS.Organizations.DescribeHandshake

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newDescribeHandshake</a> smart constructor.
data DescribeHandshake
DescribeHandshake' :: Text -> DescribeHandshake

-- | The unique identifier (ID) of the handshake that you want information
--   about. You can get the ID from the original call to
--   InviteAccountToOrganization, or from a call to
--   ListHandshakesForAccount or ListHandshakesForOrganization.
--   
--   The <a>regex pattern</a> for handshake ID string requires "h-"
--   followed by from 8 to 32 lowercase letters or digits.
[$sel:handshakeId:DescribeHandshake'] :: DescribeHandshake -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>DescribeHandshake</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:handshakeId:DescribeHandshake'</a>,
--   <a>describeHandshake_handshakeId</a> - The unique identifier (ID) of
--   the handshake that you want information about. You can get the ID from
--   the original call to InviteAccountToOrganization, or from a call to
--   ListHandshakesForAccount or ListHandshakesForOrganization.
--   
--   The <a>regex pattern</a> for handshake ID string requires "h-"
--   followed by from 8 to 32 lowercase letters or digits.
newDescribeHandshake :: Text -> DescribeHandshake

-- | The unique identifier (ID) of the handshake that you want information
--   about. You can get the ID from the original call to
--   InviteAccountToOrganization, or from a call to
--   ListHandshakesForAccount or ListHandshakesForOrganization.
--   
--   The <a>regex pattern</a> for handshake ID string requires "h-"
--   followed by from 8 to 32 lowercase letters or digits.
describeHandshake_handshakeId :: Lens' DescribeHandshake Text

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newDescribeHandshakeResponse</a> smart constructor.
data DescribeHandshakeResponse
DescribeHandshakeResponse' :: Maybe Handshake -> Int -> DescribeHandshakeResponse

-- | A structure that contains information about the specified handshake.
[$sel:handshake:DescribeHandshakeResponse'] :: DescribeHandshakeResponse -> Maybe Handshake

-- | The response's http status code.
[$sel:httpStatus:DescribeHandshakeResponse'] :: DescribeHandshakeResponse -> Int

-- | Create a value of <a>DescribeHandshakeResponse</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:handshake:DescribeHandshakeResponse'</a>,
--   <a>describeHandshakeResponse_handshake</a> - A structure that contains
--   information about the specified handshake.
--   
--   <a>$sel:httpStatus:DescribeHandshakeResponse'</a>,
--   <a>describeHandshakeResponse_httpStatus</a> - The response's http
--   status code.
newDescribeHandshakeResponse :: Int -> DescribeHandshakeResponse

describeHandshakeResponse_handshake :: Lens' DescribeHandshakeResponse (Maybe Handshake)

-- | The response's http status code.
describeHandshakeResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' DescribeHandshakeResponse Int

instance Network.AWS.Data.Path.ToPath Network.AWS.Organizations.DescribeHandshake.DescribeHandshake
instance Network.AWS.Data.Query.ToQuery Network.AWS.Organizations.DescribeHandshake.DescribeHandshake


-- | Returns the contents of the effective policy for specified policy type
--   and account. The effective policy is the aggregation of any policies
--   of the specified type that the account inherits, plus any policy of
--   that type that is directly attached to the account.
--   
--   This operation applies only to policy types <i>other</i> than service
--   control policies (SCPs).
--   
--   For more information about policy inheritance, see <a>How Policy
--   Inheritance Works</a> in the <i>AWS Organizations User Guide</i>.
--   
--   This operation can be called only from the organization's management
--   account or by a member account that is a delegated administrator for
--   an AWS service.
module Network.AWS.Organizations.DescribeEffectivePolicy

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newDescribeEffectivePolicy</a> smart constructor.
data DescribeEffectivePolicy
DescribeEffectivePolicy' :: Maybe Text -> EffectivePolicyType -> DescribeEffectivePolicy

-- | When you're signed in as the management account, specify the ID of the
--   account that you want details about. Specifying an organization root
--   or organizational unit (OU) as the target is not supported.
[$sel:targetId:DescribeEffectivePolicy'] :: DescribeEffectivePolicy -> Maybe Text

-- | The type of policy that you want information about. You can specify
--   one of the following values:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>AISERVICES_OPT_OUT_POLICY</a></li>
--   <li><a>BACKUP_POLICY</a></li>
--   <li><a>TAG_POLICY</a></li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:policyType:DescribeEffectivePolicy'] :: DescribeEffectivePolicy -> EffectivePolicyType

-- | Create a value of <a>DescribeEffectivePolicy</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:targetId:DescribeEffectivePolicy'</a>,
--   <a>describeEffectivePolicy_targetId</a> - When you're signed in as the
--   management account, specify the ID of the account that you want
--   details about. Specifying an organization root or organizational unit
--   (OU) as the target is not supported.
--   
--   <a>$sel:policyType:DescribeEffectivePolicy'</a>,
--   <a>describeEffectivePolicy_policyType</a> - The type of policy that
--   you want information about. You can specify one of the following
--   values:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>AISERVICES_OPT_OUT_POLICY</a></li>
--   <li><a>BACKUP_POLICY</a></li>
--   <li><a>TAG_POLICY</a></li>
--   </ul>
newDescribeEffectivePolicy :: EffectivePolicyType -> DescribeEffectivePolicy

-- | When you're signed in as the management account, specify the ID of the
--   account that you want details about. Specifying an organization root
--   or organizational unit (OU) as the target is not supported.
describeEffectivePolicy_targetId :: Lens' DescribeEffectivePolicy (Maybe Text)

-- | The type of policy that you want information about. You can specify
--   one of the following values:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>AISERVICES_OPT_OUT_POLICY</a></li>
--   <li><a>BACKUP_POLICY</a></li>
--   <li><a>TAG_POLICY</a></li>
--   </ul>
describeEffectivePolicy_policyType :: Lens' DescribeEffectivePolicy EffectivePolicyType

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newDescribeEffectivePolicyResponse</a> smart
--   constructor.
data DescribeEffectivePolicyResponse
DescribeEffectivePolicyResponse' :: Maybe EffectivePolicy -> Int -> DescribeEffectivePolicyResponse

-- | Retrieves the current status of an asynchronous request to create an
--   account.
--   
--   This operation can be called only from the organization's management
--   account or by a member account that is a delegated administrator for
--   an AWS service.
module Network.AWS.Organizations.DescribeCreateAccountStatus

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newDescribeCreateAccountStatus</a> smart constructor.
data DescribeCreateAccountStatus
DescribeCreateAccountStatus' :: Text -> DescribeCreateAccountStatus

-- | Specifies the <tt>Id</tt> value that uniquely identifies the
--   <tt>CreateAccount</tt> request. You can get the value from the
--   <tt>CreateAccountStatus.Id</tt> response in an earlier CreateAccount
--   request, or from the ListCreateAccountStatus operation.
--   
--   The <a>regex pattern</a> for a create account request ID string
--   requires "car-" followed by from 8 to 32 lowercase letters or digits.
[$sel:createAccountRequestId:DescribeCreateAccountStatus'] :: DescribeCreateAccountStatus -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>DescribeCreateAccountStatus</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:createAccountRequestId:DescribeCreateAccountStatus'</a>,
--   <a>describeCreateAccountStatus_createAccountRequestId</a> - Specifies
--   the <tt>Id</tt> value that uniquely identifies the
--   <tt>CreateAccount</tt> request. You can get the value from the
--   <tt>CreateAccountStatus.Id</tt> response in an earlier CreateAccount
--   request, or from the ListCreateAccountStatus operation.
--   
--   The <a>regex pattern</a> for a create account request ID string
--   requires "car-" followed by from 8 to 32 lowercase letters or digits.
newDescribeCreateAccountStatus :: Text -> DescribeCreateAccountStatus

-- | Specifies the <tt>Id</tt> value that uniquely identifies the
--   <tt>CreateAccount</tt> request. You can get the value from the
--   <tt>CreateAccountStatus.Id</tt> response in an earlier CreateAccount
--   request, or from the ListCreateAccountStatus operation.
--   
--   The <a>regex pattern</a> for a create account request ID string
--   requires "car-" followed by from 8 to 32 lowercase letters or digits.

-- | Retrieves AWS Organizations-related information about the specified
--   account.
--   
--   This operation can be called only from the organization's management
--   account or by a member account that is a delegated administrator for
--   an AWS service.
module Network.AWS.Organizations.DescribeAccount

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newDescribeAccount</a> smart constructor.
data DescribeAccount
DescribeAccount' :: Text -> DescribeAccount

-- | The unique identifier (ID) of the AWS account that you want
--   information about. You can get the ID from the ListAccounts or
--   ListAccountsForParent operations.
--   
--   The <a>regex pattern</a> for an account ID string requires exactly 12
--   digits.
[$sel:accountId:DescribeAccount'] :: DescribeAccount -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>DescribeAccount</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:accountId:DescribeAccount'</a>,
--   <a>describeAccount_accountId</a> - The unique identifier (ID) of the
--   AWS account that you want information about. You can get the ID from
--   the ListAccounts or ListAccountsForParent operations.
--   
--   The <a>regex pattern</a> for an account ID string requires exactly 12
--   digits.
newDescribeAccount :: Text -> DescribeAccount

-- | The unique identifier (ID) of the AWS account that you want
--   information about. You can get the ID from the ListAccounts or
--   ListAccountsForParent operations.
--   
--   The <a>regex pattern</a> for an account ID string requires exactly 12
--   digits.
describeAccount_accountId :: Lens' DescribeAccount Text
