-- | Removes the specified member AWS account as a delegated administrator
--   for the specified AWS service.
--   
--   Deregistering a delegated administrator can have unintended impacts on
--   the functionality of the enabled AWS service. See the documentation
--   for the enabled service before you deregister a delegated
--   administrator so that you understand any potential impacts.
--   
--   You can run this action only for AWS services that support this
--   feature. For a current list of services that support it, see the
--   column /Supports Delegated Administrator/ in the table at <a>AWS
--   Services that you can use with AWS Organizations</a> in the <i>AWS
--   Organizations User Guide.</i>
--   
--   This operation can be called only from the organization's management
--   account.
module Network.AWS.Organizations.DeregisterDelegatedAdministrator

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newDeregisterDelegatedAdministrator</a> smart
--   constructor.
data DeregisterDelegatedAdministrator
DeregisterDelegatedAdministrator' :: Text -> Text -> DeregisterDelegatedAdministrator

-- | The account ID number of the member account in the organization that
--   you want to deregister as a delegated administrator.
[$sel:accountId:DeregisterDelegatedAdministrator'] :: DeregisterDelegatedAdministrator -> Text

-- | The service principal name of an AWS service for which the account is
--   a delegated administrator.
--   
--   Delegated administrator privileges are revoked for only the specified
--   AWS service from the member account. If the specified service is the
--   only service for which the member account is a delegated
--   administrator, the operation also revokes Organizations read action
--   permissions.
[$sel:servicePrincipal:DeregisterDelegatedAdministrator'] :: DeregisterDelegatedAdministrator -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>DeregisterDelegatedAdministrator</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:accountId:DeregisterDelegatedAdministrator'</a>,
--   <a>deregisterDelegatedAdministrator_accountId</a> - The account ID
--   number of the member account in the organization that you want to
--   deregister as a delegated administrator.
--   
--   <a>$sel:servicePrincipal:DeregisterDelegatedAdministrator'</a>,
--   <a>deregisterDelegatedAdministrator_servicePrincipal</a> - The service
--   principal name of an AWS service for which the account is a delegated
--   administrator.
--   
--   Delegated administrator privileges are revoked for only the specified
--   AWS service from the member account. If the specified service is the
--   only service for which the member account is a delegated
--   administrator, the operation also revokes Organizations read action
--   permissions.
newDeregisterDelegatedAdministrator :: Text -> Text -> DeregisterDelegatedAdministrator

-- | The account ID number of the member account in the organization that
--   you want to deregister as a delegated administrator.
deregisterDelegatedAdministrator_accountId :: Lens' DeregisterDelegatedAdministrator Text

-- | The service principal name of an AWS service for which the account is
--   a delegated administrator.
--   
--   Delegated administrator privileges are revoked for only the specified
--   AWS service from the member account. If the specified service is the
--   only service for which the member account is a delegated
--   administrator, the operation also revokes Organizations read action
--   permissions.
deregisterDelegatedAdministrator_servicePrincipal :: Lens' DeregisterDelegatedAdministrator Text

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newDeregisterDelegatedAdministratorResponse</a> smart
--   constructor.
data DeregisterDelegatedAdministratorResponse
DeregisterDelegatedAdministratorResponse' :: DeregisterDelegatedAdministratorResponse

-- | Create a value of <a>DeregisterDelegatedAdministratorResponse</a> with
--   all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
newDeregisterDelegatedAdministratorResponse :: DeregisterDelegatedAdministratorResponse

-- | Deletes the specified policy from your organization. Before you
--   perform this operation, you must first detach the policy from all
--   organizational units (OUs), roots, and accounts.
--   
--   This operation can be called only from the organization's management
--   account.
module Network.AWS.Organizations.DeletePolicy

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newDeletePolicy</a> smart constructor.

DeletePolicy' :: Text -> DeletePolicy

-- | The unique identifier (ID) of the policy that you want to delete. You
--   can get the ID from the ListPolicies or ListPoliciesForTarget
--   operations.
--   
--   The <a>regex pattern</a> for a policy ID string requires "p-" followed
--   by from 8 to 128 lowercase or uppercase letters, digits, or the
--   underscore character (_).
[$sel:policyId:DeletePolicy'] :: DeletePolicy -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>DeletePolicy</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.

--   fields.

--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--

--   unique identifier (ID) of the policy that you want to delete. You can
--   get the ID from the ListPolicies or ListPoliciesForTarget operations.
--   
--   The <a>regex pattern</a> for a policy ID string requires "p-" followed
--   by from 8 to 128 lowercase or uppercase letters, digits, or the
--   underscore character (_).
newDeletePolicy :: Text -> DeletePolicy

--   can get the ID from the ListPolicies or ListPoliciesForTarget
--   operations.

-- | Deletes an organizational unit (OU) from a root or another OU. You
--   must first remove all accounts and child OUs from the OU that you want
--   to delete.
--   
--   This operation can be called only from the organization's management
--   account.
module Network.AWS.Organizations.DeleteOrganizationalUnit

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newDeleteOrganizationalUnit</a> smart constructor.
data DeleteOrganizationalUnit
DeleteOrganizationalUnit' :: Text -> DeleteOrganizationalUnit

-- | The unique identifier (ID) of the organizational unit that you want to
--   delete. You can get the ID from the ListOrganizationalUnitsForParent
--   operation.
--   
--   The <a>regex pattern</a> for an organizational unit ID string requires
--   "ou-" followed by from 4 to 32 lowercase letters or digits (the ID of
--   the root that contains the OU). This string is followed by a second
--   "-" dash and from 8 to 32 additional lowercase letters or digits.
[$sel:organizationalUnitId:DeleteOrganizationalUnit'] :: DeleteOrganizationalUnit -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>DeleteOrganizationalUnit</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:organizationalUnitId:DeleteOrganizationalUnit'</a>,
--   <a>deleteOrganizationalUnit_organizationalUnitId</a> - The unique
--   identifier (ID) of the organizational unit that you want to delete.
--   You can get the ID from the ListOrganizationalUnitsForParent
--   operation.
--   
--   The <a>regex pattern</a> for an organizational unit ID string requires
--   "ou-" followed by from 4 to 32 lowercase letters or digits (the ID of
--   the root that contains the OU). This string is followed by a second
--   "-" dash and from 8 to 32 additional lowercase letters or digits.
newDeleteOrganizationalUnit :: Text -> DeleteOrganizationalUnit

-- | The unique identifier (ID) of the organizational unit that you want to
--   delete. You can get the ID from the ListOrganizationalUnitsForParent
--   operation.
--   
--   The <a>regex pattern</a> for an organizational unit ID string requires
--   "ou-" followed by from 4 to 32 lowercase letters or digits (the ID of
--   the root that contains the OU). This string is followed by a second
--   "-" dash and from 8 to 32 additional lowercase letters or digits.
deleteOrganizationalUnit_organizationalUnitId :: Lens' DeleteOrganizationalUnit Text

-- | Deletes the organization. You can delete an organization only by using
--   credentials from the management account. The organization must be
--   empty of member accounts.
module Network.AWS.Organizations.DeleteOrganization

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newDeleteOrganization</a> smart constructor.
data DeleteOrganization
DeleteOrganization' :: DeleteOrganization

-- | Create a value of <a>DeleteOrganization</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
newDeleteOrganization :: DeleteOrganization

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newDeleteOrganizationResponse</a> smart constructor.
data DeleteOrganizationResponse
DeleteOrganizationResponse' :: DeleteOrganizationResponse

-- | Create a value of <a>DeleteOrganizationResponse</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
newDeleteOrganizationResponse :: DeleteOrganizationResponse

instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.Organizations.DeleteOrganization.DeleteOrganization
instance Network.AWS.Data.Headers.ToHeaders Network.AWS.Organizations.DeleteOrganization.DeleteOrganization
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.Organizations.DeleteOrganization.DeleteOrganization
instance Network.AWS.Data.Path.ToPath Network.AWS.Organizations.DeleteOrganization.DeleteOrganization
instance Network.AWS.Data.Query.ToQuery Network.AWS.Organizations.DeleteOrganization.DeleteOrganization


-- | Declines a handshake request. This sets the handshake state to
--   <tt>DECLINED</tt> and effectively deactivates the request.
--   
--   This operation can be called only from the account that received the
--   handshake. The originator of the handshake can use CancelHandshake
--   instead. The originator can't reactivate a declined request, but can
--   reinitiate the process with a new handshake request.
--   
--   After you decline a handshake, it continues to appear in the results
--   of relevant APIs for only 30 days. After that, it's deleted.
module Network.AWS.Organizations.DeclineHandshake

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newDeclineHandshake</a> smart constructor.
data DeclineHandshake
DeclineHandshake' :: Text -> DeclineHandshake

-- | The unique identifier (ID) of the handshake that you want to decline.
--   You can get the ID from the ListHandshakesForAccount operation.
--   
--   The <a>regex pattern</a> for handshake ID string requires "h-"
--   followed by from 8 to 32 lowercase letters or digits.
[$sel:handshakeId:DeclineHandshake'] :: DeclineHandshake -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>DeclineHandshake</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:handshakeId:DeclineHandshake'</a>,
--   <a>declineHandshake_handshakeId</a> - The unique identifier (ID) of
--   the handshake that you want to decline. You can get the ID from the
--   ListHandshakesForAccount operation.
--   
--   The <a>regex pattern</a> for handshake ID string requires "h-"
--   followed by from 8 to 32 lowercase letters or digits.
newDeclineHandshake :: Text -> DeclineHandshake

-- | The unique identifier (ID) of the handshake that you want to decline.
--   You can get the ID from the ListHandshakesForAccount operation.
--   
--   The <a>regex pattern</a> for handshake ID string requires "h-"
--   followed by from 8 to 32 lowercase letters or digits.
declineHandshake_handshakeId :: Lens' DeclineHandshake Text

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newDeclineHandshakeResponse</a> smart constructor.
data DeclineHandshakeResponse
DeclineHandshakeResponse' :: Maybe Handshake -> Int -> DeclineHandshakeResponse

-- | A structure that contains details about the declined handshake. The
--   state is updated to show the value <tt>DECLINED</tt>.
[$sel:handshake:DeclineHandshakeResponse'] :: DeclineHandshakeResponse -> Maybe Handshake

-- | The response's http status code.
[$sel:httpStatus:DeclineHandshakeResponse'] :: DeclineHandshakeResponse -> Int

-- | Create a value of <a>DeclineHandshakeResponse</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:handshake:DeclineHandshakeResponse'</a>,
--   <a>declineHandshakeResponse_handshake</a> - A structure that contains
--   details about the declined handshake. The state is updated to show the
--   value <tt>DECLINED</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:httpStatus:DeclineHandshakeResponse'</a>,
--   <a>declineHandshakeResponse_httpStatus</a> - The response's http
--   status code.
newDeclineHandshakeResponse :: Int -> DeclineHandshakeResponse

-- | A structure that contains details about the declined handshake. The
--   state is updated to show the value <tt>DECLINED</tt>.
declineHandshakeResponse_handshake :: Lens' DeclineHandshakeResponse (Maybe Handshake)

-- | The response's http status code.
declineHandshakeResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' DeclineHandshakeResponse Int
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.Organizations.DeclineHandshake.DeclineHandshake
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.Organizations.DeclineHandshake.DeclineHandshake
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.Organizations.DeclineHandshake.DeclineHandshake
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.Organizations.DeclineHandshake.DeclineHandshake
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.Organizations.DeclineHandshake.DeclineHandshakeResponse
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.Organizations.DeclineHandshake.DeclineHandshakeResponse
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.Organizations.DeclineHandshake.DeclineHandshakeResponse
instance Network.AWS.Types.AWSRequest Network.AWS.Organizations.DeclineHandshake.DeclineHandshake
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.Organizations.DeclineHandshake.DeclineHandshakeResponse
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.Organizations.DeclineHandshake.DeclineHandshake
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.Organizations.DeclineHandshake.DeclineHandshake
instance Network.AWS.Data.Headers.ToHeaders Network.AWS.Organizations.DeclineHandshake.DeclineHandshake
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.Organizations.DeclineHandshake.DeclineHandshake
instance Network.AWS.Data.Path.ToPath Network.AWS.Organizations.DeclineHandshake.DeclineHandshake
instance Network.AWS.Data.Query.ToQuery Network.AWS.Organizations.DeclineHandshake.DeclineHandshake


-- | Creates a policy of a specified type that you can attach to a root, an
--   organizational unit (OU), or an individual AWS account.
--   
--   For more information about policies and their use, see <a>Managing
--   Organization Policies</a>.
--   
--   If the request includes tags, then the requester must have the
--   <tt>organizations:TagResource</tt> permission.
--   
--   This operation can be called only from the organization's management
--   account.
module Network.AWS.Organizations.CreatePolicy

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newCreatePolicy</a> smart constructor.
data CreatePolicy
CreatePolicy' :: Maybe [Tag] -> Text -> Text -> Text -> PolicyType -> CreatePolicy

-- | A list of tags that you want to attach to the newly created policy.
--   For each tag in the list, you must specify both a tag key and a value.
--   You can set the value to an empty string, but you can't set it to
--   <tt>null</tt>. For more information about tagging, see <a>Tagging AWS
--   Organizations resources</a> in the AWS Organizations User Guide.
--   
--   If any one of the tags is invalid or if you exceed the allowed number
--   of tags for a policy, then the entire request fails and the policy is
--   not created.
[$sel:tags:CreatePolicy'] :: CreatePolicy -> Maybe [Tag]

-- | The policy text content to add to the new policy. The text that you
--   supply must adhere to the rules of the policy type you specify in the
--   <tt>Type</tt> parameter.
[$sel:content:CreatePolicy'] :: CreatePolicy -> Text

-- | An optional description to assign to the policy.
[$sel:description:CreatePolicy'] :: CreatePolicy -> Text

-- | The friendly name to assign to the policy.
--   
--   The <a>regex pattern</a> that is used to validate this parameter is a
--   string of any of the characters in the ASCII character range.
[$sel:name:CreatePolicy'] :: CreatePolicy -> Text

-- | The type of policy to create. You can specify one of the following
--   values:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>AISERVICES_OPT_OUT_POLICY</a></li>
--   <li><a>BACKUP_POLICY</a></li>
--   <li><a>SERVICE_CONTROL_POLICY</a></li>
--   <li><a>TAG_POLICY</a></li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:type':CreatePolicy'] :: CreatePolicy -> PolicyType

-- | Create a value of <a>CreatePolicy</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:tags:CreatePolicy'</a>, <a>createPolicy_tags</a> - A list of
--   tags that you want to attach to the newly created policy. For each tag
--   in the list, you must specify both a tag key and a value. You can set
--   the value to an empty string, but you can't set it to <tt>null</tt>.
--   For more information about tagging, see <a>Tagging AWS Organizations
--   resources</a> in the AWS Organizations User Guide.
--   
--   If any one of the tags is invalid or if you exceed the allowed number
--   of tags for a policy, then the entire request fails and the policy is
--   not created.
--   
--   <a>$sel:content:CreatePolicy'</a>, <a>createPolicy_content</a> - The
--   policy text content to add to the new policy. The text that you supply
--   must adhere to the rules of the policy type you specify in the
--   <tt>Type</tt> parameter.
--   
--   <a>$sel:description:CreatePolicy'</a>, <a>createPolicy_description</a>
--   - An optional description to assign to the policy.
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:CreatePolicy'</a>, <a>createPolicy_name</a> - The
--   friendly name to assign to the policy.
--   
--   The <a>regex pattern</a> that is used to validate this parameter is a
--   string of any of the characters in the ASCII character range.
--   
--   <a>$sel:type':CreatePolicy'</a>, <a>createPolicy_type</a> - The type
--   of policy to create. You can specify one of the following values:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>AISERVICES_OPT_OUT_POLICY</a></li>
--   <li><a>BACKUP_POLICY</a></li>
--   <li><a>SERVICE_CONTROL_POLICY</a></li>
--   <li><a>TAG_POLICY</a></li>
--   </ul>
newCreatePolicy :: Text -> Text -> Text -> PolicyType -> CreatePolicy

-- | A list of tags that you want to attach to the newly created policy.
--   For each tag in the list, you must specify both a tag key and a value.
--   You can set the value to an empty string, but you can't set it to
--   <tt>null</tt>. For more information about tagging, see <a>Tagging AWS
--   Organizations resources</a> in the AWS Organizations User Guide.
--   
--   If any one of the tags is invalid or if you exceed the allowed number
--   of tags for a policy, then the entire request fails and the policy is
--   not created.
createPolicy_tags :: Lens' CreatePolicy (Maybe [Tag])

-- | The policy text content to add to the new policy. The text that you
--   supply must adhere to the rules of the policy type you specify in the
--   <tt>Type</tt> parameter.
createPolicy_content :: Lens' CreatePolicy Text

-- | An optional description to assign to the policy.
createPolicy_description :: Lens' CreatePolicy Text

-- | The friendly name to assign to the policy.
--   
--   The <a>regex pattern</a> that is used to validate this parameter is a
--   string of any of the characters in the ASCII character range.
createPolicy_name :: Lens' CreatePolicy Text

-- | The type of policy to create. You can specify one of the following
--   values:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>AISERVICES_OPT_OUT_POLICY</a></li>
--   <li><a>BACKUP_POLICY</a></li>
--   <li><a>SERVICE_CONTROL_POLICY</a></li>
--   <li><a>TAG_POLICY</a></li>
--   </ul>
createPolicy_type :: Lens' CreatePolicy PolicyType

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newCreatePolicyResponse</a> smart constructor.
data CreatePolicyResponse
CreatePolicyResponse' :: Maybe Policy -> Int -> CreatePolicyResponse

-- | A structure that contains details about the newly created policy.
[$sel:policy:CreatePolicyResponse'] :: CreatePolicyResponse -> Maybe Policy

-- | The response's http status code.
[$sel:httpStatus:CreatePolicyResponse'] :: CreatePolicyResponse -> Int

--   omitted.

--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional

--   about the newly created policy.
--   
--   <a>$sel:httpStatus:CreatePolicyResponse'</a>,
--   <a>createPolicyResponse_httpStatus</a> - The response's http status
--   code.
newCreatePolicyResponse :: Int -> CreatePolicyResponse

createPolicyResponse_policy :: Lens' CreatePolicyResponse (Maybe Policy)

-- | The response's http status code.
createPolicyResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' CreatePolicyResponse Int

instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.Organizations.CreatePolicy.CreatePolicy
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.Organizations.CreatePolicy.CreatePolicy

instance Network.AWS.Data.Headers.ToHeaders Network.AWS.Organizations.CreatePolicy.CreatePolicy
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.Organizations.CreatePolicy.CreatePolicy
instance Network.AWS.Data.Path.ToPath Network.AWS.Organizations.CreatePolicy.CreatePolicy
instance Network.AWS.Data.Query.ToQuery Network.AWS.Organizations.CreatePolicy.CreatePolicy


-- | Creates an organizational unit (OU) within a root or parent OU. An OU
--   is a container for accounts that enables you to organize your accounts
--   to apply policies according to your business requirements. The number
--   of levels deep that you can nest OUs is dependent upon the policy
--   types enabled for that root. For service control policies, the limit
--   is five.
--   
--   For more information about OUs, see <a>Managing Organizational
--   Units</a> in the <i>AWS Organizations User Guide.</i>
--   
--   If the request includes tags, then the requester must have the
--   <tt>organizations:TagResource</tt> permission.
--   
--   This operation can be called only from the organization's management
--   account.
module Network.AWS.Organizations.CreateOrganizationalUnit

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newCreateOrganizationalUnit</a> smart constructor.
data CreateOrganizationalUnit
CreateOrganizationalUnit' :: Maybe [Tag] -> Text -> Text -> CreateOrganizationalUnit

-- | A list of tags that you want to attach to the newly created OU. For
--   each tag in the list, you must specify both a tag key and a value. You
--   can set the value to an empty string, but you can't set it to
--   <tt>null</tt>. For more information about tagging, see <a>Tagging AWS
--   Organizations resources</a> in the AWS Organizations User Guide.
--   
--   If any one of the tags is invalid or if you exceed the allowed number
--   of tags for an OU, then the entire request fails and the OU is not
--   created.
[$sel:tags:CreateOrganizationalUnit'] :: CreateOrganizationalUnit -> Maybe [Tag]

-- | The unique identifier (ID) of the parent root or OU that you want to
--   create the new OU in.
--   
--   The <a>regex pattern</a> for a parent ID string requires one of the
--   following:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><b>Root</b> - A string that begins with "r-" followed by from 4 to
--   32 lowercase letters or digits.</li>
--   <li><b>Organizational unit (OU)</b> - A string that begins with "ou-"
--   followed by from 4 to 32 lowercase letters or digits (the ID of the
--   root that the OU is in). This string is followed by a second "-" dash
--   and from 8 to 32 additional lowercase letters or digits.</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:parentId:CreateOrganizationalUnit'] :: CreateOrganizationalUnit -> Text

-- | The friendly name to assign to the new OU.
[$sel:name:CreateOrganizationalUnit'] :: CreateOrganizationalUnit -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>CreateOrganizationalUnit</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:tags:CreateOrganizationalUnit'</a>,
--   <a>createOrganizationalUnit_tags</a> - A list of tags that you want to
--   attach to the newly created OU. For each tag in the list, you must
--   specify both a tag key and a value. You can set the value to an empty
--   string, but you can't set it to <tt>null</tt>. For more information
--   about tagging, see <a>Tagging AWS Organizations resources</a> in the
--   AWS Organizations User Guide.
--   
--   If any one of the tags is invalid or if you exceed the allowed number
--   of tags for an OU, then the entire request fails and the OU is not
--   created.
--   
--   <a>$sel:parentId:CreateOrganizationalUnit'</a>,
--   <a>createOrganizationalUnit_parentId</a> - The unique identifier (ID)
--   of the parent root or OU that you want to create the new OU in.
--   
--   The <a>regex pattern</a> for a parent ID string requires one of the
--   following:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><b>Root</b> - A string that begins with "r-" followed by from 4 to
--   32 lowercase letters or digits.</li>
--   <li><b>Organizational unit (OU)</b> - A string that begins with "ou-"
--   followed by from 4 to 32 lowercase letters or digits (the ID of the
--   root that the OU is in). This string is followed by a second "-" dash
--   and from 8 to 32 additional lowercase letters or digits.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:CreateOrganizationalUnit'</a>,
--   <a>createOrganizationalUnit_name</a> - The friendly name to assign to
--   the new OU.
newCreateOrganizationalUnit :: Text -> Text -> CreateOrganizationalUnit

-- | A list of tags that you want to attach to the newly created OU. For
--   each tag in the list, you must specify both a tag key and a value. You
--   can set the value to an empty string, but you can't set it to
--   <tt>null</tt>. For more information about tagging, see <a>Tagging AWS
--   Organizations resources</a> in the AWS Organizations User Guide.
--   
--   If any one of the tags is invalid or if you exceed the allowed number
--   of tags for an OU, then the entire request fails and the OU is not
--   created.
createOrganizationalUnit_tags :: Lens' CreateOrganizationalUnit (Maybe [Tag])

-- | The unique identifier (ID) of the parent root or OU that you want to
--   create the new OU in.
--   
--   The <a>regex pattern</a> for a parent ID string requires one of the
--   following:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><b>Root</b> - A string that begins with "r-" followed by from 4 to
--   32 lowercase letters or digits.</li>
--   <li><b>Organizational unit (OU)</b> - A string that begins with "ou-"
--   followed by from 4 to 32 lowercase letters or digits (the ID of the
--   root that the OU is in). This string is followed by a second "-" dash
--   and from 8 to 32 additional lowercase letters or digits.</li>
--   </ul>
createOrganizationalUnit_parentId :: Lens' CreateOrganizationalUnit Text

-- | The friendly name to assign to the new OU.
createOrganizationalUnit_name :: Lens' CreateOrganizationalUnit Text

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newCreateOrganizationalUnitResponse</a> smart
--   constructor.
data CreateOrganizationalUnitResponse
CreateOrganizationalUnitResponse' :: Maybe OrganizationalUnit -> Int -> CreateOrganizationalUnitResponse

-- | A structure that contains details about the newly created OU.
[$sel:organizationalUnit:CreateOrganizationalUnitResponse'] :: CreateOrganizationalUnitResponse -> Maybe OrganizationalUnit

-- | The response's http status code.
[$sel:httpStatus:CreateOrganizationalUnitResponse'] :: CreateOrganizationalUnitResponse -> Int

-- | Create a value of <a>CreateOrganizationalUnitResponse</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:organizationalUnit:CreateOrganizationalUnitResponse'</a>,
--   <a>createOrganizationalUnitResponse_organizationalUnit</a> - A
--   structure that contains details about the newly created OU.
--   
--   <a>$sel:httpStatus:CreateOrganizationalUnitResponse'</a>,
--   <a>createOrganizationalUnitResponse_httpStatus</a> - The response's
--   http status code.
newCreateOrganizationalUnitResponse :: Int -> CreateOrganizationalUnitResponse

-- | A structure that contains details about the newly created OU.
createOrganizationalUnitResponse_organizationalUnit :: Lens' CreateOrganizationalUnitResponse (Maybe OrganizationalUnit)

-- | The response's http status code.
createOrganizationalUnitResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' CreateOrganizationalUnitResponse Int
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.Organizations.CreateOrganizationalUnit.CreateOrganizationalUnit
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.Organizations.CreateOrganizationalUnit.CreateOrganizationalUnit
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.Organizations.CreateOrganizationalUnit.CreateOrganizationalUnit
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.Organizations.CreateOrganizationalUnit.CreateOrganizationalUnit
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.Organizations.CreateOrganizationalUnit.CreateOrganizationalUnitResponse
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.Organizations.CreateOrganizationalUnit.CreateOrganizationalUnitResponse
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.Organizations.CreateOrganizationalUnit.CreateOrganizationalUnitResponse
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.Organizations.CreateOrganizationalUnit.CreateOrganizationalUnitResponse
instance Network.AWS.Types.AWSRequest Network.AWS.Organizations.CreateOrganizationalUnit.CreateOrganizationalUnit
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.Organizations.CreateOrganizationalUnit.CreateOrganizationalUnitResponse
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.Organizations.CreateOrganizationalUnit.CreateOrganizationalUnit
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.Organizations.CreateOrganizationalUnit.CreateOrganizationalUnit
instance Network.AWS.Data.Headers.ToHeaders Network.AWS.Organizations.CreateOrganizationalUnit.CreateOrganizationalUnit
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.Organizations.CreateOrganizationalUnit.CreateOrganizationalUnit
instance Network.AWS.Data.Path.ToPath Network.AWS.Organizations.CreateOrganizationalUnit.CreateOrganizationalUnit
instance Network.AWS.Data.Query.ToQuery Network.AWS.Organizations.CreateOrganizationalUnit.CreateOrganizationalUnit


-- | Creates an AWS organization. The account whose user is calling the
--   <tt>CreateOrganization</tt> operation automatically becomes the
--   <a>management account</a> of the new organization.
--   
--   This operation must be called using credentials from the account that
--   is to become the new organization's management account. The principal
--   must also have the relevant IAM permissions.
--   
--   By default (or if you set the <tt>FeatureSet</tt> parameter to
--   <tt>ALL</tt>), the new organization is created with all features
--   enabled and service control policies automatically enabled in the
--   root. If you instead choose to create the organization supporting only
--   the consolidated billing features by setting the <tt>FeatureSet</tt>
--   parameter to <tt>CONSOLIDATED_BILLING"</tt>, no policy types are
--   enabled by default, and you can't use organization policies
module Network.AWS.Organizations.CreateOrganization

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newCreateOrganization</a> smart constructor.
data CreateOrganization
CreateOrganization' :: Maybe OrganizationFeatureSet -> CreateOrganization

-- | Specifies the feature set supported by the new organization. Each
--   feature set supports different levels of functionality.
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>CONSOLIDATED_BILLING</tt>: All member accounts have their
--   bills consolidated to and paid by the management account. For more
--   information, see <a>Consolidated billing</a> in the <i>AWS
--   Organizations User Guide.</i>The consolidated billing feature subset
--   isn't available for organizations in the AWS GovCloud (US)
--   Region.</li>
--   <li><tt>ALL</tt>: In addition to all the features supported by the
--   consolidated billing feature set, the management account can also
--   apply any policy type to any member account in the organization. For
--   more information, see <a>All features</a> in the <i>AWS Organizations
--   User Guide.</i></li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:featureSet:CreateOrganization'] :: CreateOrganization -> Maybe OrganizationFeatureSet

-- | Create a value of <a>CreateOrganization</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:featureSet:CreateOrganization'</a>,
--   <a>createOrganization_featureSet</a> - Specifies the feature set
--   supported by the new organization. Each feature set supports different
--   levels of functionality.
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>CONSOLIDATED_BILLING</tt>: All member accounts have their
--   bills consolidated to and paid by the management account. For more
--   information, see <a>Consolidated billing</a> in the <i>AWS
--   Organizations User Guide.</i>The consolidated billing feature subset
--   isn't available for organizations in the AWS GovCloud (US)
--   Region.</li>
--   <li><tt>ALL</tt>: In addition to all the features supported by the
--   consolidated billing feature set, the management account can also
--   apply any policy type to any member account in the organization. For
--   more information, see <a>All features</a> in the <i>AWS Organizations
--   User Guide.</i></li>
--   </ul>
newCreateOrganization :: CreateOrganization

-- | Specifies the feature set supported by the new organization. Each
--   feature set supports different levels of functionality.
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>CONSOLIDATED_BILLING</tt>: All member accounts have their
--   bills consolidated to and paid by the management account. For more
--   information, see <a>Consolidated billing</a> in the <i>AWS
--   Organizations User Guide.</i>The consolidated billing feature subset
--   isn't available for organizations in the AWS GovCloud (US)
--   Region.</li>
--   <li><tt>ALL</tt>: In addition to all the features supported by the
--   consolidated billing feature set, the management account can also
--   apply any policy type to any member account in the organization. For
--   more information, see <a>All features</a> in the <i>AWS Organizations
--   User Guide.</i></li>
--   </ul>
createOrganization_featureSet :: Lens' CreateOrganization (Maybe OrganizationFeatureSet)

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newCreateOrganizationResponse</a> smart constructor.
data CreateOrganizationResponse
CreateOrganizationResponse' :: Maybe Organization -> Int -> CreateOrganizationResponse

-- | A structure that contains details about the newly created
--   organization.
[$sel:organization:CreateOrganizationResponse'] :: CreateOrganizationResponse -> Maybe Organization

-- | The response's http status code.
[$sel:httpStatus:CreateOrganizationResponse'] :: CreateOrganizationResponse -> Int

-- | Create a value of <a>CreateOrganizationResponse</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:organization:CreateOrganizationResponse'</a>,
--   <a>createOrganizationResponse_organization</a> - A structure that
--   contains details about the newly created organization.
--   
--   <a>$sel:httpStatus:CreateOrganizationResponse'</a>,
--   <a>createOrganizationResponse_httpStatus</a> - The response's http
--   status code.
newCreateOrganizationResponse :: Int -> CreateOrganizationResponse

-- | A structure that contains details about the newly created
--   organization.
createOrganizationResponse_organization :: Lens' CreateOrganizationResponse (Maybe Organization)

-- | The response's http status code.
createOrganizationResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' CreateOrganizationResponse Int

instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.Organizations.CreateOrganization.CreateOrganization
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.Organizations.CreateOrganization.CreateOrganization
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.Organizations.CreateOrganization.CreateOrganization

instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.Organizations.CreateOrganization.CreateOrganizationResponse

instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.Organizations.CreateOrganization.CreateOrganizationResponse
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.Organizations.CreateOrganization.CreateOrganization
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.Organizations.CreateOrganization.CreateOrganization
instance Network.AWS.Data.Headers.ToHeaders Network.AWS.Organizations.CreateOrganization.CreateOrganization
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.Organizations.CreateOrganization.CreateOrganization
instance Network.AWS.Data.Path.ToPath Network.AWS.Organizations.CreateOrganization.CreateOrganization
instance Network.AWS.Data.Query.ToQuery Network.AWS.Organizations.CreateOrganization.CreateOrganization


-- | This action is available if all of the following are true:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>You're authorized to create accounts in the AWS GovCloud (US)
--   Region. For more information on the AWS GovCloud (US) Region, see the
--   <a>AWS GovCloud User Guide.</a></li>
--   <li>You already have an account in the AWS GovCloud (US) Region that
--   is paired with a management account of an organization in the
--   commercial Region.</li>
--   <li>You call this action from the management account of your
--   organization in the commercial Region.</li>
--   <li>You have the <tt>organizations:CreateGovCloudAccount</tt>
--   permission.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   AWS Organizations automatically creates the required service-linked
--   role named <tt>AWSServiceRoleForOrganizations</tt>. For more
--   information, see <a>AWS Organizations and Service-Linked Roles</a> in
--   the <i>AWS Organizations User Guide.</i>
--   
--   AWS automatically enables AWS CloudTrail for AWS GovCloud (US)
--   accounts, but you should also do the following:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>Verify that AWS CloudTrail is enabled to store logs.</li>
--   <li>Create an S3 bucket for AWS CloudTrail log storage.For more
--   information, see <a>Verifying AWS CloudTrail Is Enabled</a> in the
--   <i>AWS GovCloud User Guide</i>.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   If the request includes tags, then the requester must have the
--   <tt>organizations:TagResource</tt> permission. The tags are attached
--   to the commercial account associated with the GovCloud account, rather
--   than the GovCloud account itself. To add tags to the GovCloud account,
--   call the TagResource operation in the GovCloud Region after the new
--   GovCloud account exists.
--   
--   You call this action from the management account of your organization
--   in the commercial Region to create a standalone AWS account in the AWS
--   GovCloud (US) Region. After the account is created, the management
--   account of an organization in the AWS GovCloud (US) Region can invite
--   it to that organization. For more information on inviting standalone
--   accounts in the AWS GovCloud (US) to join an organization, see <a>AWS
--   Organizations</a> in the <i>AWS GovCloud User Guide.</i>
--   
--   Calling <tt>CreateGovCloudAccount</tt> is an asynchronous request that
--   AWS performs in the background. Because <tt>CreateGovCloudAccount</tt>
--   operates asynchronously, it can return a successful completion message
--   even though account initialization might still be in progress. You
--   might need to wait a few minutes before you can successfully access
--   the account. To check the status of the request, do one of the
--   following:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>Use the <tt>OperationId</tt> response element from this operation
--   to provide as a parameter to the DescribeCreateAccountStatus
--   operation.</li>
--   <li>Check the AWS CloudTrail log for the <tt>CreateAccountResult</tt>
--   event. For information on using AWS CloudTrail with Organizations, see
--   <a>Monitoring the Activity in Your Organization</a> in the <i>AWS
--   Organizations User Guide.</i></li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   When you call the <tt>CreateGovCloudAccount</tt> action, you create
--   two accounts: a standalone account in the AWS GovCloud (US) Region and
--   an associated account in the commercial Region for billing and support
--   purposes. The account in the commercial Region is automatically a
--   member of the organization whose credentials made the request. Both
--   accounts are associated with the same email address.
--   
--   A role is created in the new account in the commercial Region that
--   allows the management account in the organization in the commercial
--   Region to assume it. An AWS GovCloud (US) account is then created and
--   associated with the commercial account that you just created. A role
--   is also created in the new AWS GovCloud (US) account that can be
--   assumed by the AWS GovCloud (US) account that is associated with the
--   management account of the commercial organization. For more
--   information and to view a diagram that explains how account access
--   works, see <a>AWS Organizations</a> in the <i>AWS GovCloud User
--   Guide.</i>
--   
--   For more information about creating accounts, see <a>Creating an AWS
--   Account in Your Organization</a> in the <i>AWS Organizations User
--   Guide.</i>
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>When you create an account in an organization using the AWS
--   Organizations console, API, or CLI commands, the information required
--   for the account to operate as a standalone account is <i>not</i>
--   automatically collected. This includes a payment method and signing
--   the end user license agreement (EULA). If you must remove an account
--   from your organization later, you can do so only after you provide the
--   missing information. Follow the steps at <a>To leave an organization
--   as a member account</a> in the <i>AWS Organizations User
--   Guide.</i></li>
--   <li>If you get an exception that indicates that you exceeded your
--   account limits for the organization, contact <a>AWS Support</a>.</li>
--   <li>If you get an exception that indicates that the operation failed
--   because your organization is still initializing, wait one hour and
--   then try again. If the error persists, contact <a>AWS
--   Support</a>.</li>
--   <li>Using <tt>CreateGovCloudAccount</tt> to create multiple temporary
--   accounts isn't recommended. You can only close an account from the AWS
--   Billing and Cost Management console, and you must be signed in as the
--   root user. For information on the requirements and process for closing
--   an account, see <a>Closing an AWS Account</a> in the <i>AWS
--   Organizations User Guide</i>.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   When you create a member account with this operation, you can choose
--   whether to create the account with the __IAM User and Role Access to
--   Billing Information__ switch enabled. If you enable it, IAM users and
--   roles that have appropriate permissions can view billing information
--   for the account. If you disable it, only the account root user can
--   access billing information. For information about how to disable this
--   switch for an account, see <a>Granting Access to Your Billing
--   Information and Tools</a>.
module Network.AWS.Organizations.CreateGovCloudAccount

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newCreateGovCloudAccount</a> smart constructor.
data CreateGovCloudAccount
CreateGovCloudAccount' :: Maybe IAMUserAccessToBilling -> Maybe Text -> Maybe [Tag] -> Sensitive Text -> Sensitive Text -> CreateGovCloudAccount

-- | If set to <tt>ALLOW</tt>, the new linked account in the commercial
--   Region enables IAM users to access account billing information
--   <i>if</i> they have the required permissions. If set to <tt>DENY</tt>,
--   only the root user of the new account can access account billing
--   information. For more information, see <a>Activating Access to the
--   Billing and Cost Management Console</a> in the <i>AWS Billing and Cost
--   Management User Guide.</i>
--   
--   If you don't specify this parameter, the value defaults to
--   <tt>ALLOW</tt>, and IAM users and roles with the required permissions
--   can access billing information for the new account.
[$sel:iamUserAccessToBilling:CreateGovCloudAccount'] :: CreateGovCloudAccount -> Maybe IAMUserAccessToBilling

-- | (Optional)
--   
--   The name of an IAM role that AWS Organizations automatically
--   preconfigures in the new member accounts in both the AWS GovCloud (US)
--   Region and in the commercial Region. This role trusts the management
--   account, allowing users in the management account to assume the role,
--   as permitted by the management account administrator. The role has
--   administrator permissions in the new member account.
--   
--   If you don't specify this parameter, the role name defaults to
--   <tt>OrganizationAccountAccessRole</tt>.
--   
--   For more information about how to use this role to access the member
--   account, see <a>Accessing and Administering the Member Accounts in
--   Your Organization</a> in the <i>AWS Organizations User Guide</i> and
--   steps 2 and 3 in <a>Tutorial: Delegate Access Across AWS Accounts
--   Using IAM Roles</a> in the <i>IAM User Guide.</i>
--   
--   The <a>regex pattern</a> that is used to validate this parameter. The
--   pattern can include uppercase letters, lowercase letters, digits with
--   no spaces, and any of the following characters: =,.@-
[$sel:roleName:CreateGovCloudAccount'] :: CreateGovCloudAccount -> Maybe Text

-- | A list of tags that you want to attach to the newly created account.
--   These tags are attached to the commercial account associated with the
--   GovCloud account, and not to the GovCloud account itself. To add tags
--   to the actual GovCloud account, call the TagResource operation in the
--   GovCloud region after the new GovCloud account exists.
--   
--   For each tag in the list, you must specify both a tag key and a value.
--   You can set the value to an empty string, but you can't set it to
--   <tt>null</tt>. For more information about tagging, see <a>Tagging AWS
--   Organizations resources</a> in the AWS Organizations User Guide.
--   
--   If any one of the tags is invalid or if you exceed the allowed number
--   of tags for an account, then the entire request fails and the account
--   is not created.
[$sel:tags:CreateGovCloudAccount'] :: CreateGovCloudAccount -> Maybe [Tag]

-- | The email address of the owner to assign to the new member account in
--   the commercial Region. This email address must not already be
--   associated with another AWS account. You must use a valid email
--   address to complete account creation. You can't access the root user
--   of the account or remove an account that was created with an invalid
--   email address. Like all request parameters for
--   <tt>CreateGovCloudAccount</tt>, the request for the email address for
--   the AWS GovCloud (US) account originates from the commercial Region,
--   not from the AWS GovCloud (US) Region.
[$sel:email:CreateGovCloudAccount'] :: CreateGovCloudAccount -> Sensitive Text

-- | The friendly name of the member account.
[$sel:accountName:CreateGovCloudAccount'] :: CreateGovCloudAccount -> Sensitive Text

-- | Create a value of <a>CreateGovCloudAccount</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:iamUserAccessToBilling:CreateGovCloudAccount'</a>,
--   <a>createGovCloudAccount_iamUserAccessToBilling</a> - If set to
--   <tt>ALLOW</tt>, the new linked account in the commercial Region
--   enables IAM users to access account billing information <i>if</i> they
--   have the required permissions. If set to <tt>DENY</tt>, only the root
--   user of the new account can access account billing information. For
--   more information, see <a>Activating Access to the Billing and Cost
--   Management Console</a> in the <i>AWS Billing and Cost Management User
--   Guide.</i>
--   
--   If you don't specify this parameter, the value defaults to
--   <tt>ALLOW</tt>, and IAM users and roles with the required permissions
--   can access billing information for the new account.
--   
--   <a>$sel:roleName:CreateGovCloudAccount'</a>,
--   <a>createGovCloudAccount_roleName</a> - (Optional)
--   
--   The name of an IAM role that AWS Organizations automatically
--   preconfigures in the new member accounts in both the AWS GovCloud (US)
--   Region and in the commercial Region. This role trusts the management
--   account, allowing users in the management account to assume the role,
--   as permitted by the management account administrator. The role has
--   administrator permissions in the new member account.
--   
--   If you don't specify this parameter, the role name defaults to
--   <tt>OrganizationAccountAccessRole</tt>.
--   
--   For more information about how to use this role to access the member
--   account, see <a>Accessing and Administering the Member Accounts in
--   Your Organization</a> in the <i>AWS Organizations User Guide</i> and
--   steps 2 and 3 in <a>Tutorial: Delegate Access Across AWS Accounts
--   Using IAM Roles</a> in the <i>IAM User Guide.</i>
--   
--   The <a>regex pattern</a> that is used to validate this parameter. The
--   pattern can include uppercase letters, lowercase letters, digits with
--   no spaces, and any of the following characters: =,.@-
--   
--   <a>$sel:tags:CreateGovCloudAccount'</a>,
--   <a>createGovCloudAccount_tags</a> - A list of tags that you want to
--   attach to the newly created account. These tags are attached to the
--   commercial account associated with the GovCloud account, and not to
--   the GovCloud account itself. To add tags to the actual GovCloud
--   account, call the TagResource operation in the GovCloud region after
--   the new GovCloud account exists.
--   
--   For each tag in the list, you must specify both a tag key and a value.
--   You can set the value to an empty string, but you can't set it to
--   <tt>null</tt>. For more information about tagging, see <a>Tagging AWS
--   Organizations resources</a> in the AWS Organizations User Guide.
--   
--   If any one of the tags is invalid or if you exceed the allowed number
--   of tags for an account, then the entire request fails and the account
--   is not created.
--   
--   <a>$sel:email:CreateGovCloudAccount'</a>,
--   <a>createGovCloudAccount_email</a> - The email address of the owner to
--   assign to the new member account in the commercial Region. This email
--   address must not already be associated with another AWS account. You
--   must use a valid email address to complete account creation. You can't
--   access the root user of the account or remove an account that was
--   created with an invalid email address. Like all request parameters for
--   <tt>CreateGovCloudAccount</tt>, the request for the email address for
--   the AWS GovCloud (US) account originates from the commercial Region,
--   not from the AWS GovCloud (US) Region.
--   
--   <a>$sel:accountName:CreateGovCloudAccount'</a>,
--   <a>createGovCloudAccount_accountName</a> - The friendly name of the
--   member account.
newCreateGovCloudAccount :: Text -> Text -> CreateGovCloudAccount

-- | If set to <tt>ALLOW</tt>, the new linked account in the commercial
--   Region enables IAM users to access account billing information
--   <i>if</i> they have the required permissions. If set to <tt>DENY</tt>,
--   only the root user of the new account can access account billing
--   information. For more information, see <a>Activating Access to the
--   Billing and Cost Management Console</a> in the <i>AWS Billing and Cost
--   Management User Guide.</i>
--   
--   If you don't specify this parameter, the value defaults to
--   <tt>ALLOW</tt>, and IAM users and roles with the required permissions
--   can access billing information for the new account.
createGovCloudAccount_iamUserAccessToBilling :: Lens' CreateGovCloudAccount (Maybe IAMUserAccessToBilling)

-- | (Optional)
--   
--   The name of an IAM role that AWS Organizations automatically
--   preconfigures in the new member accounts in both the AWS GovCloud (US)
--   Region and in the commercial Region. This role trusts the management
--   account, allowing users in the management account to assume the role,
--   as permitted by the management account administrator. The role has
--   administrator permissions in the new member account.
--   
--   If you don't specify this parameter, the role name defaults to
--   <tt>OrganizationAccountAccessRole</tt>.
--   
--   For more information about how to use this role to access the member
--   account, see <a>Accessing and Administering the Member Accounts in
--   Your Organization</a> in the <i>AWS Organizations User Guide</i> and
--   steps 2 and 3 in <a>Tutorial: Delegate Access Across AWS Accounts
--   Using IAM Roles</a> in the <i>IAM User Guide.</i>
--   
--   The <a>regex pattern</a> that is used to validate this parameter. The
--   pattern can include uppercase letters, lowercase letters, digits with
--   no spaces, and any of the following characters: =,.@-
createGovCloudAccount_roleName :: Lens' CreateGovCloudAccount (Maybe Text)

-- | A list of tags that you want to attach to the newly created account.
--   These tags are attached to the commercial account associated with the
--   GovCloud account, and not to the GovCloud account itself. To add tags
--   to the actual GovCloud account, call the TagResource operation in the
--   GovCloud region after the new GovCloud account exists.
--   
--   For each tag in the list, you must specify both a tag key and a value.
--   You can set the value to an empty string, but you can't set it to
--   <tt>null</tt>. For more information about tagging, see <a>Tagging AWS
--   Organizations resources</a> in the AWS Organizations User Guide.
--   
--   If any one of the tags is invalid or if you exceed the allowed number
--   of tags for an account, then the entire request fails and the account
--   is not created.
createGovCloudAccount_tags :: Lens' CreateGovCloudAccount (Maybe [Tag])

-- | The email address of the owner to assign to the new member account in
--   the commercial Region. This email address must not already be
--   associated with another AWS account. You must use a valid email
--   address to complete account creation. You can't access the root user
--   of the account or remove an account that was created with an invalid
--   email address. Like all request parameters for
--   <tt>CreateGovCloudAccount</tt>, the request for the email address for
--   the AWS GovCloud (US) account originates from the commercial Region,
--   not from the AWS GovCloud (US) Region.
createGovCloudAccount_email :: Lens' CreateGovCloudAccount Text

createGovCloudAccount_accountName :: Lens' CreateGovCloudAccount Text

instance Network.AWS.Data.Path.ToPath Network.AWS.Organizations.CreateGovCloudAccount.CreateGovCloudAccount
instance Network.AWS.Data.Query.ToQuery Network.AWS.Organizations.CreateGovCloudAccount.CreateGovCloudAccount


-- | Creates an AWS account that is automatically a member of the
--   organization whose credentials made the request. This is an
--   asynchronous request that AWS performs in the background. Because
--   <tt>CreateAccount</tt> operates asynchronously, it can return a
--   successful completion message even though account initialization might
--   still be in progress. You might need to wait a few minutes before you
--   can successfully access the account. To check the status of the
--   request, do one of the following:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>Use the <tt>Id</tt> member of the <tt>CreateAccountStatus</tt>
--   response element from this operation to provide as a parameter to the
--   DescribeCreateAccountStatus operation.</li>
--   <li>Check the AWS CloudTrail log for the <tt>CreateAccountResult</tt>
--   event. For information on using AWS CloudTrail with AWS Organizations,
--   see <a>Logging and monitoring in AWS Organizations</a> in the <i>AWS
--   Organizations User Guide.</i></li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   The user who calls the API to create an account must have the
--   <tt>organizations:CreateAccount</tt> permission. If you enabled all
--   features in the organization, AWS Organizations creates the required
--   service-linked role named <tt>AWSServiceRoleForOrganizations</tt>. For
--   more information, see <a>AWS Organizations and Service-Linked
--   Roles</a> in the <i>AWS Organizations User Guide</i>.
--   
--   If the request includes tags, then the requester must have the
--   <tt>organizations:TagResource</tt> permission.
--   
--   AWS Organizations preconfigures the new member account with a role
--   (named <tt>OrganizationAccountAccessRole</tt> by default) that grants
--   users in the management account administrator permissions in the new
--   member account. Principals in the management account can assume the
--   role. AWS Organizations clones the company name and address
--   information for the new account from the organization's management
--   account.
--   
--   This operation can be called only from the organization's management
--   account.
--   
--   For more information about creating accounts, see <a>Creating an AWS
--   Account in Your Organization</a> in the <i>AWS Organizations User
--   Guide.</i>
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>When you create an account in an organization using the AWS
--   Organizations console, API, or CLI commands, the information required
--   for the account to operate as a standalone account, such as a payment
--   method and signing the end user license agreement (EULA) is <i>not</i>
--   automatically collected. If you must remove an account from your
--   organization later, you can do so only after you provide the missing
--   information. Follow the steps at <a>To leave an organization as a
--   member account</a> in the <i>AWS Organizations User Guide</i>.</li>
--   <li>If you get an exception that indicates that you exceeded your
--   account limits for the organization, contact <a>AWS Support</a>.</li>
--   <li>If you get an exception that indicates that the operation failed
--   because your organization is still initializing, wait one hour and
--   then try again. If the error persists, contact <a>AWS
--   Support</a>.</li>
--   <li>Using <tt>CreateAccount</tt> to create multiple temporary accounts
--   isn't recommended. You can only close an account from the Billing and
--   Cost Management Console, and you must be signed in as the root user.
--   For information on the requirements and process for closing an
--   account, see <a>Closing an AWS Account</a> in the <i>AWS Organizations
--   User Guide</i>.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   When you create a member account with this operation, you can choose
--   whether to create the account with the __IAM User and Role Access to
--   Billing Information__ switch enabled. If you enable it, IAM users and
--   roles that have appropriate permissions can view billing information
--   for the account. If you disable it, only the account root user can
--   access billing information. For information about how to disable this
--   switch for an account, see <a>Granting Access to Your Billing
--   Information and Tools</a>.
module Network.AWS.Organizations.CreateAccount

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newCreateAccount</a> smart constructor.
data CreateAccount
CreateAccount' :: Maybe IAMUserAccessToBilling -> Maybe Text -> Maybe [Tag] -> Sensitive Text -> Sensitive Text -> CreateAccount

-- | If set to <tt>ALLOW</tt>, the new account enables IAM users to access
--   account billing information <i>if</i> they have the required
--   permissions. If set to <tt>DENY</tt>, only the root user of the new
--   account can access account billing information. For more information,
--   see <a>Activating Access to the Billing and Cost Management
--   Console</a> in the <i>AWS Billing and Cost Management User Guide</i>.
--   
--   If you don't specify this parameter, the value defaults to
--   <tt>ALLOW</tt>, and IAM users and roles with the required permissions
--   can access billing information for the new account.
[$sel:iamUserAccessToBilling:CreateAccount'] :: CreateAccount -> Maybe IAMUserAccessToBilling

-- | (Optional)
--   
--   The name of an IAM role that AWS Organizations automatically
--   preconfigures in the new member account. This role trusts the
--   management account, allowing users in the management account to assume
--   the role, as permitted by the management account administrator. The
--   role has administrator permissions in the new member account.
--   
--   If you don't specify this parameter, the role name defaults to
--   <tt>OrganizationAccountAccessRole</tt>.
--   
--   For more information about how to use this role to access the member
--   account, see the following links:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>Accessing and Administering the Member Accounts in Your
--   Organization</a> in the <i>AWS Organizations User Guide</i></li>
--   <li>Steps 2 and 3 in <a>Tutorial: Delegate Access Across AWS Accounts
--   Using IAM Roles</a> in the <i>IAM User Guide</i></li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   The <a>regex pattern</a> that is used to validate this parameter. The
--   pattern can include uppercase letters, lowercase letters, digits with
--   no spaces, and any of the following characters: =,.@-
[$sel:roleName:CreateAccount'] :: CreateAccount -> Maybe Text

-- | A list of tags that you want to attach to the newly created account.
--   For each tag in the list, you must specify both a tag key and a value.
--   You can set the value to an empty string, but you can't set it to
--   <tt>null</tt>. For more information about tagging, see <a>Tagging AWS
--   Organizations resources</a> in the AWS Organizations User Guide.
--   
--   If any one of the tags is invalid or if you exceed the allowed number
--   of tags for an account, then the entire request fails and the account
--   is not created.
[$sel:tags:CreateAccount'] :: CreateAccount -> Maybe [Tag]

-- | The email address of the owner to assign to the new member account.
--   This email address must not already be associated with another AWS
--   account. You must use a valid email address to complete account
--   creation. You can't access the root user of the account or remove an
--   account that was created with an invalid email address.
[$sel:email:CreateAccount'] :: CreateAccount -> Sensitive Text

-- | The friendly name of the member account.
[$sel:accountName:CreateAccount'] :: CreateAccount -> Sensitive Text

-- | Create a value of <a>CreateAccount</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:iamUserAccessToBilling:CreateAccount'</a>,
--   <a>createAccount_iamUserAccessToBilling</a> - If set to
--   <tt>ALLOW</tt>, the new account enables IAM users to access account
--   billing information <i>if</i> they have the required permissions. If
--   set to <tt>DENY</tt>, only the root user of the new account can access
--   account billing information. For more information, see <a>Activating
--   Access to the Billing and Cost Management Console</a> in the <i>AWS
--   Billing and Cost Management User Guide</i>.
--   
--   If you don't specify this parameter, the value defaults to
--   <tt>ALLOW</tt>, and IAM users and roles with the required permissions
--   can access billing information for the new account.
--   
--   <a>$sel:roleName:CreateAccount'</a>, <a>createAccount_roleName</a> -
--   (Optional)
--   
--   The name of an IAM role that AWS Organizations automatically
--   preconfigures in the new member account. This role trusts the
--   management account, allowing users in the management account to assume
--   the role, as permitted by the management account administrator. The
--   role has administrator permissions in the new member account.
--   
--   If you don't specify this parameter, the role name defaults to
--   <tt>OrganizationAccountAccessRole</tt>.
--   
--   For more information about how to use this role to access the member
--   account, see the following links:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>Accessing and Administering the Member Accounts in Your
--   Organization</a> in the <i>AWS Organizations User Guide</i></li>
--   <li>Steps 2 and 3 in <a>Tutorial: Delegate Access Across AWS Accounts
--   Using IAM Roles</a> in the <i>IAM User Guide</i></li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   The <a>regex pattern</a> that is used to validate this parameter. The
--   pattern can include uppercase letters, lowercase letters, digits with
--   no spaces, and any of the following characters: =,.@-
--   
--   <a>$sel:tags:CreateAccount'</a>, <a>createAccount_tags</a> - A list of
--   tags that you want to attach to the newly created account. For each
--   tag in the list, you must specify both a tag key and a value. You can
--   set the value to an empty string, but you can't set it to
--   <tt>null</tt>. For more information about tagging, see <a>Tagging AWS
--   Organizations resources</a> in the AWS Organizations User Guide.
--   
--   If any one of the tags is invalid or if you exceed the allowed number
--   of tags for an account, then the entire request fails and the account
--   is not created.
--   
--   <a>$sel:email:CreateAccount'</a>, <a>createAccount_email</a> - The
--   email address of the owner to assign to the new member account. This
--   email address must not already be associated with another AWS account.
--   You must use a valid email address to complete account creation. You
--   can't access the root user of the account or remove an account that
--   was created with an invalid email address.
--   
--   <a>$sel:accountName:CreateAccount'</a>,
--   <a>createAccount_accountName</a> - The friendly name of the member
--   account.
newCreateAccount :: Text -> Text -> CreateAccount

-- | If set to <tt>ALLOW</tt>, the new account enables IAM users to access
--   account billing information <i>if</i> they have the required
--   permissions. If set to <tt>DENY</tt>, only the root user of the new
--   account can access account billing information. For more information,
--   see <a>Activating Access to the Billing and Cost Management
--   Console</a> in the <i>AWS Billing and Cost Management User Guide</i>.
--   
--   If you don't specify this parameter, the value defaults to
--   <tt>ALLOW</tt>, and IAM users and roles with the required permissions
--   can access billing information for the new account.
createAccount_iamUserAccessToBilling :: Lens' CreateAccount (Maybe IAMUserAccessToBilling)

-- | (Optional)
--   
--   The name of an IAM role that AWS Organizations automatically
--   preconfigures in the new member account. This role trusts the
--   management account, allowing users in the management account to assume
--   the role, as permitted by the management account administrator. The
--   role has administrator permissions in the new member account.
--   
--   If you don't specify this parameter, the role name defaults to
--   <tt>OrganizationAccountAccessRole</tt>.
--   
--   For more information about how to use this role to access the member
--   account, see the following links:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>Accessing and Administering the Member Accounts in Your
--   Organization</a> in the <i>AWS Organizations User Guide</i></li>
--   <li>Steps 2 and 3 in <a>Tutorial: Delegate Access Across AWS Accounts
--   Using IAM Roles</a> in the <i>IAM User Guide</i></li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   The <a>regex pattern</a> that is used to validate this parameter. The
--   pattern can include uppercase letters, lowercase letters, digits with
--   no spaces, and any of the following characters: =,.@-
createAccount_roleName :: Lens' CreateAccount (Maybe Text)

-- | A list of tags that you want to attach to the newly created account.
--   For each tag in the list, you must specify both a tag key and a value.
--   You can set the value to an empty string, but you can't set it to
--   <tt>null</tt>. For more information about tagging, see <a>Tagging AWS
--   Organizations resources</a> in the AWS Organizations User Guide.
--   
--   If any one of the tags is invalid or if you exceed the allowed number
--   of tags for an account, then the entire request fails and the account
--   is not created.
createAccount_tags :: Lens' CreateAccount (Maybe [Tag])

-- | The email address of the owner to assign to the new member account.
--   This email address must not already be associated with another AWS
--   account. You must use a valid email address to complete account
--   creation. You can't access the root user of the account or remove an
--   account that was created with an invalid email address.
createAccount_email :: Lens' CreateAccount Text

-- | The friendly name of the member account.
createAccount_accountName :: Lens' CreateAccount Text

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newCreateAccountResponse</a> smart constructor.
data CreateAccountResponse
CreateAccountResponse' :: Maybe CreateAccountStatus -> Int -> CreateAccountResponse

-- | A structure that contains details about the request to create an
--   account. This response structure might not be fully populated when you
--   first receive it because account creation is an asynchronous process.
--   You can pass the returned <tt>CreateAccountStatus</tt> ID as a
--   parameter to DescribeCreateAccountStatus to get status about the
--   progress of the request at later times. You can also check the AWS
--   CloudTrail log for the <tt>CreateAccountResult</tt> event. For more
--   information, see <a>Monitoring the Activity in Your Organization</a>
--   in the <i>AWS Organizations User Guide</i>.
[$sel:createAccountStatus:CreateAccountResponse'] :: CreateAccountResponse -> Maybe CreateAccountStatus

-- | The response's http status code.
[$sel:httpStatus:CreateAccountResponse'] :: CreateAccountResponse -> Int

-- | Create a value of <a>CreateAccountResponse</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:createAccountStatus:CreateAccountResponse'</a>,
--   <a>createAccountResponse_createAccountStatus</a> - A structure that
--   contains details about the request to create an account. This response
--   structure might not be fully populated when you first receive it
--   because account creation is an asynchronous process. You can pass the
--   returned <tt>CreateAccountStatus</tt> ID as a parameter to
--   DescribeCreateAccountStatus to get status about the progress of the
--   request at later times. You can also check the AWS CloudTrail log for
--   the <tt>CreateAccountResult</tt> event. For more information, see
--   <a>Monitoring the Activity in Your Organization</a> in the <i>AWS
--   Organizations User Guide</i>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:httpStatus:CreateAccountResponse'</a>,
--   <a>createAccountResponse_httpStatus</a> - The response's http status
--   code.
newCreateAccountResponse :: Int -> CreateAccountResponse

-- | A structure that contains details about the request to create an
--   account. This response structure might not be fully populated when you
--   first receive it because account creation is an asynchronous process.
--   You can pass the returned <tt>CreateAccountStatus</tt> ID as a
--   parameter to DescribeCreateAccountStatus to get status about the
--   progress of the request at later times. You can also check the AWS
--   CloudTrail log for the <tt>CreateAccountResult</tt> event. For more
--   information, see <a>Monitoring the Activity in Your Organization</a>
--   in the <i>AWS Organizations User Guide</i>.
createAccountResponse_createAccountStatus :: Lens' CreateAccountResponse (Maybe CreateAccountStatus)

-- | The response's http status code.
createAccountResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' CreateAccountResponse Int

-- | Cancels a handshake. Canceling a handshake sets the handshake state to
--   <tt>CANCELED</tt>.
--   
--   This operation can be called only from the account that originated the
--   handshake. The recipient of the handshake can't cancel it, but can use
--   DeclineHandshake instead. After a handshake is canceled, the recipient
--   can no longer respond to that handshake.
--   
--   After you cancel a handshake, it continues to appear in the results of
--   relevant APIs for only 30 days. After that, it's deleted.
module Network.AWS.Organizations.CancelHandshake

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newCancelHandshake</a> smart constructor.
data CancelHandshake
CancelHandshake' :: Text -> CancelHandshake

-- | The unique identifier (ID) of the handshake that you want to cancel.
--   You can get the ID from the ListHandshakesForOrganization operation.
--   
--   The <a>regex pattern</a> for handshake ID string requires "h-"
--   followed by from 8 to 32 lowercase letters or digits.
[$sel:handshakeId:CancelHandshake'] :: CancelHandshake -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>CancelHandshake</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:handshakeId:CancelHandshake'</a>,
--   <a>cancelHandshake_handshakeId</a> - The unique identifier (ID) of the
--   handshake that you want to cancel. You can get the ID from the
--   ListHandshakesForOrganization operation.
--   
--   The <a>regex pattern</a> for handshake ID string requires "h-"
--   followed by from 8 to 32 lowercase letters or digits.
newCancelHandshake :: Text -> CancelHandshake

-- | The unique identifier (ID) of the handshake that you want to cancel.
--   You can get the ID from the ListHandshakesForOrganization operation.
--   
--   The <a>regex pattern</a> for handshake ID string requires "h-"
--   followed by from 8 to 32 lowercase letters or digits.
cancelHandshake_handshakeId :: Lens' CancelHandshake Text

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newCancelHandshakeResponse</a> smart constructor.
data CancelHandshakeResponse
CancelHandshakeResponse' :: Maybe Handshake -> Int -> CancelHandshakeResponse

-- | A structure that contains details about the handshake that you
--   canceled.
[$sel:handshake:CancelHandshakeResponse'] :: CancelHandshakeResponse -> Maybe Handshake

-- | The response's http status code.
[$sel:httpStatus:CancelHandshakeResponse'] :: CancelHandshakeResponse -> Int

-- | Create a value of <a>CancelHandshakeResponse</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:handshake:CancelHandshakeResponse'</a>,
--   <a>cancelHandshakeResponse_handshake</a> - A structure that contains
--   details about the handshake that you canceled.
--   
--   <a>$sel:httpStatus:CancelHandshakeResponse'</a>,
--   <a>cancelHandshakeResponse_httpStatus</a> - The response's http status
--   code.
newCancelHandshakeResponse :: Int -> CancelHandshakeResponse

-- | A structure that contains details about the handshake that you
--   canceled.
cancelHandshakeResponse_handshake :: Lens' CancelHandshakeResponse (Maybe Handshake)

-- | The response's http status code.
cancelHandshakeResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' CancelHandshakeResponse Int
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.Organizations.CancelHandshake.CancelHandshake
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.Organizations.CancelHandshake.CancelHandshake
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.Organizations.CancelHandshake.CancelHandshake
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.Organizations.CancelHandshake.CancelHandshake
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.Organizations.CancelHandshake.CancelHandshakeResponse
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.Organizations.CancelHandshake.CancelHandshakeResponse
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.Organizations.CancelHandshake.CancelHandshakeResponse
instance Network.AWS.Types.AWSRequest Network.AWS.Organizations.CancelHandshake.CancelHandshake
