instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.Organizations.CancelHandshake.CancelHandshake
instance Network.AWS.Data.Headers.ToHeaders Network.AWS.Organizations.CancelHandshake.CancelHandshake
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.Organizations.CancelHandshake.CancelHandshake
instance Network.AWS.Data.Path.ToPath Network.AWS.Organizations.CancelHandshake.CancelHandshake
instance Network.AWS.Data.Query.ToQuery Network.AWS.Organizations.CancelHandshake.CancelHandshake


-- | Attaches a policy to a root, an organizational unit (OU), or an
--   individual account. How the policy affects accounts depends on the
--   type of policy. Refer to the <i>AWS Organizations User Guide</i> for
--   information about each policy type:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>AISERVICES_OPT_OUT_POLICY</a></li>
--   <li><a>BACKUP_POLICY</a></li>
--   <li><a>SERVICE_CONTROL_POLICY</a></li>
--   <li><a>TAG_POLICY</a></li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   This operation can be called only from the organization's management
--   account.
module Network.AWS.Organizations.AttachPolicy

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newAttachPolicy</a> smart constructor.
data AttachPolicy
AttachPolicy' :: Text -> Text -> AttachPolicy

-- | The unique identifier (ID) of the policy that you want to attach to
--   the target. You can get the ID for the policy by calling the
--   ListPolicies operation.
--   
--   The <a>regex pattern</a> for a policy ID string requires "p-" followed
--   by from 8 to 128 lowercase or uppercase letters, digits, or the
--   underscore character (_).
[$sel:policyId:AttachPolicy'] :: AttachPolicy -> Text

-- | The unique identifier (ID) of the root, OU, or account that you want
--   to attach the policy to. You can get the ID by calling the ListRoots,
--   ListOrganizationalUnitsForParent, or ListAccounts operations.
--   
--   The <a>regex pattern</a> for a target ID string requires one of the
--   following:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><b>Root</b> - A string that begins with "r-" followed by from 4 to
--   32 lowercase letters or digits.</li>
--   <li><b>Account</b> - A string that consists of exactly 12 digits.</li>
--   <li><b>Organizational unit (OU)</b> - A string that begins with "ou-"
--   followed by from 4 to 32 lowercase letters or digits (the ID of the
--   root that the OU is in). This string is followed by a second "-" dash
--   and from 8 to 32 additional lowercase letters or digits.</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:targetId:AttachPolicy'] :: AttachPolicy -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>AttachPolicy</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:policyId:AttachPolicy'</a>, <a>attachPolicy_policyId</a> - The
--   unique identifier (ID) of the policy that you want to attach to the
--   target. You can get the ID for the policy by calling the ListPolicies
--   operation.
--   
--   The <a>regex pattern</a> for a policy ID string requires "p-" followed
--   by from 8 to 128 lowercase or uppercase letters, digits, or the
--   underscore character (_).
--   
--   <a>$sel:targetId:AttachPolicy'</a>, <a>attachPolicy_targetId</a> - The
--   unique identifier (ID) of the root, OU, or account that you want to
--   attach the policy to. You can get the ID by calling the ListRoots,
--   ListOrganizationalUnitsForParent, or ListAccounts operations.
--   
--   The <a>regex pattern</a> for a target ID string requires one of the
--   following:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><b>Root</b> - A string that begins with "r-" followed by from 4 to
--   32 lowercase letters or digits.</li>
--   <li><b>Account</b> - A string that consists of exactly 12 digits.</li>
--   <li><b>Organizational unit (OU)</b> - A string that begins with "ou-"
--   followed by from 4 to 32 lowercase letters or digits (the ID of the
--   root that the OU is in). This string is followed by a second "-" dash
--   and from 8 to 32 additional lowercase letters or digits.</li>
--   </ul>
newAttachPolicy :: Text -> Text -> AttachPolicy

-- | The unique identifier (ID) of the policy that you want to attach to
--   the target. You can get the ID for the policy by calling the
--   ListPolicies operation.
--   
--   The <a>regex pattern</a> for a policy ID string requires "p-" followed
--   by from 8 to 128 lowercase or uppercase letters, digits, or the
--   underscore character (_).
attachPolicy_policyId :: Lens' AttachPolicy Text

-- | The unique identifier (ID) of the root, OU, or account that you want
--   to attach the policy to. You can get the ID by calling the ListRoots,
--   ListOrganizationalUnitsForParent, or ListAccounts operations.
--   
--   The <a>regex pattern</a> for a target ID string requires one of the
--   following:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><b>Root</b> - A string that begins with "r-" followed by from 4 to
--   32 lowercase letters or digits.</li>
--   <li><b>Account</b> - A string that consists of exactly 12 digits.</li>
--   <li><b>Organizational unit (OU)</b> - A string that begins with "ou-"
--   followed by from 4 to 32 lowercase letters or digits (the ID of the
--   root that the OU is in). This string is followed by a second "-" dash
--   and from 8 to 32 additional lowercase letters or digits.</li>
--   </ul>
attachPolicy_targetId :: Lens' AttachPolicy Text

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newAttachPolicyResponse</a> smart constructor.
data AttachPolicyResponse
AttachPolicyResponse' :: AttachPolicyResponse

-- | Create a value of <a>AttachPolicyResponse</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
newAttachPolicyResponse :: AttachPolicyResponse
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.Organizations.AttachPolicy.AttachPolicy
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.Organizations.AttachPolicy.AttachPolicy
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.Organizations.AttachPolicy.AttachPolicy
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.Organizations.AttachPolicy.AttachPolicy
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.Organizations.AttachPolicy.AttachPolicyResponse
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.Organizations.AttachPolicy.AttachPolicyResponse
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.Organizations.AttachPolicy.AttachPolicyResponse
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.Organizations.AttachPolicy.AttachPolicyResponse
instance Network.AWS.Types.AWSRequest Network.AWS.Organizations.AttachPolicy.AttachPolicy
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.Organizations.AttachPolicy.AttachPolicyResponse
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.Organizations.AttachPolicy.AttachPolicy
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.Organizations.AttachPolicy.AttachPolicy
instance Network.AWS.Data.Headers.ToHeaders Network.AWS.Organizations.AttachPolicy.AttachPolicy
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.Organizations.AttachPolicy.AttachPolicy
instance Network.AWS.Data.Path.ToPath Network.AWS.Organizations.AttachPolicy.AttachPolicy
instance Network.AWS.Data.Query.ToQuery Network.AWS.Organizations.AttachPolicy.AttachPolicy


-- | Sends a response to the originator of a handshake agreeing to the
--   action proposed by the handshake request.
--   
--   This operation can be called only by the following principals when
--   they also have the relevant IAM permissions:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><b>Invitation to join</b> or <b>Approve all features request</b>
--   handshakes: only a principal from the member account.The user who
--   calls the API for an invitation to join must have the
--   <tt>organizations:AcceptHandshake</tt> permission. If you enabled all
--   features in the organization, the user must also have the
--   <tt>iam:CreateServiceLinkedRole</tt> permission so that AWS
--   Organizations can create the required service-linked role named
--   <tt>AWSServiceRoleForOrganizations</tt>. For more information, see
--   <a>AWS Organizations and Service-Linked Roles</a> in the <i>AWS
--   Organizations User Guide</i>.</li>
--   <li><b>Enable all features final confirmation</b> handshake: only a
--   principal from the management account.For more information about
--   invitations, see <a>Inviting an AWS Account to Join Your
--   Organization</a> in the <i>AWS Organizations User Guide.</i> For more
--   information about requests to enable all features in the organization,
--   see <a>Enabling All Features in Your Organization</a> in the <i>AWS
--   Organizations User Guide.</i></li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   After you accept a handshake, it continues to appear in the results of
--   relevant APIs for only 30 days. After that, it's deleted.
module Network.AWS.Organizations.AcceptHandshake

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newAcceptHandshake</a> smart constructor.
data AcceptHandshake
AcceptHandshake' :: Text -> AcceptHandshake

-- | The unique identifier (ID) of the handshake that you want to accept.
--   
--   The <a>regex pattern</a> for handshake ID string requires "h-"
--   followed by from 8 to 32 lowercase letters or digits.
[$sel:handshakeId:AcceptHandshake'] :: AcceptHandshake -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>AcceptHandshake</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:handshakeId:AcceptHandshake'</a>,
--   <a>acceptHandshake_handshakeId</a> - The unique identifier (ID) of the
--   handshake that you want to accept.
--   
--   The <a>regex pattern</a> for handshake ID string requires "h-"
--   followed by from 8 to 32 lowercase letters or digits.
newAcceptHandshake :: Text -> AcceptHandshake

-- | The unique identifier (ID) of the handshake that you want to accept.
--   
--   The <a>regex pattern</a> for handshake ID string requires "h-"
--   followed by from 8 to 32 lowercase letters or digits.
acceptHandshake_handshakeId :: Lens' AcceptHandshake Text

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newAcceptHandshakeResponse</a> smart constructor.
data AcceptHandshakeResponse
AcceptHandshakeResponse' :: Maybe Handshake -> Int -> AcceptHandshakeResponse

-- | A structure that contains details about the accepted handshake.
[$sel:handshake:AcceptHandshakeResponse'] :: AcceptHandshakeResponse -> Maybe Handshake

-- | The response's http status code.
[$sel:httpStatus:AcceptHandshakeResponse'] :: AcceptHandshakeResponse -> Int

-- | Create a value of <a>AcceptHandshakeResponse</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:handshake:AcceptHandshakeResponse'</a>,
--   <a>acceptHandshakeResponse_handshake</a> - A structure that contains
--   details about the accepted handshake.
--   
--   <a>$sel:httpStatus:AcceptHandshakeResponse'</a>,
--   <a>acceptHandshakeResponse_httpStatus</a> - The response's http status
--   code.
newAcceptHandshakeResponse :: Int -> AcceptHandshakeResponse

-- | A structure that contains details about the accepted handshake.
acceptHandshakeResponse_handshake :: Lens' AcceptHandshakeResponse (Maybe Handshake)

-- | The response's http status code.
acceptHandshakeResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' AcceptHandshakeResponse Int
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.Organizations.AcceptHandshake.AcceptHandshake
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.Organizations.AcceptHandshake.AcceptHandshake
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.Organizations.AcceptHandshake.AcceptHandshake
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.Organizations.AcceptHandshake.AcceptHandshake
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.Organizations.AcceptHandshake.AcceptHandshakeResponse
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.Organizations.AcceptHandshake.AcceptHandshakeResponse
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.Organizations.AcceptHandshake.AcceptHandshakeResponse
instance Network.AWS.Types.AWSRequest Network.AWS.Organizations.AcceptHandshake.AcceptHandshake
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.Organizations.AcceptHandshake.AcceptHandshakeResponse
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.Organizations.AcceptHandshake.AcceptHandshake
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.Organizations.AcceptHandshake.AcceptHandshake
instance Network.AWS.Data.Headers.ToHeaders Network.AWS.Organizations.AcceptHandshake.AcceptHandshake
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.Organizations.AcceptHandshake.AcceptHandshake
instance Network.AWS.Data.Path.ToPath Network.AWS.Organizations.AcceptHandshake.AcceptHandshake
instance Network.AWS.Data.Query.ToQuery Network.AWS.Organizations.AcceptHandshake.AcceptHandshake


-- | Removes any tags with the specified keys from the specified resource.
--   
--   You can attach tags to the following resources in AWS Organizations.
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>AWS account</li>
--   <li>Organization root</li>
--   <li>Organizational unit (OU)</li>
--   <li>Policy (any type)</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   This operation can be called only from the organization's management
--   account.
module Network.AWS.Organizations.UntagResource

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newUntagResource</a> smart constructor.
data UntagResource
UntagResource' :: Text -> [Text] -> UntagResource

-- | The ID of the resource to remove a tag from.
--   
--   You can specify any of the following taggable resources.
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>AWS account – specify the account ID number.</li>
--   <li>Organizational unit – specify the OU ID that begins with
--   <tt>ou-</tt> and looks similar to: <tt>ou-1a2b-34uvwxyz </tt></li>
--   <li>Root – specify the root ID that begins with <tt>r-</tt> and looks
--   similar to: <tt>r-1a2b </tt></li>
--   <li>Policy – specify the policy ID that begins with <tt>p-</tt>
--   andlooks similar to: <tt>p-12abcdefg3 </tt></li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:resourceId:UntagResource'] :: UntagResource -> Text

-- | The list of keys for tags to remove from the specified resource.
[$sel:tagKeys:UntagResource'] :: UntagResource -> [Text]

-- | Create a value of <a>UntagResource</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:resourceId:UntagResource'</a>, <a>untagResource_resourceId</a>
--   - The ID of the resource to remove a tag from.
--   
--   You can specify any of the following taggable resources.
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>AWS account – specify the account ID number.</li>
--   <li>Organizational unit – specify the OU ID that begins with
--   <tt>ou-</tt> and looks similar to: <tt>ou-1a2b-34uvwxyz </tt></li>
--   <li>Root – specify the root ID that begins with <tt>r-</tt> and looks
--   similar to: <tt>r-1a2b </tt></li>
--   <li>Policy – specify the policy ID that begins with <tt>p-</tt>
--   andlooks similar to: <tt>p-12abcdefg3 </tt></li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:tagKeys:UntagResource'</a>, <a>untagResource_tagKeys</a> - The
--   list of keys for tags to remove from the specified resource.
newUntagResource :: Text -> UntagResource

-- | The ID of the resource to remove a tag from.
--   
--   You can specify any of the following taggable resources.
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>AWS account – specify the account ID number.</li>
--   <li>Organizational unit – specify the OU ID that begins with
--   <tt>ou-</tt> and looks similar to: <tt>ou-1a2b-34uvwxyz </tt></li>
--   <li>Root – specify the root ID that begins with <tt>r-</tt> and looks
--   similar to: <tt>r-1a2b </tt></li>
--   <li>Policy – specify the policy ID that begins with <tt>p-</tt>
--   andlooks similar to: <tt>p-12abcdefg3 </tt></li>
--   </ul>
untagResource_resourceId :: Lens' UntagResource Text

-- | The list of keys for tags to remove from the specified resource.
untagResource_tagKeys :: Lens' UntagResource [Text]

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newUntagResourceResponse</a> smart constructor.
data UntagResourceResponse
UntagResourceResponse' :: UntagResourceResponse

-- | Create a value of <a>UntagResourceResponse</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
newUntagResourceResponse :: UntagResourceResponse
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.Organizations.UntagResource.UntagResource
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.Organizations.UntagResource.UntagResource
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.Organizations.UntagResource.UntagResource
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.Organizations.UntagResource.UntagResource
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.Organizations.UntagResource.UntagResourceResponse
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.Organizations.UntagResource.UntagResourceResponse
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.Organizations.UntagResource.UntagResourceResponse
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.Organizations.UntagResource.UntagResourceResponse
instance Network.AWS.Types.AWSRequest Network.AWS.Organizations.UntagResource.UntagResource
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.Organizations.UntagResource.UntagResourceResponse
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.Organizations.UntagResource.UntagResource
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.Organizations.UntagResource.UntagResource
instance Network.AWS.Data.Headers.ToHeaders Network.AWS.Organizations.UntagResource.UntagResource
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.Organizations.UntagResource.UntagResource
instance Network.AWS.Data.Path.ToPath Network.AWS.Organizations.UntagResource.UntagResource
instance Network.AWS.Data.Query.ToQuery Network.AWS.Organizations.UntagResource.UntagResource


-- | Renames the specified organizational unit (OU). The ID and ARN don't
--   change. The child OUs and accounts remain in place, and any attached
--   policies of the OU remain attached.
--   
--   This operation can be called only from the organization's management
--   account.
module Network.AWS.Organizations.UpdateOrganizationalUnit

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newUpdateOrganizationalUnit</a> smart constructor.
data UpdateOrganizationalUnit
UpdateOrganizationalUnit' :: Maybe Text -> Text -> UpdateOrganizationalUnit

-- | The new name that you want to assign to the OU.
--   
--   The <a>regex pattern</a> that is used to validate this parameter is a
--   string of any of the characters in the ASCII character range.
[$sel:name:UpdateOrganizationalUnit'] :: UpdateOrganizationalUnit -> Maybe Text

-- | The unique identifier (ID) of the OU that you want to rename. You can
--   get the ID from the ListOrganizationalUnitsForParent operation.
--   
--   The <a>regex pattern</a> for an organizational unit ID string requires
--   "ou-" followed by from 4 to 32 lowercase letters or digits (the ID of
--   the root that contains the OU). This string is followed by a second
--   "-" dash and from 8 to 32 additional lowercase letters or digits.
[$sel:organizationalUnitId:UpdateOrganizationalUnit'] :: UpdateOrganizationalUnit -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>UpdateOrganizationalUnit</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:UpdateOrganizationalUnit'</a>,
--   <a>updateOrganizationalUnit_name</a> - The new name that you want to
--   assign to the OU.
--   
--   The <a>regex pattern</a> that is used to validate this parameter is a
--   string of any of the characters in the ASCII character range.
--   
--   <a>$sel:organizationalUnitId:UpdateOrganizationalUnit'</a>,
--   <a>updateOrganizationalUnit_organizationalUnitId</a> - The unique
--   identifier (ID) of the OU that you want to rename. You can get the ID
--   from the ListOrganizationalUnitsForParent operation.
--   
--   The <a>regex pattern</a> for an organizational unit ID string requires
--   "ou-" followed by from 4 to 32 lowercase letters or digits (the ID of
--   the root that contains the OU). This string is followed by a second
--   "-" dash and from 8 to 32 additional lowercase letters or digits.
newUpdateOrganizationalUnit :: Text -> UpdateOrganizationalUnit

-- | The new name that you want to assign to the OU.
--   
--   The <a>regex pattern</a> that is used to validate this parameter is a
--   string of any of the characters in the ASCII character range.
updateOrganizationalUnit_name :: Lens' UpdateOrganizationalUnit (Maybe Text)

-- | The unique identifier (ID) of the OU that you want to rename. You can
--   get the ID from the ListOrganizationalUnitsForParent operation.
--   
--   The <a>regex pattern</a> for an organizational unit ID string requires
--   "ou-" followed by from 4 to 32 lowercase letters or digits (the ID of
--   the root that contains the OU). This string is followed by a second
--   "-" dash and from 8 to 32 additional lowercase letters or digits.
updateOrganizationalUnit_organizationalUnitId :: Lens' UpdateOrganizationalUnit Text

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newUpdateOrganizationalUnitResponse</a> smart
--   constructor.
data UpdateOrganizationalUnitResponse
UpdateOrganizationalUnitResponse' :: Maybe OrganizationalUnit -> Int -> UpdateOrganizationalUnitResponse

-- | A structure that contains the details about the specified OU,
--   including its new name.
[$sel:organizationalUnit:UpdateOrganizationalUnitResponse'] :: UpdateOrganizationalUnitResponse -> Maybe OrganizationalUnit

-- | The response's http status code.
[$sel:httpStatus:UpdateOrganizationalUnitResponse'] :: UpdateOrganizationalUnitResponse -> Int

-- | Create a value of <a>UpdateOrganizationalUnitResponse</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:organizationalUnit:UpdateOrganizationalUnitResponse'</a>,
--   <a>updateOrganizationalUnitResponse_organizationalUnit</a> - A
--   structure that contains the details about the specified OU, including
--   its new name.
--   
--   <a>$sel:httpStatus:UpdateOrganizationalUnitResponse'</a>,
--   <a>updateOrganizationalUnitResponse_httpStatus</a> - The response's
--   http status code.
newUpdateOrganizationalUnitResponse :: Int -> UpdateOrganizationalUnitResponse

-- | A structure that contains the details about the specified OU,
--   including its new name.
updateOrganizationalUnitResponse_organizationalUnit :: Lens' UpdateOrganizationalUnitResponse (Maybe OrganizationalUnit)

-- | The response's http status code.
updateOrganizationalUnitResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' UpdateOrganizationalUnitResponse Int
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.Organizations.UpdateOrganizationalUnit.UpdateOrganizationalUnit
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.Organizations.UpdateOrganizationalUnit.UpdateOrganizationalUnit
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.Organizations.UpdateOrganizationalUnit.UpdateOrganizationalUnit
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.Organizations.UpdateOrganizationalUnit.UpdateOrganizationalUnit
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.Organizations.UpdateOrganizationalUnit.UpdateOrganizationalUnitResponse
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.Organizations.UpdateOrganizationalUnit.UpdateOrganizationalUnitResponse
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.Organizations.UpdateOrganizationalUnit.UpdateOrganizationalUnitResponse
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.Organizations.UpdateOrganizationalUnit.UpdateOrganizationalUnitResponse
instance Network.AWS.Types.AWSRequest Network.AWS.Organizations.UpdateOrganizationalUnit.UpdateOrganizationalUnit
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.Organizations.UpdateOrganizationalUnit.UpdateOrganizationalUnitResponse

instance Network.AWS.Data.Query.ToQuery Network.AWS.Organizations.UpdateOrganizationalUnit.UpdateOrganizationalUnit


-- | Updates an existing policy with a new name, description, or content.
--   If you don't supply any parameter, that value remains unchanged. You
--   can't change a policy's type.
--   
--   This operation can be called only from the organization's management
--   account.
module Network.AWS.Organizations.UpdatePolicy

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newUpdatePolicy</a> smart constructor.
data UpdatePolicy
UpdatePolicy' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Text -> UpdatePolicy

-- | If provided, the new content for the policy. The text must be
--   correctly formatted JSON that complies with the syntax for the
--   policy's type. For more information, see <a>Service Control Policy
--   Syntax</a> in the <i>AWS Organizations User Guide.</i>
[$sel:content:UpdatePolicy'] :: UpdatePolicy -> Maybe Text

-- | If provided, the new name for the policy.
--   
--   The <a>regex pattern</a> that is used to validate this parameter is a
--   string of any of the characters in the ASCII character range.
[$sel:name:UpdatePolicy'] :: UpdatePolicy -> Maybe Text

-- | If provided, the new description for the policy.
[$sel:description:UpdatePolicy'] :: UpdatePolicy -> Maybe Text

-- | The unique identifier (ID) of the policy that you want to update.
--   
--   The <a>regex pattern</a> for a policy ID string requires "p-" followed
--   by from 8 to 128 lowercase or uppercase letters, digits, or the
--   underscore character (_).
[$sel:policyId:UpdatePolicy'] :: UpdatePolicy -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>UpdatePolicy</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:content:UpdatePolicy'</a>, <a>updatePolicy_content</a> - If
--   provided, the new content for the policy. The text must be correctly
--   formatted JSON that complies with the syntax for the policy's type.
--   For more information, see <a>Service Control Policy Syntax</a> in the
--   <i>AWS Organizations User Guide.</i>
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:UpdatePolicy'</a>, <a>updatePolicy_name</a> - If
--   provided, the new name for the policy.
--   
--   The <a>regex pattern</a> that is used to validate this parameter is a
--   string of any of the characters in the ASCII character range.
--   
--   <a>$sel:description:UpdatePolicy'</a>, <a>updatePolicy_description</a>
--   - If provided, the new description for the policy.
--   
--   <a>$sel:policyId:UpdatePolicy'</a>, <a>updatePolicy_policyId</a> - The
--   unique identifier (ID) of the policy that you want to update.
--   
--   The <a>regex pattern</a> for a policy ID string requires "p-" followed
--   by from 8 to 128 lowercase or uppercase letters, digits, or the
--   underscore character (_).
newUpdatePolicy :: Text -> UpdatePolicy

-- | If provided, the new content for the policy. The text must be
--   correctly formatted JSON that complies with the syntax for the
--   policy's type. For more information, see <a>Service Control Policy
--   Syntax</a> in the <i>AWS Organizations User Guide.</i>
updatePolicy_content :: Lens' UpdatePolicy (Maybe Text)

-- | If provided, the new name for the policy.
--   
--   The <a>regex pattern</a> that is used to validate this parameter is a
--   string of any of the characters in the ASCII character range.
updatePolicy_name :: Lens' UpdatePolicy (Maybe Text)

-- | If provided, the new description for the policy.
updatePolicy_description :: Lens' UpdatePolicy (Maybe Text)

-- | The unique identifier (ID) of the policy that you want to update.
--   
--   The <a>regex pattern</a> for a policy ID string requires "p-" followed
--   by from 8 to 128 lowercase or uppercase letters, digits, or the
--   underscore character (_).
updatePolicy_policyId :: Lens' UpdatePolicy Text

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newUpdatePolicyResponse</a> smart constructor.
data UpdatePolicyResponse
UpdatePolicyResponse' :: Maybe Policy -> Int -> UpdatePolicyResponse

-- | A structure that contains details about the updated policy, showing
--   the requested changes.
[$sel:policy:UpdatePolicyResponse'] :: UpdatePolicyResponse -> Maybe Policy

-- | The response's http status code.
[$sel:httpStatus:UpdatePolicyResponse'] :: UpdatePolicyResponse -> Int

-- | Create a value of <a>UpdatePolicyResponse</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:policy:UpdatePolicyResponse'</a>,
--   <a>updatePolicyResponse_policy</a> - A structure that contains details
--   about the updated policy, showing the requested changes.
--   
--   <a>$sel:httpStatus:UpdatePolicyResponse'</a>,
--   <a>updatePolicyResponse_httpStatus</a> - The response's http status
--   code.
newUpdatePolicyResponse :: Int -> UpdatePolicyResponse

-- | A structure that contains details about the updated policy, showing
--   the requested changes.
updatePolicyResponse_policy :: Lens' UpdatePolicyResponse (Maybe Policy)

-- | The response's http status code.
updatePolicyResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' UpdatePolicyResponse Int
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.Organizations.UpdatePolicy.UpdatePolicy
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.Organizations.UpdatePolicy.UpdatePolicy
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.Organizations.UpdatePolicy.UpdatePolicy
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.Organizations.UpdatePolicy.UpdatePolicy

module Network.AWS.Organizations.Lens

-- | The parameter for receiving additional results if you receive a
--   <tt>NextToken</tt> response in a previous request. A
--   <tt>NextToken</tt> response indicates that more output is available.
--   Set this parameter to the value of the previous call's
--   <tt>NextToken</tt> response to indicate where the output should
--   continue from.
listHandshakesForAccount_nextToken :: Lens' ListHandshakesForAccount (Maybe Text)

-- | Filters the handshakes that you want included in the response. The
--   default is all types. Use the <tt>ActionType</tt> element to limit the
--   output to only a specified type, such as <tt>INVITE</tt>,
--   <tt>ENABLE_ALL_FEATURES</tt>, or <tt>APPROVE_ALL_FEATURES</tt>.
--   Alternatively, for the <tt>ENABLE_ALL_FEATURES</tt> handshake that
--   generates a separate child handshake for each member account, you can
--   specify <tt>ParentHandshakeId</tt> to see only the handshakes that
--   were generated by that parent request.
listHandshakesForAccount_filter :: Lens' ListHandshakesForAccount (Maybe HandshakeFilter)

-- | The total number of results that you want included on each page of the
--   response. If you do not include this parameter, it defaults to a value
--   that is specific to the operation. If additional items exist beyond
--   the maximum you specify, the <tt>NextToken</tt> response element is
--   present and has a value (is not null). Include that value as the
--   <tt>NextToken</tt> request parameter in the next call to the operation
--   to get the next part of the results. Note that Organizations might
--   return fewer results than the maximum even when there are more results
--   available. You should check <tt>NextToken</tt> after every operation
--   to ensure that you receive all of the results.
listHandshakesForAccount_maxResults :: Lens' ListHandshakesForAccount (Maybe Natural)

-- | A list of Handshake objects with details about each of the handshakes
--   that is associated with the specified account.
listHandshakesForAccountResponse_handshakes :: Lens' ListHandshakesForAccountResponse (Maybe [Handshake])

-- | If present, indicates that more output is available than is included
--   in the current response. Use this value in the <tt>NextToken</tt>
--   request parameter in a subsequent call to the operation to get the
--   next part of the output. You should repeat this until the
--   <tt>NextToken</tt> response element comes back as <tt>null</tt>.
listHandshakesForAccountResponse_nextToken :: Lens' ListHandshakesForAccountResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | The response's http status code.
listHandshakesForAccountResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' ListHandshakesForAccountResponse Int

-- | The unique identifier (ID) of the AWS account that you want
--   information about. You can get the ID from the ListAccounts or
--   ListAccountsForParent operations.
--   
--   The <a>regex pattern</a> for an account ID string requires exactly 12
--   digits.
describeAccount_accountId :: Lens' DescribeAccount Text

-- | A structure that contains information about the requested account.
describeAccountResponse_account :: Lens' DescribeAccountResponse (Maybe Account)

-- | The response's http status code.
describeAccountResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' DescribeAccountResponse Int

-- | The parameter for receiving additional results if you receive a
--   <tt>NextToken</tt> response in a previous request. A
--   <tt>NextToken</tt> response indicates that more output is available.
--   Set this parameter to the value of the previous call's
--   <tt>NextToken</tt> response to indicate where the output should
--   continue from.
listPolicies_nextToken :: Lens' ListPolicies (Maybe Text)

-- | The total number of results that you want included on each page of the
--   response. If you do not include this parameter, it defaults to a value
--   that is specific to the operation. If additional items exist beyond
--   the maximum you specify, the <tt>NextToken</tt> response element is
--   present and has a value (is not null). Include that value as the
--   <tt>NextToken</tt> request parameter in the next call to the operation
--   to get the next part of the results. Note that Organizations might
--   return fewer results than the maximum even when there are more results
--   available. You should check <tt>NextToken</tt> after every operation
--   to ensure that you receive all of the results.
listPolicies_maxResults :: Lens' ListPolicies (Maybe Natural)

-- | Specifies the type of policy that you want to include in the response.
--   You must specify one of the following values:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>AISERVICES_OPT_OUT_POLICY</a></li>
--   <li><a>BACKUP_POLICY</a></li>
--   <li><a>SERVICE_CONTROL_POLICY</a></li>
--   <li><a>TAG_POLICY</a></li>
--   </ul>
listPolicies_filter :: Lens' ListPolicies PolicyType

-- | If present, indicates that more output is available than is included
--   in the current response. Use this value in the <tt>NextToken</tt>
--   request parameter in a subsequent call to the operation to get the
--   next part of the output. You should repeat this until the
--   <tt>NextToken</tt> response element comes back as <tt>null</tt>.
listPoliciesResponse_nextToken :: Lens' ListPoliciesResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | A list of policies that match the filter criteria in the request. The
--   output list doesn't include the policy contents. To see the content
--   for a policy, see DescribePolicy.
listPoliciesResponse_policies :: Lens' ListPoliciesResponse (Maybe [PolicySummary])

-- | The response's http status code.
listPoliciesResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' ListPoliciesResponse Int

-- | A list of tags that you want to attach to the newly created policy.
--   For each tag in the list, you must specify both a tag key and a value.
--   You can set the value to an empty string, but you can't set it to
--   <tt>null</tt>. For more information about tagging, see <a>Tagging AWS
--   Organizations resources</a> in the AWS Organizations User Guide.
--   
--   If any one of the tags is invalid or if you exceed the allowed number
--   of tags for a policy, then the entire request fails and the policy is
--   not created.
createPolicy_tags :: Lens' CreatePolicy (Maybe [Tag])

-- | The policy text content to add to the new policy. The text that you
--   supply must adhere to the rules of the policy type you specify in the
--   <tt>Type</tt> parameter.
createPolicy_content :: Lens' CreatePolicy Text

-- | An optional description to assign to the policy.
createPolicy_description :: Lens' CreatePolicy Text

-- | The friendly name to assign to the policy.
--   
--   The <a>regex pattern</a> that is used to validate this parameter is a
--   string of any of the characters in the ASCII character range.
createPolicy_name :: Lens' CreatePolicy Text

-- | The type of policy to create. You can specify one of the following
--   values:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>AISERVICES_OPT_OUT_POLICY</a></li>
--   <li><a>BACKUP_POLICY</a></li>
--   <li><a>SERVICE_CONTROL_POLICY</a></li>
--   <li><a>TAG_POLICY</a></li>
--   </ul>
createPolicy_type :: Lens' CreatePolicy PolicyType

-- | A structure that contains details about the newly created policy.
createPolicyResponse_policy :: Lens' CreatePolicyResponse (Maybe Policy)

-- | The response's http status code.
createPolicyResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' CreatePolicyResponse Int

-- | The parameter for receiving additional results if you receive a
--   <tt>NextToken</tt> response in a previous request. A
--   <tt>NextToken</tt> response indicates that more output is available.
--   Set this parameter to the value of the previous call's
--   <tt>NextToken</tt> response to indicate where the output should
--   continue from.
listRoots_nextToken :: Lens' ListRoots (Maybe Text)

-- | The total number of results that you want included on each page of the
--   response. If you do not include this parameter, it defaults to a value
--   that is specific to the operation. If additional items exist beyond
--   the maximum you specify, the <tt>NextToken</tt> response element is
--   present and has a value (is not null). Include that value as the
--   <tt>NextToken</tt> request parameter in the next call to the operation
--   to get the next part of the results. Note that Organizations might
--   return fewer results than the maximum even when there are more results
--   available. You should check <tt>NextToken</tt> after every operation
--   to ensure that you receive all of the results.
listRoots_maxResults :: Lens' ListRoots (Maybe Natural)

-- | A list of roots that are defined in an organization.
listRootsResponse_roots :: Lens' ListRootsResponse (Maybe [Root])

-- | If present, indicates that more output is available than is included
--   in the current response. Use this value in the <tt>NextToken</tt>
--   request parameter in a subsequent call to the operation to get the
--   next part of the output. You should repeat this until the
--   <tt>NextToken</tt> response element comes back as <tt>null</tt>.
listRootsResponse_nextToken :: Lens' ListRootsResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | The response's http status code.
listRootsResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' ListRootsResponse Int

-- | The unique identifier (ID) of the handshake that you want to accept.
--   
--   The <a>regex pattern</a> for handshake ID string requires "h-"
--   followed by from 8 to 32 lowercase letters or digits.
acceptHandshake_handshakeId :: Lens' AcceptHandshake Text

-- | A structure that contains details about the accepted handshake.
acceptHandshakeResponse_handshake :: Lens' AcceptHandshakeResponse (Maybe Handshake)

-- | The response's http status code.
acceptHandshakeResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' AcceptHandshakeResponse Int

-- | Specifies the feature set supported by the new organization. Each
--   feature set supports different levels of functionality.
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>CONSOLIDATED_BILLING</tt>: All member accounts have their
--   bills consolidated to and paid by the management account. For more
--   information, see <a>Consolidated billing</a> in the <i>AWS
--   Organizations User Guide.</i>The consolidated billing feature subset
--   isn't available for organizations in the AWS GovCloud (US)
--   Region.</li>
--   <li><tt>ALL</tt>: In addition to all the features supported by the
--   consolidated billing feature set, the management account can also
--   apply any policy type to any member account in the organization. For
--   more information, see <a>All features</a> in the <i>AWS Organizations
--   User Guide.</i></li>
--   </ul>
createOrganization_featureSet :: Lens' CreateOrganization (Maybe OrganizationFeatureSet)

-- | A structure that contains details about the newly created
--   organization.
createOrganizationResponse_organization :: Lens' CreateOrganizationResponse (Maybe Organization)

-- | The response's http status code.
createOrganizationResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' CreateOrganizationResponse Int

-- | A structure that contains details about the handshake created to
--   support this request to enable all features in the organization.
enableAllFeaturesResponse_handshake :: Lens' EnableAllFeaturesResponse (Maybe Handshake)

-- | The response's http status code.
enableAllFeaturesResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' EnableAllFeaturesResponse Int

-- | The unique identifier (ID) of the handshake that you want information
--   about. You can get the ID from the original call to
--   InviteAccountToOrganization, or from a call to
--   ListHandshakesForAccount or ListHandshakesForOrganization.
--   
--   The <a>regex pattern</a> for handshake ID string requires "h-"
--   followed by from 8 to 32 lowercase letters or digits.
describeHandshake_handshakeId :: Lens' DescribeHandshake Text

-- | A structure that contains information about the specified handshake.
describeHandshakeResponse_handshake :: Lens' DescribeHandshakeResponse (Maybe Handshake)

-- | The response's http status code.
describeHandshakeResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' DescribeHandshakeResponse Int

-- | The parameter for receiving additional results if you receive a
--   <tt>NextToken</tt> response in a previous request. A
--   <tt>NextToken</tt> response indicates that more output is available.
--   Set this parameter to the value of the previous call's
--   <tt>NextToken</tt> response to indicate where the output should
--   continue from.
listTagsForResource_nextToken :: Lens' ListTagsForResource (Maybe Text)

-- | The ID of the resource with the tags to list.
--   
--   You can specify any of the following taggable resources.
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>AWS account – specify the account ID number.</li>
--   <li>Organizational unit – specify the OU ID that begins with
--   <tt>ou-</tt> and looks similar to: <tt>ou-1a2b-34uvwxyz </tt></li>
--   <li>Root – specify the root ID that begins with <tt>r-</tt> and looks
--   similar to: <tt>r-1a2b </tt></li>
--   <li>Policy – specify the policy ID that begins with <tt>p-</tt>
--   andlooks similar to: <tt>p-12abcdefg3 </tt></li>
--   </ul>
listTagsForResource_resourceId :: Lens' ListTagsForResource Text

-- | If present, indicates that more output is available than is included
--   in the current response. Use this value in the <tt>NextToken</tt>
--   request parameter in a subsequent call to the operation to get the
--   next part of the output. You should repeat this until the
--   <tt>NextToken</tt> response element comes back as <tt>null</tt>.
listTagsForResourceResponse_nextToken :: Lens' ListTagsForResourceResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | The tags that are assigned to the resource.
listTagsForResourceResponse_tags :: Lens' ListTagsForResourceResponse (Maybe [Tag])

-- | The response's http status code.
listTagsForResourceResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' ListTagsForResourceResponse Int

-- | The unique identifier (ID) of the policy that you want details about.
--   You can get the ID from the ListPolicies or ListPoliciesForTarget
--   operations.
--   
--   The <a>regex pattern</a> for a policy ID string requires "p-" followed
--   by from 8 to 128 lowercase or uppercase letters, digits, or the
--   underscore character (_).

--   form of a URL, such as <tt> service-abbreviation.amazonaws.com</tt>.
disableAWSServiceAccess_servicePrincipal :: Lens' DisableAWSServiceAccess Text

--   account that you want details about. Specifying an organization root
--   or organizational unit (OU) as the target is not supported.
describeEffectivePolicy_targetId :: Lens' DescribeEffectivePolicy (Maybe Text)

--   one of the following values:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>AISERVICES_OPT_OUT_POLICY</a></li>

-- | The response's http status code.
describeEffectivePolicyResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' DescribeEffectivePolicyResponse Int

-- | The unique identifier (ID) of the account that you want to move.
--   
--   The <a>regex pattern</a> for an account ID string requires exactly 12
--   digits.
moveAccount_accountId :: Lens' MoveAccount Text

-- | The unique identifier (ID) of the root or organizational unit that you
--   want to move the account from.
--   
--   The <a>regex pattern</a> for a parent ID string requires one of the
--   following:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><b>Root</b> - A string that begins with "r-" followed by from 4 to
--   32 lowercase letters or digits.</li>
--   <li><b>Organizational unit (OU)</b> - A string that begins with "ou-"
--   followed by from 4 to 32 lowercase letters or digits (the ID of the
--   root that the OU is in). This string is followed by a second "-" dash
--   and from 8 to 32 additional lowercase letters or digits.</li>
--   </ul>
moveAccount_sourceParentId :: Lens' MoveAccount Text

-- | The unique identifier (ID) of the root or organizational unit that you
--   want to move the account to.
--   
--   The <a>regex pattern</a> for a parent ID string requires one of the
--   following:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><b>Root</b> - A string that begins with "r-" followed by from 4 to
--   32 lowercase letters or digits.</li>
--   <li><b>Organizational unit (OU)</b> - A string that begins with "ou-"
--   followed by from 4 to 32 lowercase letters or digits (the ID of the
--   root that the OU is in). This string is followed by a second "-" dash
--   and from 8 to 32 additional lowercase letters or digits.</li>
--   </ul>
moveAccount_destinationParentId :: Lens' MoveAccount Text

-- | The parameter for receiving additional results if you receive a
--   <tt>NextToken</tt> response in a previous request. A
--   <tt>NextToken</tt> response indicates that more output is available.

--   continue from.
listAccounts_nextToken :: Lens' ListAccounts (Maybe Text)

--   response. If you do not include this parameter, it defaults to a value
--   that is specific to the operation. If additional items exist beyond
--   the maximum you specify, the <tt>NextToken</tt> response element is
--   present and has a value (is not null). Include that value as the
--   <tt>NextToken</tt> request parameter in the next call to the operation
--   to get the next part of the results. Note that Organizations might
--   return fewer results than the maximum even when there are more results
--   available. You should check <tt>NextToken</tt> after every operation
--   to ensure that you receive all of the results.
listAccounts_maxResults :: Lens' ListAccounts (Maybe Natural)

listAccountsResponse_accounts :: Lens' ListAccountsResponse (Maybe [Account])

-- | If present, indicates that more output is available than is included
--   in the current response. Use this value in the <tt>NextToken</tt>
--   request parameter in a subsequent call to the operation to get the
--   next part of the output. You should repeat this until the
--   <tt>NextToken</tt> response element comes back as <tt>null</tt>.
listAccountsResponse_nextToken :: Lens' ListAccountsResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | The response's http status code.
listAccountsResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' ListAccountsResponse Int

-- | Additional information that you want to include in the generated email
--   to the recipient account owner.
inviteAccountToOrganization_notes :: Lens' InviteAccountToOrganization (Maybe Text)

-- | A list of tags that you want to attach to the account when it becomes
--   a member of the organization. For each tag in the list, you must
--   specify both a tag key and a value. You can set the value to an empty
--   string, but you can't set it to <tt>null</tt>. For more information
--   about tagging, see <a>Tagging AWS Organizations resources</a> in the
--   AWS Organizations User Guide.
--   
--   Any tags in the request are checked for compliance with any applicable
--   tag policies when the request is made. The request is rejected if the
--   tags in the request don't match the requirements of the policy at that
--   time. Tag policy compliance is <i><b>not</b></i> checked again when
--   the invitation is accepted and the tags are actually attached to the
--   account. That means that if the tag policy changes between the
--   invitation and the acceptance, then that tags could potentially be
--   non-compliant.
--   
--   If any one of the tags is invalid or if you exceed the allowed number
--   of tags for an account, then the entire request fails and invitations
--   are not sent.
inviteAccountToOrganization_tags :: Lens' InviteAccountToOrganization (Maybe [Tag])

-- | The identifier (ID) of the AWS account that you want to invite to join
--   your organization. This is a JSON object that contains the following
--   elements:
--   
--   <pre>
--   { "Type": "ACCOUNT", "Id": "&lt; account id number &gt;" }
--   </pre>
--   
--   If you use the AWS CLI, you can submit this as a single string,
--   similar to the following example:
--   
--   <pre>
--   --target Id=123456789012,Type=ACCOUNT
--   </pre>
--   
--   If you specify <tt>"Type": "ACCOUNT"</tt>, you must provide the AWS
--   account ID number as the <tt>Id</tt>. If you specify <tt>"Type":
--   "EMAIL"</tt>, you must specify the email address that is associated
--   with the account.
--   
--   <pre>
--   --target Id=diego@example.com,Type=EMAIL
--   </pre>
inviteAccountToOrganization_target :: Lens' InviteAccountToOrganization HandshakeParty

-- | A structure that contains details about the handshake that is created
--   to support this invitation request.
inviteAccountToOrganizationResponse_handshake :: Lens' InviteAccountToOrganizationResponse (Maybe Handshake)

-- | The response's http status code.
inviteAccountToOrganizationResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' InviteAccountToOrganizationResponse Int

-- | The parameter for receiving additional results if you receive a
--   <tt>NextToken</tt> response in a previous request. A
--   <tt>NextToken</tt> response indicates that more output is available.

--   <tt>NextToken</tt> response to indicate where the output should
--   continue from.
listAWSServiceAccessForOrganization_nextToken :: Lens' ListAWSServiceAccessForOrganization (Maybe Text)

--   following:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><b>Root</b> - A string that begins with "r-" followed by from 4 to

--   <li><b>Organizational unit (OU)</b> - A string that begins with "ou-"
--   followed by from 4 to 32 lowercase letters or digits (the ID of the

--

--   followed by from 4 to 32 lowercase letters or digits (the ID of the

listChildren_childType :: Lens' ListChildren ChildType

-- | Specifies a service principal name. If specified, then the operation
--   lists the delegated administrators only for the specified service.
--   
--   If you don't specify a service principal, the operation lists all
--   delegated administrators for all services in your organization.
listDelegatedAdministrators_servicePrincipal :: Lens' ListDelegatedAdministrators (Maybe Text)

-- | The parameter for receiving additional results if you receive a
--   <tt>NextToken</tt> response in a previous request. A
--   <tt>NextToken</tt> response indicates that more output is available.
--   Set this parameter to the value of the previous call's
--   <tt>NextToken</tt> response to indicate where the output should
--   continue from.
listDelegatedAdministrators_nextToken :: Lens' ListDelegatedAdministrators (Maybe Text)

-- | The total number of results that you want included on each page of the
--   response. If you do not include this parameter, it defaults to a value
--   that is specific to the operation. If additional items exist beyond
--   the maximum you specify, the <tt>NextToken</tt> response element is
--   present and has a value (is not null). Include that value as the
--   <tt>NextToken</tt> request parameter in the next call to the operation
--   to get the next part of the results. Note that Organizations might
--   return fewer results than the maximum even when there are more results
--   available. You should check <tt>NextToken</tt> after every operation
--   to ensure that you receive all of the results.
listDelegatedAdministrators_maxResults :: Lens' ListDelegatedAdministrators (Maybe Natural)

-- | The list of delegated administrators in your organization.
listDelegatedAdministratorsResponse_delegatedAdministrators :: Lens' ListDelegatedAdministratorsResponse (Maybe [DelegatedAdministrator])

-- | If present, indicates that more output is available than is included
--   in the current response. Use this value in the <tt>NextToken</tt>
--   request parameter in a subsequent call to the operation to get the
--   next part of the output. You should repeat this until the
--   <tt>NextToken</tt> response element comes back as <tt>null</tt>.
listDelegatedAdministratorsResponse_nextToken :: Lens' ListDelegatedAdministratorsResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | The response's http status code.
listDelegatedAdministratorsResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' ListDelegatedAdministratorsResponse Int

-- | The unique identifier (ID) of the policy that you want to delete. You
--   can get the ID from the ListPolicies or ListPoliciesForTarget
--   operations.
--   
--   The <a>regex pattern</a> for a policy ID string requires "p-" followed
--   by from 8 to 128 lowercase or uppercase letters, digits, or the
--   underscore character (_).
deletePolicy_policyId :: Lens' DeletePolicy Text

-- | If provided, the new content for the policy. The text must be
--   correctly formatted JSON that complies with the syntax for the
--   policy's type. For more information, see <a>Service Control Policy
--   Syntax</a> in the <i>AWS Organizations User Guide.</i>
updatePolicy_content :: Lens' UpdatePolicy (Maybe Text)

-- | If provided, the new name for the policy.
--   
--   The <a>regex pattern</a> that is used to validate this parameter is a
--   string of any of the characters in the ASCII character range.
updatePolicy_name :: Lens' UpdatePolicy (Maybe Text)

-- | If provided, the new description for the policy.
updatePolicy_description :: Lens' UpdatePolicy (Maybe Text)

-- | The unique identifier (ID) of the policy that you want to update.
--   
--   The <a>regex pattern</a> for a policy ID string requires "p-" followed
--   by from 8 to 128 lowercase or uppercase letters, digits, or the
--   underscore character (_).
updatePolicy_policyId :: Lens' UpdatePolicy Text

-- | A structure that contains details about the updated policy, showing
--   the requested changes.
updatePolicyResponse_policy :: Lens' UpdatePolicyResponse (Maybe Policy)

-- | The response's http status code.
updatePolicyResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' UpdatePolicyResponse Int

-- | The unique identifier (ID) of the root in which you want to enable a
--   policy type. You can get the ID from the ListRoots operation.
--   
--   The <a>regex pattern</a> for a root ID string requires "r-" followed
--   by from 4 to 32 lowercase letters or digits.
enablePolicyType_rootId :: Lens' EnablePolicyType Text

-- | The policy type that you want to enable. You can specify one of the
--   following values:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>AISERVICES_OPT_OUT_POLICY</a></li>
--   <li><a>BACKUP_POLICY</a></li>
--   <li><a>SERVICE_CONTROL_POLICY</a></li>
--   <li><a>TAG_POLICY</a></li>
--   </ul>
enablePolicyType_policyType :: Lens' EnablePolicyType PolicyType

-- | A structure that shows the root with the updated list of enabled
--   policy types.
enablePolicyTypeResponse_root :: Lens' EnablePolicyTypeResponse (Maybe Root)

-- | The response's http status code.
enablePolicyTypeResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' EnablePolicyTypeResponse Int

-- | The unique identifier (ID) of the root in which you want to disable a
--   policy type. You can get the ID from the ListRoots operation.
--   
--   The <a>regex pattern</a> for a root ID string requires "r-" followed
--   by from 4 to 32 lowercase letters or digits.
disablePolicyType_rootId :: Lens' DisablePolicyType Text

-- | The policy type that you want to disable in this root. You can specify
--   one of the following values:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>AISERVICES_OPT_OUT_POLICY</a></li>
--   <li><a>BACKUP_POLICY</a></li>
--   <li><a>SERVICE_CONTROL_POLICY</a></li>
--   <li><a>TAG_POLICY</a></li>
--   </ul>
disablePolicyType_policyType :: Lens' DisablePolicyType PolicyType

-- | A structure that shows the root with the updated list of enabled
--   policy types.
disablePolicyTypeResponse_root :: Lens' DisablePolicyTypeResponse (Maybe Root)

-- | The response's http status code.
disablePolicyTypeResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' DisablePolicyTypeResponse Int

-- | Specifies the <tt>Id</tt> value that uniquely identifies the
--   <tt>CreateAccount</tt> request. You can get the value from the
--   <tt>CreateAccountStatus.Id</tt> response in an earlier CreateAccount
--   request, or from the ListCreateAccountStatus operation.
--   
--   The <a>regex pattern</a> for a create account request ID string
--   requires "car-" followed by from 8 to 32 lowercase letters or digits.
describeCreateAccountStatus_createAccountRequestId :: Lens' DescribeCreateAccountStatus Text

-- | A structure that contains the current status of an account creation
--   request.
describeCreateAccountStatusResponse_createAccountStatus :: Lens' DescribeCreateAccountStatusResponse (Maybe CreateAccountStatus)

-- | The response's http status code.
describeCreateAccountStatusResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' DescribeCreateAccountStatusResponse Int

-- | A list of tags that you want to attach to the newly created OU. For
--   each tag in the list, you must specify both a tag key and a value. You
--   can set the value to an empty string, but you can't set it to
--   <tt>null</tt>. For more information about tagging, see <a>Tagging AWS
--   Organizations resources</a> in the AWS Organizations User Guide.
--   
--   If any one of the tags is invalid or if you exceed the allowed number
--   of tags for an OU, then the entire request fails and the OU is not
--   created.
createOrganizationalUnit_tags :: Lens' CreateOrganizationalUnit (Maybe [Tag])

-- | The unique identifier (ID) of the parent root or OU that you want to
--   create the new OU in.
--   
--   The <a>regex pattern</a> for a parent ID string requires one of the
--   following:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><b>Root</b> - A string that begins with "r-" followed by from 4 to
--   32 lowercase letters or digits.</li>
--   <li><b>Organizational unit (OU)</b> - A string that begins with "ou-"
--   followed by from 4 to 32 lowercase letters or digits (the ID of the
--   root that the OU is in). This string is followed by a second "-" dash
--   and from 8 to 32 additional lowercase letters or digits.</li>
--   </ul>
createOrganizationalUnit_parentId :: Lens' CreateOrganizationalUnit Text

-- | The friendly name to assign to the new OU.
createOrganizationalUnit_name :: Lens' CreateOrganizationalUnit Text

-- | A structure that contains details about the newly created OU.
createOrganizationalUnitResponse_organizationalUnit :: Lens' CreateOrganizationalUnitResponse (Maybe OrganizationalUnit)

-- | The response's http status code.
createOrganizationalUnitResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' CreateOrganizationalUnitResponse Int

-- | The parameter for receiving additional results if you receive a
--   <tt>NextToken</tt> response in a previous request. A
--   <tt>NextToken</tt> response indicates that more output is available.
--   Set this parameter to the value of the previous call's
--   <tt>NextToken</tt> response to indicate where the output should
--   continue from.
listAccountsForParent_nextToken :: Lens' ListAccountsForParent (Maybe Text)

-- | The total number of results that you want included on each page of the
--   response. If you do not include this parameter, it defaults to a value
--   that is specific to the operation. If additional items exist beyond
--   the maximum you specify, the <tt>NextToken</tt> response element is
--   present and has a value (is not null). Include that value as the
--   <tt>NextToken</tt> request parameter in the next call to the operation
--   to get the next part of the results. Note that Organizations might
--   return fewer results than the maximum even when there are more results
--   available. You should check <tt>NextToken</tt> after every operation
--   to ensure that you receive all of the results.
listAccountsForParent_maxResults :: Lens' ListAccountsForParent (Maybe Natural)

-- | The unique identifier (ID) for the parent root or organization unit
--   (OU) whose accounts you want to list.
listAccountsForParent_parentId :: Lens' ListAccountsForParent Text

-- | A list of the accounts in the specified root or OU.
listAccountsForParentResponse_accounts :: Lens' ListAccountsForParentResponse (Maybe [Account])

-- | If present, indicates that more output is available than is included
--   in the current response. Use this value in the <tt>NextToken</tt>
--   request parameter in a subsequent call to the operation to get the
--   next part of the output. You should repeat this until the
--   <tt>NextToken</tt> response element comes back as <tt>null</tt>.
listAccountsForParentResponse_nextToken :: Lens' ListAccountsForParentResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | The response's http status code.
listAccountsForParentResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' ListAccountsForParentResponse Int

-- | The unique identifier (ID) of the policy you want to detach. You can
--   get the ID from the ListPolicies or ListPoliciesForTarget operations.
--   
--   The <a>regex pattern</a> for a policy ID string requires "p-" followed
--   by from 8 to 128 lowercase or uppercase letters, digits, or the
--   underscore character (_).
detachPolicy_policyId :: Lens' DetachPolicy Text

-- | The unique identifier (ID) of the root, OU, or account that you want
--   to detach the policy from. You can get the ID from the ListRoots,
--   ListOrganizationalUnitsForParent, or ListAccounts operations.
--   
--   The <a>regex pattern</a> for a target ID string requires one of the
--   following:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><b>Root</b> - A string that begins with "r-" followed by from 4 to
--   32 lowercase letters or digits.</li>
--   <li><b>Account</b> - A string that consists of exactly 12 digits.</li>
--   <li><b>Organizational unit (OU)</b> - A string that begins with "ou-"
--   followed by from 4 to 32 lowercase letters or digits (the ID of the
--   root that the OU is in). This string is followed by a second "-" dash
--   and from 8 to 32 additional lowercase letters or digits.</li>
--   </ul>
detachPolicy_targetId :: Lens' DetachPolicy Text

-- | The unique identifier (ID) of the member account that you want to
--   remove from the organization.
--   
--   The <a>regex pattern</a> for an account ID string requires exactly 12
--   digits.
removeAccountFromOrganization_accountId :: Lens' RemoveAccountFromOrganization Text

-- | If set to <tt>ALLOW</tt>, the new linked account in the commercial
--   Region enables IAM users to access account billing information
--   <i>if</i> they have the required permissions. If set to <tt>DENY</tt>,
--   only the root user of the new account can access account billing
--   information. For more information, see <a>Activating Access to the
--   Billing and Cost Management Console</a> in the <i>AWS Billing and Cost
--   Management User Guide.</i>
--   
--   If you don't specify this parameter, the value defaults to
--   <tt>ALLOW</tt>, and IAM users and roles with the required permissions
--   can access billing information for the new account.
createGovCloudAccount_iamUserAccessToBilling :: Lens' CreateGovCloudAccount (Maybe IAMUserAccessToBilling)

-- | (Optional)
--   
--   The name of an IAM role that AWS Organizations automatically
--   preconfigures in the new member accounts in both the AWS GovCloud (US)
--   Region and in the commercial Region. This role trusts the management
--   account, allowing users in the management account to assume the role,
--   as permitted by the management account administrator. The role has
--   administrator permissions in the new member account.
--   
--   If you don't specify this parameter, the role name defaults to
--   <tt>OrganizationAccountAccessRole</tt>.
--   
--   For more information about how to use this role to access the member
--   account, see <a>Accessing and Administering the Member Accounts in
--   Your Organization</a> in the <i>AWS Organizations User Guide</i> and
--   steps 2 and 3 in <a>Tutorial: Delegate Access Across AWS Accounts
--   Using IAM Roles</a> in the <i>IAM User Guide.</i>
--   
--   The <a>regex pattern</a> that is used to validate this parameter. The
--   pattern can include uppercase letters, lowercase letters, digits with
--   no spaces, and any of the following characters: =,.@-
createGovCloudAccount_roleName :: Lens' CreateGovCloudAccount (Maybe Text)

-- | A list of tags that you want to attach to the newly created account.
--   These tags are attached to the commercial account associated with the
--   GovCloud account, and not to the GovCloud account itself. To add tags
--   to the actual GovCloud account, call the TagResource operation in the
--   GovCloud region after the new GovCloud account exists.
--   
--   For each tag in the list, you must specify both a tag key and a value.
--   You can set the value to an empty string, but you can't set it to
--   <tt>null</tt>. For more information about tagging, see <a>Tagging AWS
--   Organizations resources</a> in the AWS Organizations User Guide.
--   
--   If any one of the tags is invalid or if you exceed the allowed number
--   of tags for an account, then the entire request fails and the account
--   is not created.
createGovCloudAccount_tags :: Lens' CreateGovCloudAccount (Maybe [Tag])

-- | The email address of the owner to assign to the new member account in
--   the commercial Region. This email address must not already be
--   associated with another AWS account. You must use a valid email
--   address to complete account creation. You can't access the root user
--   of the account or remove an account that was created with an invalid
--   email address. Like all request parameters for
--   <tt>CreateGovCloudAccount</tt>, the request for the email address for
--   the AWS GovCloud (US) account originates from the commercial Region,
--   not from the AWS GovCloud (US) Region.
createGovCloudAccount_email :: Lens' CreateGovCloudAccount Text

-- | The friendly name of the member account.
createGovCloudAccount_accountName :: Lens' CreateGovCloudAccount Text

-- | Undocumented member.
createGovCloudAccountResponse_createAccountStatus :: Lens' CreateGovCloudAccountResponse (Maybe CreateAccountStatus)

-- | The response's http status code.
createGovCloudAccountResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' CreateGovCloudAccountResponse Int

-- | The service principal name of the AWS service for which you want to
--   enable integration with your organization. This is typically in the
--   form of a URL, such as <tt> service-abbreviation.amazonaws.com</tt>.
enableAWSServiceAccess_servicePrincipal :: Lens' EnableAWSServiceAccess Text

--   continue from.
listParents_nextToken :: Lens' ListParents (Maybe Text)

-- | The total number of results that you want included on each page of the
--   response. If you do not include this parameter, it defaults to a value
--   that is specific to the operation. If additional items exist beyond
--   the maximum you specify, the <tt>NextToken</tt> response element is
--   present and has a value (is not null). Include that value as the
--   <tt>NextToken</tt> request parameter in the next call to the operation
--   to get the next part of the results. Note that Organizations might
--   return fewer results than the maximum even when there are more results
--   available. You should check <tt>NextToken</tt> after every operation
--   to ensure that you receive all of the results.
listParents_maxResults :: Lens' ListParents (Maybe Natural)

-- | The unique identifier (ID) of the OU or account whose parent
--   containers you want to list. Don't specify a root.
--   
--   The <a>regex pattern</a> for a child ID string requires one of the
--   following:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><b>Account</b> - A string that consists of exactly 12 digits.</li>
--   <li><b>Organizational unit (OU)</b> - A string that begins with "ou-"
--   followed by from 4 to 32 lowercase letters or digits (the ID of the
--   root that contains the OU). This string is followed by a second "-"
--   dash and from 8 to 32 additional lowercase letters or digits.</li>
--   </ul>
listParents_childId :: Lens' ListParents Text

--   in the current response. Use this value in the <tt>NextToken</tt>
--   request parameter in a subsequent call to the operation to get the
--   next part of the output. You should repeat this until the
--   <tt>NextToken</tt> response element comes back as <tt>null</tt>.
listParentsResponse_nextToken :: Lens' ListParentsResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | A list of parents for the specified child account or OU.
listParentsResponse_parents :: Lens' ListParentsResponse (Maybe [Parent])

-- | The response's http status code.
listParentsResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' ListParentsResponse Int

-- | If set to <tt>ALLOW</tt>, the new account enables IAM users to access
--   account billing information <i>if</i> they have the required
--   permissions. If set to <tt>DENY</tt>, only the root user of the new
--   account can access account billing information. For more information,
--   see <a>Activating Access to the Billing and Cost Management
--   Console</a> in the <i>AWS Billing and Cost Management User Guide</i>.
--   
--   If you don't specify this parameter, the value defaults to
--   <tt>ALLOW</tt>, and IAM users and roles with the required permissions
--   can access billing information for the new account.
createAccount_iamUserAccessToBilling :: Lens' CreateAccount (Maybe IAMUserAccessToBilling)

-- | (Optional)
--   
--   The name of an IAM role that AWS Organizations automatically
--   preconfigures in the new member account. This role trusts the
--   management account, allowing users in the management account to assume
--   the role, as permitted by the management account administrator. The
--   role has administrator permissions in the new member account.
--   
--   If you don't specify this parameter, the role name defaults to
--   <tt>OrganizationAccountAccessRole</tt>.
--   
--   For more information about how to use this role to access the member
--   account, see the following links:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>Accessing and Administering the Member Accounts in Your
--   Organization</a> in the <i>AWS Organizations User Guide</i></li>
--   <li>Steps 2 and 3 in <a>Tutorial: Delegate Access Across AWS Accounts
--   Using IAM Roles</a> in the <i>IAM User Guide</i></li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   The <a>regex pattern</a> that is used to validate this parameter. The
--   pattern can include uppercase letters, lowercase letters, digits with
--   no spaces, and any of the following characters: =,.@-
createAccount_roleName :: Lens' CreateAccount (Maybe Text)

-- | A list of tags that you want to attach to the newly created account.
--   For each tag in the list, you must specify both a tag key and a value.
--   You can set the value to an empty string, but you can't set it to
--   <tt>null</tt>. For more information about tagging, see <a>Tagging AWS
--   Organizations resources</a> in the AWS Organizations User Guide.
--   
--   If any one of the tags is invalid or if you exceed the allowed number
--   of tags for an account, then the entire request fails and the account
--   is not created.
createAccount_tags :: Lens' CreateAccount (Maybe [Tag])

-- | The email address of the owner to assign to the new member account.
--   This email address must not already be associated with another AWS
--   account. You must use a valid email address to complete account
--   creation. You can't access the root user of the account or remove an
--   account that was created with an invalid email address.
createAccount_email :: Lens' CreateAccount Text

-- | The friendly name of the member account.
createAccount_accountName :: Lens' CreateAccount Text

-- | A structure that contains details about the request to create an
--   account. This response structure might not be fully populated when you
--   first receive it because account creation is an asynchronous process.
--   You can pass the returned <tt>CreateAccountStatus</tt> ID as a
--   parameter to DescribeCreateAccountStatus to get status about the
--   progress of the request at later times. You can also check the AWS
--   CloudTrail log for the <tt>CreateAccountResult</tt> event. For more
--   information, see <a>Monitoring the Activity in Your Organization</a>
--   in the <i>AWS Organizations User Guide</i>.
createAccountResponse_createAccountStatus :: Lens' CreateAccountResponse (Maybe CreateAccountStatus)

-- | The response's http status code.
createAccountResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' CreateAccountResponse Int

-- | The account ID number of the member account in the organization that
--   you want to deregister as a delegated administrator.
deregisterDelegatedAdministrator_accountId :: Lens' DeregisterDelegatedAdministrator Text

-- | The service principal name of an AWS service for which the account is
--   a delegated administrator.
--   
--   Delegated administrator privileges are revoked for only the specified
--   AWS service from the member account. If the specified service is the
--   only service for which the member account is a delegated
--   administrator, the operation also revokes Organizations read action
--   permissions.
deregisterDelegatedAdministrator_servicePrincipal :: Lens' DeregisterDelegatedAdministrator Text

-- | The ID of the resource to add a tag to.
tagResource_resourceId :: Lens' TagResource Text

-- | A list of tags to add to the specified resource.
--   
--   You can specify any of the following taggable resources.
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>AWS account – specify the account ID number.</li>
--   <li>Organizational unit – specify the OU ID that begins with
--   <tt>ou-</tt> and looks similar to: <tt>ou-1a2b-34uvwxyz </tt></li>
--   <li>Root – specify the root ID that begins with <tt>r-</tt> and looks
--   similar to: <tt>r-1a2b </tt></li>
--   <li>Policy – specify the policy ID that begins with <tt>p-</tt>
--   andlooks similar to: <tt>p-12abcdefg3 </tt></li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   For each tag in the list, you must specify both a tag key and a value.
--   You can set the value to an empty string, but you can't set it to
--   <tt>null</tt>.
--   
--   If any one of the tags is invalid or if you exceed the allowed number
--   of tags for an account user, then the entire request fails and the
--   account is not created.
tagResource_tags :: Lens' TagResource [Tag]

-- | A list of one or more states that you want included in the response.
--   If this parameter isn't present, all requests are included in the
--   response.
listCreateAccountStatus_states :: Lens' ListCreateAccountStatus (Maybe [CreateAccountState])

-- | The parameter for receiving additional results if you receive a
--   <tt>NextToken</tt> response in a previous request. A
--   <tt>NextToken</tt> response indicates that more output is available.

--   <tt>NextToken</tt> request parameter in the next call to the operation
--   to get the next part of the results. Note that Organizations might
--   return fewer results than the maximum even when there are more results
--   available. You should check <tt>NextToken</tt> after every operation
--   to ensure that you receive all of the results.
listCreateAccountStatus_maxResults :: Lens' ListCreateAccountStatus (Maybe Natural)

--   such as the accountId number, are present in the output only after the
--   account has been successfully created.
listCreateAccountStatusResponse_createAccountStatuses :: Lens' ListCreateAccountStatusResponse (Maybe [CreateAccountStatus])

-- | The total number of results that you want included on each page of the
