--   that is specific to the operation. If additional items exist beyond
--   the maximum you specify, the <tt>NextToken</tt> response element is
--   present and has a value (is not null). Include that value as the
--   <tt>NextToken</tt> request parameter in the next call to the operation
--   to get the next part of the results. Note that Organizations might
--   return fewer results than the maximum even when there are more results
--   available. You should check <tt>NextToken</tt> after every operation
--   to ensure that you receive all of the results.
listTargetsForPolicy_maxResults :: Lens' ListTargetsForPolicy (Maybe Natural)

-- | The unique identifier (ID) of the policy whose attachments you want to
--   know.
--   
--   The <a>regex pattern</a> for a policy ID string requires "p-" followed
--   by from 8 to 128 lowercase or uppercase letters, digits, or the
--   underscore character (_).
listTargetsForPolicy_policyId :: Lens' ListTargetsForPolicy Text

-- | If present, indicates that more output is available than is included
--   in the current response. Use this value in the <tt>NextToken</tt>
--   request parameter in a subsequent call to the operation to get the
--   next part of the output. You should repeat this until the
--   <tt>NextToken</tt> response element comes back as <tt>null</tt>.
listTargetsForPolicyResponse_nextToken :: Lens' ListTargetsForPolicyResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | A list of structures, each of which contains details about one of the
--   entities to which the specified policy is attached.
listTargetsForPolicyResponse_targets :: Lens' ListTargetsForPolicyResponse (Maybe [PolicyTargetSummary])

-- | The response's http status code.
listTargetsForPolicyResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' ListTargetsForPolicyResponse Int

-- | The unique identifier (ID) of the handshake that you want to decline.
--   You can get the ID from the ListHandshakesForAccount operation.
--   
--   The <a>regex pattern</a> for handshake ID string requires "h-"
--   followed by from 8 to 32 lowercase letters or digits.
declineHandshake_handshakeId :: Lens' DeclineHandshake Text

-- | A structure that contains details about the declined handshake. The
--   state is updated to show the value <tt>DECLINED</tt>.
declineHandshakeResponse_handshake :: Lens' DeclineHandshakeResponse (Maybe Handshake)

-- | The response's http status code.
declineHandshakeResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' DeclineHandshakeResponse Int

-- | The ID of the resource to remove a tag from.
--   
--   You can specify any of the following taggable resources.
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>AWS account – specify the account ID number.</li>
--   <li>Organizational unit – specify the OU ID that begins with
--   <tt>ou-</tt> and looks similar to: <tt>ou-1a2b-34uvwxyz </tt></li>
--   <li>Root – specify the root ID that begins with <tt>r-</tt> and looks
--   similar to: <tt>r-1a2b </tt></li>
--   <li>Policy – specify the policy ID that begins with <tt>p-</tt>
--   andlooks similar to: <tt>p-12abcdefg3 </tt></li>
--   </ul>
untagResource_resourceId :: Lens' UntagResource Text

-- | The list of keys for tags to remove from the specified resource.
untagResource_tagKeys :: Lens' UntagResource [Text]

-- | The unique identifier (ID) of the policy that you want to attach to
--   the target. You can get the ID for the policy by calling the
--   ListPolicies operation.
--   
--   The <a>regex pattern</a> for a policy ID string requires "p-" followed
--   by from 8 to 128 lowercase or uppercase letters, digits, or the
--   underscore character (_).
attachPolicy_policyId :: Lens' AttachPolicy Text

-- | The unique identifier (ID) of the root, OU, or account that you want
--   to attach the policy to. You can get the ID by calling the ListRoots,
--   ListOrganizationalUnitsForParent, or ListAccounts operations.
--   
--   The <a>regex pattern</a> for a target ID string requires one of the
--   following:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><b>Root</b> - A string that begins with "r-" followed by from 4 to
--   32 lowercase letters or digits.</li>
--   <li><b>Account</b> - A string that consists of exactly 12 digits.</li>
--   <li><b>Organizational unit (OU)</b> - A string that begins with "ou-"
--   followed by from 4 to 32 lowercase letters or digits (the ID of the
--   root that the OU is in). This string is followed by a second "-" dash
--   and from 8 to 32 additional lowercase letters or digits.</li>
--   </ul>
attachPolicy_targetId :: Lens' AttachPolicy Text

-- | The parameter for receiving additional results if you receive a
--   <tt>NextToken</tt> response in a previous request. A
--   <tt>NextToken</tt> response indicates that more output is available.
--   Set this parameter to the value of the previous call's
--   <tt>NextToken</tt> response to indicate where the output should
--   continue from.
listPoliciesForTarget_nextToken :: Lens' ListPoliciesForTarget (Maybe Text)

-- | The total number of results that you want included on each page of the
--   response. If you do not include this parameter, it defaults to a value
--   that is specific to the operation. If additional items exist beyond
--   the maximum you specify, the <tt>NextToken</tt> response element is
--   present and has a value (is not null). Include that value as the
--   <tt>NextToken</tt> request parameter in the next call to the operation
--   to get the next part of the results. Note that Organizations might
--   return fewer results than the maximum even when there are more results
--   available. You should check <tt>NextToken</tt> after every operation
--   to ensure that you receive all of the results.
listPoliciesForTarget_maxResults :: Lens' ListPoliciesForTarget (Maybe Natural)

-- | The unique identifier (ID) of the root, organizational unit, or
--   account whose policies you want to list.
--   
--   The <a>regex pattern</a> for a target ID string requires one of the
--   following:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><b>Root</b> - A string that begins with "r-" followed by from 4 to
--   32 lowercase letters or digits.</li>
--   <li><b>Account</b> - A string that consists of exactly 12 digits.</li>
--   <li><b>Organizational unit (OU)</b> - A string that begins with "ou-"
--   followed by from 4 to 32 lowercase letters or digits (the ID of the
--   root that the OU is in). This string is followed by a second "-" dash
--   and from 8 to 32 additional lowercase letters or digits.</li>
--   </ul>
listPoliciesForTarget_targetId :: Lens' ListPoliciesForTarget Text

-- | The type of policy that you want to include in the returned list. You
--   must specify one of the following values:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>AISERVICES_OPT_OUT_POLICY</a></li>
--   <li><a>BACKUP_POLICY</a></li>
--   <li><a>SERVICE_CONTROL_POLICY</a></li>
--   <li><a>TAG_POLICY</a></li>
--   </ul>
listPoliciesForTarget_filter :: Lens' ListPoliciesForTarget PolicyType

-- | If present, indicates that more output is available than is included
--   in the current response. Use this value in the <tt>NextToken</tt>
--   request parameter in a subsequent call to the operation to get the
--   next part of the output. You should repeat this until the
--   <tt>NextToken</tt> response element comes back as <tt>null</tt>.
listPoliciesForTargetResponse_nextToken :: Lens' ListPoliciesForTargetResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | The list of policies that match the criteria in the request.
listPoliciesForTargetResponse_policies :: Lens' ListPoliciesForTargetResponse (Maybe [PolicySummary])

-- | The response's http status code.
listPoliciesForTargetResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' ListPoliciesForTargetResponse Int

-- | A structure that contains information about the organization.
--   
--   The <tt>AvailablePolicyTypes</tt> part of the response is deprecated,
--   and you shouldn't use it in your apps. It doesn't include any policy
--   type supported by Organizations other than SCPs. To determine which
--   policy types are enabled in your organization, use the <tt> ListRoots
--   </tt> operation.
describeOrganizationResponse_organization :: Lens' DescribeOrganizationResponse (Maybe Organization)

-- | The response's http status code.
describeOrganizationResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' DescribeOrganizationResponse Int

-- | The parameter for receiving additional results if you receive a
--   <tt>NextToken</tt> response in a previous request. A
--   <tt>NextToken</tt> response indicates that more output is available.
--   Set this parameter to the value of the previous call's
--   <tt>NextToken</tt> response to indicate where the output should
--   continue from.
listHandshakesForOrganization_nextToken :: Lens' ListHandshakesForOrganization (Maybe Text)

-- | A filter of the handshakes that you want included in the response. The
--   default is all types. Use the <tt>ActionType</tt> element to limit the
--   output to only a specified type, such as <tt>INVITE</tt>,
--   <tt>ENABLE-ALL-FEATURES</tt>, or <tt>APPROVE-ALL-FEATURES</tt>.
--   Alternatively, for the <tt>ENABLE-ALL-FEATURES</tt> handshake that
--   generates a separate child handshake for each member account, you can
--   specify the <tt>ParentHandshakeId</tt> to see only the handshakes that
--   were generated by that parent request.
listHandshakesForOrganization_filter :: Lens' ListHandshakesForOrganization (Maybe HandshakeFilter)

-- | The total number of results that you want included on each page of the
--   response. If you do not include this parameter, it defaults to a value
--   that is specific to the operation. If additional items exist beyond
--   the maximum you specify, the <tt>NextToken</tt> response element is
--   present and has a value (is not null). Include that value as the
--   <tt>NextToken</tt> request parameter in the next call to the operation
--   to get the next part of the results. Note that Organizations might
--   return fewer results than the maximum even when there are more results
--   available. You should check <tt>NextToken</tt> after every operation
--   to ensure that you receive all of the results.
listHandshakesForOrganization_maxResults :: Lens' ListHandshakesForOrganization (Maybe Natural)

-- | A list of Handshake objects with details about each of the handshakes
--   that are associated with an organization.
listHandshakesForOrganizationResponse_handshakes :: Lens' ListHandshakesForOrganizationResponse (Maybe [Handshake])

-- | If present, indicates that more output is available than is included
--   in the current response. Use this value in the <tt>NextToken</tt>
--   request parameter in a subsequent call to the operation to get the
--   next part of the output. You should repeat this until the
--   <tt>NextToken</tt> response element comes back as <tt>null</tt>.
listHandshakesForOrganizationResponse_nextToken :: Lens' ListHandshakesForOrganizationResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | The response's http status code.
listHandshakesForOrganizationResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' ListHandshakesForOrganizationResponse Int

-- | The account ID number of the member account in the organization to
--   register as a delegated administrator.
registerDelegatedAdministrator_accountId :: Lens' RegisterDelegatedAdministrator Text

-- | The service principal of the AWS service for which you want to make
--   the member account a delegated administrator.
registerDelegatedAdministrator_servicePrincipal :: Lens' RegisterDelegatedAdministrator Text

-- | The unique identifier (ID) of the organizational unit that you want to
--   delete. You can get the ID from the ListOrganizationalUnitsForParent
--   operation.
--   
--   The <a>regex pattern</a> for an organizational unit ID string requires
--   "ou-" followed by from 4 to 32 lowercase letters or digits (the ID of
--   the root that contains the OU). This string is followed by a second
--   "-" dash and from 8 to 32 additional lowercase letters or digits.
deleteOrganizationalUnit_organizationalUnitId :: Lens' DeleteOrganizationalUnit Text

-- | The new name that you want to assign to the OU.
--   
--   The <a>regex pattern</a> that is used to validate this parameter is a
--   string of any of the characters in the ASCII character range.
updateOrganizationalUnit_name :: Lens' UpdateOrganizationalUnit (Maybe Text)

-- | The unique identifier (ID) of the OU that you want to rename. You can
--   get the ID from the ListOrganizationalUnitsForParent operation.
--   
--   The <a>regex pattern</a> for an organizational unit ID string requires
--   "ou-" followed by from 4 to 32 lowercase letters or digits (the ID of
--   the root that contains the OU). This string is followed by a second
--   "-" dash and from 8 to 32 additional lowercase letters or digits.
updateOrganizationalUnit_organizationalUnitId :: Lens' UpdateOrganizationalUnit Text

-- | A structure that contains the details about the specified OU,
--   including its new name.
updateOrganizationalUnitResponse_organizationalUnit :: Lens' UpdateOrganizationalUnitResponse (Maybe OrganizationalUnit)

-- | The response's http status code.
updateOrganizationalUnitResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' UpdateOrganizationalUnitResponse Int

-- | The status of the account in the organization.
account_status :: Lens' Account (Maybe AccountStatus)

-- | The method by which the account joined the organization.
account_joinedMethod :: Lens' Account (Maybe AccountJoinedMethod)

-- | The email address associated with the AWS account.
--   
--   The <a>regex pattern</a> for this parameter is a string of characters
--   that represents a standard internet email address.
account_email :: Lens' Account (Maybe Text)

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the account.
--   
--   For more information about ARNs in Organizations, see <a>ARN Formats
--   Supported by Organizations</a> in the <i>AWS Service Authorization
--   Reference</i>.
account_arn :: Lens' Account (Maybe Text)

-- | The date the account became a part of the organization.
account_joinedTimestamp :: Lens' Account (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The friendly name of the account.
--   
--   The <a>regex pattern</a> that is used to validate this parameter is a
--   string of any of the characters in the ASCII character range.
account_name :: Lens' Account (Maybe Text)

-- | The unique identifier (ID) of the account.
--   
--   The <a>regex pattern</a> for an account ID string requires exactly 12
--   digits.
account_id :: Lens' Account (Maybe Text)

-- | The unique identifier (ID) of this child entity.
--   
--   The <a>regex pattern</a> for a child ID string requires one of the
--   following:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><b>Account</b> - A string that consists of exactly 12 digits.</li>
--   <li><b>Organizational unit (OU)</b> - A string that begins with "ou-"
--   followed by from 4 to 32 lowercase letters or digits (the ID of the
--   root that contains the OU). This string is followed by a second "-"
--   dash and from 8 to 32 additional lowercase letters or digits.</li>
--   </ul>
child_id :: Lens' Child (Maybe Text)

-- | The type of this child entity.
child_type :: Lens' Child (Maybe ChildType)

-- | If the request failed, a description of the reason for the failure.
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>ACCOUNT_LIMIT_EXCEEDED: The account couldn't be created because
--   you reached the limit on the number of accounts in your
--   organization.</li>
--   <li>CONCURRENT_ACCOUNT_MODIFICATION: You already submitted a request
--   with the same information.</li>
--   <li>EMAIL_ALREADY_EXISTS: The account could not be created because
--   another AWS account with that email address already exists.</li>
--   <li>FAILED_BUSINESS_VALIDATION: The AWS account that owns your
--   organization failed to receive business license validation.</li>
--   <li>GOVCLOUD_ACCOUNT_ALREADY_EXISTS: The account in the AWS GovCloud
--   (US) Region could not be created because this Region already includes
--   an account with that email address.</li>
--   <li>IDENTITY_INVALID_BUSINESS_VALIDATION: The AWS account that owns
--   your organization can't complete business license validation because
--   it doesn't have valid identity data.</li>
--   <li>INVALID_ADDRESS: The account could not be created because the
--   address you provided is not valid.</li>
--   <li>INVALID_EMAIL: The account could not be created because the email
--   address you provided is not valid.</li>
--   <li>INTERNAL_FAILURE: The account could not be created because of an
--   internal failure. Try again later. If the problem persists, contact
--   AWS Customer Support.</li>
--   <li>MISSING_BUSINESS_VALIDATION: The AWS account that owns your
--   organization has not received Business Validation.</li>
--   <li>MISSING_PAYMENT_INSTRUMENT: You must configure the management
--   account with a valid payment method, such as a credit card.</li>
--   <li>PENDING_BUSINESS_VALIDATION: The AWS account that owns your
--   organization is still in the process of completing business license
--   validation.</li>
--   <li>UNKNOWN_BUSINESS_VALIDATION: The AWS account that owns your
--   organization has an unknown issue with business license
--   validation.</li>
--   </ul>
createAccountStatus_failureReason :: Lens' CreateAccountStatus (Maybe CreateAccountFailureReason)

-- | The status of the asynchronous request to create an AWS account.
createAccountStatus_state :: Lens' CreateAccountStatus (Maybe CreateAccountState)

-- | The date and time that the account was created and the request
--   completed.
createAccountStatus_completedTimestamp :: Lens' CreateAccountStatus (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The account name given to the account when it was created.
createAccountStatus_accountName :: Lens' CreateAccountStatus (Maybe Text)

-- | If the account was created successfully, the unique identifier (ID) of
--   the new account.
--   
--   The <a>regex pattern</a> for an account ID string requires exactly 12
--   digits.
createAccountStatus_accountId :: Lens' CreateAccountStatus (Maybe Text)

-- | The unique identifier (ID) that references this request. You get this
--   value from the response of the initial CreateAccount request to create
--   the account.
--   
--   The <a>regex pattern</a> for a create account request ID string
--   requires "car-" followed by from 8 to 32 lowercase letters or digits.
createAccountStatus_id :: Lens' CreateAccountStatus (Maybe Text)

-- | If the account was created successfully, the unique identifier (ID) of
--   the new account in the AWS GovCloud (US) Region.
createAccountStatus_govCloudAccountId :: Lens' CreateAccountStatus (Maybe Text)

-- | The date and time that the request was made for the account creation.
createAccountStatus_requestedTimestamp :: Lens' CreateAccountStatus (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The status of the delegated administrator's account in the
--   organization.
delegatedAdministrator_status :: Lens' DelegatedAdministrator (Maybe AccountStatus)

-- | The method by which the delegated administrator's account joined the
--   organization.
delegatedAdministrator_joinedMethod :: Lens' DelegatedAdministrator (Maybe AccountJoinedMethod)

-- | The email address that is associated with the delegated
--   administrator's AWS account.
delegatedAdministrator_email :: Lens' DelegatedAdministrator (Maybe Text)

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the delegated administrator's
--   account.
delegatedAdministrator_arn :: Lens' DelegatedAdministrator (Maybe Text)

-- | The date when the delegated administrator's account became a part of
--   the organization.
delegatedAdministrator_joinedTimestamp :: Lens' DelegatedAdministrator (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The date when the account was made a delegated administrator.
delegatedAdministrator_delegationEnabledDate :: Lens' DelegatedAdministrator (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The friendly name of the delegated administrator's account.
delegatedAdministrator_name :: Lens' DelegatedAdministrator (Maybe Text)

-- | The unique identifier (ID) of the delegated administrator's account.
delegatedAdministrator_id :: Lens' DelegatedAdministrator (Maybe Text)

-- | The name of an AWS service that can request an operation for the
--   specified service. This is typically in the form of a URL, such as:
--   <tt> servicename.amazonaws.com</tt>.
delegatedService_servicePrincipal :: Lens' DelegatedService (Maybe Text)

-- | The date that the account became a delegated administrator for this
--   service.
delegatedService_delegationEnabledDate :: Lens' DelegatedService (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The account ID of the policy target.
effectivePolicy_targetId :: Lens' EffectivePolicy (Maybe Text)

-- | The policy type.
effectivePolicy_policyType :: Lens' EffectivePolicy (Maybe EffectivePolicyType)

-- | The time of the last update to this policy.
effectivePolicy_lastUpdatedTimestamp :: Lens' EffectivePolicy (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The text content of the policy.
effectivePolicy_policyContent :: Lens' EffectivePolicy (Maybe Text)

-- | The name of the service principal. This is typically in the form of a
--   URL, such as: <tt> servicename.amazonaws.com</tt>.
enabledServicePrincipal_servicePrincipal :: Lens' EnabledServicePrincipal (Maybe Text)

-- | The date that the service principal was enabled for integration with
--   AWS Organizations.
enabledServicePrincipal_dateEnabled :: Lens' EnabledServicePrincipal (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The current state of the handshake. Use the state to trace the flow of
--   the handshake through the process from its creation to its acceptance.
--   The meaning of each of the valid values is as follows:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><b>REQUESTED</b>: This handshake was sent to multiple recipients
--   (applicable to only some handshake types) and not all recipients have
--   responded yet. The request stays in this state until all recipients
--   respond.</li>
--   <li><b>OPEN</b>: This handshake was sent to multiple recipients
--   (applicable to only some policy types) and all recipients have
--   responded, allowing the originator to complete the handshake
--   action.</li>
--   <li><b>CANCELED</b>: This handshake is no longer active because it was
--   canceled by the originating account.</li>
--   <li><b>ACCEPTED</b>: This handshake is complete because it has been
--   accepted by the recipient.</li>
--   <li><b>DECLINED</b>: This handshake is no longer active because it was
--   declined by the recipient account.</li>
--   <li><b>EXPIRED</b>: This handshake is no longer active because the
--   originator did not receive a response of any kind from the recipient
--   before the expiration time (15 days).</li>
--   </ul>
handshake_state :: Lens' Handshake (Maybe HandshakeState)

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of a handshake.
--   
--   For more information about ARNs in Organizations, see <a>ARN Formats
--   Supported by Organizations</a> in the <i>AWS Service Authorization
--   Reference</i>.
handshake_arn :: Lens' Handshake (Maybe Text)

-- | The type of handshake, indicating what action occurs when the
--   recipient accepts the handshake. The following handshake types are
--   supported:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><b>INVITE</b>: This type of handshake represents a request to join
--   an organization. It is always sent from the management account to only
--   non-member accounts.</li>
--   <li><b>ENABLE_ALL_FEATURES</b>: This type of handshake represents a
--   request to enable all features in an organization. It is always sent
--   from the management account to only <i>invited</i> member accounts.
--   Created accounts do not receive this because those accounts were
--   created by the organization's management account and approval is
--   inferred.</li>
--   <li><b>APPROVE_ALL_FEATURES</b>: This type of handshake is sent from
--   the Organizations service when all member accounts have approved the
--   <tt>ENABLE_ALL_FEATURES</tt> invitation. It is sent only to the
--   management account and signals the master that it can finalize the
--   process to enable all features.</li>
--   </ul>
handshake_action :: Lens' Handshake (Maybe ActionType)

-- | Additional information that is needed to process the handshake.
handshake_resources :: Lens' Handshake (Maybe [HandshakeResource])

-- | The unique identifier (ID) of a handshake. The originating account
--   creates the ID when it initiates the handshake.
--   
--   The <a>regex pattern</a> for handshake ID string requires "h-"
--   followed by from 8 to 32 lowercase letters or digits.
handshake_id :: Lens' Handshake (Maybe Text)

-- | The date and time that the handshake expires. If the recipient of the
--   handshake request fails to respond before the specified date and time,
--   the handshake becomes inactive and is no longer valid.
handshake_expirationTimestamp :: Lens' Handshake (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | Information about the two accounts that are participating in the
--   handshake.
handshake_parties :: Lens' Handshake (Maybe [HandshakeParty])

-- | The date and time that the handshake request was made.
handshake_requestedTimestamp :: Lens' Handshake (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | Specifies the parent handshake. Only used for handshake types that are
--   a child of another type.
--   
--   If you specify <tt>ParentHandshakeId</tt>, you cannot also specify
--   <tt>ActionType</tt>.
--   
--   The <a>regex pattern</a> for handshake ID string requires "h-"
--   followed by from 8 to 32 lowercase letters or digits.
handshakeFilter_parentHandshakeId :: Lens' HandshakeFilter (Maybe Text)

-- | Specifies the type of handshake action.
--   
--   If you specify <tt>ActionType</tt>, you cannot also specify
--   <tt>ParentHandshakeId</tt>.
handshakeFilter_actionType :: Lens' HandshakeFilter (Maybe ActionType)

-- | The unique identifier (ID) for the party.
--   
--   The <a>regex pattern</a> for handshake ID string requires "h-"
--   followed by from 8 to 32 lowercase letters or digits.
handshakeParty_id :: Lens' HandshakeParty Text

-- | The type of party.
handshakeParty_type :: Lens' HandshakeParty HandshakePartyType

-- | The information that is passed to the other party in the handshake.
--   The format of the value string must match the requirements of the
--   specified type.
handshakeResource_value :: Lens' HandshakeResource (Maybe Text)

-- | When needed, contains an additional array of
--   <tt>HandshakeResource</tt> objects.
handshakeResource_resources :: Lens' HandshakeResource (Maybe [HandshakeResource])

-- | The type of information being passed, specifying how the value is to
--   be interpreted by the other party:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>ACCOUNT</tt> - Specifies an AWS account ID number.</li>
--   <li><tt>ORGANIZATION</tt> - Specifies an organization ID number.</li>
--   <li><tt>EMAIL</tt> - Specifies the email address that is associated
--   with the account that receives the handshake.</li>
--   <li><tt>OWNER_EMAIL</tt> - Specifies the email address associated with
--   the management account. Included as information about an
--   organization.</li>
--   <li><tt>OWNER_NAME</tt> - Specifies the name associated with the
--   management account. Included as information about an
--   organization.</li>
--   <li><tt>NOTES</tt> - Additional text provided by the handshake
--   initiator and intended for the recipient to read.</li>
--   </ul>
handshakeResource_type :: Lens' HandshakeResource (Maybe HandshakeResourceType)

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of an organization.
--   
--   For more information about ARNs in Organizations, see <a>ARN Formats
--   Supported by Organizations</a> in the <i>AWS Service Authorization
--   Reference</i>.
organization_arn :: Lens' Organization (Maybe Text)

-- | The unique identifier (ID) of the management account of an
--   organization.
--   
--   The <a>regex pattern</a> for an account ID string requires exactly 12
--   digits.
organization_masterAccountId :: Lens' Organization (Maybe Text)

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the account that is designated as
--   the management account for the organization.
--   
--   For more information about ARNs in Organizations, see <a>ARN Formats
--   Supported by Organizations</a> in the <i>AWS Service Authorization
--   Reference</i>.
organization_masterAccountArn :: Lens' Organization (Maybe Text)

-- | The email address that is associated with the AWS account that is
--   designated as the management account for the organization.
organization_masterAccountEmail :: Lens' Organization (Maybe Text)

-- | Do not use. This field is deprecated and doesn't provide complete
--   information about the policies in your organization.
--   
--   To determine the policies that are enabled and available for use in
--   your organization, use the ListRoots operation instead.
organization_availablePolicyTypes :: Lens' Organization (Maybe [PolicyTypeSummary])

-- | The unique identifier (ID) of an organization.
--   
--   The <a>regex pattern</a> for an organization ID string requires "o-"
--   followed by from 10 to 32 lowercase letters or digits.
organization_id :: Lens' Organization (Maybe Text)

-- | Specifies the functionality that currently is available to the
--   organization. If set to "ALL", then all features are enabled and
--   policies can be applied to accounts in the organization. If set to
--   "CONSOLIDATED_BILLING", then only consolidated billing functionality
--   is available. For more information, see <a>Enabling All Features in
--   Your Organization</a> in the <i>AWS Organizations User Guide</i>.
organization_featureSet :: Lens' Organization (Maybe OrganizationFeatureSet)

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of this OU.
--   
--   For more information about ARNs in Organizations, see <a>ARN Formats
--   Supported by Organizations</a> in the <i>AWS Service Authorization
--   Reference</i>.
organizationalUnit_arn :: Lens' OrganizationalUnit (Maybe Text)

-- | The friendly name of this OU.
--   
--   The <a>regex pattern</a> that is used to validate this parameter is a
--   string of any of the characters in the ASCII character range.
organizationalUnit_name :: Lens' OrganizationalUnit (Maybe Text)

-- | The unique identifier (ID) associated with this OU.
--   
--   The <a>regex pattern</a> for an organizational unit ID string requires
--   "ou-" followed by from 4 to 32 lowercase letters or digits (the ID of
--   the root that contains the OU). This string is followed by a second
--   "-" dash and from 8 to 32 additional lowercase letters or digits.
organizationalUnit_id :: Lens' OrganizationalUnit (Maybe Text)

-- | The unique identifier (ID) of the parent entity.
--   
--   The <a>regex pattern</a> for a parent ID string requires one of the
--   following:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><b>Root</b> - A string that begins with "r-" followed by from 4 to
--   32 lowercase letters or digits.</li>
--   <li><b>Organizational unit (OU)</b> - A string that begins with "ou-"
--   followed by from 4 to 32 lowercase letters or digits (the ID of the
--   root that the OU is in). This string is followed by a second "-" dash
--   and from 8 to 32 additional lowercase letters or digits.</li>
--   </ul>
parent_id :: Lens' Parent (Maybe Text)

-- | The type of the parent entity.
parent_type :: Lens' Parent (Maybe ParentType)

-- | The text content of the policy.
policy_content :: Lens' Policy (Maybe Text)

-- | A structure that contains additional details about the policy.
policy_policySummary :: Lens' Policy (Maybe PolicySummary)

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the policy.
--   
--   For more information about ARNs in Organizations, see <a>ARN Formats
--   Supported by Organizations</a> in the <i>AWS Service Authorization
--   Reference</i>.
policySummary_arn :: Lens' PolicySummary (Maybe Text)

-- | The friendly name of the policy.
--   
--   The <a>regex pattern</a> that is used to validate this parameter is a
--   string of any of the characters in the ASCII character range.
policySummary_name :: Lens' PolicySummary (Maybe Text)

-- | The unique identifier (ID) of the policy.
--   
--   The <a>regex pattern</a> for a policy ID string requires "p-" followed
--   by from 8 to 128 lowercase or uppercase letters, digits, or the
--   underscore character (_).
policySummary_id :: Lens' PolicySummary (Maybe Text)

-- | A boolean value that indicates whether the specified policy is an AWS
--   managed policy. If true, then you can attach the policy to roots, OUs,
--   or accounts, but you cannot edit it.
policySummary_awsManaged :: Lens' PolicySummary (Maybe Bool)

-- | The type of policy.
policySummary_type :: Lens' PolicySummary (Maybe PolicyType)

-- | The description of the policy.
policySummary_description :: Lens' PolicySummary (Maybe Text)

-- | The unique identifier (ID) of the policy target.
--   
--   The <a>regex pattern</a> for a target ID string requires one of the
--   following:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><b>Root</b> - A string that begins with "r-" followed by from 4 to
--   32 lowercase letters or digits.</li>
--   <li><b>Account</b> - A string that consists of exactly 12 digits.</li>
--   <li><b>Organizational unit (OU)</b> - A string that begins with "ou-"
--   followed by from 4 to 32 lowercase letters or digits (the ID of the
--   root that the OU is in). This string is followed by a second "-" dash
--   and from 8 to 32 additional lowercase letters or digits.</li>
--   </ul>
policyTargetSummary_targetId :: Lens' PolicyTargetSummary (Maybe Text)

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the policy target.
--   
--   For more information about ARNs in Organizations, see <a>ARN Formats
--   Supported by Organizations</a> in the <i>AWS Service Authorization
--   Reference</i>.
policyTargetSummary_arn :: Lens' PolicyTargetSummary (Maybe Text)

-- | The friendly name of the policy target.
--   
--   The <a>regex pattern</a> that is used to validate this parameter is a
--   string of any of the characters in the ASCII character range.
policyTargetSummary_name :: Lens' PolicyTargetSummary (Maybe Text)

-- | The type of the policy target.
policyTargetSummary_type :: Lens' PolicyTargetSummary (Maybe TargetType)

-- | The status of the policy type as it relates to the associated root. To
--   attach a policy of the specified type to a root or to an OU or account
--   in that root, it must be available in the organization and enabled for
--   that root.
policyTypeSummary_status :: Lens' PolicyTypeSummary (Maybe PolicyTypeStatus)

-- | The name of the policy type.
policyTypeSummary_type :: Lens' PolicyTypeSummary (Maybe PolicyType)

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the root.
--   
--   For more information about ARNs in Organizations, see <a>ARN Formats
--   Supported by Organizations</a> in the <i>AWS Service Authorization
--   Reference</i>.
root_arn :: Lens' Root (Maybe Text)

-- | The friendly name of the root.
--   
--   The <a>regex pattern</a> that is used to validate this parameter is a
--   string of any of the characters in the ASCII character range.
root_name :: Lens' Root (Maybe Text)

-- | The unique identifier (ID) for the root.
--   
--   The <a>regex pattern</a> for a root ID string requires "r-" followed
--   by from 4 to 32 lowercase letters or digits.
root_id :: Lens' Root (Maybe Text)

-- | The types of policies that are currently enabled for the root and
--   therefore can be attached to the root or to its OUs or accounts.
--   
--   Even if a policy type is shown as available in the organization, you
--   can separately enable and disable them at the root level by using
--   EnablePolicyType and DisablePolicyType. Use DescribeOrganization to
--   see the availability of the policy types in that organization.
root_policyTypes :: Lens' Root (Maybe [PolicyTypeSummary])

-- | The key identifier, or name, of the tag.
tag_key :: Lens' Tag Text

-- | The string value that's associated with the key of the tag. You can
--   set the value of a tag to an empty string, but you can't set the value
--   of a tag to null.
tag_value :: Lens' Tag Text


module Network.AWS.Organizations.Waiters


-- | Derived from API version <tt>2016-11-28</tt> of the AWS service
--   descriptions, licensed under Apache 2.0.
--   
--   AWS Organizations is a web service that enables you to consolidate
--   your multiple AWS accounts into an <i>organization</i> and centrally
--   manage your accounts and their resources.
--   
--   This guide provides descriptions of the Organizations operations. For
--   more information about using this service, see the <a>AWS
--   Organizations User Guide</a>.
--   
--   <b>Support and feedback for AWS Organizations</b>
--   
--   We welcome your feedback. Send your comments to
--   <a>feedback-awsorganizations@amazon.com</a> or post your feedback and
--   questions in the <a>AWS Organizations support forum</a>. For more
--   information about the AWS support forums, see <a>Forums Help</a>.
--   
--   <b>Endpoint to call When using the AWS CLI or the AWS SDK</b>
--   
--   For the current release of Organizations, specify the
--   <tt>us-east-1</tt> region for all AWS API and AWS CLI calls made from
--   the commercial AWS Regions outside of China. If calling from one of
--   the AWS Regions in China, then specify <tt>cn-northwest-1</tt>. You
--   can do this in the AWS CLI by using these parameters and commands:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>Use the following parameter with each command to specify both the
--   endpoint and its region:<tt>--endpoint-url
--   https://organizations.us-east-1.amazonaws.com</tt> <i>(from commercial
--   AWS Regions outside of China)</i>or<tt>--endpoint-url
--   https://organizations.cn-northwest-1.amazonaws.com.cn</tt> <i>(from
--   AWS Regions in China)</i></li>
--   <li>Use the default endpoint, but configure your default region with
--   this command:<tt>aws configure set default.region us-east-1</tt>
--   /(from commercial AWS Regions outside of China)/or<tt>aws configure
--   set default.region cn-northwest-1</tt> /(from AWS Regions in
--   China)/</li>
--   <li>Use the following parameter with each command to specify the
--   endpoint:<tt>--region us-east-1</tt> /(from commercial AWS Regions
--   outside of China)/or<tt>--region cn-northwest-1</tt> <i>(from AWS
--   Regions in China)</i></li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <b>Recording API Requests</b>
--   
--   AWS Organizations supports AWS CloudTrail, a service that records AWS
--   API calls for your AWS account and delivers log files to an Amazon S3
--   bucket. By using information collected by AWS CloudTrail, you can
--   determine which requests the Organizations service received, who made
--   the request and when, and so on. For more about AWS Organizations and
--   its support for AWS CloudTrail, see <a>Logging AWS Organizations
--   Events with AWS CloudTrail</a> in the <i>AWS Organizations User
--   Guide</i>. To learn more about AWS CloudTrail, including how to turn
--   it on and find your log files, see the <a>AWS CloudTrail User
--   Guide</a>.
module Network.AWS.Organizations

-- | API version <tt>2016-11-28</tt> of the Amazon Organizations SDK
--   configuration.
defaultService :: Service

-- | We can't find a policy with the <tt>PolicyId</tt> that you specified.
_PolicyNotFoundException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | The specified policy type is already enabled in the specified root.
_PolicyTypeAlreadyEnabledException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | The requested operation would violate the constraint identified in the
--   reason code.
--   
--   Some of the reasons in the following list might not be applicable to
--   this specific API or operation:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>ACCOUNT_NUMBER_LIMIT_EXCEEDED: You attempted to exceed the limit
--   on the number of accounts in an organization. Note that deleted and
--   closed accounts still count toward your limit.If you get this
--   exception immediately after creating the organization, wait one hour
--   and try again. If after an hour it continues to fail with this error,
--   contact <a>AWS Support</a>.</li>
--   <li>ALREADY_IN_AN_ORGANIZATION: The handshake request is invalid
--   because the invited account is already a member of an
--   organization.</li>
--   <li>HANDSHAKE_RATE_LIMIT_EXCEEDED: You attempted to exceed the number
--   of handshakes that you can send in one day.</li>
--   <li>INVITE_DISABLED_DURING_ENABLE_ALL_FEATURES: You can't issue new
--   invitations to join an organization while it's in the process of
--   enabling all features. You can resume inviting accounts after you
--   finalize the process when all accounts have agreed to the change.</li>
--   <li>ORGANIZATION_ALREADY_HAS_ALL_FEATURES: The handshake request is
--   invalid because the organization has already enabled all
--   features.</li>
--   <li>ORGANIZATION_IS_ALREADY_PENDING_ALL_FEATURES_MIGRATION: The
--   handshake request is invalid because the organization has already
--   started the process to enable all features.</li>
--   <li>ORGANIZATION_FROM_DIFFERENT_SELLER_OF_RECORD: The request failed
--   because the account is from a different marketplace than the accounts
--   in the organization. For example, accounts with India addresses must
--   be associated with the AISPL marketplace. All accounts in an
--   organization must be from the same marketplace.</li>
--   <li>ORGANIZATION_MEMBERSHIP_CHANGE_RATE_LIMIT_EXCEEDED: You attempted
--   to change the membership of an account too quickly after its previous
--   change.</li>
--   <li>PAYMENT_INSTRUMENT_REQUIRED: You can't complete the operation with
--   an account that doesn't have a payment instrument, such as a credit
--   card, associated with it.</li>
--   </ul>
_HandshakeConstraintViolationException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | You don't have permissions to perform the requested operation. The
--   user or role that is making the request must have at least one IAM
--   permissions policy attached that grants the required permissions. For
--   more information, see <a>Access Management</a> in the <i>IAM User
--   Guide.</i>
_AccessDeniedException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | The provided policy document doesn't meet the requirements of the
--   specified policy type. For example, the syntax might be incorrect. For
--   details about service control policy syntax, see <a>Service Control
--   Policy Syntax</a> in the <i>AWS Organizations User Guide.</i>
_MalformedPolicyDocumentException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | We can't find a root with the <tt>RootId</tt> that you specified.
_RootNotFoundException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | You can't remove a management account from an organization. If you
--   want the management account to become a member account in another
--   organization, you must first delete the current organization of the
--   management account.
_MasterCannotLeaveOrganizationException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | We can't find an AWS account with the <tt>AccountId</tt> that you
--   specified, or the account whose credentials you used to make this
--   request isn't a member of an organization.
_AccountNotFoundException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | The specified account is already a delegated administrator for this
--   AWS service.
_AccountAlreadyRegisteredException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | A policy with the same name already exists.
_DuplicatePolicyException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | Performing this operation violates a minimum or maximum value limit.
--   For example, attempting to remove the last service control policy
--   (SCP) from an OU or root, inviting or creating too many accounts to
--   the organization, or attaching too many policies to an account, OU, or
--   root. This exception includes a reason that contains additional
--   information about the violated limit:
--   
--   Some of the reasons in the following list might not be applicable to
--   this specific API or operation.
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>ACCOUNT_CANNOT_LEAVE_ORGANIZATION: You attempted to remove the
--   management account from the organization. You can't remove the
--   management account. Instead, after you remove all member accounts,
--   delete the organization itself.</li>
--   <li>ACCOUNT_CANNOT_LEAVE_WITHOUT_EULA: You attempted to remove an
--   account from the organization that doesn't yet have enough information
--   to exist as a standalone account. This account requires you to first
--   agree to the AWS Customer Agreement. Follow the steps at <a>Removing a
--   member account from your organization</a>in the <i>AWS Organizations
--   User Guide.</i></li>
--   <li>ACCOUNT_CANNOT_LEAVE_WITHOUT_PHONE_VERIFICATION: You attempted to
--   remove an account from the organization that doesn't yet have enough
--   information to exist as a standalone account. This account requires
--   you to first complete phone verification. Follow the steps at
--   <a>Removing a member account from your organization</a> in the <i>AWS
--   Organizations User Guide.</i></li>
--   <li>ACCOUNT_CREATION_RATE_LIMIT_EXCEEDED: You attempted to exceed the
--   number of accounts that you can create in one day.</li>
--   <li>ACCOUNT_NUMBER_LIMIT_EXCEEDED: You attempted to exceed the limit
--   on the number of accounts in an organization. If you need more
--   accounts, contact <a>AWS Support</a> to request an increase in your
--   limit.Or the number of invitations that you tried to send would cause
--   you to exceed the limit of accounts in your organization. Send fewer
--   invitations or contact AWS Support to request an increase in the
--   number of accounts.Deleted and closed accounts still count toward your
--   limit.If you get this exception when running a command immediately
--   after creating the organization, wait one hour and try again. After an
--   hour, if the command continues to fail with this error, contact <a>AWS
--   Support</a>.</li>
--   <li>CANNOT_REGISTER_MASTER_AS_DELEGATED_ADMINISTRATOR: You attempted
--   to register the management account of the organization as a delegated
--   administrator for an AWS service integrated with Organizations. You
--   can designate only a member account as a delegated administrator.</li>
--   <li>CANNOT_REMOVE_DELEGATED_ADMINISTRATOR_FROM_ORG: You attempted to
--   remove an account that is registered as a delegated administrator for
--   a service integrated with your organization. To complete this
--   operation, you must first deregister this account as a delegated
--   administrator.</li>
--   <li>CREATE_ORGANIZATION_IN_BILLING_MODE_UNSUPPORTED_REGION: To create
--   an organization in the specified region, you must enable all features
--   mode.</li>
--   <li>DELEGATED_ADMINISTRATOR_EXISTS_FOR_THIS_SERVICE: You attempted to
--   register an AWS account as a delegated administrator for an AWS
--   service that already has a delegated administrator. To complete this
--   operation, you must first deregister any existing delegated
--   administrators for this service.</li>
--   <li>EMAIL_VERIFICATION_CODE_EXPIRED: The email verification code is
--   only valid for a limited period of time. You must resubmit the request
--   and generate a new verfication code.</li>
--   <li>HANDSHAKE_RATE_LIMIT_EXCEEDED: You attempted to exceed the number
--   of handshakes that you can send in one day.</li>
--   <li>MASTER_ACCOUNT_ADDRESS_DOES_NOT_MATCH_MARKETPLACE: To create an
--   account in this organization, you first must migrate the
--   organization's management account to the marketplace that corresponds
--   to the management account's address. For example, accounts with India
--   addresses must be associated with the AISPL marketplace. All accounts
--   in an organization must be associated with the same marketplace.</li>
--   <li>MASTER_ACCOUNT_MISSING_BUSINESS_LICENSE: Applies only to the AWS
--   Regions in China. To create an organization, the master must have a
--   valid business license. For more information, contact customer
--   support.</li>
--   <li>MASTER_ACCOUNT_MISSING_CONTACT_INFO: To complete this operation,
--   you must first provide a valid contact address and phone number for
--   the management account. Then try the operation again.</li>
--   <li>MASTER_ACCOUNT_NOT_GOVCLOUD_ENABLED: To complete this operation,
--   the management account must have an associated account in the AWS
--   GovCloud (US-West) Region. For more information, see <a>AWS
--   Organizations</a> in the <i>AWS GovCloud User Guide.</i></li>
--   <li>MASTER_ACCOUNT_PAYMENT_INSTRUMENT_REQUIRED: To create an
--   organization with this management account, you first must associate a
--   valid payment instrument, such as a credit card, with the account.
--   Follow the steps at <a>To leave an organization when all required
--   account information has not yet been provided</a> in the <i>AWS
--   Organizations User Guide.</i></li>
--   <li>MAX_DELEGATED_ADMINISTRATORS_FOR_SERVICE_LIMIT_EXCEEDED: You
--   attempted to register more delegated administrators than allowed for
--   the service principal.</li>
--   <li>MAX_POLICY_TYPE_ATTACHMENT_LIMIT_EXCEEDED: You attempted to exceed
--   the number of policies of a certain type that can be attached to an
--   entity at one time.</li>
--   <li>MAX_TAG_LIMIT_EXCEEDED: You have exceeded the number of tags
--   allowed on this resource.</li>
--   <li>MEMBER_ACCOUNT_PAYMENT_INSTRUMENT_REQUIRED: To complete this
--   operation with this member account, you first must associate a valid
--   payment instrument, such as a credit card, with the account. Follow
--   the steps at <a>To leave an organization when all required account
--   information has not yet been provided</a> in the <i>AWS Organizations
--   User Guide.</i></li>
--   <li>MIN_POLICY_TYPE_ATTACHMENT_LIMIT_EXCEEDED: You attempted to detach
--   a policy from an entity that would cause the entity to have fewer than
--   the minimum number of policies of a certain type required.</li>
--   <li>ORGANIZATION_NOT_IN_ALL_FEATURES_MODE: You attempted to perform an
--   operation that requires the organization to be configured to support
--   all features. An organization that supports only consolidated billing
--   features can't perform this operation.</li>
--   <li>OU_DEPTH_LIMIT_EXCEEDED: You attempted to create an OU tree that
--   is too many levels deep.</li>
--   <li>OU_NUMBER_LIMIT_EXCEEDED: You attempted to exceed the number of
--   OUs that you can have in an organization.</li>
--   <li>POLICY_CONTENT_LIMIT_EXCEEDED: You attempted to create a policy
--   that is larger than the maximum size.</li>
--   <li>POLICY_NUMBER_LIMIT_EXCEEDED: You attempted to exceed the number
--   of policies that you can have in an organization.</li>
--   <li>TAG_POLICY_VIOLATION: You attempted to create or update a resource
--   with tags that are not compliant with the tag policy requirements for
--   this account.</li>
--   </ul>
_ConstraintViolationException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | The specified account is not a delegated administrator for this AWS
--   service.
_AccountNotRegisteredException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | AWS Organizations couldn't perform the operation because your
--   organization hasn't finished initializing. This can take up to an
--   hour. Try again later. If after one hour you continue to receive this
--   error, contact <a>AWS Support</a>.
_FinalizingOrganizationException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | We can't find a handshake with the <tt>HandshakeId</tt> that you
--   specified.
_HandshakeNotFoundException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | You can't use the specified policy type with the feature set currently
--   enabled for this organization. For example, you can enable SCPs only
--   after you enable all features in the organization. For more
--   information, see <a>Managing AWS Organizations Policies</a>in the
--   <i>AWS Organizations User Guide.</i>
_PolicyTypeNotAvailableForOrganizationException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | We can't find an organizational unit (OU) or AWS account with the
--   <tt>ChildId</tt> that you specified.
_ChildNotFoundException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | This action isn't available in the current AWS Region.
_UnsupportedAPIEndpointException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | If you ran this action on the management account, this policy type is
--   not enabled. If you ran the action on a member account, the account
--   doesn't have an effective policy of this type. Contact the
--   administrator of your organization about attaching a policy of this
--   type to the account.
_EffectivePolicyNotFoundException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | We can't find an OU with the <tt>OrganizationalUnitId</tt> that you
--   specified.
_OrganizationalUnitNotFoundException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | We can't find the destination container (a root or OU) with the
--   <tt>ParentId</tt> that you specified.
_DestinationParentNotFoundException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | The organization isn't empty. To delete an organization, you must
--   first remove all accounts except the management account, delete all
--   OUs, and delete all policies.
_OrganizationNotEmptyException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | You can't invite an existing account to your organization until you
--   verify that you own the email address associated with the management
--   account. For more information, see <a>Email Address Verification</a>
--   in the <i>AWS Organizations User Guide.</i>
_AccountOwnerNotVerifiedException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | The specified policy type isn't currently enabled in this root. You
--   can't attach policies of the specified type to entities in a root
--   until you enable that type in the root. For more information, see
--   <a>Enabling All Features in Your Organization</a> in the <i>AWS
--   Organizations User Guide.</i>
_PolicyTypeNotEnabledException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | A handshake with the same action and target already exists. For
--   example, if you invited an account to join your organization, the
--   invited account might already have a pending invitation from this
--   organization. If you intend to resend an invitation to an account,
--   ensure that existing handshakes that might be considered duplicates
--   are canceled or declined.
_DuplicateHandshakeException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | The specified OU is not empty. Move all accounts to another root or to
--   other OUs, remove all child OUs, and try the operation again.
_OrganizationalUnitNotEmptyException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | You have sent too many requests in too short a period of time. The
--   quota helps protect against denial-of-service attacks. Try again
--   later.
--   
--   For information about quotas that affect AWS Organizations, see
--   <a>Quotas for AWS Organizations</a>in the <i>AWS Organizations User
--   Guide.</i>
_TooManyRequestsException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | The target of the operation is currently being modified by a different
--   request. Try again later.
_ConcurrentModificationException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | AWS Organizations can't complete your request because of an internal
--   service error. Try again later.
_ServiceException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | We can't find a source root or OU with the <tt>ParentId</tt> that you
--   specified.
_SourceParentNotFoundException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | We can't find a root, OU, account, or policy with the
--   <tt>TargetId</tt> that you specified.
_TargetNotFoundException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | We can't find an create account request with the
--   <tt>CreateAccountRequestId</tt> that you specified.
_CreateAccountStatusNotFoundException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | This account is already a member of an organization. An account can
--   belong to only one organization at a time.
_AlreadyInOrganizationException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | An OU with the same name already exists.
_DuplicateOrganizationalUnitException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | The requested operation failed because you provided invalid values for
--   one or more of the request parameters. This exception includes a
--   reason that contains additional information about the violated limit:
--   
--   Some of the reasons in the following list might not be applicable to
--   this specific API or operation.
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>DUPLICATE_TAG_KEY: Tag keys must be unique among the tags attached
--   to the same entity.</li>
--   <li>IMMUTABLE_POLICY: You specified a policy that is managed by AWS
--   and can't be modified.</li>
--   <li>INPUT_REQUIRED: You must include a value for all required
--   parameters.</li>
--   <li>INVALID_EMAIL_ADDRESS_TARGET: You specified an invalid email
--   address for the invited account owner.</li>
--   <li>INVALID_ENUM: You specified an invalid value.</li>
--   <li>INVALID_ENUM_POLICY_TYPE: You specified an invalid policy type
--   string.</li>
--   <li>INVALID_FULL_NAME_TARGET: You specified a full name that contains
--   invalid characters.</li>
--   <li>INVALID_LIST_MEMBER: You provided a list to a parameter that
--   contains at least one invalid value.</li>
--   <li>INVALID_PAGINATION_TOKEN: Get the value for the <tt>NextToken</tt>
--   parameter from the response to a previous call of the operation.</li>
--   <li>INVALID_PARTY_TYPE_TARGET: You specified the wrong type of entity
--   (account, organization, or email) as a party.</li>
--   <li>INVALID_PATTERN: You provided a value that doesn't match the
--   required pattern.</li>
--   <li>INVALID_PATTERN_TARGET_ID: You specified a policy target ID that
--   doesn't match the required pattern.</li>
--   <li>INVALID_ROLE_NAME: You provided a role name that isn't valid. A
--   role name can't begin with the reserved prefix
--   <tt>AWSServiceRoleFor</tt>.</li>
--   <li>INVALID_SYNTAX_ORGANIZATION_ARN: You specified an invalid Amazon
--   Resource Name (ARN) for the organization.</li>
--   <li>INVALID_SYNTAX_POLICY_ID: You specified an invalid policy ID.</li>
--   <li>INVALID_SYSTEM_TAGS_PARAMETER: You specified a tag key that is a
--   system tag. You can’t add, edit, or delete system tag keys because
--   they're reserved for AWS use. System tags don’t count against your
--   tags per resource limit.</li>
--   <li>MAX_FILTER_LIMIT_EXCEEDED: You can specify only one filter
--   parameter for the operation.</li>
--   <li>MAX_LENGTH_EXCEEDED: You provided a string parameter that is
--   longer than allowed.</li>
--   <li>MAX_VALUE_EXCEEDED: You provided a numeric parameter that has a
--   larger value than allowed.</li>
--   <li>MIN_LENGTH_EXCEEDED: You provided a string parameter that is
--   shorter than allowed.</li>
--   <li>MIN_VALUE_EXCEEDED: You provided a numeric parameter that has a
--   smaller value than allowed.</li>
--   <li>MOVING_ACCOUNT_BETWEEN_DIFFERENT_ROOTS: You can move an account
--   only between entities in the same root.</li>
--   <li>TARGET_NOT_SUPPORTED: You can't perform the specified operation on
--   that target entity.</li>
--   <li>UNRECOGNIZED_SERVICE_PRINCIPAL: You specified a service principal
--   that isn't recognized.</li>
--   </ul>
_InvalidInputException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | Changes to the effective policy are in progress, and its contents
--   can't be returned. Try the operation again later.
_PolicyChangesInProgressException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | The policy isn't attached to the specified target in the specified
--   root.
_PolicyNotAttachedException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | We can't find a root or OU with the <tt>ParentId</tt> that you
--   specified.
_ParentNotFoundException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | The operation that you attempted requires you to have the
--   <tt>iam:CreateServiceLinkedRole</tt> for
--   <tt>organizations.amazonaws.com</tt> permission so that AWS
--   Organizations can create the required service-linked role. You don't
--   have that permission.
_AccessDeniedForDependencyException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | Your account isn't a member of an organization. To make this request,
--   you must use the credentials of an account that belongs to an
--   organization.
_AWSOrganizationsNotInUseException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | The policy is attached to one or more entities. You must detach it
--   from all roots, OUs, and accounts before performing this operation.
_PolicyInUseException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | You can't perform the operation on the handshake in its current state.
--   For example, you can't cancel a handshake that was already accepted or
--   accept a handshake that was already declined.
_InvalidHandshakeTransitionException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | The specified handshake is already in the requested state. For
--   example, you can't accept a handshake that was already accepted.
_HandshakeAlreadyInStateException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | That account is already present in the specified destination.
_DuplicateAccountException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | The selected policy is already attached to the specified target.
_DuplicatePolicyAttachmentException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newListHandshakesForAccount</a> smart constructor.
data ListHandshakesForAccount
ListHandshakesForAccount' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe HandshakeFilter -> Maybe Natural -> ListHandshakesForAccount

-- | Create a value of <a>ListHandshakesForAccount</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:nextToken:ListHandshakesForAccount'</a>,
--   <a>listHandshakesForAccount_nextToken</a> - The parameter for
--   receiving additional results if you receive a <tt>NextToken</tt>
--   response in a previous request. A <tt>NextToken</tt> response
--   indicates that more output is available. Set this parameter to the
--   value of the previous call's <tt>NextToken</tt> response to indicate
--   where the output should continue from.
--   
--   <a>$sel:filter':ListHandshakesForAccount'</a>,
--   <a>listHandshakesForAccount_filter</a> - Filters the handshakes that
--   you want included in the response. The default is all types. Use the
--   <tt>ActionType</tt> element to limit the output to only a specified
--   type, such as <tt>INVITE</tt>, <tt>ENABLE_ALL_FEATURES</tt>, or
--   <tt>APPROVE_ALL_FEATURES</tt>. Alternatively, for the
--   <tt>ENABLE_ALL_FEATURES</tt> handshake that generates a separate child
--   handshake for each member account, you can specify
--   <tt>ParentHandshakeId</tt> to see only the handshakes that were
--   generated by that parent request.
--   
--   <a>$sel:maxResults:ListHandshakesForAccount'</a>,
--   <a>listHandshakesForAccount_maxResults</a> - The total number of
--   results that you want included on each page of the response. If you do
--   not include this parameter, it defaults to a value that is specific to
--   the operation. If additional items exist beyond the maximum you
--   specify, the <tt>NextToken</tt> response element is present and has a
--   value (is not null). Include that value as the <tt>NextToken</tt>
--   request parameter in the next call to the operation to get the next
--   part of the results. Note that Organizations might return fewer
--   results than the maximum even when there are more results available.
--   You should check <tt>NextToken</tt> after every operation to ensure
--   that you receive all of the results.
newListHandshakesForAccount :: ListHandshakesForAccount

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newListHandshakesForAccountResponse</a> smart
--   constructor.

--   associated with the specified account.

--   indicates that more output is available than is included in the
--   current response. Use this value in the <tt>NextToken</tt> request
--   parameter in a subsequent call to the operation to get the next part
--   of the output. You should repeat this until the <tt>NextToken</tt>
--   response element comes back as <tt>null</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:httpStatus:ListHandshakesForAccountResponse'</a>,
--   <a>listHandshakesForAccountResponse_httpStatus</a> - The response's
--   http status code.
newListHandshakesForAccountResponse :: Int -> ListHandshakesForAccountResponse

--   
--   <a>$sel:tags:CreatePolicy'</a>, <a>createPolicy_tags</a> - A list of
--   tags that you want to attach to the newly created policy. For each tag
--   in the list, you must specify both a tag key and a value. You can set
--   the value to an empty string, but you can't set it to <tt>null</tt>.
--   For more information about tagging, see <a>Tagging AWS Organizations
--   resources</a> in the AWS Organizations User Guide.
--   
--   If any one of the tags is invalid or if you exceed the allowed number
--   of tags for a policy, then the entire request fails and the policy is
--   not created.
--   
--   <a>$sel:content:CreatePolicy'</a>, <a>createPolicy_content</a> - The
--   policy text content to add to the new policy. The text that you supply
--   must adhere to the rules of the policy type you specify in the
--   <tt>Type</tt> parameter.

--   friendly name to assign to the policy.

--   The <a>regex pattern</a> that is used to validate this parameter is a
--   string of any of the characters in the ASCII character range.
--   
--   <a>$sel:type':CreatePolicy'</a>, <a>createPolicy_type</a> - The type
--   of policy to create. You can specify one of the following values:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>AISERVICES_OPT_OUT_POLICY</a></li>
--   <li><a>BACKUP_POLICY</a></li>
--   <li><a>SERVICE_CONTROL_POLICY</a></li>

--   omitted.

--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:featureSet:CreateOrganization'</a>,
--   <a>createOrganization_featureSet</a> - Specifies the feature set
--   supported by the new organization. Each feature set supports different
--   levels of functionality.
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>CONSOLIDATED_BILLING</tt>: All member accounts have their
--   bills consolidated to and paid by the management account. For more
--   information, see <a>Consolidated billing</a> in the <i>AWS
--   Organizations User Guide.</i>The consolidated billing feature subset
--   isn't available for organizations in the AWS GovCloud (US)
--   Region.</li>
--   <li><tt>ALL</tt>: In addition to all the features supported by the
--   consolidated billing feature set, the management account can also
--   apply any policy type to any member account in the organization. For
--   more information, see <a>All features</a> in the <i>AWS Organizations
--   User Guide.</i></li>
--   </ul>

--   omitted.
--

--   the handshake that you want information about. You can get the ID from
--   the original call to InviteAccountToOrganization, or from a call to
--   ListHandshakesForAccount or ListHandshakesForOrganization.

--   followed by from 8 to 32 lowercase letters or digits.

-- | Create a value of <a>ListTagsForResource</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--

--   additional results if you receive a <tt>NextToken</tt> response in a
--   previous request. A <tt>NextToken</tt> response indicates that more
--   output is available. Set this parameter to the value of the previous
--   call's <tt>NextToken</tt> response to indicate where the output should
--   continue from.
--   
--   <a>$sel:resourceId:ListTagsForResource'</a>,
--   <a>listTagsForResource_resourceId</a> - The ID of the resource with
--   the tags to list.
--   
--   You can specify any of the following taggable resources.
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>AWS account – specify the account ID number.</li>
--   <li>Organizational unit – specify the OU ID that begins with
--   <tt>ou-</tt> and looks similar to: <tt>ou-1a2b-34uvwxyz </tt></li>
--   <li>Root – specify the root ID that begins with <tt>r-</tt> and looks
--   similar to: <tt>r-1a2b </tt></li>
--   <li>Policy – specify the policy ID that begins with <tt>p-</tt>
--   andlooks similar to: <tt>p-12abcdefg3 </tt></li>
--   </ul>
newListTagsForResource :: Text -> ListTagsForResource

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newMoveAccount</a> smart constructor.
data MoveAccount
MoveAccount' :: Text -> Text -> Text -> MoveAccount

-- | Create a value of <a>MoveAccount</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:accountId:MoveAccount'</a>, <a>moveAccount_accountId</a> - The
--   unique identifier (ID) of the account that you want to move.
--   
--   The <a>regex pattern</a> for an account ID string requires exactly 12
--   digits.
--   
--   <a>$sel:sourceParentId:MoveAccount'</a>,
--   <a>moveAccount_sourceParentId</a> - The unique identifier (ID) of the
--   root or organizational unit that you want to move the account from.
--   
--   The <a>regex pattern</a> for a parent ID string requires one of the
--   following:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><b>Root</b> - A string that begins with "r-" followed by from 4 to
--   32 lowercase letters or digits.</li>
--   <li><b>Organizational unit (OU)</b> - A string that begins with "ou-"
--   followed by from 4 to 32 lowercase letters or digits (the ID of the
--   root that the OU is in). This string is followed by a second "-" dash
--   and from 8 to 32 additional lowercase letters or digits.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:destinationParentId:MoveAccount'</a>,
--   <a>moveAccount_destinationParentId</a> - The unique identifier (ID) of
--   the root or organizational unit that you want to move the account to.
--   
--   The <a>regex pattern</a> for a parent ID string requires one of the
--   following:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><b>Root</b> - A string that begins with "r-" followed by from 4 to
--   32 lowercase letters or digits.</li>
--   <li><b>Organizational unit (OU)</b> - A string that begins with "ou-"
--   followed by from 4 to 32 lowercase letters or digits (the ID of the
--   root that the OU is in). This string is followed by a second "-" dash
--   and from 8 to 32 additional lowercase letters or digits.</li>
--   </ul>
newMoveAccount :: Text -> Text -> Text -> MoveAccount

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newInviteAccountToOrganization</a> smart constructor.
data InviteAccountToOrganization
InviteAccountToOrganization' :: Maybe (Sensitive Text) -> Maybe [Tag] -> HandshakeParty -> InviteAccountToOrganization

-- | Create a value of <a>InviteAccountToOrganization</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:notes:InviteAccountToOrganization'</a>,
--   <a>inviteAccountToOrganization_notes</a> - Additional information that
--   you want to include in the generated email to the recipient account
--   owner.
--   
--   <a>$sel:tags:InviteAccountToOrganization'</a>,
--   <a>inviteAccountToOrganization_tags</a> - A list of tags that you want
--   to attach to the account when it becomes a member of the organization.
--   For each tag in the list, you must specify both a tag key and a value.
--   You can set the value to an empty string, but you can't set it to
--   <tt>null</tt>. For more information about tagging, see <a>Tagging AWS
--   Organizations resources</a> in the AWS Organizations User Guide.
--   
--   Any tags in the request are checked for compliance with any applicable
--   tag policies when the request is made. The request is rejected if the
--   tags in the request don't match the requirements of the policy at that
--   time. Tag policy compliance is <i><b>not</b></i> checked again when
--   the invitation is accepted and the tags are actually attached to the
--   account. That means that if the tag policy changes between the
--   invitation and the acceptance, then that tags could potentially be
--   non-compliant.
--   
--   If any one of the tags is invalid or if you exceed the allowed number
--   of tags for an account, then the entire request fails and invitations
--   are not sent.
--   
--   <a>$sel:target:InviteAccountToOrganization'</a>,
--   <a>inviteAccountToOrganization_target</a> - The identifier (ID) of the
--   AWS account that you want to invite to join your organization. This is
--   a JSON object that contains the following elements:
--   
--   <pre>
--   { "Type": "ACCOUNT", "Id": "&lt; account id number &gt;" }
--   </pre>
--   
--   If you use the AWS CLI, you can submit this as a single string,
--   similar to the following example:
--   
--   <pre>
--   --target Id=123456789012,Type=ACCOUNT
--   </pre>
--   
--   If you specify <tt>"Type": "ACCOUNT"</tt>, you must provide the AWS
--   account ID number as the <tt>Id</tt>. If you specify <tt>"Type":
--   "EMAIL"</tt>, you must specify the email address that is associated
--   with the account.
--   
--   <pre>
--   --target Id=diego@example.com,Type=EMAIL
--   </pre>
newInviteAccountToOrganization :: HandshakeParty -> InviteAccountToOrganization

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newInviteAccountToOrganizationResponse</a> smart
--   constructor.
data InviteAccountToOrganizationResponse
InviteAccountToOrganizationResponse' :: Maybe Handshake -> Int -> InviteAccountToOrganizationResponse

-- | Create a value of <a>InviteAccountToOrganizationResponse</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:handshake:InviteAccountToOrganizationResponse'</a>,
--   <a>inviteAccountToOrganizationResponse_handshake</a> - A structure
--   that contains details about the handshake that is created to support
--   this invitation request.
--   
--   <a>$sel:httpStatus:InviteAccountToOrganizationResponse'</a>,
--   <a>inviteAccountToOrganizationResponse_httpStatus</a> - The response's
--   http status code.
newInviteAccountToOrganizationResponse :: Int -> InviteAccountToOrganizationResponse

-- | Create a value of <a>ListAWSServiceAccessForOrganizationResponse</a>

--   present, indicates that more output is available than is included in
--   the current response. Use this value in the <tt>NextToken</tt> request
--   parameter in a subsequent call to the operation to get the next part
--   of the output. You should repeat this until the <tt>NextToken</tt>
--   response element comes back as <tt>null</tt>.
--   
--   
--   <a>$sel:enabledServicePrincipals:ListAWSServiceAccessForOrganizationResponse'</a>,
--   <a>listAWSServiceAccessForOrganizationResponse_enabledServicePrincipals</a>
--   - A list of the service principals for the services that are enabled
--   to integrate with your organization. Each principal is a structure
--   that includes the name and the date that it was enabled for
--   integration with AWS Organizations.
--   
--   <a>$sel:httpStatus:ListAWSServiceAccessForOrganizationResponse'</a>,
--   <a>listAWSServiceAccessForOrganizationResponse_httpStatus</a> - The
--   response's http status code.
newListAWSServiceAccessForOrganizationResponse :: Int -> ListAWSServiceAccessForOrganizationResponse

--   response in a previous request. A <tt>NextToken</tt> response
--   indicates that more output is available. Set this parameter to the
--   value of the previous call's <tt>NextToken</tt> response to indicate
--   where the output should continue from.

--   identifier (ID) of the root or OU whose child OUs you want to list.

--   following:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><b>Root</b> - A string that begins with "r-" followed by from 4 to
--   32 lowercase letters or digits.</li>
--   <li><b>Organizational unit (OU)</b> - A string that begins with "ou-"
--   followed by from 4 to 32 lowercase letters or digits (the ID of the
--   root that the OU is in). This string is followed by a second "-" dash
--   and from 8 to 32 additional lowercase letters or digits.</li>
--   </ul>

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newCreateOrganizationalUnit</a> smart constructor.
data CreateOrganizationalUnit
CreateOrganizationalUnit' :: Maybe [Tag] -> Text -> Text -> CreateOrganizationalUnit

-- | Create a value of <a>CreateOrganizationalUnit</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:tags:CreateOrganizationalUnit'</a>,
--   <a>createOrganizationalUnit_tags</a> - A list of tags that you want to
--   attach to the newly created OU. For each tag in the list, you must
--   specify both a tag key and a value. You can set the value to an empty
--   string, but you can't set it to <tt>null</tt>. For more information
--   about tagging, see <a>Tagging AWS Organizations resources</a> in the
--   AWS Organizations User Guide.
--   
--   If any one of the tags is invalid or if you exceed the allowed number
--   of tags for an OU, then the entire request fails and the OU is not
--   created.
--   
--   <a>$sel:parentId:CreateOrganizationalUnit'</a>,
--   <a>createOrganizationalUnit_parentId</a> - The unique identifier (ID)
--   of the parent root or OU that you want to create the new OU in.
--   
--   The <a>regex pattern</a> for a parent ID string requires one of the
--   following:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><b>Root</b> - A string that begins with "r-" followed by from 4 to
--   32 lowercase letters or digits.</li>
--   <li><b>Organizational unit (OU)</b> - A string that begins with "ou-"
--   followed by from 4 to 32 lowercase letters or digits (the ID of the
--   root that the OU is in). This string is followed by a second "-" dash
--   and from 8 to 32 additional lowercase letters or digits.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:CreateOrganizationalUnit'</a>,
--   <a>createOrganizationalUnit_name</a> - The friendly name to assign to
--   the new OU.
newCreateOrganizationalUnit :: Text -> Text -> CreateOrganizationalUnit

--   call's <tt>NextToken</tt> response to indicate where the output should
--   continue from.
