--   operation. If additional items exist beyond the maximum you specify,
--   the <tt>NextToken</tt> response element is present and has a value (is
--   not null). Include that value as the <tt>NextToken</tt> request
--   parameter in the next call to the operation to get the next part of
--   the results. Note that Organizations might return fewer results than
--   the maximum even when there are more results available. You should
--   check <tt>NextToken</tt> after every operation to ensure that you
--   receive all of the results.

data DetachPolicy

-- | Create a value of <a>DetachPolicy</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:policyId:DetachPolicy'</a>, <a>detachPolicy_policyId</a> - The
--   unique identifier (ID) of the policy you want to detach. You can get
--   the ID from the ListPolicies or ListPoliciesForTarget operations.
--   
--   The <a>regex pattern</a> for a policy ID string requires "p-" followed
--   by from 8 to 128 lowercase or uppercase letters, digits, or the
--   underscore character (_).
--   
--   <a>$sel:targetId:DetachPolicy'</a>, <a>detachPolicy_targetId</a> - The
--   unique identifier (ID) of the root, OU, or account that you want to
--   detach the policy from. You can get the ID from the ListRoots,
--   ListOrganizationalUnitsForParent, or ListAccounts operations.
--   
--   The <a>regex pattern</a> for a target ID string requires one of the
--   following:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><b>Root</b> - A string that begins with "r-" followed by from 4 to
--   32 lowercase letters or digits.</li>
--   <li><b>Account</b> - A string that consists of exactly 12 digits.</li>
--   <li><b>Organizational unit (OU)</b> - A string that begins with "ou-"
--   followed by from 4 to 32 lowercase letters or digits (the ID of the
--   root that the OU is in). This string is followed by a second "-" dash
--   and from 8 to 32 additional lowercase letters or digits.</li>
--   </ul>
newDetachPolicy :: Text -> Text -> DetachPolicy

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newDetachPolicyResponse</a> smart constructor.

-- | Create a value of <a>DetachPolicyResponse</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newCreateGovCloudAccount</a> smart constructor.
data CreateGovCloudAccount
CreateGovCloudAccount' :: Maybe IAMUserAccessToBilling -> Maybe Text -> Maybe [Tag] -> Sensitive Text -> Sensitive Text -> CreateGovCloudAccount

-- | Create a value of <a>CreateGovCloudAccount</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:iamUserAccessToBilling:CreateGovCloudAccount'</a>,
--   <a>createGovCloudAccount_iamUserAccessToBilling</a> - If set to
--   <tt>ALLOW</tt>, the new linked account in the commercial Region
--   enables IAM users to access account billing information <i>if</i> they
--   have the required permissions. If set to <tt>DENY</tt>, only the root
--   user of the new account can access account billing information. For
--   more information, see <a>Activating Access to the Billing and Cost
--   Management Console</a> in the <i>AWS Billing and Cost Management User
--   Guide.</i>
--   
--   If you don't specify this parameter, the value defaults to
--   <tt>ALLOW</tt>, and IAM users and roles with the required permissions
--   can access billing information for the new account.
--   
--   <a>$sel:roleName:CreateGovCloudAccount'</a>,
--   <a>createGovCloudAccount_roleName</a> - (Optional)
--   
--   The name of an IAM role that AWS Organizations automatically
--   preconfigures in the new member accounts in both the AWS GovCloud (US)
--   Region and in the commercial Region. This role trusts the management
--   account, allowing users in the management account to assume the role,
--   as permitted by the management account administrator. The role has
--   administrator permissions in the new member account.
--   
--   If you don't specify this parameter, the role name defaults to
--   <tt>OrganizationAccountAccessRole</tt>.
--   
--   For more information about how to use this role to access the member
--   account, see <a>Accessing and Administering the Member Accounts in
--   Your Organization</a> in the <i>AWS Organizations User Guide</i> and
--   steps 2 and 3 in <a>Tutorial: Delegate Access Across AWS Accounts
--   Using IAM Roles</a> in the <i>IAM User Guide.</i>
--   
--   The <a>regex pattern</a> that is used to validate this parameter. The
--   pattern can include uppercase letters, lowercase letters, digits with
--   no spaces, and any of the following characters: =,.@-
--   
--   <a>$sel:tags:CreateGovCloudAccount'</a>,
--   <a>createGovCloudAccount_tags</a> - A list of tags that you want to
--   attach to the newly created account. These tags are attached to the
--   commercial account associated with the GovCloud account, and not to
--   the GovCloud account itself. To add tags to the actual GovCloud
--   account, call the TagResource operation in the GovCloud region after
--   the new GovCloud account exists.
--   
--   For each tag in the list, you must specify both a tag key and a value.
--   You can set the value to an empty string, but you can't set it to
--   <tt>null</tt>. For more information about tagging, see <a>Tagging AWS
--   Organizations resources</a> in the AWS Organizations User Guide.
--   
--   If any one of the tags is invalid or if you exceed the allowed number
--   of tags for an account, then the entire request fails and the account
--   is not created.
--   
--   <a>$sel:email:CreateGovCloudAccount'</a>,
--   <a>createGovCloudAccount_email</a> - The email address of the owner to
--   assign to the new member account in the commercial Region. This email
--   address must not already be associated with another AWS account. You
--   must use a valid email address to complete account creation. You can't
--   access the root user of the account or remove an account that was
--   created with an invalid email address. Like all request parameters for
--   <tt>CreateGovCloudAccount</tt>, the request for the email address for
--   the AWS GovCloud (US) account originates from the commercial Region,
--   not from the AWS GovCloud (US) Region.
--   
--   <a>$sel:accountName:CreateGovCloudAccount'</a>,
--   <a>createGovCloudAccount_accountName</a> - The friendly name of the
--   member account.
newCreateGovCloudAccount :: Text -> Text -> CreateGovCloudAccount

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newCreateGovCloudAccountResponse</a> smart constructor.

--   you want to list. Don't specify a root.

data CreateAccount
CreateAccount' :: Maybe IAMUserAccessToBilling -> Maybe Text -> Maybe [Tag] -> Sensitive Text -> Sensitive Text -> CreateAccount

-- | Create a value of <a>CreateAccount</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:iamUserAccessToBilling:CreateAccount'</a>,
--   <a>createAccount_iamUserAccessToBilling</a> - If set to
--   <tt>ALLOW</tt>, the new account enables IAM users to access account
--   billing information <i>if</i> they have the required permissions. If
--   set to <tt>DENY</tt>, only the root user of the new account can access
--   account billing information. For more information, see <a>Activating
--   Access to the Billing and Cost Management Console</a> in the <i>AWS
--   Billing and Cost Management User Guide</i>.
--   
--   If you don't specify this parameter, the value defaults to
--   <tt>ALLOW</tt>, and IAM users and roles with the required permissions
--   can access billing information for the new account.
--   
--   <a>$sel:roleName:CreateAccount'</a>, <a>createAccount_roleName</a> -
--   (Optional)
--   
--   The name of an IAM role that AWS Organizations automatically
--   preconfigures in the new member account. This role trusts the
--   management account, allowing users in the management account to assume
--   the role, as permitted by the management account administrator. The
--   role has administrator permissions in the new member account.
--   
--   If you don't specify this parameter, the role name defaults to
--   <tt>OrganizationAccountAccessRole</tt>.
--   
--   For more information about how to use this role to access the member
--   account, see the following links:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>Accessing and Administering the Member Accounts in Your
--   Organization</a> in the <i>AWS Organizations User Guide</i></li>
--   <li>Steps 2 and 3 in <a>Tutorial: Delegate Access Across AWS Accounts
--   Using IAM Roles</a> in the <i>IAM User Guide</i></li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   The <a>regex pattern</a> that is used to validate this parameter. The
--   pattern can include uppercase letters, lowercase letters, digits with
--   no spaces, and any of the following characters: =,.@-
--   
--   <a>$sel:tags:CreateAccount'</a>, <a>createAccount_tags</a> - A list of
--   tags that you want to attach to the newly created account. For each
--   tag in the list, you must specify both a tag key and a value. You can
--   set the value to an empty string, but you can't set it to
--   <tt>null</tt>. For more information about tagging, see <a>Tagging AWS
--   Organizations resources</a> in the AWS Organizations User Guide.
--   
--   If any one of the tags is invalid or if you exceed the allowed number
--   of tags for an account, then the entire request fails and the account
--   is not created.
--   
--   <a>$sel:email:CreateAccount'</a>, <a>createAccount_email</a> - The
--   email address of the owner to assign to the new member account. This
--   email address must not already be associated with another AWS account.
--   You must use a valid email address to complete account creation. You
--   can't access the root user of the account or remove an account that
--   was created with an invalid email address.
--   
--   <a>$sel:accountName:CreateAccount'</a>,
--   <a>createAccount_accountName</a> - The friendly name of the member
--   account.
newCreateAccount :: Text -> Text -> CreateAccount

--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:createAccountStatus:CreateAccountResponse'</a>,
--   <a>createAccountResponse_createAccountStatus</a> - A structure that
--   contains details about the request to create an account. This response
--   structure might not be fully populated when you first receive it
--   because account creation is an asynchronous process. You can pass the
--   returned <tt>CreateAccountStatus</tt> ID as a parameter to
--   DescribeCreateAccountStatus to get status about the progress of the
--   request at later times. You can also check the AWS CloudTrail log for
--   the <tt>CreateAccountResult</tt> event. For more information, see
--   <a>Monitoring the Activity in Your Organization</a> in the <i>AWS
--   Organizations User Guide</i>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:httpStatus:CreateAccountResponse'</a>,
--   <a>createAccountResponse_httpStatus</a> - The response's http status
--   code.

--   constructor.
data DeregisterDelegatedAdministrator
DeregisterDelegatedAdministrator' :: Text -> Text -> DeregisterDelegatedAdministrator

-- | Create a value of <a>DeregisterDelegatedAdministrator</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:accountId:DeregisterDelegatedAdministrator'</a>,
--   <a>deregisterDelegatedAdministrator_accountId</a> - The account ID
--   number of the member account in the organization that you want to
--   deregister as a delegated administrator.
--   
--   <a>$sel:servicePrincipal:DeregisterDelegatedAdministrator'</a>,
--   <a>deregisterDelegatedAdministrator_servicePrincipal</a> - The service
--   principal name of an AWS service for which the account is a delegated
--   administrator.
--   
--   Delegated administrator privileges are revoked for only the specified
--   AWS service from the member account. If the specified service is the
--   only service for which the member account is a delegated
--   administrator, the operation also revokes Organizations read action
--   permissions.
newDeregisterDelegatedAdministrator :: Text -> Text -> DeregisterDelegatedAdministrator

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newDeregisterDelegatedAdministratorResponse</a> smart
--   constructor.
data DeregisterDelegatedAdministratorResponse
DeregisterDelegatedAdministratorResponse' :: DeregisterDelegatedAdministratorResponse

-- | Create a value of <a>DeregisterDelegatedAdministratorResponse</a> with
--   all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
newDeregisterDelegatedAdministratorResponse :: DeregisterDelegatedAdministratorResponse

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newTagResource</a> smart constructor.
data TagResource
TagResource' :: Text -> [Tag] -> TagResource

-- | Create a value of <a>TagResource</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:resourceId:TagResource'</a>, <a>tagResource_resourceId</a> -
--   The ID of the resource to add a tag to.
--   
--   <a>$sel:tags:TagResource'</a>, <a>tagResource_tags</a> - A list of
--   tags to add to the specified resource.
--   
--   You can specify any of the following taggable resources.
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>AWS account – specify the account ID number.</li>
--   <li>Organizational unit – specify the OU ID that begins with
--   <tt>ou-</tt> and looks similar to: <tt>ou-1a2b-34uvwxyz </tt></li>
--   <li>Root – specify the root ID that begins with <tt>r-</tt> and looks
--   similar to: <tt>r-1a2b </tt></li>
--   <li>Policy – specify the policy ID that begins with <tt>p-</tt>
--   andlooks similar to: <tt>p-12abcdefg3 </tt></li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   For each tag in the list, you must specify both a tag key and a value.
--   You can set the value to an empty string, but you can't set it to
--   <tt>null</tt>.
--   
--   If any one of the tags is invalid or if you exceed the allowed number
--   of tags for an account user, then the entire request fails and the
--   account is not created.
newTagResource :: Text -> TagResource

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newTagResourceResponse</a> smart constructor.
data TagResourceResponse
TagResourceResponse' :: TagResourceResponse

-- | Create a value of <a>TagResourceResponse</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
newTagResourceResponse :: TagResourceResponse

-- | Create a value of <a>ListCreateAccountStatus</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--

--   <a>listCreateAccountStatus_states</a> - A list of one or more states
--   that you want included in the response. If this parameter isn't
--   present, all requests are included in the response.
--   
--   <a>$sel:nextToken:ListCreateAccountStatus'</a>,
--   <a>listCreateAccountStatus_nextToken</a> - The parameter for receiving
--   additional results if you receive a <tt>NextToken</tt> response in a
--   previous request. A <tt>NextToken</tt> response indicates that more
--   output is available. Set this parameter to the value of the previous
--   call's <tt>NextToken</tt> response to indicate where the output should
--   continue from.
--   
--   <a>$sel:maxResults:ListCreateAccountStatus'</a>,
--   <a>listCreateAccountStatus_maxResults</a> - The total number of
--   results that you want included on each page of the response. If you do
--   not include this parameter, it defaults to a value that is specific to
--   the operation. If additional items exist beyond the maximum you
--   specify, the <tt>NextToken</tt> response element is present and has a
--   value (is not null). Include that value as the <tt>NextToken</tt>
--   request parameter in the next call to the operation to get the next
--   part of the results. Note that Organizations might return fewer
--   results than the maximum even when there are more results available.
--   You should check <tt>NextToken</tt> after every operation to ensure
--   that you receive all of the results.
newListCreateAccountStatus :: ListCreateAccountStatus

--   response element comes back as <tt>null</tt>.

--   <li>AWS account – specify the account ID number.</li>
--   <li>Organizational unit – specify the OU ID that begins with

--   <li>Root – specify the root ID that begins with <tt>r-</tt> and looks

--   andlooks similar to: <tt>p-12abcdefg3 </tt></li>

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newAttachPolicy</a> smart constructor.
data AttachPolicy
AttachPolicy' :: Text -> Text -> AttachPolicy

-- | Create a value of <a>AttachPolicy</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:policyId:AttachPolicy'</a>, <a>attachPolicy_policyId</a> - The
--   unique identifier (ID) of the policy that you want to attach to the
--   target. You can get the ID for the policy by calling the ListPolicies
--   operation.
--   
--   The <a>regex pattern</a> for a policy ID string requires "p-" followed
--   by from 8 to 128 lowercase or uppercase letters, digits, or the
--   underscore character (_).
--   
--   <a>$sel:targetId:AttachPolicy'</a>, <a>attachPolicy_targetId</a> - The
--   unique identifier (ID) of the root, OU, or account that you want to
--   attach the policy to. You can get the ID by calling the ListRoots,
--   ListOrganizationalUnitsForParent, or ListAccounts operations.
--   
--   The <a>regex pattern</a> for a target ID string requires one of the
--   following:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><b>Root</b> - A string that begins with "r-" followed by from 4 to
--   32 lowercase letters or digits.</li>
--   <li><b>Account</b> - A string that consists of exactly 12 digits.</li>
--   <li><b>Organizational unit (OU)</b> - A string that begins with "ou-"
--   followed by from 4 to 32 lowercase letters or digits (the ID of the
--   root that the OU is in). This string is followed by a second "-" dash
--   and from 8 to 32 additional lowercase letters or digits.</li>
--   </ul>
newAttachPolicy :: Text -> Text -> AttachPolicy

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newAttachPolicyResponse</a> smart constructor.
data AttachPolicyResponse
AttachPolicyResponse' :: AttachPolicyResponse

-- | Create a value of <a>AttachPolicyResponse</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
newAttachPolicyResponse :: AttachPolicyResponse

--   previous request. A <tt>NextToken</tt> response indicates that more
--   output is available. Set this parameter to the value of the previous
--   call's <tt>NextToken</tt> response to indicate where the output should
--   continue from.

--   <a>listPoliciesForTarget_maxResults</a> - The total number of results
--   that you want included on each page of the response. If you do not
--   include this parameter, it defaults to a value that is specific to the
--   operation. If additional items exist beyond the maximum you specify,
--   the <tt>NextToken</tt> response element is present and has a value (is
--   not null). Include that value as the <tt>NextToken</tt> request
--   parameter in the next call to the operation to get the next part of

--   32 lowercase letters or digits.</li>

--   <li><b>Organizational unit (OU)</b> - A string that begins with "ou-"
--   followed by from 4 to 32 lowercase letters or digits (the ID of the
--   root that the OU is in). This string is followed by a second "-" dash
--   and from 8 to 32 additional lowercase letters or digits.</li>
--   </ul>

--   <a>$sel:filter':ListPoliciesForTarget'</a>,
--   <a>listPoliciesForTarget_filter</a> - The type of policy that you want
--   to include in the returned list. You must specify one of the following
--   values:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>AISERVICES_OPT_OUT_POLICY</a></li>
--   <li><a>BACKUP_POLICY</a></li>
--   <li><a>SERVICE_CONTROL_POLICY</a></li>
--   <li><a>TAG_POLICY</a></li>
--   </ul>

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newListHandshakesForOrganization</a> smart constructor.
data ListHandshakesForOrganization
ListHandshakesForOrganization' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe HandshakeFilter -> Maybe Natural -> ListHandshakesForOrganization

-- | Create a value of <a>ListHandshakesForOrganization</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:nextToken:ListHandshakesForOrganization'</a>,
--   <a>listHandshakesForOrganization_nextToken</a> - The parameter for
--   receiving additional results if you receive a <tt>NextToken</tt>
--   response in a previous request. A <tt>NextToken</tt> response
--   indicates that more output is available. Set this parameter to the
--   value of the previous call's <tt>NextToken</tt> response to indicate
--   where the output should continue from.
--   
--   <a>$sel:filter':ListHandshakesForOrganization'</a>,
--   <a>listHandshakesForOrganization_filter</a> - A filter of the
--   handshakes that you want included in the response. The default is all
--   types. Use the <tt>ActionType</tt> element to limit the output to only
--   a specified type, such as <tt>INVITE</tt>,
--   <tt>ENABLE-ALL-FEATURES</tt>, or <tt>APPROVE-ALL-FEATURES</tt>.
--   Alternatively, for the <tt>ENABLE-ALL-FEATURES</tt> handshake that
--   generates a separate child handshake for each member account, you can
--   specify the <tt>ParentHandshakeId</tt> to see only the handshakes that
--   were generated by that parent request.
--   
--   <a>$sel:maxResults:ListHandshakesForOrganization'</a>,
--   <a>listHandshakesForOrganization_maxResults</a> - The total number of
--   results that you want included on each page of the response. If you do
--   not include this parameter, it defaults to a value that is specific to
--   the operation. If additional items exist beyond the maximum you
--   specify, the <tt>NextToken</tt> response element is present and has a
--   value (is not null). Include that value as the <tt>NextToken</tt>
--   request parameter in the next call to the operation to get the next
--   part of the results. Note that Organizations might return fewer
--   results than the maximum even when there are more results available.
--   You should check <tt>NextToken</tt> after every operation to ensure
--   that you receive all of the results.
newListHandshakesForOrganization :: ListHandshakesForOrganization

data RegisterDelegatedAdministrator

-- | Create a value of <a>RegisterDelegatedAdministrator</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:accountId:RegisterDelegatedAdministrator'</a>,
--   <a>registerDelegatedAdministrator_accountId</a> - The account ID
--   number of the member account in the organization to register as a
--   delegated administrator.
--   
--   <a>$sel:servicePrincipal:RegisterDelegatedAdministrator'</a>,
--   <a>registerDelegatedAdministrator_servicePrincipal</a> - The service
--   principal of the AWS service for which you want to make the member
--   account a delegated administrator.
newRegisterDelegatedAdministrator :: Text -> Text -> RegisterDelegatedAdministrator

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newRegisterDelegatedAdministratorResponse</a> smart
--   constructor.
data RegisterDelegatedAdministratorResponse
RegisterDelegatedAdministratorResponse' :: RegisterDelegatedAdministratorResponse

-- | Create a value of <a>RegisterDelegatedAdministratorResponse</a> with
--   all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
newRegisterDelegatedAdministratorResponse :: RegisterDelegatedAdministratorResponse

data DeleteOrganizationalUnit

-- | Create a value of <a>DeleteOrganizationalUnit</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:organizationalUnitId:DeleteOrganizationalUnit'</a>,
--   <a>deleteOrganizationalUnit_organizationalUnitId</a> - The unique
--   identifier (ID) of the organizational unit that you want to delete.
--   You can get the ID from the ListOrganizationalUnitsForParent
--   operation.
--   
--   The <a>regex pattern</a> for an organizational unit ID string requires
--   "ou-" followed by from 4 to 32 lowercase letters or digits (the ID of
--   the root that contains the OU). This string is followed by a second
--   "-" dash and from 8 to 32 additional lowercase letters or digits.
newDeleteOrganizationalUnit :: Text -> DeleteOrganizationalUnit

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newDeleteOrganizationalUnitResponse</a> smart
--   constructor.

-- | Contains information about an AWS account that is a member of an
--   organization.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newAccount</a> smart constructor.
data Account
Account' :: Maybe AccountStatus -> Maybe AccountJoinedMethod -> Maybe (Sensitive Text) -> Maybe Text -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe (Sensitive Text) -> Maybe Text -> Account

-- | Create a value of <a>Account</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:status:Account'</a>, <a>account_status</a> - The status of the
--   account in the organization.
--   
--   <a>$sel:joinedMethod:Account'</a>, <a>account_joinedMethod</a> - The
--   method by which the account joined the organization.
--   
--   <a>$sel:email:Account'</a>, <a>account_email</a> - The email address
--   associated with the AWS account.
--   
--   The <a>regex pattern</a> for this parameter is a string of characters
--   that represents a standard internet email address.
--   
--   <a>$sel:arn:Account'</a>, <a>account_arn</a> - The Amazon Resource
--   Name (ARN) of the account.
--   
--   For more information about ARNs in Organizations, see <a>ARN Formats
--   Supported by Organizations</a> in the <i>AWS Service Authorization
--   Reference</i>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:joinedTimestamp:Account'</a>, <a>account_joinedTimestamp</a> -
--   The date the account became a part of the organization.
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:Account'</a>, <a>account_name</a> - The friendly name of
--   the account.
--   
--   The <a>regex pattern</a> that is used to validate this parameter is a
--   string of any of the characters in the ASCII character range.
--   
--   <a>$sel:id:Account'</a>, <a>account_id</a> - The unique identifier
--   (ID) of the account.
--   
--   The <a>regex pattern</a> for an account ID string requires exactly 12
--   digits.
newAccount :: Account

-- | Contains a list of child entities, either OUs or accounts.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newChild</a> smart constructor.
data Child
Child' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe ChildType -> Child

-- | Create a value of <a>Child</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:id:Child'</a>, <a>child_id</a> - The unique identifier (ID) of
--   this child entity.
--   
--   The <a>regex pattern</a> for a child ID string requires one of the
--   following:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><b>Account</b> - A string that consists of exactly 12 digits.</li>
--   <li><b>Organizational unit (OU)</b> - A string that begins with "ou-"
--   followed by from 4 to 32 lowercase letters or digits (the ID of the
--   root that contains the OU). This string is followed by a second "-"
--   dash and from 8 to 32 additional lowercase letters or digits.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:type':Child'</a>, <a>child_type</a> - The type of this child
--   entity.
newChild :: Child

-- | Contains the status about a CreateAccount or CreateGovCloudAccount
--   request to create an AWS account or an AWS GovCloud (US) account in an
--   organization.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newCreateAccountStatus</a> smart constructor.
data CreateAccountStatus
CreateAccountStatus' :: Maybe CreateAccountFailureReason -> Maybe CreateAccountState -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe (Sensitive Text) -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe POSIX -> CreateAccountStatus

-- | Create a value of <a>CreateAccountStatus</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:failureReason:CreateAccountStatus'</a>,
--   <a>createAccountStatus_failureReason</a> - If the request failed, a
--   description of the reason for the failure.
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>ACCOUNT_LIMIT_EXCEEDED: The account couldn't be created because
--   you reached the limit on the number of accounts in your
--   organization.</li>
--   <li>CONCURRENT_ACCOUNT_MODIFICATION: You already submitted a request
--   with the same information.</li>
--   <li>EMAIL_ALREADY_EXISTS: The account could not be created because
--   another AWS account with that email address already exists.</li>
--   <li>FAILED_BUSINESS_VALIDATION: The AWS account that owns your
--   organization failed to receive business license validation.</li>
--   <li>GOVCLOUD_ACCOUNT_ALREADY_EXISTS: The account in the AWS GovCloud
--   (US) Region could not be created because this Region already includes
--   an account with that email address.</li>
--   <li>IDENTITY_INVALID_BUSINESS_VALIDATION: The AWS account that owns
--   your organization can't complete business license validation because
--   it doesn't have valid identity data.</li>
--   <li>INVALID_ADDRESS: The account could not be created because the
--   address you provided is not valid.</li>
--   <li>INVALID_EMAIL: The account could not be created because the email
--   address you provided is not valid.</li>
--   <li>INTERNAL_FAILURE: The account could not be created because of an
--   internal failure. Try again later. If the problem persists, contact
--   AWS Customer Support.</li>
--   <li>MISSING_BUSINESS_VALIDATION: The AWS account that owns your
--   organization has not received Business Validation.</li>
--   <li>MISSING_PAYMENT_INSTRUMENT: You must configure the management
--   account with a valid payment method, such as a credit card.</li>
--   <li>PENDING_BUSINESS_VALIDATION: The AWS account that owns your
--   organization is still in the process of completing business license
--   validation.</li>
--   <li>UNKNOWN_BUSINESS_VALIDATION: The AWS account that owns your
--   organization has an unknown issue with business license
--   validation.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:state:CreateAccountStatus'</a>,
--   <a>createAccountStatus_state</a> - The status of the asynchronous
--   request to create an AWS account.
--   
--   <a>$sel:completedTimestamp:CreateAccountStatus'</a>,
--   <a>createAccountStatus_completedTimestamp</a> - The date and time that
--   the account was created and the request completed.
--   
--   <a>$sel:accountName:CreateAccountStatus'</a>,
--   <a>createAccountStatus_accountName</a> - The account name given to the
--   account when it was created.
--   
--   <a>$sel:accountId:CreateAccountStatus'</a>,
--   <a>createAccountStatus_accountId</a> - If the account was created
--   successfully, the unique identifier (ID) of the new account.
--   
--   The <a>regex pattern</a> for an account ID string requires exactly 12
--   digits.
--   
--   <a>$sel:id:CreateAccountStatus'</a>, <a>createAccountStatus_id</a> -
--   The unique identifier (ID) that references this request. You get this
--   value from the response of the initial CreateAccount request to create
--   the account.
--   
--   The <a>regex pattern</a> for a create account request ID string
--   requires "car-" followed by from 8 to 32 lowercase letters or digits.
--   
--   <a>$sel:govCloudAccountId:CreateAccountStatus'</a>,
--   <a>createAccountStatus_govCloudAccountId</a> - If the account was
--   created successfully, the unique identifier (ID) of the new account in
--   the AWS GovCloud (US) Region.
--   
--   <a>$sel:requestedTimestamp:CreateAccountStatus'</a>,
--   <a>createAccountStatus_requestedTimestamp</a> - The date and time that
--   the request was made for the account creation.
newCreateAccountStatus :: CreateAccountStatus

-- | Contains information about the delegated administrator.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newDelegatedAdministrator</a> smart constructor.
data DelegatedAdministrator
DelegatedAdministrator' :: Maybe AccountStatus -> Maybe AccountJoinedMethod -> Maybe (Sensitive Text) -> Maybe Text -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe (Sensitive Text) -> Maybe Text -> DelegatedAdministrator

-- | Create a value of <a>DelegatedAdministrator</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:status:DelegatedAdministrator'</a>,
--   <a>delegatedAdministrator_status</a> - The status of the delegated
--   administrator's account in the organization.
--   
--   <a>$sel:joinedMethod:DelegatedAdministrator'</a>,
--   <a>delegatedAdministrator_joinedMethod</a> - The method by which the
--   delegated administrator's account joined the organization.
--   
--   <a>$sel:email:DelegatedAdministrator'</a>,
--   <a>delegatedAdministrator_email</a> - The email address that is
--   associated with the delegated administrator's AWS account.
--   
--   <a>$sel:arn:DelegatedAdministrator'</a>,
--   <a>delegatedAdministrator_arn</a> - The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of
--   the delegated administrator's account.
--   
--   <a>$sel:joinedTimestamp:DelegatedAdministrator'</a>,
--   <a>delegatedAdministrator_joinedTimestamp</a> - The date when the
--   delegated administrator's account became a part of the organization.
--   
--   <a>$sel:delegationEnabledDate:DelegatedAdministrator'</a>,
--   <a>delegatedAdministrator_delegationEnabledDate</a> - The date when
--   the account was made a delegated administrator.
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:DelegatedAdministrator'</a>,
--   <a>delegatedAdministrator_name</a> - The friendly name of the
--   delegated administrator's account.
--   
--   <a>$sel:id:DelegatedAdministrator'</a>,
--   <a>delegatedAdministrator_id</a> - The unique identifier (ID) of the
--   delegated administrator's account.
newDelegatedAdministrator :: DelegatedAdministrator

-- | Contains information about the AWS service for which the account is a
--   delegated administrator.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newDelegatedService</a> smart constructor.
data DelegatedService
DelegatedService' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe POSIX -> DelegatedService

-- | Create a value of <a>DelegatedService</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:servicePrincipal:DelegatedService'</a>,
--   <a>delegatedService_servicePrincipal</a> - The name of an AWS service
--   that can request an operation for the specified service. This is
--   typically in the form of a URL, such as: <tt>
--   servicename.amazonaws.com</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:delegationEnabledDate:DelegatedService'</a>,
--   <a>delegatedService_delegationEnabledDate</a> - The date that the
--   account became a delegated administrator for this service.
newDelegatedService :: DelegatedService

-- | Contains rules to be applied to the affected accounts. The effective
--   policy is the aggregation of any policies the account inherits, plus
--   any policy directly attached to the account.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newEffectivePolicy</a> smart constructor.
data EffectivePolicy
EffectivePolicy' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe EffectivePolicyType -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe Text -> EffectivePolicy

-- | Create a value of <a>EffectivePolicy</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:targetId:EffectivePolicy'</a>, <a>effectivePolicy_targetId</a>
--   - The account ID of the policy target.
--   
--   <a>$sel:policyType:EffectivePolicy'</a>,
--   <a>effectivePolicy_policyType</a> - The policy type.
--   
--   <a>$sel:lastUpdatedTimestamp:EffectivePolicy'</a>,
--   <a>effectivePolicy_lastUpdatedTimestamp</a> - The time of the last
--   update to this policy.
--   
--   <a>$sel:policyContent:EffectivePolicy'</a>,
--   <a>effectivePolicy_policyContent</a> - The text content of the policy.
newEffectivePolicy :: EffectivePolicy

-- | A structure that contains details of a service principal that
--   represents an AWS service that is enabled to integrate with AWS
--   Organizations.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newEnabledServicePrincipal</a> smart constructor.
data EnabledServicePrincipal

-- | Create a value of <a>EnabledServicePrincipal</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--

--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:servicePrincipal:EnabledServicePrincipal'</a>,
--   <a>enabledServicePrincipal_servicePrincipal</a> - The name of the
--   service principal. This is typically in the form of a URL, such as:
--   <tt> servicename.amazonaws.com</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:dateEnabled:EnabledServicePrincipal'</a>,
--   <a>enabledServicePrincipal_dateEnabled</a> - The date that the service
--   principal was enabled for integration with AWS Organizations.
newEnabledServicePrincipal :: EnabledServicePrincipal

-- | Contains information that must be exchanged to securely establish a
--   relationship between two accounts (an <i>originator</i> and a
--   <i>recipient</i>). For example, when a management account (the
--   originator) invites another account (the recipient) to join its
--   organization, the two accounts exchange information as a series of
--   handshake requests and responses.
--   
--   <b>Note:</b> Handshakes that are <tt>CANCELED</tt>, <tt>ACCEPTED</tt>,
--   or <tt>DECLINED</tt> show up in lists for only 30 days after entering
--   that state After that they are deleted.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newHandshake</a> smart constructor.
data Handshake
Handshake' :: Maybe HandshakeState -> Maybe Text -> Maybe ActionType -> Maybe [HandshakeResource] -> Maybe Text -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe [HandshakeParty] -> Maybe POSIX -> Handshake

-- | Create a value of <a>Handshake</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:state:Handshake'</a>, <a>handshake_state</a> - The current
--   state of the handshake. Use the state to trace the flow of the
--   handshake through the process from its creation to its acceptance. The
--   meaning of each of the valid values is as follows:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><b>REQUESTED</b>: This handshake was sent to multiple recipients
--   (applicable to only some handshake types) and not all recipients have
--   responded yet. The request stays in this state until all recipients
--   respond.</li>
--   <li><b>OPEN</b>: This handshake was sent to multiple recipients
--   (applicable to only some policy types) and all recipients have
--   responded, allowing the originator to complete the handshake
--   action.</li>
--   <li><b>CANCELED</b>: This handshake is no longer active because it was
--   canceled by the originating account.</li>
--   <li><b>ACCEPTED</b>: This handshake is complete because it has been
--   accepted by the recipient.</li>
--   <li><b>DECLINED</b>: This handshake is no longer active because it was
--   declined by the recipient account.</li>
--   <li><b>EXPIRED</b>: This handshake is no longer active because the
--   originator did not receive a response of any kind from the recipient
--   before the expiration time (15 days).</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:arn:Handshake'</a>, <a>handshake_arn</a> - The Amazon Resource
--   Name (ARN) of a handshake.
--   
--   For more information about ARNs in Organizations, see <a>ARN Formats
--   Supported by Organizations</a> in the <i>AWS Service Authorization
--   Reference</i>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:action:Handshake'</a>, <a>handshake_action</a> - The type of
--   handshake, indicating what action occurs when the recipient accepts
--   the handshake. The following handshake types are supported:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><b>INVITE</b>: This type of handshake represents a request to join
--   an organization. It is always sent from the management account to only
--   non-member accounts.</li>
--   <li><b>ENABLE_ALL_FEATURES</b>: This type of handshake represents a
--   request to enable all features in an organization. It is always sent
--   from the management account to only <i>invited</i> member accounts.
--   Created accounts do not receive this because those accounts were
--   created by the organization's management account and approval is
--   inferred.</li>
--   <li><b>APPROVE_ALL_FEATURES</b>: This type of handshake is sent from
--   the Organizations service when all member accounts have approved the
--   <tt>ENABLE_ALL_FEATURES</tt> invitation. It is sent only to the
--   management account and signals the master that it can finalize the
--   process to enable all features.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:resources:Handshake'</a>, <a>handshake_resources</a> -
--   Additional information that is needed to process the handshake.
--   
--   <a>$sel:id:Handshake'</a>, <a>handshake_id</a> - The unique identifier
--   (ID) of a handshake. The originating account creates the ID when it
--   initiates the handshake.
--   
--   The <a>regex pattern</a> for handshake ID string requires "h-"
--   followed by from 8 to 32 lowercase letters or digits.
--   
--   <a>$sel:expirationTimestamp:Handshake'</a>,
--   <a>handshake_expirationTimestamp</a> - The date and time that the
--   handshake expires. If the recipient of the handshake request fails to
--   respond before the specified date and time, the handshake becomes
--   inactive and is no longer valid.
--   
--   <a>$sel:parties:Handshake'</a>, <a>handshake_parties</a> - Information
--   about the two accounts that are participating in the handshake.
--   
--   <a>$sel:requestedTimestamp:Handshake'</a>,
--   <a>handshake_requestedTimestamp</a> - The date and time that the
--   handshake request was made.
newHandshake :: Handshake

-- | Specifies the criteria that are used to select the handshakes for the
--   operation.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newHandshakeFilter</a> smart constructor.
data HandshakeFilter
HandshakeFilter' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe ActionType -> HandshakeFilter

-- | Create a value of <a>HandshakeFilter</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:parentHandshakeId:HandshakeFilter'</a>,
--   <a>handshakeFilter_parentHandshakeId</a> - Specifies the parent
--   handshake. Only used for handshake types that are a child of another
--   type.
--   
--   If you specify <tt>ParentHandshakeId</tt>, you cannot also specify
--   <tt>ActionType</tt>.
--   
--   The <a>regex pattern</a> for handshake ID string requires "h-"
--   followed by from 8 to 32 lowercase letters or digits.
--   
--   <a>$sel:actionType:HandshakeFilter'</a>,
--   <a>handshakeFilter_actionType</a> - Specifies the type of handshake
--   action.
--   
--   If you specify <tt>ActionType</tt>, you cannot also specify
--   <tt>ParentHandshakeId</tt>.
newHandshakeFilter :: HandshakeFilter

-- | Identifies a participant in a handshake.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newHandshakeParty</a> smart constructor.
data HandshakeParty
HandshakeParty' :: Sensitive Text -> HandshakePartyType -> HandshakeParty

-- | Create a value of <a>HandshakeParty</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:id:HandshakeParty'</a>, <a>handshakeParty_id</a> - The unique
--   identifier (ID) for the party.
--   
--   The <a>regex pattern</a> for handshake ID string requires "h-"
--   followed by from 8 to 32 lowercase letters or digits.
--   
--   <a>$sel:type':HandshakeParty'</a>, <a>handshakeParty_type</a> - The
--   type of party.
newHandshakeParty :: Text -> HandshakePartyType -> HandshakeParty

-- | Contains additional data that is needed to process a handshake.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newHandshakeResource</a> smart constructor.
data HandshakeResource
HandshakeResource' :: Maybe (Sensitive Text) -> Maybe [HandshakeResource] -> Maybe HandshakeResourceType -> HandshakeResource

-- | Create a value of <a>HandshakeResource</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:value:HandshakeResource'</a>, <a>handshakeResource_value</a> -
--   The information that is passed to the other party in the handshake.
--   The format of the value string must match the requirements of the
--   specified type.
--   
--   <a>$sel:resources:HandshakeResource'</a>,
--   <a>handshakeResource_resources</a> - When needed, contains an
--   additional array of <tt>HandshakeResource</tt> objects.
--   
--   <a>$sel:type':HandshakeResource'</a>, <a>handshakeResource_type</a> -
--   The type of information being passed, specifying how the value is to
--   be interpreted by the other party:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>ACCOUNT</tt> - Specifies an AWS account ID number.</li>
--   <li><tt>ORGANIZATION</tt> - Specifies an organization ID number.</li>
--   <li><tt>EMAIL</tt> - Specifies the email address that is associated
--   with the account that receives the handshake.</li>
--   <li><tt>OWNER_EMAIL</tt> - Specifies the email address associated with
--   the management account. Included as information about an
--   organization.</li>
--   <li><tt>OWNER_NAME</tt> - Specifies the name associated with the
--   management account. Included as information about an
--   organization.</li>
--   <li><tt>NOTES</tt> - Additional text provided by the handshake
--   initiator and intended for the recipient to read.</li>
--   </ul>
newHandshakeResource :: HandshakeResource

-- | Contains details about an organization. An organization is a
--   collection of accounts that are centrally managed together using
--   consolidated billing, organized hierarchically with organizational
--   units (OUs), and controlled with policies .
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newOrganization</a> smart constructor.
data Organization
Organization' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe (Sensitive Text) -> Maybe [PolicyTypeSummary] -> Maybe Text -> Maybe OrganizationFeatureSet -> Organization

-- | Create a value of <a>Organization</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:arn:Organization'</a>, <a>organization_arn</a> - The Amazon
--   Resource Name (ARN) of an organization.
--   
--   For more information about ARNs in Organizations, see <a>ARN Formats
--   Supported by Organizations</a> in the <i>AWS Service Authorization
--   Reference</i>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:masterAccountId:Organization'</a>,
--   <a>organization_masterAccountId</a> - The unique identifier (ID) of
--   the management account of an organization.
--   
--   The <a>regex pattern</a> for an account ID string requires exactly 12
--   digits.
--   
--   <a>$sel:masterAccountArn:Organization'</a>,
--   <a>organization_masterAccountArn</a> - The Amazon Resource Name (ARN)
--   of the account that is designated as the management account for the
--   organization.
--   
--   For more information about ARNs in Organizations, see <a>ARN Formats
--   Supported by Organizations</a> in the <i>AWS Service Authorization
--   Reference</i>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:masterAccountEmail:Organization'</a>,
--   <a>organization_masterAccountEmail</a> - The email address that is
--   associated with the AWS account that is designated as the management
--   account for the organization.
--   
--   <a>$sel:availablePolicyTypes:Organization'</a>,
--   <a>organization_availablePolicyTypes</a> - Do not use. This field is
--   deprecated and doesn't provide complete information about the policies
--   in your organization.
--   
--   To determine the policies that are enabled and available for use in
--   your organization, use the ListRoots operation instead.
--   
--   <a>$sel:id:Organization'</a>, <a>organization_id</a> - The unique
--   identifier (ID) of an organization.
--   
--   The <a>regex pattern</a> for an organization ID string requires "o-"
--   followed by from 10 to 32 lowercase letters or digits.
--   
--   <a>$sel:featureSet:Organization'</a>, <a>organization_featureSet</a> -
--   Specifies the functionality that currently is available to the
--   organization. If set to "ALL", then all features are enabled and
--   policies can be applied to accounts in the organization. If set to
--   "CONSOLIDATED_BILLING", then only consolidated billing functionality
--   is available. For more information, see <a>Enabling All Features in
--   Your Organization</a> in the <i>AWS Organizations User Guide</i>.
newOrganization :: Organization

-- | Contains details about an organizational unit (OU). An OU is a
--   container of AWS accounts within a root of an organization. Policies
--   that are attached to an OU apply to all accounts contained in that OU
--   and in any child OUs.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newOrganizationalUnit</a> smart constructor.
data OrganizationalUnit
OrganizationalUnit' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> OrganizationalUnit

-- | Create a value of <a>OrganizationalUnit</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:arn:OrganizationalUnit'</a>, <a>organizationalUnit_arn</a> -
--   The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of this OU.
--   
--   For more information about ARNs in Organizations, see <a>ARN Formats
--   Supported by Organizations</a> in the <i>AWS Service Authorization
--   Reference</i>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:OrganizationalUnit'</a>, <a>organizationalUnit_name</a> -
--   The friendly name of this OU.
--   
--   The <a>regex pattern</a> that is used to validate this parameter is a
--   string of any of the characters in the ASCII character range.
--   
--   <a>$sel:id:OrganizationalUnit'</a>, <a>organizationalUnit_id</a> - The
--   unique identifier (ID) associated with this OU.
--   
--   The <a>regex pattern</a> for an organizational unit ID string requires
--   "ou-" followed by from 4 to 32 lowercase letters or digits (the ID of
--   the root that contains the OU). This string is followed by a second
--   "-" dash and from 8 to 32 additional lowercase letters or digits.
newOrganizationalUnit :: OrganizationalUnit

-- | Contains information about either a root or an organizational unit
--   (OU) that can contain OUs or accounts in an organization.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newParent</a> smart constructor.
data Parent
Parent' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe ParentType -> Parent

-- | Create a value of <a>Parent</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:id:Parent'</a>, <a>parent_id</a> - The unique identifier (ID)
--   of the parent entity.
--   
--   The <a>regex pattern</a> for a parent ID string requires one of the
--   following:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><b>Root</b> - A string that begins with "r-" followed by from 4 to
--   32 lowercase letters or digits.</li>
--   <li><b>Organizational unit (OU)</b> - A string that begins with "ou-"
--   followed by from 4 to 32 lowercase letters or digits (the ID of the
--   root that the OU is in). This string is followed by a second "-" dash
--   and from 8 to 32 additional lowercase letters or digits.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:type':Parent'</a>, <a>parent_type</a> - The type of the parent
--   entity.
newParent :: Parent

-- | Contains rules to be applied to the affected accounts. Policies can be
--   attached directly to accounts, or to roots and OUs to affect all
--   accounts in those hierarchies.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newPolicy</a> smart constructor.
data Policy
Policy' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe PolicySummary -> Policy

-- | Create a value of <a>Policy</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:content:Policy'</a>, <a>policy_content</a> - The text content
--   of the policy.
--   
--   <a>$sel:policySummary:Policy'</a>, <a>policy_policySummary</a> - A
--   structure that contains additional details about the policy.
newPolicy :: Policy

-- | Contains information about a policy, but does not include the content.
--   To see the content of a policy, see DescribePolicy.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newPolicySummary</a> smart constructor.
data PolicySummary
PolicySummary' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe PolicyType -> Maybe Text -> PolicySummary

-- | Create a value of <a>PolicySummary</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:arn:PolicySummary'</a>, <a>policySummary_arn</a> - The Amazon
--   Resource Name (ARN) of the policy.
--   
--   For more information about ARNs in Organizations, see <a>ARN Formats
--   Supported by Organizations</a> in the <i>AWS Service Authorization
--   Reference</i>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:PolicySummary'</a>, <a>policySummary_name</a> - The
--   friendly name of the policy.
--   
--   The <a>regex pattern</a> that is used to validate this parameter is a
--   string of any of the characters in the ASCII character range.
--   
--   <a>$sel:id:PolicySummary'</a>, <a>policySummary_id</a> - The unique
--   identifier (ID) of the policy.
--   
--   The <a>regex pattern</a> for a policy ID string requires "p-" followed
--   by from 8 to 128 lowercase or uppercase letters, digits, or the
--   underscore character (_).
--   
--   <a>$sel:awsManaged:PolicySummary'</a>, <a>policySummary_awsManaged</a>
--   - A boolean value that indicates whether the specified policy is an
--   AWS managed policy. If true, then you can attach the policy to roots,
--   OUs, or accounts, but you cannot edit it.
--   
--   <a>$sel:type':PolicySummary'</a>, <a>policySummary_type</a> - The type
--   of policy.
--   
--   <a>$sel:description:PolicySummary'</a>,
--   <a>policySummary_description</a> - The description of the policy.
newPolicySummary :: PolicySummary

-- | Contains information about a root, OU, or account that a policy is
--   attached to.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newPolicyTargetSummary</a> smart constructor.
data PolicyTargetSummary
PolicyTargetSummary' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe TargetType -> PolicyTargetSummary

-- | Create a value of <a>PolicyTargetSummary</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:targetId:PolicyTargetSummary'</a>,
--   <a>policyTargetSummary_targetId</a> - The unique identifier (ID) of
--   the policy target.
--   
--   The <a>regex pattern</a> for a target ID string requires one of the
--   following:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><b>Root</b> - A string that begins with "r-" followed by from 4 to
--   32 lowercase letters or digits.</li>
--   <li><b>Account</b> - A string that consists of exactly 12 digits.</li>
--   <li><b>Organizational unit (OU)</b> - A string that begins with "ou-"
--   followed by from 4 to 32 lowercase letters or digits (the ID of the
--   root that the OU is in). This string is followed by a second "-" dash
--   and from 8 to 32 additional lowercase letters or digits.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:arn:PolicyTargetSummary'</a>, <a>policyTargetSummary_arn</a> -
--   The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the policy target.
--   
--   For more information about ARNs in Organizations, see <a>ARN Formats
--   Supported by Organizations</a> in the <i>AWS Service Authorization
--   Reference</i>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:PolicyTargetSummary'</a>, <a>policyTargetSummary_name</a>
--   - The friendly name of the policy target.
--   
--   The <a>regex pattern</a> that is used to validate this parameter is a
--   string of any of the characters in the ASCII character range.
--   
--   <a>$sel:type':PolicyTargetSummary'</a>,
--   <a>policyTargetSummary_type</a> - The type of the policy target.
newPolicyTargetSummary :: PolicyTargetSummary

-- | Contains information about a policy type and its status in the
--   associated root.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newPolicyTypeSummary</a> smart constructor.
data PolicyTypeSummary
PolicyTypeSummary' :: Maybe PolicyTypeStatus -> Maybe PolicyType -> PolicyTypeSummary

-- | Create a value of <a>PolicyTypeSummary</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:status:PolicyTypeSummary'</a>, <a>policyTypeSummary_status</a>
--   - The status of the policy type as it relates to the associated root.
--   To attach a policy of the specified type to a root or to an OU or
--   account in that root, it must be available in the organization and
--   enabled for that root.
--   
--   <a>$sel:type':PolicyTypeSummary'</a>, <a>policyTypeSummary_type</a> -
--   The name of the policy type.
newPolicyTypeSummary :: PolicyTypeSummary

-- | Contains details about a root. A root is a top-level parent node in
--   the hierarchy of an organization that can contain organizational units
--   (OUs) and accounts. The root contains every AWS account in the
--   organization.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newRoot</a> smart constructor.
data Root
Root' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe [PolicyTypeSummary] -> Root

-- | Create a value of <a>Root</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:arn:Root'</a>, <a>root_arn</a> - The Amazon Resource Name
--   (ARN) of the root.
--   
--   For more information about ARNs in Organizations, see <a>ARN Formats
--   Supported by Organizations</a> in the <i>AWS Service Authorization
--   Reference</i>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:Root'</a>, <a>root_name</a> - The friendly name of the
--   root.
--   
--   The <a>regex pattern</a> that is used to validate this parameter is a
--   string of any of the characters in the ASCII character range.
--   
--   <a>$sel:id:Root'</a>, <a>root_id</a> - The unique identifier (ID) for
--   the root.
--   
--   The <a>regex pattern</a> for a root ID string requires "r-" followed
--   by from 4 to 32 lowercase letters or digits.
--   
--   <a>$sel:policyTypes:Root'</a>, <a>root_policyTypes</a> - The types of
--   policies that are currently enabled for the root and therefore can be
--   attached to the root or to its OUs or accounts.
--   
--   Even if a policy type is shown as available in the organization, you
--   can separately enable and disable them at the root level by using
--   EnablePolicyType and DisablePolicyType. Use DescribeOrganization to
--   see the availability of the policy types in that organization.
newRoot :: Root

-- | A custom key-value pair associated with a resource within your
--   organization.
--   
--   You can attach tags to any of the following organization resources.
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>AWS account</li>
--   <li>Organizational unit (OU)</li>
--   <li>Organization root</li>
--   <li>Policy</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newTag</a> smart constructor.
data Tag
Tag' :: Text -> Text -> Tag

-- | Create a value of <a>Tag</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:key:Tag'</a>, <a>tag_key</a> - The key identifier, or name, of
--   the tag.
--   
--   <a>$sel:value:Tag'</a>, <a>tag_value</a> - The string value that's
--   associated with the key of the tag. You can set the value of a tag to
--   an empty string, but you can't set the value of a tag to null.
newTag :: Text -> Text -> Tag
